' And yet it turns out , after all , that [you]4588-sir are not [the man who answered [my]371-the young man advertisement]4647-the man who answered my advertisement , but [a stranger]4470-a stranger ! ”[371-the young man] “ Ay , ay ; that 's so , ”[371-the young man] said [the young man]371-the young man . [Henchard]128-henchard again suspended [his]371-the young man words , and then [his]371-the young man voice came thoughtfully : “ [Your]4588-sir forehead , [Farfrae]139-farfrae , is something like [[my]371-the young man poor brother]4649-my poor brother 's — now dead and gone ; and the nose , too , is n't unlike [his]4646-the man i had engaged . [You]4588-sir must be , what — five foot nine , [I]371-the young man reckon ? [I]371-the young man am six foot one and a half out of [my]371-the young man shoes . But what of that ? In [my]371-the young man business , ' tis true that strength and bustle build up a firm . But judgment and knowledge are what keep it established . Unluckily , [I]371-the young man am bad at science , [Farfrae]139-farfrae ; bad at figures — [a rule o ' thumb sort of man]4650-a rule o ' thumb sort of man . [You]4588-sir are just the reverse — [I]371-the young man can see that . [I]371-the young man have been looking for such as [you]4588-sir these two year , and yet [you]4588-sir are not for [me]371-the young man . Well , before [I]371-the young man go , let [me]371-the young man ask this : Though [you]4588-sir are not [the young man]371-the young man [I]371-the young man thought [you]4588-sir were , what 's the difference ? Ca n't [ye]4588-sir stay just the same ? Have [you]4588-sir really made up [your]4588-sir mind about this American notion ? [I]371-the young man wo n't mince matters . [I]371-the young man feel [you]4588-sir would be invaluable to [me]371-the young man — that need n't be said — and if [you]4588-sir will bide and be [[my]371-the young man manager]4652-my manager , [I]371-the young man will make it worth [your]4588-sir while . ”[371-the young man] “ [My]371-the young man plans are fixed , ”[371-the young man] said [the young man]371-the young man , in negative tones . “ [I]371-the young man have formed a scheme , and so [we]4653-we need na say any more about it . But will [you]4588-sir not drink with [me]371-the young man , [sir]4588-sir ? [I]371-the young man find [this Casterbridge]6-casterbridge ale warreming to the stomach . ”[371-the young man] “ No , no ; [I]128-henchard fain would , but [I]128-henchard ca n't , ”[128-henchard] said [Henchard]128-henchard gravely , the scraping of [his]371-the young man chair informing [the listeners]460-the listeners that [he]371-the young man was rising to leave . “ When [I]128-henchard was [a young man]285-a young man [I]128-henchard went in for that sort of thing too strong — far too strong — and was well - nigh ruined by it ! [I]128-henchard did a deed on account of it which [I]128-henchard shall be ashamed of to [my]128-henchard dying day . It made such an impression on [me]128-henchard that [I]128-henchard swore , there and then , that [I]128-henchard 'd drink nothing stronger than tea for as many years as [I]128-henchard was old that day . [I]128-henchard have kept [my]128-henchard oath ; and though , [Farfrae]139-farfrae , [I]128-henchard am sometimes that dry in the dog days that [I]128-henchard could drink a quarter - barrel to the pitching , [I]128-henchard think o ' [my]128-henchard oath , and touch no strong drink at all . ”[128-henchard] “ [I]1064-i 'll no ' press [ye]128-henchard , [sir]4588-sir — [I]1064-i 'll no ' press [ye]128-henchard . [I]1064-i respect [your]128-henchard vow . ”[1064-i] “ Well , [I]128-henchard shall get [a manager]4657-a manager somewhere , no doubt , ”[128-henchard] said [Henchard]128-henchard , with strong feeling in [his]1064-i tones . “ But it will be long before [I]128-henchard see one that would suit [me]128-henchard so well ! ”[128-henchard] [The young man]371-the young man appeared much moved by [Henchard]128-henchard 's warm convictions of [his]1064-i value . [He]1064-i was silent till [they]1066-they reached the door . “ [I]1064-i wish [I]1064-i could stay — sincerely [I]1064-i would like to , ”[1064-i] [he]1064-i replied . “ But no — it cannet be ! it cannet ! [I]1064-i want to see the warrld . ”[1064-i]

Thus [they]1066-they parted ; and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard and [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother remained each in [her]191-henchard thoughts over [their]1066-they meal , [the mother]586-the mother 's face being strangely bright since [Henchard]128-henchard 's avowal of shame for a past action . The quivering of the partition to its core presently denoted that [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae had again rung [his]1064-i bell , no doubt to have [his]1064-i supper removed ; for humming a tune , and walking up and down , [he]1064-i seemed to be attracted by the lively bursts of conversation and melody from [the general company below]1069-the general company below . [He]1064-i sauntered out upon [the landing]1070-the landing , and descended the staircase . When [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had carried down [his]1064-i supper tray , and also that used by [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother and [herself]191-henchard , [she]191-henchard found the bustle of serving to be at its height below , as it always was at this hour . [The young woman]310-the young woman shrank from having anything to do with the ground - floor serving , and crept silently about observing the scene — so new to [her]310-the young woman , fresh from the seclusion of [a seaside cottage]1073-a seaside cottage . In [the general sitting - room]1074-the general sitting - room , which was large , [she]310-the young woman remarked the two or three dozen strong - backed chairs that stood round against the wall , each fitted with [its genial occupant]1075-its genial occupant ; the sanded floor ; the black settle which , projecting endwise from the wall within the door , permitted [Elizabeth]191-henchard to be a spectator of all that went on without [herself]191-henchard being particularly seen . [The young Scotchman]1045-the young scotchman had just joined [the guests]404-the guests . These , in addition to [the respectable master - tradesmen occupying the seats of privileges in the bow - window and [[its]1079-its neighbourhood]1080-its neighbourhood]1078-the respectable master - tradesmen occupying the seats of privileges in the bow - window and its neighbourhood , included [an inferior set at the unlighted end , whose seats were mere benches against the wall , and who drank from cups instead of from glasses]1081-an inferior set at the unlighted end , whose seats were mere benches against the wall , and who drank from cups instead of from glasses . Among the latter [she]310-the young woman noticed [some of [those personages who had stood outside the windows of [the King]1084-the king 's Arms]1083-those personages who had stood outside the windows of the king 's arms]1082-some of those personages who had stood outside the windows of the king 's arms . Behind [their]1082-some of those personages who had stood outside the windows of the king 's arms backs was a small window , with a wheel ventilator in one of the panes , which would suddenly start off spinning with a jingling sound , as suddenly stop , and as suddenly start again . While thus furtively making [her]310-the young woman survey the opening words of a song greeted [her]310-the young woman ears from the front of [the settle]1085-the settle , in a melody and accent of peculiar charm . There had been some singing before [she]310-the young woman came down ; and now [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman had made [himself]886-the scotchman so soon at [home]675-home that , at the request of [some of [the master - tradesmen]1089-the master - tradesmen]1088-some of the master - tradesmen , [he]886-the scotchman , too , was favouring [the room]985-the room with a ditty . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard was fond of music ; [she]191-henchard could not help pausing to listen ; and the longer [she]191-henchard listened the more [she]191-henchard was enraptured . [She]191-henchard had never heard any singing like this and it was evident that [the majority of [the audience]1092-the audience]1091-the majority of the audience had not heard such frequently , for [they]1091-the majority of the audience were attentive to a much greater degree than usual . [They]1091-the majority of the audience neither whispered , nor drank , nor dipped [their]1091-the majority of the audience pipe - stems in [their]1091-the majority of the audience ale to moisten them , nor pushed the mug to [[their]1091-the majority of the audience neighbours]1093-their neighbours . [The singer]1094-the singer [himself]1094-the singer grew emotional , till [she]191-henchard could imagine a tear in [his]1094-the singer eye as the words went on : — There was a burst of applause , and a deep silence which was even more eloquent than the applause . It was of such a kind that the snapping of a pipe - stem too long for [him]1094-the singer by [old Solomon Longways]131-longways , who was one of [those gathered at the shady end of [the room]985-the room]1095-those gathered at the shady end of the room , seemed a harsh and irreverent act . Then the ventilator in the window - pane spasmodically started off for a new spin , and the pathos of [Donald]139-farfrae 's song was temporarily effaced . “ ' Twas not amiss — not at all amiss ! ”[132-christopher coney] muttered [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney , who was also present . And removing [his]132-christopher coney pipe a finger 's breadth from [his]132-christopher coney lips , [he]132-christopher coney said aloud , “ Draw on with the next verse , [young gentleman]4658-young gentleman , please . ”[132-christopher coney] “ Yes . Let 's have it again , [stranger]4659-stranger , ”[1097-the glazier] said [the glazier]1097-the glazier , [a stout , bucket - headed man , with a white apron rolled up round [his]1097-the glazier waist]1098-a stout , bucket - headed man , with a white apron rolled up round his waist . “ [Folks]4660-folks do n't lift up [their]4660-folks hearts like that in [this part of [the world]4424-the world]4661-this part of the world . ”[1097-the glazier] And turning aside , [he]1097-the glazier said in undertones , “ Who is [the young man]371-the young man ? — Scotch , d'ye say ? ”[1097-the glazier] “ Yes , straight from [the mountains of [Scotland]21-scotland]4664-the mountains of scotland , [I]132-christopher coney believe , ”[132-christopher coney] replied [Coney]132-christopher coney . [Young Farfrae]141-young farfrae repeated the last verse . It was plain that nothing so pathetic had been heard at [the Three Mariners]135-the three mariners for a considerable time . The difference of accent , the excitability of [the singer]1094-the singer , the intense local feeling , and the seriousness with which [he]141-young farfrae worked [himself]141-young farfrae up to a climax , surprised this set of worthies , who were only too prone to shut up [their]135-the three mariners emotions with caustic words . “ Danged if [[our]4665-we country]4666-our country down here is worth singing about like that ! ”[1097-the glazier] continued [the glazier]1097-the glazier , as [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman again melodized with a dying fall , “ [My]886-the scotchman ain countree ! ”[886-the scotchman] “ When [you]4667-you take away from among [us]4665-we [the fools]4668-the fools and [the rogues]4669-the rogues , and [the lammigers]4670-the lammigers , and [the wanton hussies]4671-the wanton hussies , and [the slatterns]4672-the slatterns , and such like , there 's cust few left to ornament a song with in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , or [the country round]4673-the country round . ”[1102-the dealer] “ True , ”[142-buzzford] said [Buzzford]142-buzzford , [the dealer]1102-the dealer , looking at the grain of the table . “ [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge is [a old , hoary place o ' wickedness]4674-a old , hoary place o ' wickedness , by all account . ' Tis recorded in history that [we]4665-we rebelled against [the King]1084-the king one or two hundred years ago , in the time of [the Romans]4676-the romans , and that [lots of [us]4665-we]4677-lots of us was hanged on [Gallows Hill]23-gallows hill , and quartered , and [[our]4665-we different jints]4678-our different jints sent about [the country]633-the country like [butcher]4680-butcher 's meat ; and for [my]1102-the dealer part [I]1102-the dealer can well believe it . ”[1102-the dealer] “ What did [ye]4681-ye come away from [[yer]4681-ye own country]4682-yer own country for , [young maister]4683-young maister , if [ye]4681-ye be so wownded about it ? ”[132-christopher coney] inquired [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney , from the background , with the tone of [a man who preferred the original subject]1103-a man who preferred the original subject . “ Faith , it was n't worth [your]4681-ye while on [our]4665-we account , for as [Maister Billy Wills]134-billy wills the glazier says , [we]4665-we be [bruckle folk here]4684-bruckle folk here — the best o ' [us]4665-we hardly honest sometimes , what with hard winters , and so many mouths to fill , and [Goda'mighty]143-goda'mighty sending [his]143-goda'mighty little taties so terrible small to fill ['em]4685-'em with . [We]4665-we do n't think about flowers and fair faces , not [we]4665-we — except in the shape o ' cauliflowers and pigs ' chaps . ”[132-christopher coney] “ But , no ! ”[139-farfrae] said [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae , gazing round into [their]1104-ye faces with earnest concern ; “ the best of [ye]1104-ye hardly honest — not that surely ? None of [ye]1104-ye has been stealing what did n't belong to [him]132-christopher coney ? ”[139-farfrae] “ [Lord]4686-lord ! no , no ! ”[131-longways] said [Solomon Longways]131-longways , smiling grimly . “ That 's only [his]132-christopher coney random way o ' speaking . ' [A]144-a was always such [a man of underthoughts]4687-a man of underthoughts . ”[131-longways] ( And reprovingly towards [Christopher]132-christopher coney ): “ Do n't [ye]1104-ye be so over - familiar with [a gentleman]4562-a gentleman that [ye]1104-ye know nothing of — and that 's travelled a'most from [the North Pole]24-the north pole . ”[131-longways] [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney was silenced , and as [he]132-christopher coney could get no public sympathy , [he]132-christopher coney mumbled [his]132-christopher coney feelings to [himself]132-christopher coney : “ Be dazed , if [I]132-christopher coney loved [[my]132-christopher coney country]4689-my country half as well as [the young feller]4690-the young feller do , [I]132-christopher coney 'd live by claning [[my]132-christopher coney neighbour]4691-my neighbour 's pigsties afore [I]132-christopher coney 'd go away ! For [my]132-christopher coney part [I]132-christopher coney 've no more love for [[my]132-christopher coney country]4689-my country than [I]132-christopher coney have for [Botany Bay]25-botany bay ! ”[132-christopher coney] “ Come , ”[131-longways] said [Longways]131-longways ; “ let [the young man]371-the young man draw onward with [his]371-the young man ballet , or [we]4694-we shall be here all night . ”[131-longways] “ That 's all of it , ”[1094-the singer] said [the singer]1094-the singer apologetically . “ Soul of [my]1106-the general dealer body , then [we]4694-we 'll have another ! ”[1106-the general dealer] said [the general dealer]1106-the general dealer . “ Can [you]371-the young man turn a strain to [the ladies]4695-the ladies , [sir]4588-sir ? ”[1107-a fat woman with a figured purple apron] inquired [a fat woman with a figured purple apron]1107-a fat woman with a figured purple apron , the waiststring of which was overhung so far by [her]1107-a fat woman with a figured purple apron sides as to be invisible . “ Let [him]371-the young man breathe — let [him]371-the young man breathe , [Mother Cuxsom]145-mother cuxsom . [He]371-the young man hain't got [his]371-the young man second wind yet , ”[1108-the master glazier] said [the master glazier]1108-the master glazier . “ Oh yes , but [I]371-the young man have ! ”[371-the young man] exclaimed [the young man]371-the young man ; and [he]371-the young man at once rendered “ [O Nannie]146-o nannie ”[371-the young man] with faultless modulations , and another or two of the like sentiment , winding up at [their]1110-their earnest request with “ [Auld Lang Syne]147-auld lang syne . ”[371-the young man] By this time [he]371-the young man had completely taken possession of the hearts of [[the Three Mariners]135-the three mariners ' inmates]1111-the three mariners ' inmates , including even [old Coney]132-christopher coney . Notwithstanding an occasional odd gravity which awoke [their]1110-their sense of the ludicrous for the moment , [they]1110-their began to view [him]371-the young man through a golden haze which the tone of [his]371-the young man mind seemed to raise around [him]371-the young man . [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge had sentiment — [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge had romance ; but [this stranger]1112-this stranger 's sentiment was of differing quality . Or rather , perhaps , the difference was mainly superficial ; [he]371-the young man was to [them]1110-their like [the poet of a new school who takes [[his]371-the young man contemporaries]1114-his contemporaries by storm ; who is not really new , but is the first to articulate what all [[his]371-the young man listeners]1115-his listeners have felt , though but dumbly till then]1113-the poet of a new school who takes his contemporaries by storm ; who is not really new , but is the first to articulate what all his listeners have felt , though but dumbly till then . [The silent landlord]1116-the silent landlord came and leant over the settle while [the young man]371-the young man sang ; and even [Mrs. Stannidge]136-mrs. stannidge managed to unstick [herself]136-mrs. stannidge from the framework of [her]136-mrs. stannidge chair in the bar and get as far as the door - post , which movement [she]136-mrs. stannidge accomplished by rolling [herself]136-mrs. stannidge round , as a cask is trundled on the chine by [a drayman]1118-a drayman without losing much of its perpendicular . “ And are [you]371-the young man going to bide in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , [sir]4588-sir ? ”[136-mrs. stannidge] [she]136-mrs. stannidge asked . “ Ah — no ! ”[886-the scotchman] said [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman , with melancholy fatality in [his]886-the scotchman voice , “ [I]886-the scotchman 'm only passing thirrough ! [I]886-the scotchman am on [my]886-the scotchman way to [Bristol]17-bristol , and on frae there to [foreign parts]4698-foreign parts . ”[886-the scotchman] “ [We]4699-we be truly sorry to hear it , ”[131-longways] said [Solomon Longways]131-longways . “ [We]4699-we can ill afford to lose tuneful wynd - pipes like [yours]4700-ye when they fall among [us]4699-we . And verily , to mak ' acquaintance with [a man]4474-a man a - come from so far , from [the land o ' perpetual snow]4702-the land o ' perpetual snow , as [we]4699-we may say , where wolves and wild boars and other dangerous animalcules be as common as blackbirds here - about — why , ' tis a thing [we]4699-we ca n't do every day ; and there 's good sound information for bide - at - [homes]4703-homes like [we]4699-we when [such a man]4704-such a man opens [his]4704-such a man mouth . ”[131-longways] “ Nay , but [ye]4700-ye mistake [[my]371-the young man country]4689-my country , ”[371-the young man] said [the young man]371-the young man , looking round upon [them]1121-them with tragic fixity , till [his]371-the young man eye lighted up and [his]371-the young man cheek kindled with a sudden enthusiasm to right [their]1121-them errors . “ There are not perpetual snow and wolves at all in it ! — except snow in winter , and — well — a little in summer just sometimes , and a ' gaberlunzie ' or two stalking about here and there , if [ye]4700-ye may call [them]1121-them dangerous . Eh , but [you]4700-ye should take a summer jarreny to [Edinboro]26-edinboro ' , and [Arthur]148-arthur 's Seat , and all round there , and then go on to [the lochs]4706-the lochs , and all [the Highland scenery]4707-the highland scenery — in May and June — and [you]4700-ye would never say ' tis [the land of wolves]4708-the land of wolves and perpetual snow ! ”[371-the young man] “ Of course not — it stands to reason , ”[142-buzzford] said [Buzzford]142-buzzford . “ ' Tis barren ignorance that leads to such words . [He]4704-such a man 's [a simple home - spun man , that never was fit for good company]4709-a simple home - spun man , that never was fit for good company — think nothing of [him]4704-such a man , [sir]4588-sir . ”[142-buzzford] “ And do [ye]4700-ye carry [your]4700-ye flock bed , and [your]4700-ye quilt , and [your]4700-ye crock , and [your]4700-ye bit of chiney ? or do [ye]4700-ye go in bare bones , as [I]132-christopher coney may say ? ”[132-christopher coney] inquired [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney . “ [I]139-farfrae 've sent on [my]139-farfrae luggage — though it is n't much ; for the voyage is long . ”[139-farfrae] [Donald]139-farfrae 's eyes dropped into a remote gaze as [he]1122-he added : “ But [I]1122-he said to [myself]1122-he , ' Never a one of the prizes of life will [I]1122-he come by unless [I]1122-he undertake it ! ' and [I]1122-he decided to go . ”[1122-he] A general sense of regret , in which [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard shared not least , made itself apparent in the company . As [she]191-henchard looked at [Farfrae]139-farfrae from the back of [the settle]1085-the settle [she]191-henchard decided that [his]1122-he statements showed [him]1122-he to be no less thoughtful than [his]1122-he fascinating melodies revealed [him]1122-he to be cordial and impassioned . [She]191-henchard admired the serious light in which [he]1122-he looked at serious things . [He]1122-he had seen no jest in ambiguities and roguery , as [the Casterbridge toss - pots]1124-the casterbridge toss - pots had done ; and rightly not — there was none . [She]191-henchard disliked those wretched humours of [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney and [[his]132-christopher coney tribe]1125-his tribe ; and [he]1122-he did not appreciate [them]1126-them . [He]1122-he seemed to feel exactly as [she]191-henchard felt about life and its surroundings — that they were a tragical rather than a comical thing ; that though [one]1127-one could be gay on occasion , moments of gaiety were interludes , and no part of the actual drama . It was extraordinary how similar [their]1128-their views were . Though it was still early [the young Scotchman]1045-the young scotchman expressed [his]1045-the young scotchman wish to retire , whereupon [the landlady]972-the landlady whispered to [Elizabeth]191-henchard to run [upstairs]1000-upstairs and turn down [his]1045-the young scotchman bed . [She]191-henchard took a candlestick and proceeded on [her]191-henchard mission , which was the act of a few moments only . When , candle in hand , [she]191-henchard reached the top of the stairs on [her]191-henchard way down again , [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae was at the foot coming up . [She]191-henchard could not very well retreat ; [they]1128-their met and passed in the turn of the staircase . [She]191-henchard must have appeared interesting in some way — not - withstanding [her]191-henchard plain dress — or rather , possibly , in consequence of it , for [she]191-henchard was [a girl characterized by earnestness and soberness of mien , with which simple drapery accorded well]1132-a girl characterized by earnestness and soberness of mien , with which simple drapery accorded well . [Her]191-henchard face flushed , too , at the slight awkwardness of the meeting , and [she]191-henchard passed [him]1045-the young scotchman with [her]191-henchard eyes bent on the candle - flame that [she]191-henchard carried just below [her]191-henchard nose . Thus it happened that when confronting [her]191-henchard [he]1045-the young scotchman smiled ; and then , with the manner of [a temporarily light - hearted man]1133-a temporarily light - hearted man , who has started [himself]1045-the young scotchman on a flight of song whose momentum [he]1045-the young scotchman can not readily check , [he]1045-the young scotchman softly tuned an old ditty that [she]191-henchard seemed to suggest — [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , rather disconcerted , hastened on ; and [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman 's voice died away , humming more of the same within the closed door of [[his]1045-the young scotchman room]1135-his room . Here the scene and sentiment ended for the present . When soon after , [the girl]311-the girl rejoined [[her]311-the girl mother]588-her mother , [the latter]4511-the latter was still in thought — on quite another matter than [a young man]285-a young man 's song . “ [We]4711-us 've made a mistake , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard whispered ( that [the Scotch - man]1140-the scotch - man might not overhear ) . “ On no account ought [ye]4711-us to have helped serve [here]4417-here to - night . Not because of [ourselves]4711-us , but for the sake of [him]886-the scotchman . If [he]886-the scotchman should befriend [us]4711-us , and take [us]4711-us up , and then find out what [you]4711-us did when staying [here]4417-here , ' twould grieve and wound [his]886-the scotchman natural pride as [Mayor of [the town]632-the town]4714-mayor of the town . ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard , who would perhaps have been more alarmed at this than [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother had [she]191-henchard known the real relationship , was not much disturbed about it as things stood . [Her]191-henchard “ [he]886-the scotchman ”[1142-another man than her poor mother 's] was [another man than [[her]191-henchard poor mother]1143-her poor mother 's]1142-another man than her poor mother 's . “ For [myself]191-henchard , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said , “ [I]191-henchard did n't at all mind waiting a little upon [him]886-the scotchman . [He]886-the scotchman 's so respectable , and educated — far above [the rest of 'em in [the inn]939-the inn]4716-the rest of 'em in the inn . [They]1145-they thought [him]886-the scotchman very simple not to know [their]1145-they grim broad way of talking about [themselves]1145-they here . But of course [he]886-the scotchman did n't know — [he]886-the scotchman was too refined in [his]886-the scotchman mind to know such things ! ”[191-henchard] Thus [she]191-henchard earnestly pleaded . Meanwhile , the “ he ”[588-her mother] of [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother was not so far away as even [they]1145-they thought . After leaving [the Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners [he]1147-i had sauntered up and down [the empty High Street]1148-the empty high street , passing and repassing [the inn]939-the inn in [[his]1147-i promenade]1150-his promenade . When [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman sang [his]1147-i voice had reached [Henchard]128-henchard 's ears through the heart - shaped holes in the window - shutters , and had led [him]1147-i to pause outside them a long while . “ To be sure , to be sure , how [that fellow]4718-that fellow does draw [me]1147-i ! ”[1147-i] [he]1147-i had said to [himself]1147-i . “ [I]1147-i suppose ' tis because [I]1147-i 'm so lonely . [I]1147-i 'd have given [him]4718-that fellow a third share in the business to have stayed ! ”[1147-i]

When [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard opened the hinged casement next morning the mellow air brought in the feel of imminent autumn almost as distinctly as if [she]191-henchard had been in [the remotest hamlet]1152-the remotest hamlet . [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge was the complement of the rural life around , not [[its]6-casterbridge urban opposite]1153-its urban opposite . Bees and butterflies in the cornfields at [the top of [the town]632-the town]1154-the top of the town , who desired to get to [the meads at the bottom]1156-the meads at the bottom , took no circuitous course , but flew straight down [High Street]27-high street without any apparent consciousness that [they]1157-they were traversing strange latitudes . And in autumn airy spheres of thistledown floated into [the same street]1158-the same street , lodged upon [the shop fronts]1159-the shop fronts , blew into drains , and innumerable tawny and yellow leaves skimmed along [the pavement]1160-the pavement , and stole through [people]1161-people 's doorways into [[their]1161-people passages]1162-their passages with a hesitating scratch on the floor , like the skirts of [timid visitors]1163-timid visitors . Hearing voices , one of which was close at hand , [she]191-henchard withdrew [her]191-henchard head and glanced from behind the window - curtains . [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard — now habited no longer as [a great personage]1164-a great personage , but as [a thriving man of business]1165-a thriving man of business — was pausing on [his]120-henchard way up the middle of [the street]797-the street , and [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman was looking from the window adjoining [her]191-henchard own . [Henchard]120-henchard it appeared , had gone a little way past [the inn]939-the inn before [he]120-henchard had noticed [his]120-henchard acquaintance of the previous evening . [He]120-henchard came back a few steps , [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae opening the window further . “ And [you]120-henchard are off soon , [I]120-henchard suppose ? ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard upwards . “ Yes — almost this moment , [sir]4588-sir , ”[338-the other] said [the other]338-the other . “ Maybe [I]338-the other 'll walk on till [the coach]4720-the coach makes up on [me]338-the other . ”[338-the other] “ Which way ? ”[139-farfrae] “ The way [ye]120-henchard are going . ”[338-the other] “ Then shall [we]4721-we walk together to [the top o [' town]4723-' town]4722-the top o ' town ? ”[338-the other] “ If ye'll wait a minute , ”[886-the scotchman] said [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman . In a few minutes [the latter]4511-the latter emerged , bag in hand . [Henchard]120-henchard looked at the bag as at [an enemy]1172-an enemy . It showed there was no mistake about [the young man]371-the young man 's departure . “ Ah , [[my]120-henchard lad]4724-my lad , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said , “ [you]4724-my lad should have been [a wise man]4725-a wise man , and have stayed with [me]120-henchard . ”[120-henchard] “ Yes , yes — it might have been wiser , ”[139-farfrae] said [Donald]139-farfrae , looking microscopically at [the houses that were furthest off]1174-the houses that were furthest off . “ It is only telling [ye]4724-my lad the truth when [I]139-farfrae say [my]139-farfrae plans are vague . ”[139-farfrae] [They]1175-they had by this time passed on from [the precincts of [the inn]939-the inn]1176-the precincts of the inn , and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard heard no more . [She]191-henchard saw that [they]1175-they continued in conversation , [Henchard]120-henchard turning to the other occasionally , and emphasizing some remark with a gesture . Thus [they]1175-they passed [the King 's Arms Hotel]1024-the king 's arms hotel , [the Market House]1179-the market house , [[St. Peter]230-peter 's churchyard wall]1180-st. peter 's churchyard wall , ascending to the upper end of [the long street]1181-the long street till [they]1175-they were small as two grains of corn ; when [they]1175-they bent suddenly to the right into [the Bristol Road]1182-the bristol road , and were out of view . “ [He]120-henchard was [a good man]4726-a good man — and [he]120-henchard 's gone , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said to [herself]191-henchard . “ [I]191-henchard was nothing to [him]120-henchard , and there was no reason why [he]120-henchard should have wished [me]191-henchard good - bye . ”[191-henchard] The simple thought , with its latent sense of slight , had moulded itself out of the following little fact : when [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman came out at the door [he]886-the scotchman had by accident glanced up at [her]191-henchard ; and then [he]886-the scotchman had looked away again without nodding , or smiling , or saying a word . “ [You]191-henchard are still thinking , [mother]4495-mother , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said , when [she]191-henchard turned inwards . “ Yes ; [I]191-henchard am thinking of [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard 's sudden liking for [that young man]4728-that young man . [He]120-henchard was always so . Now , surely , if [he]120-henchard takes so warmly to [people who are not related to [him]120-henchard at all , may [he]120-henchard not take as warmly to [[his]120-henchard own kin]4730-his own kin]4729-people who are not related to him at all , may he not take as warmly to his own kin ? ”[191-henchard] While [they]1184-they debated this question a procession of five large waggons went past , laden with hay up to the bedroom windows . [They]1185-they came in from [the country]633-the country , and [the steaming horses]1187-the steaming horses had probably been travelling a great part of the night . To the shaft of each hung a little board , on which was painted in white letters , “ [Henchard]120-henchard , [corn - factor]4731-corn - factor and [hay - merchant]4732-hay - merchant . ”[1188-he] The spectacle renewed [[his]1188-he wife]380-his wife 's conviction that , for [[her]380-his wife daughter]4518-her daughter 's sake , [she]380-his wife should strain a point to rejoin [him]1188-he . The discussion was continued during breakfast , and the end of it was that [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard decided , for good or for ill , to send [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard with a message to [Henchard]128-henchard , to the effect that [[his]1188-he relative]1191-his relative [Susan]122-henchard , [[a sailor]1192-a sailor 's widow]1193-a sailor 's widow , was in [the town]632-the town ; leaving it to [him]1188-he to say whether or not [he]1188-he would recognize [her]191-henchard . What had brought [her]380-his wife to this determination were chiefly two things . [He]1188-he had been described as [a lonely widower]1195-a lonely widower ; and [he]1188-he had expressed shame for a past transaction of [his]1188-he life . There was promise in both . “ If [he]1188-he says no , ”[380-his wife] [she]380-his wife enjoined , as [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard stood , bonnet on , ready to depart ; “ if [he]1188-he thinks it does not become the good position [he]1188-he has reached to in [the town]632-the town , to own — to let [us]4734-we call on [him]1188-he as — [[his]1188-he distant kinfolk]4735-his distant kinfolk , say , ' Then , [sir]4588-sir , [we]4734-we would rather not intrude ; [we]4734-we will leave [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge as quietly as [we]4734-we have come , and go back to [[our]4734-we [own country]4738-own country]4737-our own country . ' ... [I]380-his wife almost feel that [I]380-his wife would rather [he]1188-he did say so , as [I]380-his wife have not seen [him]1188-he for so many years , and [we]4734-we are so — little allied to [him]1188-he ! ”[380-his wife] “ And if [he]1188-he say yes ? ”[1196-the more sanguine one] inquired [the more sanguine one]1196-the more sanguine one . “ In that case , ”[128-henchard] answered [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard cautiously , “ ask [him]1188-he to write [me]128-henchard a note , saying when and how [he]1188-he will see [us]4734-we — or [ME]128-henchard . ”[128-henchard] [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard went a few steps towards [the landing]1070-the landing . “ And tell [him]1188-he , ”[588-her mother] continued [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother , “ that [I]588-her mother fully know [I]588-her mother have no claim upon [him]1188-he — that [I]588-her mother am glad to find [he]1188-he is thriving ; that [I]588-her mother hope [his]1188-he life may be long and happy — there , go . ”[588-her mother] Thus with a half - hearted willingness , a smothered reluctance , did [the poor forgiving woman]1199-the poor forgiving woman start [[her]588-her mother unconscious daughter]1200-her unconscious daughter on this errand . It was about ten o'clock , and market - day , when [Elizabeth]191-henchard paced up [the High Street]759-the high street , in no great hurry ; for to [herself]191-henchard [her]191-henchard position was only that of [a poor relation deputed to hunt up [a rich one]1203-a rich one]1202-a poor relation deputed to hunt up a rich one . The front doors of [the private houses]1204-the private houses were mostly left open at this warm autumn time , no thought of [umbrella stealers]1205-umbrella stealers disturbing the minds of [the placid burgesses]1206-the placid burgesses . Hence , through the long , straight , entrance passages thus unclosed could be seen , as through [tunnels]1207-tunnels , [the mossy gardens at the back]1208-the mossy gardens at the back , glowing with nasturtiums , fuchsias , scarlet geraniums , [“ bloody warriors , ”[1205-umbrella stealers] snapdragons]4739-“ bloody warriors , ” snapdragons , and dahlias , this floral blaze being backed by crusted grey stone - work remaining from [a yet remoter Casterbridge]1209-a yet remoter casterbridge than the venerable one visible in [the street]797-the street . The old - fashioned fronts of [these houses , which had older than old - fashioned backs]1211-these houses , which had older than old - fashioned backs , rose sheer from the pavement , into which the bow windows protruded like bastions , necessitating a pleasing chassez - dechassez movement to [the time - pressed pedestrian at every few yards]1212-the time - pressed pedestrian at every few yards . [He]1213-he was bound also to evolve other Terpsichorean figures in respect of door - steps , scrapers , cellar - hatches , church buttresses , and the overhanging angles of walls which , originally unobtrusive , had become bow - legged and knock - kneed . In addition to these fixed obstacles which spoke so cheerfully of individual unrestraint as to boundaries , movables occupied [the path and roadway]1214-the path and roadway to a perplexing extent . First [the vans of [the carriers in and out of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]1216-the carriers in and out of casterbridge , who hailed from [Mellstock]29-mellstock , [Weatherbury]30-weatherbury , [The Hintocks]31-the hintocks , [Sherton - Abbas]32-sherton - abbas , [Kingsbere]33-kingsbere , [Overcombe]34-overcombe , and [many [other towns]1218-other towns and [villages round]1219-villages round]1217-many other towns and villages round]1215-the vans of the carriers in and out of casterbridge , who hailed from mellstock , weatherbury , the hintocks , sherton - abbas , kingsbere , overcombe , and many other towns and villages round . [[Their]1215-the vans of the carriers in and out of casterbridge , who hailed from mellstock , weatherbury , the hintocks , sherton - abbas , kingsbere , overcombe , and many other towns and villages round owners]1220-their owners were numerous enough to be regarded as [a tribe]1221-a tribe , and had almost distinctiveness enough to be regarded as [a race]1222-a race . [[Their]1215-the vans of the carriers in and out of casterbridge , who hailed from mellstock , weatherbury , the hintocks , sherton - abbas , kingsbere , overcombe , and many other towns and villages round vans]1223-their vans had just arrived , and were drawn up on each side of [the street]797-the street in close file , so as to form at places a wall between the pavement and [the roadway]1225-the roadway . Moreover [every shop]1226-every shop pitched out half [its]1226-every shop contents upon trestles and boxes on [the kerb]1227-the kerb , extending the display each week a little further and further into [the roadway]1225-the roadway , despite the expostulations of [the two feeble old constables]1229-the two feeble old constables , until there remained but a tortuous defile for [carriages]1230-carriages down the centre of [the street]797-the street , which afforded fine opportunities for skill with the reins . Over the pavement on the sunny side of the way hung [shopblinds]1232-shopblinds so constructed as to give [the passenger]1233-the passenger 's hat a smart buffet off [his]1233-the passenger head , as from the unseen hands of [Cranstoun]150-cranstoun 's Goblin Page , celebrated in romantic lore . [Horses for sale]1234-horses for sale were tied in rows , [their]1234-horses for sale forelegs on [the pavement]1160-the pavement , [their]1234-horses for sale hind legs in [the street]797-the street , in which position [they]1234-horses for sale occasionally nipped [little boys]1237-little boys by the shoulder who were passing to [school]1238-school . And any inviting recess in front of [a house that had been modestly kept back from the general line]1239-a house that had been modestly kept back from the general line was utilized by [pig - dealers]1240-pig - dealers as a pen for [their]1240-pig - dealers stock . [The yeomen]1241-the yeomen , [farmers]712-farmers , [dairymen]1243-dairymen , and [townsfolk]1244-townsfolk , who came to transact business in [these ancient streets]1245-these ancient streets , spoke in other ways than by articulation . Not to hear the words of [[your]1246-your interlocutor]1247-your interlocutor in [metropolitan centres]1248-metropolitan centres is to know nothing of [his]1247-your interlocutor meaning . Here the face , the arms , the hat , the stick , the body throughout spoke equally with the tongue . To express satisfaction [the Casterbridge market - man]1249-the casterbridge market - man added to [his]1249-the casterbridge market - man utterance a broadening of the cheeks , a crevicing of the eyes , a throwing back of the shoulders , which was intelligible from the other end of [the street]797-the street . If [he]1249-the casterbridge market - man wondered , though all [Henchard]128-henchard 's carts and waggons were rattling past [him]1249-the casterbridge market - man , [you]1246-your knew it from perceiving the inside of [his]1249-the casterbridge market - man crimson mouth , and a target - like circling of [his]1249-the casterbridge market - man eyes . Deliberation caused sundry attacks on the moss of adjoining walls with the end of [his]1249-the casterbridge market - man stick , a change of [his]1249-the casterbridge market - man hat from the horizontal to the less so ; a sense of tediousness announced itself in a lowering of [the person]1251-the person by spreading the knees to a lozenge - shaped aperture and contorting the arms . Chicanery , subterfuge , had hardly a place in [the streets of [this honest borough]1253-this honest borough]1252-the streets of this honest borough to all appearance ; and it was said that [the lawyers in [the Court House]1255-the court house]1254-the lawyers in the court house hard by occasionally threw in strong arguments for the other side out of pure generosity ( though apparently by mischance ) when advancing [their]1254-the lawyers in the court house own . Thus [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge was in most respects but the pole , focus , or nerve - knot of [the surrounding country]1256-the surrounding country life ; differing from [the many manufacturing towns which are as foreign bodies set down]1257-the many manufacturing towns which are as foreign bodies set down , like boulders on a plain , in a green world with which [they]1257-the many manufacturing towns which are as foreign bodies set down have nothing in common . [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge lived by agriculture at one remove further from [the fountainhead]1258-the fountainhead than [the adjoining villages]1259-the adjoining villages — no more . [The townsfolk]1260-the townsfolk understood every fluctuation in [the rustic]1261-the rustic 's condition , for it affected [their]1260-the townsfolk receipts as much as [the labourer]336-the labourer 's ; [they]1260-the townsfolk entered into the troubles and joys which moved [the aristocratic families]1263-the aristocratic families ten miles round — for the same reason . And even at the dinner - parties of [the professional families]1264-the professional families the subjects of discussion were corn , cattle - disease , sowing and reaping , fencing and planting ; while politics were viewed by [them]1260-the townsfolk less from [their]1260-the townsfolk own standpoint of [burgesses with rights and privileges]1265-burgesses with rights and privileges than from the standpoint of [[their]1260-the townsfolk country neighbours]1266-their country neighbours . All the venerable contrivances and confusions which delighted the eye by [their]1257-the many manufacturing towns which are as foreign bodies set down quaintness , and in a measure reasonableness , in [this rare old [market - town]1268-market - town]1267-this rare old market - town , were metropolitan novelties to the unpractised eyes of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , fresh from netting fish - seines in [a seaside cottage]1073-a seaside cottage . Very little inquiry was necessary to guide [her]191-henchard footsteps . [[Henchard]128-henchard 's house]1270-henchard 's house was one of the best , faced with dull red - and - grey old brick . The front door was open , and , as in [other houses]1271-other houses , [she]191-henchard could see through the passage to the end of [the garden]1272-the garden — nearly a quarter of a mile off . [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard was not in [the house]782-the house , but in [the store - yard]1274-the store - yard . [She]191-henchard was conducted into [the mossy garden]1275-the mossy garden , and through a door in the wall , which was studded with rusty nails speaking of generations of fruit - trees that had been trained [there]447-there . The door opened upon [the yard]1277-the yard , and here [she]191-henchard was left to find [him]120-henchard as [she]191-henchard could . It was [a place flanked by [hay - barns]1279-hay - barns , into which tons of fodder , all in trusses , were being packed from the waggons [she]191-henchard had seen pass [the inn]939-the inn]1278-a place flanked by hay - barns , into which tons of fodder , all in trusses , were being packed from the waggons she had seen pass the inn that morning . Wherever the doors of [these places]1284-these places were open , a closely packed throng of bursting wheat - sacks could be seen standing inside , with the air of awaiting a famine that would not come . [She]191-henchard wandered about [this place]482-this place , uncomfortably conscious of the impending interview , till [she]191-henchard was quite weary of searching ; [she]191-henchard ventured to inquire of [a boy in what quarter [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard could be found]1286-a boy in what quarter mr. henchard could be found . [He]120-henchard directed [her]191-henchard to [an office which [she]191-henchard had not seen before]1287-an office which she had not seen before , and knocking at the door [she]191-henchard was answered by a cry of “ Come in . ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard turned the handle ; and there stood before [her]191-henchard , bending over some sample - bags on a table , not [the corn - merchant]1288-the corn - merchant , but [the young Scotchman Mr. Farfrae]1289-the young scotchman mr. farfrae — in the act of pouring some grains of wheat from one hand to the other . [His]120-henchard hat hung on a peg behind [him]120-henchard , and the roses of [his]120-henchard carpet - bag glowed from the corner of [the room]985-the room . Having toned [her]191-henchard feelings and arranged words on [her]191-henchard lips for [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , and for [him]120-henchard alone , [she]191-henchard was for the moment confounded . “ Yes , what it is ? ”[886-the scotchman] said [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman , like [a man who permanently ruled [there]447-there]1292-a man who permanently ruled there . [She]191-henchard said [she]191-henchard wanted to see [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard . “ Ah , yes ; will [you]191-henchard wait a minute ? [He]371-the young man handed [her]191-henchard a chair , bade [her]191-henchard sit down and turned to [his]371-the young man sample - bags again . While [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard sits waiting in great amaze at [the young man]371-the young man 's presence [we]1298-we may briefly explain how [he]371-the young man came [there]447-there . When [the two new acquaintances]1300-the two new acquaintances had passed out of sight that morning towards [the Bath and Bristol road]1301-the bath and bristol road [they]1300-the two new acquaintances went on silently , except for a few commonplaces , till [they]1300-the two new acquaintances had gone down [an avenue on the town walls called [the Chalk Walk]1303-the chalk walk]1302-an avenue on the town walls called the chalk walk , leading to an angle where [the North and West escarpments]1304-the north and west escarpments met . From this high corner of the square earthworks [a vast extent of country]1305-a vast extent of country could be seen . [A footpath]1306-a footpath ran steeply down [the green slope]1307-the green slope , conducting from the shady promenade on the walls to [a road at the bottom of [the scarp]1309-the scarp]1308-a road at the bottom of the scarp . It was by this path [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman had to descend . “ Well , here 's success to ' ee , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard , holding out [his]120-henchard right hand and leaning with [his]120-henchard left upon the wicket which protected the descent . In the act there was the inelegance of [one whose feelings are nipped and wishes defeated]1311-one whose feelings are nipped and wishes defeated . “ [I]120-henchard shall often think of this time , and of how [you]371-the young man came at the very moment to throw a light upon [my]120-henchard difficulty . ”[120-henchard] Still holding [the young man]371-the young man 's hand [he]120-henchard paused , and then added deliberately : “ Now [I]120-henchard am not the man to let a cause be lost for want of a word . And before [ye]371-the young man are gone for ever [I]120-henchard 'll speak . Once more , will [ye]371-the young man stay ? There it is , flat and plain . [You]371-the young man can see that it is n't all selfishness that makes [me]120-henchard press ' ee ; for [my]120-henchard business is not quite so scientific as to require an intellect entirely out of the common . [Others]860-others would do for [the place]515-the place without doubt . Some selfishness perhaps there is , but there is more ; it is n't for [me]120-henchard to repeat what . Come bide with [me]120-henchard — and name [your]371-the young man own terms . [I]120-henchard 'll agree to ['em]4742-'em willingly and ' ithout a word of gainsaying ; for , hang it , Farfrae , [I]120-henchard like [thee]371-the young man well ! ”[120-henchard] [The young man]371-the young man 's hand remained steady in [Henchard]120-henchard 's for a moment or two . [He]371-the young man looked over [the fertile country that stretched beneath [them]1315-them]1314-the fertile country that stretched beneath them , then backward along [the shaded walk]1316-the shaded walk reaching to [the top of [the town]632-the town]1154-the top of the town . [His]371-the young man face flushed . “ [I]371-the young man never expected this — [I]371-the young man did not ! ”[371-the young man] [he]371-the young man said . “ It 's [Providence]35-providence ! Should [any one]4743-any one go against it ? The face of [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard beamed forth a satisfaction that was almost fierce in its strength . “ Now [you]120-henchard are [[my]120-henchard friend]4745-my friend ! ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard exclaimed . “ Come back to [[my]120-henchard house]4643-my house ; let 's clinch it at once by clear terms , so as to be comfortable in [our]4747-our minds . ”[120-henchard] [Farfrae]139-farfrae caught up [his]120-henchard bag and retraced [the North - West Avenue]1320-the north - west avenue in [Henchard]120-henchard 's company as [he]120-henchard had come . [Henchard]120-henchard was all confidence now . “ [I]120-henchard am [the most distant fellow in [the world]4424-the world]4748-the most distant fellow in the world when [I]120-henchard do n't care for [a man]4474-a man , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said . “ But when [a man]4474-a man takes [my]120-henchard fancy [he]4474-a man takes it strong . Now [I]120-henchard am sure [you]120-henchard can eat another breakfast ? [You]120-henchard could n't have eaten much so early , even if [they]4752-they had anything at that place to gi'e [thee]120-henchard , which [they]4752-they had n't ; so come to [[my]120-henchard house]4643-my house and [we]4754-we will have a solid , staunch tuck - in , and settle terms in black - and - white if [you]120-henchard like ; though [my]120-henchard word 's [my]120-henchard bond . [I]120-henchard can always make a good meal in the morning . [I]120-henchard 've got a splendid cold pigeon - pie going just now . [You]120-henchard can have some [home]675-home - brewed if [you]120-henchard want to , [you]120-henchard know . ”[120-henchard] “ It is too airly in the morning for that , ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae with a smile . “ Well , of course , [I]139-farfrae did n't know . Here the matter was settled over the breakfast , at which [Henchard]120-henchard heaped [the young Scotchman]1045-the young scotchman 's plate to a prodigal fulness . [He]120-henchard would not rest satisfied till [Farfrae]139-farfrae had written for [his]120-henchard luggage from [Bristol]17-bristol , and dispatched the letter to [the post - office]1325-the post - office . While [she]191-henchard still sat under [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman 's eyes [a man]4474-a man came up to the door , reaching it as [Henchard]120-henchard opened the door of [the inner office]1336-the inner office to admit [Elizabeth]191-henchard . [The newcomer]1337-the newcomer stepped forward like [the quicker cripple at [Bethesda]36-bethesda]1338-the quicker cripple at bethesda , and entered in [her]191-henchard stead . [She]191-henchard could hear [his]4474-a man words to [Henchard]120-henchard : “ [Joshua Jopp]137-jopp , [sir]4588-sir — by appointment — [the new manager]4758-the new manager . ”[4474-a man] “ [The new manager]4758-the new manager ! — [he]4758-the new manager 's in [[his]4758-the new manager office]4760-his office , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard bluntly . “ In [[his]4758-the new manager office]4760-his office ! ”[291-the man] said [the man]291-the man , with a stultified air . “ [I]120-henchard mentioned Thursday , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard ; “ and as [you]1337-the newcomer did not keep [your]1337-the newcomer appointment , [I]120-henchard have engaged [another manager]4762-another manager . But it ca n't be helped . ”[120-henchard] There was no more to be said , and [the man]291-the man came out , encountering [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard in [his]291-the man passage . [She]191-henchard could see that [his]291-the man mouth twitched with anger , and that bitter disappointment was written in [his]291-the man face everywhere . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard now entered , and stood before [the master of [the premises]1016-the premises]1344-the master of the premises . [His]291-the man dark pupils — which always seemed to have a red spark of light in them , though this could hardly be a physical fact — turned indifferently round under [his]291-the man dark brows until they rested on [her]191-henchard figure . “ Now then , what is it , [[my]291-the man young woman]4764-my young woman ? ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man said blandly . “ Can [I]191-henchard speak to [you]291-the man — not on business , [sir]4588-sir ? ”[191-henchard] said [she]191-henchard . “ Yes — [I]291-the man suppose . ”[291-the man] [He]291-the man looked at [her]291-the man more thoughtfully . “ [I]191-henchard am sent to tell [you]291-the man , [sir]4588-sir , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard innocently went on , “ that [a distant relative of [yours]291-the man]4767-a distant relative of yours by marriage , [Susan Newson]151-susan , [[a sailor]1192-a sailor 's widow]1193-a sailor 's widow , is in [the town]632-the town , and to ask whether [you]291-the man would wish to see [her]151-susan . ”[191-henchard] The rich rouge - et - noir of [his]291-the man countenance underwent a slight change . “ Oh — [Susan]151-susan is — still alive ? ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man asked with difficulty . “ Yes , [sir]4588-sir . ”[291-the man] “ Are [you]291-the man [[her]151-susan daughter]4518-her daughter ? ”[191-henchard] “ Yes , [sir]4588-sir — [[her]151-susan only daughter]4774-her only daughter . ”[191-henchard] “ What — do [you]291-the man call [yourself]291-the man — [your]291-the man Christian name ? ”[291-the man] “ [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard , [sir]4588-sir . ”[191-henchard] “ [Newson]191-henchard ? ”[191-henchard] “ [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane Newson]191-henchard . ”[291-the man] This at once suggested to [Henchard]120-henchard that the transaction of [his]291-the man early married life at [Weydon Fair]8-weydon fair was unrecorded in the family history . It was more than [he]120-henchard could have expected . [[His]291-the man wife]380-his wife had behaved kindly to [him]291-the man in return for [his]291-the man unkindness , and had never proclaimed [her]380-his wife wrong to [[her]380-his wife child]587-her child or to [the world]4424-the world . “ [I]291-the man am — a good deal interested in [your]191-henchard news , ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man said . “ And as this is not a matter of business , but pleasure , suppose [we]4776-we go [indoors]4777-indoors . ”[291-the man] It was with a gentle delicacy of manner , surprising to [Elizabeth]191-henchard , that [he]291-the man showed [her]191-henchard out of [the office]1349-the office and through [the outer room]1350-the outer room , where [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae was overhauling bins and samples with the inquiring inspection of [a beginner in charge]1351-a beginner in charge . [Henchard]120-henchard preceded [her]191-henchard through the door in the wall to the suddenly changed scene of [the garden and flowers]1352-the garden and flowers , and onward into [the house]782-the house . [The dining - room]891-the dining - room to which [he]291-the man introduced [her]191-henchard still exhibited the remnants of the lavish breakfast laid for [Farfrae]139-farfrae . [It]891-the dining - room was furnished to profusion with heavy mahogany furniture of the deepest red - Spanish hues . Pembroke tables , with leaves hanging so low that they well - nigh touched the floor , stood against the walls on legs and feet shaped like those of an elephant , and on one lay three huge folio volumes — a Family Bible , a “ [Josephus]152-josephus , ”[None-None] and a “ Whole Duty of [Man]488-man . ”[291-the man] In the chimney corner was a fire - grate with a fluted semicircular back , having urns and festoons cast in relief thereon , and the chairs were of the kind which , since that day , has cast lustre upon the names of [Chippendale]37-chippendale and [Sheraton]38-sheraton , though , in point of fact , [their]1355-their patterns may have been such as those [illustrious carpenters]1356-illustrious carpenters never saw or heard of . “ Sit down — [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard — sit down , ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man said , with a shake in [his]291-the man voice as [he]291-the man uttered [her]191-henchard name , and sitting down [himself]291-the man [he]291-the man allowed [his]291-the man hands to hang between [his]291-the man knees while [he]291-the man looked upon the carpet . “ [[Your]191-henchard mother]4779-your mother , then , is quite well ? ”[291-the man] “ [She]4779-your mother is rather worn out , [sir]4588-sir , with travelling . ”[291-the man] “ [[A sailor]1192-a sailor 's widow]1193-a sailor 's widow — when did [he]1192-a sailor die ? ”[291-the man] “ [Father]4491-father was lost last spring . ”[291-the man] [Henchard]120-henchard winced at the word “ [father]4491-father , ”[120-henchard] thus applied . “ Do [you]4779-your mother and [she]191-henchard come from abroad — [America]19-america or [Australia]39-australia ? ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard asked . “ No . [We]4785-we have been in [England]3-england some years . [I]120-henchard was twelve when [we]4785-we came here from [Canada]9-canada . ”[120-henchard] “ Ah ; exactly . ”[120-henchard] By such conversation [he]120-henchard discovered the circumstances which had enveloped [[his]120-henchard wife]380-his wife and [[her]380-his wife child]587-her child in such total obscurity that [he]120-henchard had long ago believed [them]1359-them to be in [their]1359-them graves . These things being clear , [he]120-henchard returned to the present . “ And where is [[your]380-his wife mother]4779-your mother staying ? ”[120-henchard] “ At [the Three Mariners]135-the three mariners . ”[120-henchard] “ And [you]380-his wife are [[her]4779-your mother daughter]4518-her daughter [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard ? ”[120-henchard] repeated [Henchard]120-henchard . [He]120-henchard arose , came close to [her]380-his wife , and glanced in [her]380-his wife face . “ [I]120-henchard think , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said , suddenly turning away with a wet eye , “ [you]380-his wife shall take a note from [me]380-his wife to [[your]380-his wife mother]4779-your mother . [I]380-his wife should like to see [her]4779-your mother .... [She]4779-your mother is not left very well off by [[her]4779-your mother late husband]4789-her late husband ? ”[380-his wife] [His]120-henchard eye fell on [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's clothes , which , though a respectable suit of black , and [her]191-henchard very best , were decidedly old - fashioned even to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge eyes . “ Not very well , ”[120-henchard] [she]380-his wife said , glad that [he]120-henchard had divined this without [her]380-his wife being obliged to express it . [He]120-henchard sat down at the table and wrote a few lines , next taking from [his]120-henchard pocket - book a five - pound note , which [he]120-henchard put in the envelope with the letter , adding to it , as by an afterthought , five shillings . Sealing the whole up carefully , [he]120-henchard directed it to “ [Mrs. Newson]128-henchard , [Three Mariners Inn]4790-three mariners inn , ”[128-henchard] and handed the packet to [Elizabeth]191-henchard . “ Deliver it to [her]191-henchard personally , please , ”[128-henchard] said [Henchard]128-henchard . “ Well , [I]120-henchard am glad to see [you]191-henchard here , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard — very glad . [We]4791-we must have a long talk together — but not just now . ”[120-henchard] [He]120-henchard took [her]191-henchard hand at parting , and held it so warmly that [she]191-henchard , who had known so little friendship , was much affected , and tears rose to [her]191-henchard aerial - grey eyes . The instant that [she]191-henchard was gone [Henchard]128-henchard 's state showed itself more distinctly ; having shut the door [he]120-henchard sat in [[his]120-henchard dining - room]1360-his dining - room stiffly erect , gazing at the opposite wall as if [he]120-henchard read [his]120-henchard history there . “ Begad ! ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard suddenly exclaimed , jumping up . “ [I]128-henchard did n't think of that . Perhaps these are [impostors]4792-impostors — and [Susan]151-susan and [the child]306-the child dead after all ! ”[128-henchard] However , a something in [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard soon assured [him]120-henchard that , as regarded [her]191-henchard , at least , there could be little doubt . And a few hours would settle the question of [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother 's identity ; for [he]120-henchard had arranged in [his]120-henchard note to see [her]191-henchard that evening . “ It never rains but it pours ! ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]128-henchard . [His]120-henchard keenly excited interest in [[his]120-henchard new friend]1327-his new friend [the Scotchman]153-the scotchman was now eclipsed by this event , and [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae saw so little of [him]120-henchard during the rest of the day that [he]120-henchard wondered at the suddenness of [[his]120-henchard employer]1363-his employer 's moods . In the meantime [Elizabeth]191-henchard had reached [the inn]939-the inn . [[Her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother , instead of taking the note with the curiosity of [a poor woman expecting assistance]1366-a poor woman expecting assistance , was much moved at sight of it . [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's back was turned when [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother opened the letter . [The place]515-the place is easy to find . [I]120-henchard can say no more now . The news upsets [me]120-henchard almost . [The girl]311-the girl seems to be in ignorance .
