Among [the rest of [the onlookers]1803-the onlookers]1802-the rest of the onlookers were [Elizabeth]191-henchard and [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother — the former thoughtful yet much interested , [her]588-her mother eyes beaming with a longing lingering light , as if Nature had been advised by [Correggio]173-correggio in [their]1805-their creation . The dancing progressed with unabated spirit , and [Henchard]120-henchard walked and waited till [[his]120-henchard wife]380-his wife should be disposed to go [home]675-home . [He]120-henchard did not care to keep in the light , and when [he]120-henchard went into the dark it was worse , for there [he]120-henchard heard remarks of a kind which were becoming too frequent : “ [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard 's rejoicings could n't say good morning to this , ”[338-the other] said [one]1127-one . “ [A man]4474-a man must be [a headstrong stunpoll]5017-a headstrong stunpoll to think [folk]5018-folk would go up to [that bleak place]5019-that bleak place to - day . ”[1812-this gentleman] [The other]338-the other answered that [people]1161-people said it was not only in such things as those that [the Mayor]4556-the mayor was wanting . “ Where would [his]120-henchard business be if it were not for [this young fellow]5020-this young fellow ? ' Twas verily [Fortune]174-fortune sent [him]120-henchard to [Henchard]120-henchard . [His]120-henchard accounts were like a bramblewood when [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae came . [He]149-farfrae used to reckon [his]149-farfrae sacks by chalk strokes all in a row like garden - palings , measure [his]149-farfrae ricks by stretching with [his]149-farfrae arms , weigh [his]149-farfrae trusses by a lift , judge [his]149-farfrae hay by a chaw , and settle the price with a curse . But now [this accomplished young man]5021-this accomplished young man does it all by ciphering and mensuration . Then the wheat — that sometimes used to taste so strong o ' mice when made into bread that [people]1161-people could fairly tell the breed — [Farfrae]149-farfrae has a plan for purifying , so that [nobody]298-nobody would dream the smallest four - legged beast had walked over it once . O yes , [everybody]1670-everybody is full of [him]120-henchard , and the care [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard has to keep [him]120-henchard , to be sure ! ”[338-the other] concluded [this gentleman]1812-this gentleman . “ But [he]120-henchard wo n't do it for long , good - now , ”[120-henchard] said [the other]338-the other . “ No ! ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard to [himself]120-henchard behind the tree . “ Or if [he]120-henchard do , [he]120-henchard 'll be honeycombed clean out of all the character and standing that [he]120-henchard 's built up in these eighteen year ! ”[149-farfrae] [He]120-henchard went back to [the dancing pavilion]1814-the dancing pavilion . [Farfrae]149-farfrae was footing a quaint little dance with [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard — an old country thing , [the only one [she]191-henchard knew]1815-the only one she knew , and though [he]149-farfrae considerately toned down [his]149-farfrae movements to suit [her]191-henchard demurer gait , the pattern of the shining little nails in the soles of [his]149-farfrae boots became familiar to the eyes of [every bystander]1816-every bystander . The tune had enticed [her]191-henchard into it ; being a tune of a busy , vaulting , leaping sort — some low notes on the silver string of each fiddle , then a skipping on the small , like running up and down ladders — “ [Miss M'Leod of Ayr]175-miss m'leod of ayr ”[149-farfrae] was its name , so [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae had said , and that it was very popular in [[his]149-farfrae own country]1817-his own country . It was soon over , and [the girl]311-the girl looked at [Henchard]120-henchard for approval ; but [he]120-henchard did not give it . [He]120-henchard seemed not to see [her]311-the girl . “ Look here , [Farfrae]149-farfrae , ”[149-farfrae] [he]149-farfrae said , like one whose mind was elsewhere , “ [I]176-alderman tubber 'll go to [Port - Bredy Great Market]5025-port - bredy great market to - morrow [myself]176-alderman tubber . [You]139-farfrae can stay and put things right in [your]139-farfrae clothes - box , and recover strength to [your]139-farfrae knees after [your]139-farfrae vagaries . ”[176-alderman tubber] [He]149-farfrae planted on [Donald]139-farfrae an antagonistic glare that had begun as a smile . [Some other townsmen]1819-some other townsmen came up , and [Donald]139-farfrae drew aside . “ What 's this , [Henchard]120-henchard , ”[176-alderman tubber] said [Alderman Tubber]176-alderman tubber , applying [his]176-alderman tubber thumb to the corn - factor like a cheese - taster . “ An opposition randy to [yours]120-henchard , eh ? [Jack]162-jack griggs 's as good as [[his]162-jack griggs master]5026-his master , eh ? Cut [ye]120-henchard out quite , has n't [he]162-jack griggs ? ”[1820-the lawyer] “ [You]120-henchard see , [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , ”[1820-the lawyer] said [the lawyer]1820-the lawyer , [another goodnatured friend]1821-another goodnatured friend , “ where [you]120-henchard made the mistake was in going so far afield . [You]120-henchard should have taken a leaf out of [his]162-jack griggs book , and have had [your]120-henchard sports in [a sheltered place like this]5027-a sheltered place like this . But [you]120-henchard did n't think of it , [you]120-henchard see ; and [he]162-jack griggs did , and that 's where [he]162-jack griggs 's beat [you]120-henchard . ”[177-jocular mr. tubber] “ [He]162-jack griggs 'll be top - sawyer soon of [[you]120-henchard two]4809-you two , and carry all afore [him]162-jack griggs , ”[120-henchard] added [jocular Mr. Tubber]177-jocular mr. tubber . “ No , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard gloomily . “ [He]162-jack griggs wo n't be that , because [he]162-jack griggs 's shortly going to leave [me]371-the young man . ”[371-the young man] [He]120-henchard looked towards [Donald]139-farfrae , who had come near . “ [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae 's time as [[my]4474-a man manager]4652-my manager is drawing to a close — is n't it , [Farfrae]149-farfrae ? ”[4474-a man] [The young man]371-the young man , who could now read the lines and folds of [Henchard]120-henchard 's strongly - traced face as if they were clear verbal inscriptions , quietly assented ; and when [people]1161-people deplored the fact , and asked why it was , [he]371-the young man simply replied that [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard no longer required [his]371-the young man help . [Henchard]120-henchard went [home]675-home , apparently satisfied . But in the morning , when [his]120-henchard jealous temper had passed away , [his]120-henchard heart sank within [him]120-henchard at what [he]120-henchard had said and done . [He]120-henchard was the more disturbed when [he]120-henchard found that this time [Farfrae]149-farfrae was determined to take [him]120-henchard at [his]120-henchard word .

[Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard had perceived from [Henchard]120-henchard 's manner that in assenting to dance [she]191-henchard had made a mistake of some kind . In [her]191-henchard simplicity [she]191-henchard did not know what it was till a hint from [a nodding acquaintance]1825-a nodding acquaintance enlightened [her]191-henchard . As [[the Mayor]4556-the mayor 's step - daughter]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter , [she]191-henchard learnt , [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter had not been quite in [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter place in treading a measure amid such a mixed throng as filled [the dancing pavilion]1814-the dancing pavilion . Thereupon [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter ears , cheeks , and chin glowed like live coals at the dawning of the idea that [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter tastes were not good enough for [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter position , and would bring [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter into disgrace . This made [her]191-henchard very miserable , and [she]191-henchard looked about for [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother ; but [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard , who had less idea of conventionality than [Elizabeth]191-henchard [herself]128-henchard , had gone away , leaving [[her]128-henchard daughter]4518-her daughter to return at [her]4518-her daughter own pleasure . [The latter]4511-the latter moved on into [the dark dense old avenues]1832-the dark dense old avenues , or rather vaults of living woodwork , which ran along [the town]632-the town boundary , and stood reflecting . [A man]4474-a man followed in a few minutes , and [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter face being to - wards the shine from the tent [he]4474-a man recognized [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter . It was [Farfrae]149-farfrae — just come from the dialogue with [Henchard]128-henchard which had signified [his]149-farfrae dismissal . “ And it 's [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter , [Miss Newson]167-miss newson ? — and [I]4474-a man 've been looking for [ye]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter everywhere ! ”[4474-a man] [he]4474-a man said , overcoming a sadness imparted by the estrangement with [the corn - merchant]1288-the corn - merchant . “ May [I]149-farfrae walk on with [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter as far as [[your]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter street - corner]5030-your street - corner ? ”[149-farfrae] [She]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter thought there might be something wrong in this , but did not utter any objection . So together [they]1836-they went on , first down [the West Walk]1763-the west walk , and then into [the Bowling Walk]1838-the bowling walk , till [Farfrae]149-farfrae said , “ It 's like that [I]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter 'm going to leave [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter soon . ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] [She]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter faltered , “ Why ? ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] “ Oh — as a mere matter of business — nothing more . But [we]1836-they 'll not concern [ourselves]1836-they about it — it is for the best . [I]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter hoped to have another dance with [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter . ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] [She]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter said [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter could not dance — in any proper way . “ Nay , but [you]149-farfrae do ! It 's the feeling for it rather than the learning of steps that makes [pleasant dancers]5031-pleasant dancers .... [I]149-farfrae fear [I]149-farfrae offended [[your]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter father]5032-your father by getting up this ! And now , perhaps , [I]149-farfrae 'll have to go to another part o ' the warrld altogether ! ”[149-farfrae] This seemed such a melancholy prospect that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard breathed a sigh — letting it off in fragments that [he]149-farfrae might not hear [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter . But darkness makes [people]1161-people truthful , and [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman went on impulsively — perhaps [he]149-farfrae had heard [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter after all : “ [I]139-farfrae wish [I]139-farfrae was richer , [Miss Newson]167-miss newson ; and [[your]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter stepfather]5033-your stepfather had not been offended , [I]139-farfrae would ask [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter something in a short time — yes , [I]139-farfrae would ask [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter to - night . But that 's not for [me]139-farfrae ! ”[139-farfrae] What [he]149-farfrae would have asked [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter [he]149-farfrae did not say , and instead of encouraging [him]149-farfrae [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter remained incompetently silent . Thus afraid one of another [they]1841-they continued [their]1841-they promenade along the walls till [they]1841-they got near the bottom of [the Bowling Walk]51-the bowling walk ; twenty steps further and the trees would end , and [the street - corner]1842-the street - corner and lamps appear . In consciousness of this [they]1841-they stopped . “ [I]139-farfrae never found out who it was that sent [us]1841-they to [Durnover granary]52-durnover granary on [a fool]4995-a fool 's errand that day , ”[139-farfrae] said [Donald]139-farfrae , in [his]149-farfrae undulating tones . “ Did [ye]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter ever know [yourself]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter , [Miss Newson]167-miss newson ? ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] “ Never , ”[139-farfrae] said [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter . “ [I]139-farfrae wonder why [they]5035-they did it ! ”[139-farfrae] “ For fun , perhaps . ”[139-farfrae] “ Perhaps it was not for fun . It might have been that [they]5035-they thought [they]5035-they would like [us]1841-they to stay waiting there , talking to [one another]5036-one another ? Ay , well ! [I]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter hope [[you]5035-they [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge folk]5037-you casterbridge folk will not forget [me]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter if [I]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter go . ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] “ That [I]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter 'm sure [we]1841-they wo n't ! ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter said earnestly . “ [I]139-farfrae — wish [you]139-farfrae would n't go at all . ”[139-farfrae] [They]1843-they had got into the lamplight . “ Now , [I]139-farfrae 'll think over that , ”[139-farfrae] said [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae . “ And [I]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter 'll not come up to [your]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter door ; but part from [you]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter here ; lest it make [[your]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter father]5032-your father more angry still . ”[1827-the mayor 's step - daughter] [They]1843-they parted , [Farfrae]139-farfrae returning into [the dark Bowling Walk]1844-the dark bowling walk , and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard going up [the street]797-the street . Without any consciousness of what [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter was doing [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter started running with all [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter might till [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter reached [[her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter father]4886-her father 's door . “ O dear [me]191-henchard — what am [I]191-henchard at ? ”[191-henchard] [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter thought , as [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter pulled up breathless . Indoors [she]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter fell to conjecturing the meaning of [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's enigmatic words about not daring to ask [her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter what [he]4886-her father fain would . [Elizabeth]191-henchard , [that silent observing woman]1847-that silent observing woman , had long noted how [he]4886-her father was rising in favour among [the townspeople]1848-the townspeople ; and knowing [Henchard]128-henchard 's nature now [she]191-henchard had feared that [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's days as [manager]4985-manager were numbered , so that the announcement gave [her]191-henchard little surprise . Would [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae stay in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge despite [his]4886-her father words and [[her]1827-the mayor 's step - daughter father]4886-her father 's dismissal ? [His]4886-her father occult breathings to [her]191-henchard might be solvable by [his]4886-her father course in that respect . The next day was windy — so windy that walking in [the garden]1272-the garden [she]191-henchard picked up a portion of the draft of a letter on business in [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae 's writing , which had flown over the wall from [the office]1349-the office . The useless scrap [she]191-henchard took [indoors]4777-indoors , and began to copy the calligraphy , which [she]191-henchard much admired . The letter began “ [Dear Sir]5039-dear sir , ”[191-henchard] and presently writing on a loose slip “ [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard laid the latter over “ [Sir]4588-sir , ”[191-henchard] making the phrase “ Dear Elizabeth - [Jane]191-henchard . ”[191-henchard] When [she]191-henchard saw the effect a quick red ran up [her]191-henchard face and warmed [her]191-henchard through , though [nobody]298-nobody was there to see what [she]191-henchard had done . [She]191-henchard quickly tore up the slip , and threw it away . After this [she]191-henchard grew cool and laughed at [herself]191-henchard , walked about [the room]985-the room , and laughed again ; not joyfully , but distressfully rather . It was quickly known in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge that [Farfrae]139-farfrae and [Henchard]128-henchard had decided to dispense with [each other]4626-each other . [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard 's anxiety to know if [Farfrae]139-farfrae were going away from [the town]632-the town reached a pitch that disturbed [her]191-henchard , for [she]191-henchard could no longer conceal from [herself]191-henchard the cause . At length the news reached [her]191-henchard that [he]1858-him was not going to leave [the place]515-the place . [A man following the same trade as [Henchard]128-henchard]1860-a man following the same trade as henchard , but on a very small scale , had sold [[his]1860-a man following the same trade as henchard business]1861-his business to [Farfrae]139-farfrae , who was forthwith about to start as [corn and hay merchant]1862-corn and hay merchant on [his]1858-him own account . [Her]191-henchard heart fluttered when [she]191-henchard heard of this step of [Donald]139-farfrae 's , proving that [he]1858-him meant to remain ; and yet , would [a man who cared one little bit for [her]191-henchard]1863-a man who cared one little bit for her have endangered [his]1860-a man following the same trade as henchard suit by setting up a business in opposition to [[Mr. Henchard]120-henchard 's]1864-mr. henchard 's ? Surely not ; and it must have been a passing impulse only which had led [him]1858-him to address [her]191-henchard so softly . To solve the problem whether [her]191-henchard appearance on the evening of the dance were such as to inspire a fleeting love at first sight , [she]191-henchard dressed [herself]191-henchard up exactly as [she]191-henchard had dressed then — the muslin , the spencer , the sandals , the para - sol — and looked in the mirror The picture glassed back was in [her]191-henchard opinion , precisely of such a kind as to inspire that fleeting regard , and no more — “ just enough to make [him]1858-him silly , and not enough to keep [him]1858-him so , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said luminously ; and [Elizabeth]191-henchard thought , in a much lower key , that by this time [he]1858-him had discovered how plain and homely was the informing spirit of that pretty outside . Hence , when [she]191-henchard felt [her]191-henchard heart going out to [him]1858-him , [she]191-henchard would say to [herself]191-henchard with a mock pleasantry that carried an ache with it , “ No , no , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard — such dreams are not for [you]1858-him ! ”[1873-his] [She]191-henchard tried to prevent [herself]191-henchard from seeing [him]1858-him , and thinking of [him]1858-him ; succeeding fairly well in the former attempt , in the latter not so completely . [Henchard]120-henchard , who had been hurt at finding that [Farfrae]139-farfrae did not mean to put up with [his]120-henchard temper any longer , was incensed beyond measure when [he]120-henchard learnt what [the young man]371-the young man had done as an alternative . It was in [the town - hall]1866-the town - hall , after a council meeting , that [he]120-henchard first became aware of [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's coup for establishing [himself]120-henchard independently in [the town]632-the town ; and [his]120-henchard voice might have been heard as far as [the town]632-the town - pump expressing [his]120-henchard feelings to [[his]120-henchard fellow councilmen]1869-his fellow councilmen . These tones showed that , though under a long reign of self - control [he]1858-him had become [Mayor]1548-mayor and [churchwarden]4807-churchwarden and what not , there was still the same unruly volcanic stuff beneath the rind of [Michael Henchard]120-henchard as when [he]1858-him had sold [[his]1858-him wife]380-his wife at [Weydon Fair]8-weydon fair . “ Well , [he]120-henchard 's [a friend of [mine]139-farfrae]5041-a friend of mine , and [I]120-henchard 'm [a friend of [his]120-henchard]5042-a friend of his — or if [we]5043-we are not , what are [we]5043-we ? ' Od send , if [I]120-henchard 've not been [[his]120-henchard friend]1456-his friend , who has , [I]120-henchard should like to know ? Did n't [he]120-henchard come here without a sound shoe to [his]120-henchard voot ? Did n't [I]120-henchard keep [him]120-henchard [here]4417-here — help [him]120-henchard to a living ? Did n't [I]120-henchard help [him]120-henchard to money , or whatever [he]120-henchard wanted ? [I]120-henchard stuck out for no terms — [I]120-henchard said ' Name [your]120-henchard own price . ' [I]120-henchard 'd have shared [my]120-henchard last crust with [that young fellow]5046-that young fellow at one time , [I]120-henchard liked [him]120-henchard so well . And now [he]120-henchard 's defied [me]120-henchard ! But damn [him]120-henchard , [I]120-henchard 'll have a tussle with [him]120-henchard now — at fair buying and selling , mind — at fair buying and selling ! And if [I]120-henchard ca n't overbid such a stripling as [he]120-henchard , then [I]120-henchard 'm not wo'th a varden ! [We]5047-we 'll show that [we]5047-we know [our]5047-we business as well as one here and there ! ”[120-henchard] [[His]1873-his friends of [the Corporation]1875-the corporation]1874-his friends of the corporation did not specially respond . [Henchard]120-henchard was less popular now than [he]120-henchard had been when nearly two years before , [they]1874-his friends of the corporation had voted [him]120-henchard to [the chief magistracy]1876-the chief magistracy on account of [his]120-henchard amazing energy . While [they]1874-his friends of the corporation had collectively profited by this quality of the corn - factor 's [they]1874-his friends of the corporation had been made to wince individually on more than one occasion . So [he]120-henchard went out of [the hall]1877-the hall and down [the street]797-the street alone . Reaching [home]675-home [he]120-henchard seemed to recollect something with a sour satisfaction . [He]120-henchard called [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . Seeing how [he]120-henchard looked when [she]191-henchard entered [she]191-henchard appeared alarmed . “ Nothing to find fault with , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said , observing [her]191-henchard concern . “ Only [I]1880-i want to caution [you]191-henchard , [[my]1880-i dear]4489-my dear . [That man]4800-that man , [Farfrae]139-farfrae — it is about [him]4800-that man . [I]1880-i 've seen [him]4800-that man talking to [you]191-henchard two or three times — [he]4800-that man danced with ' [ee]5050-ee at the rejoicings , and came [home]675-home with ' ee . Now , now , no blame to [you]191-henchard . But just harken : Have [you]1880-i made [him]4800-that man any foolish promise ? Gone the least bit beyond sniff and snaff at all ? ”[1880-i] “ No . [I]1880-i have promised [him]4800-that man nothing . ”[1880-i] “ Good . All 's well that ends well . [I]120-henchard particularly wish [you]191-henchard not to see [him]4800-that man again . ”[120-henchard] “ Very well , [sir]4588-sir . ”[1880-i] “ [You]4588-sir promise ? ”[1880-i] [She]1880-i hesitated for a moment , and then said — “ Yes , if [you]1881-you much wish it . ”[1880-i] “ [I]139-farfrae do . [He]4800-that man 's [an enemy to [[our]5054-our house]5055-our house]5053-an enemy to our house ! ”[139-farfrae] When [she]1880-i had gone [he]1881-you sat down , and wrote in a heavy hand to [Farfrae]139-farfrae thus : — [SIR]4588-sir , — [I]0-i make request that henceforth [you]4588-sir and [[my]0-i stepdaughter]1883-my stepdaughter be as [strangers]826-strangers to [each other]4626-each other . [She]1880-i on [her]1880-i part has promised to welcome no more addresses from [you]4588-sir ; and [I]0-i trust , therefore , [you]4588-sir will not attempt to force them upon [her]1880-i . [M. HENCHARD]178-henchard . [One]1127-one would almost have supposed [Henchard]178-henchard to have had policy to see that [no better modus vivendi]1887-no better modus vivendi could be arrived at with [Farfrae]139-farfrae than by encouraging [him]178-henchard to become [[his]178-henchard son - in - law]1888-his son - in - law . But such a scheme for buying over [a rival]1889-a rival had nothing to recommend it to [[the Mayor]4556-the mayor 's headstrong faculties]1891-the mayor 's headstrong faculties . With all domestic finesse of that kind [he]178-henchard was hopelessly at variance . Loving [a man]4474-a man or hating [him]4474-a man , [his]178-henchard diplomacy was as wrongheaded as a buffalo 's ; and [[his]178-henchard wife]380-his wife had not ventured to suggest the course which [she]380-his wife , for many reasons , would have welcomed gladly . Meanwhile [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae had opened the gates of commerce on [his]178-henchard own account at [a spot on [Durnover Hill]44-durnover hill]1894-a spot on durnover hill — as far as possible from [[Henchard]178-henchard 's stores]1895-henchard 's stores , and with every intention of keeping clear of [[his]178-henchard former friend]1896-his former friend and [[employer]1457-employer 's customers]1898-employer 's customers . There was , it seemed to [the younger man]1588-the younger man , room for both of [them]1900-them and to spare . [The town]632-the town was small , but the corn and hay - trade was proportionately large , and with [his]178-henchard native sagacity [he]178-henchard saw opportunity for a share of it . So determined was [he]178-henchard to do nothing which should seem like trade - antagonism to [the Mayor]4556-the mayor that [he]178-henchard refused [[his]178-henchard first customer]1903-his first customer — [a large farmer of good repute]1904-a large farmer of good repute — because [Henchard]178-henchard and [this man]542-this man had dealt together within the preceding three months . “ [He]542-this man was once [[my]139-farfrae friend]4745-my friend , ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae , “ and it 's not for [me]186-bellerophon to take business from [him]542-this man . [I]186-bellerophon am sorry to disappoint [you]5057-you , but [I]186-bellerophon can not hurt the trade of [a man who 's been so kind to [me]186-bellerophon]5058-a man who 's been so kind to me . ”[186-bellerophon] In spite of this praiseworthy course [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman 's trade increased . Whether it were that [his]178-henchard northern energy was an overmastering force among [the easy - going Wessex worthies]1907-the easy - going wessex worthies , or whether it was sheer luck , the fact remained that whatever [he]178-henchard touched [he]178-henchard prospered in . Like [Jacob]179-jacob in [Padan - Aram]53-padan - aram , [he]178-henchard would no sooner humbly limit [himself]178-henchard to the ringstraked - and - spotted exceptions of trade than the ringstraked - and - spotted would multiply and prevail . But most probably luck had little to do with it . [Character]180-character is [Fate]181-fate , said [Novalis]182-novalis , and [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's character was just the reverse of [Henchard]178-henchard 's , who might not inaptly be described as [Faust]183-faust has been described — as [a vehement gloomy being who had quitted the ways of [vulgar men]1909-vulgar men without light to guide [him]178-henchard on a better way]1908-a vehement gloomy being who had quitted the ways of vulgar men without light to guide him on a better way . [Farfrae]139-farfrae duly received the request to discontinue attentions to [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . [His]178-henchard acts of that kind had been so slight that the request was almost superfluous . Yet [he]178-henchard had felt a considerable interest in [her]191-henchard , and after some cogitation [he]178-henchard decided that it would be as well to enact no Romeo part just then — for [the young girl]1910-the young girl 's sake no less than [his]178-henchard own . Thus the incipient attachment was stifled down . A time came when , avoid collision with [[his]178-henchard former friend]1896-his former friend as [he]178-henchard might , [Farfrae]139-farfrae was compelled , in sheer self - defence , to close with [Henchard]178-henchard in mortal commercial combat . [He]178-henchard could no longer parry the fierce attacks of [the latter by simple avoidance]1912-the latter by simple avoidance . As soon as [their]1913-their war of prices began [everybody]1670-everybody was interested , and [some few]1915-some few guessed the end . It was , in some degree , Northern insight matched against [Southern doggedness]184-southern doggedness — the dirk against the cudgel — and [Henchard]178-henchard 's weapon was one which , if it did not deal ruin at the first or second stroke , left [him]178-henchard afterwards well - nigh at [[his]178-henchard antagonist]1916-his antagonist 's mercy . Almost every Saturday [they]1913-their encountered [each other]4626-each other amid [the crowd of farmers which thronged about [the market - place]1919-the market - place in the weekly course of [their]1913-their business]1918-the crowd of farmers which thronged about the market - place in the weekly course of their business . [Donald]139-farfrae was always ready , and even anxious , to say a few friendly words , but [the Mayor]4556-the mayor invariably gazed stormfully past [him]178-henchard , like one who had endured and lost on [his]4556-the mayor account , and could in no sense forgive the wrong ; nor did [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's snubbed manner of perplexity at all appease [him]178-henchard . [The large farmers]1921-the large farmers , [corn - merchants]1922-corn - merchants , [millers]1923-millers , [auctioneers]1924-auctioneers , and [others]860-others had each an official stall in [the corn - market room]1926-the corn - market room , with [their]1913-their names painted thereon ; and when to the familiar series of “ [Henchard]178-henchard , ”[186-bellerophon] “ [Everdene]185-everdene , ”[186-bellerophon] “ Shiner , ”[186-bellerophon] “ Darton , ”[178-henchard] and so on , was added one inscribed “ [Farfrae]139-farfrae , ”[387-her husband] in staring new letters , [Henchard]178-henchard was stung into bitterness ; like [Bellerophon]186-bellerophon , [he]178-henchard wandered away from [the crowd]347-the crowd , cankered in soul . From that day [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae 's name was seldom mentioned in [[Henchard]178-henchard 's house]1270-henchard 's house . If at breakfast or dinner [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [[Jane]191-henchard 's mother]1929-jane 's mother inadvertently alluded to [her]1929-jane 's mother favourite 's movements , [the girl]311-the girl would implore [her]1929-jane 's mother by a look to be silent ; and [[her]1929-jane 's mother husband]387-her husband would say , “ What — are [you]191-henchard , too , [[my]1643-the writer enemy]5059-my enemy ? ”[1643-the writer]

There came a shock which had been foreseen for some time by [Elizabeth]191-henchard , as [the box passenger]1932-the box passenger foresees the approaching jerk from some channel across [the highway]301-the highway . [[Her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother was ill — too unwell to leave [[her]588-her mother room]1935-her room . [Henchard]178-henchard , who treated [her]191-henchard kindly , except in moments of irritation , sent at once for [the richest , busiest doctor]1936-the richest , busiest doctor , whom [he]178-henchard supposed to be the best . Bedtime came , and [they]1937-they burnt a light all night . In a day or two [she]191-henchard rallied . [Elizabeth]191-henchard , who had been staying up , did not appear at breakfast on the second morning , and [Henchard]178-henchard sat down alone . [He]178-henchard was startled to see a letter for [him]178-henchard from [Jersey]43-jersey in a writing [he]178-henchard knew too well , and had expected least to behold again . [He]178-henchard took it up in [his]178-henchard hands and looked at it as at a picture , a vision , a vista of past enactments ; and then [he]178-henchard read it as an unimportant finale to conjecture . [The writer]1643-the writer said that [she]1643-the writer at length perceived how impossible it would be for any further communications to proceed between [them]1937-they now that [his]178-henchard re - marriage had taken place . That such reunion had been the only straightforward course open to [him]178-henchard [she]1643-the writer was bound to admit . “ On calm reflection , therefore , ”[1643-the writer] [she]1643-the writer went on , “ [I]0-i quite forgive [you]178-henchard for landing [me]0-i in such a dilemma , remembering that [you]178-henchard concealed nothing before [our]1937-they ill - advised acquaintance ; and that [you]178-henchard really did set before [me]0-i in [your]178-henchard grim way the fact of there being a certain risk in intimacy with [you]178-henchard , slight as it seemed to be after fifteen or sixteen years of silence on [[your]178-henchard wife]4877-your wife 's part . [I]0-i thus look upon the whole as a misfortune of [mine]0-i , and not a fault of [yours]178-henchard . “[0-i] So that , [Michael]120-henchard , [I]0-i must ask [you]120-henchard to overlook those letters with which [I]0-i pestered [you]120-henchard day after day in the heat of [my]0-i feelings . They were written whilst [I]0-i thought [your]120-henchard conduct to [me]0-i cruel ; but now [I]0-i know more particulars of the position [you]120-henchard were in [I]0-i see how inconsiderate [my]0-i reproaches were . “ Now [you]120-henchard will , [I]120-henchard am sure , perceive that the one condition which will make any future happiness possible for [me]120-henchard is that the past connection between [our]5061-our lives be kept secret outside [this isle]5062-this isle . Speak of it [I]120-henchard know [you]120-henchard will not ; and [I]120-henchard can trust [you]120-henchard not to write of it . One safe - guard more remains to be mentioned — that no writings of mine , or trifling articles belonging to [me]120-henchard , should be left in [your]120-henchard possession through neglect or forgetfulness . To this end may [I]120-henchard request [you]120-henchard to return to [me]120-henchard any such [you]120-henchard may have , particularly the letters written in the first abandonment of feeling . “[120-henchard] For the handsome sum [you]120-henchard forwarded to [me]0-i as a plaster to the wound [I]0-i heartily thank [you]120-henchard . “ [I]0-i am now on [my]0-i way to [Bristol]17-bristol , to see [[my]0-i only relative]5063-my only relative . [She]5063-my only relative is rich , and [I]0-i hope will do something for [me]0-i . [I]0-i shall return through [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge and [Budmouth]54-budmouth , where [I]0-i shall take [the packet - boat]5064-the packet - boat . Can [you]120-henchard meet [me]0-i with the letters and other trifles ? [I]0-i shall be in [the coach which changes horses]5065-the coach which changes horses at [the Antelope Hotel]5066-the antelope hotel at half - past five Wednesday evening ; [I]0-i shall be wearing a Paisley shawl with a red centre , and thus may easily be found . [I]0-i should prefer this plan of receiving [them]5067-them to having [them]5067-them sent . — [I]0-i remain still , [yours]120-henchard ; ever , “[0-i] [LUCETTA ” Henchard]188-lucetta breathed heavily . “[120-henchard] Poor thing — better [you]1939-you had not known [me]0-i ! Upon [my]0-i heart and soul , if ever [I]0-i should be left in a position to carry out that marriage with [thee]1939-you , [I]0-i OUGHT to do it — [I]0-i ought to do it , indeed ! ” The contingency that [he]0-i had in [his]0-i mind was , of course , the death of [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard . As requested , [he]0-i sealed up [Lucetta]188-lucetta 's letters , and put the parcel aside till the day [she]128-henchard had appointed ; this plan of returning them by hand being apparently a little ruse of [the young lady]4876-the young lady for exchanging a word or two with [him]0-i on past times . [He]0-i would have preferred not to see [her]4876-the young lady ; but deeming that there could be no great harm in acquiescing thus far , [he]0-i went at dusk and stood opposite [the coach - office]5069-the coach - office . The evening was chilly , and [the coach]4720-the coach was late . [Henchard]188-lucetta crossed over to [it]4720-the coach while the horses were being changed ; but there was no [Lucetta]188-lucetta inside or out . Concluding that something had happened to modify [her]128-henchard arrangements [he]0-i gave the matter up and went [home]675-home , not without a sense of relief . Meanwhile [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard was weakening visibly . [She]128-henchard could not go out of doors any more . One day , after much thinking which seemed to distress [her]128-henchard , [she]128-henchard said [she]128-henchard wanted to write something . A desk was put upon [her]128-henchard bed with pen and paper , and at [her]128-henchard request [she]128-henchard was left alone . [She]128-henchard remained writing for a short time , folded [her]128-henchard paper carefully , called [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard to bring a taper and wax , and then , still refusing assistance , sealed up the sheet , directed it , and locked it in [her]128-henchard desk . [She]128-henchard had directed it in these words : — “[1940-you] [MR . MICHAEL HENCHARD]120-henchard . NOT TO BE OPENED TILL [ELIZABETH - JANE]191-henchard 'S WEDDING - DAY . ” [The latter]4511-the latter sat up with [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother to the utmost of [her]191-henchard strength night after night . To learn to take the universe seriously there is no quicker way than to watch — to be a “[1940-you] waker , ” as [the country - people]5074-the country - people call it . Between the hours at which the last toss - pot went by and [the first sparrow]5075-the first sparrow shook [himself]5075-the first sparrow , the silence in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge — barring the rare sound of [the watchman]5076-the watchman — was broken in [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's ear only by the time - piece in [the bedroom]5077-the bedroom ticking frantically against the clock on the stairs ; ticking harder and harder till it seemed to clang like a gong ; and all this while [the subtle - souled girl]5078-the subtle - souled girl asking [herself]5078-the subtle - souled girl why [she]5078-the subtle - souled girl was born , why sitting in [a room]5079-a room , and blinking at the candle ; why things around [her]5078-the subtle - souled girl had taken the shape [they]5080-they wore in preference to every other possible shape . Why [they]5080-they stared at [her]5078-the subtle - souled girl so helplessly , as if waiting for the touch of some wand that should release [them]5080-they from terrestrial constraint ; what that chaos called consciousness , which spun in [her]5078-the subtle - souled girl at this moment like a top , tended to , and began in . [Her]5078-the subtle - souled girl eyes fell together ; [she]5078-the subtle - souled girl was awake , yet [she]5078-the subtle - souled girl was asleep . A word from [[her]5078-the subtle - souled girl mother]588-her mother roused [her]5078-the subtle - souled girl . Without preface , and as the continuation of a scene already progressing in [her]5078-the subtle - souled girl mind , [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard said : “[1940-you] [You]1940-you remember the note sent to [you]1940-you and [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae — asking [you]1940-you to meet [some one in [Durnover Barton]55-durnover barton]1941-some one in durnover barton — and that [you]1940-you thought it was a trick to make fools of [you]1940-you ? ” “[1940-you] Yes . ” “[0-i] It was not to make fools of [you]1940-you — it was done to bring [you]1940-you together . ' Twas [I]0-i did it . ” “[0-i] Why ? ” said [Elizabeth]191-henchard , with a start . “[149-farfrae] [I]0-i — wanted [you]0-i to marry [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae . ” “[4495-mother] O [mother]4495-mother ! ” [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard bent down [her]191-henchard head so much that [she]191-henchard looked quite into [her]191-henchard own lap . But as [[her]191-henchard mother]588-her mother did not go on , [she]191-henchard said , “[4495-mother] What reason ? ” “[128-henchard] Well , [I]0-i had a reason . ' Twill out one day . [I]0-i wish it could have been in [my]0-i time ! But there — nothing is as [you]0-i wish it ! [Henchard]128-henchard hates [him]149-farfrae . ” “[0-i] Perhaps [they]1943-they 'll be [friends]1944-friends again , ” murmured [the girl]311-the girl . “[1945-she] [I]0-i do n't know — [I]0-i do n't know . ” After this [[her]311-the girl mother]588-her mother was silent , and dozed ; and [she]588-her mother spoke on the subject no more . Some little time later on [Farfrae]149-farfrae was passing [[Henchard]128-henchard 's house]1270-henchard 's house on a Sunday morning , when [he]149-farfrae observed that the blinds were all down . [He]149-farfrae rang the bell so softly that it only sounded a single full note and a small one ; and then [he]149-farfrae was informed that [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard was dead — just dead — that very hour . At [the town]632-the town - pump there were gathered when [he]149-farfrae passed [a few old inhabitants]5087-a few old inhabitants , who came [there]447-there for water whenever [they]5087-a few old inhabitants had , as at present , spare time to fetch it , because it was purer from that original fount than from [[their]5087-a few old inhabitants own wells]5089-their own wells . [Mrs. Cuxsom]159-mrs. cuxsom , who had been standing [there]447-there for an indefinite time with [[her]159-mrs. cuxsom pitcher]5091-her pitcher , was describing the incidents of [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard 's death , as [she]159-mrs. cuxsom had learnt them from [the nurse]5092-the nurse . “[1945-she] And [she]1945-she was white as marble - stone , ” said [Mrs. Cuxsom]159-mrs. cuxsom . “[191-henchard] And likewise such [a thoughtful woman]1946-a thoughtful woman , too — ah , [poor soul]1947-poor soul — that a ' minded every little thing that wanted tending . ' Yes , ' says [she]1945-she , ' when [I]0-i 'm gone , and [my]0-i last breath 's blowed , look in the top drawer o ' the chest in [the back room]1948-the back room by the window , and [you]1949-you 'll find all [my]0-i coffin clothes , a piece of flannel — that 's to put under [me]0-i , and the little piece is to put under [my]0-i head ; and [my]0-i new stockings for [my]0-i feet — they are folded alongside , and all [my]0-i other things . And there 's four ounce pennies , the heaviest [I]0-i could find , a - tied up in bits of linen , for weights — two for [my]0-i right eye and two for [my]0-i left , ' [she]1945-she said . ' And when [you]1949-you 've used 'em , and [my]0-i eyes do n't open no more , bury the pennies , [good souls]1950-good souls and do n't [ye]1949-you go spending 'em , for [I]0-i should n't like it . And open the windows as soon as [I]0-i am carried out , and make it as cheerful as [you]1949-you can for [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . ' ” “[191-henchard] Ah , poor heart ! ” “[4800-that man] Well , and [Martha]189-martha did it , and buried the ounce pennies in [the garden]1272-the garden . But if [ye'll]1952-ye'll believe words , [that man]4800-that man , [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney , went and dug ['em]1954-'em up , and spent 'em at the Three Mariners . ' Faith , ' [he]4800-that man said , ' why should death rob life o ' fourpence ? Death 's not of such good report that [we]1955-we should respect ' en to that extent , ' says [he]4800-that man . ” “[4800-that man] ' Twas a cannibal deed ! ” deprecated [[her]191-henchard listeners]5093-her listeners . “[0-i] Gad , then [I]0-i wo n't quite ha'e it , ” said [Solomon Longways]131-longways . “[0-i] [I]0-i say it to - day , and ' tis a Sunday morning , and [I]0-i would n't speak wrongfully for a zilver zixpence at such a time . [I]0-i do n't see noo harm in it . To respect the dead is sound doxology ; and [I]0-i would n't sell [skellintons — leastwise respectable skellintons]1956-skellintons — leastwise respectable skellintons — to be varnished for ' natomies , except [I]0-i were out o ' work . But money is scarce , and throats get dry . Why SHOULD death rob life o ' fourpence ? [I]0-i say there was no treason in it . ” “[1947-poor soul] Well , [poor soul]1947-poor soul ; [she]1947-poor soul 's helpless to hinder that or anything now , ” answered [Mother Cuxsom]145-mother cuxsom . “[1947-poor soul] And all [her]1947-poor soul shining keys will be took from [her]1947-poor soul , and [her]1947-poor soul cupboards opened ; and little things a ' did n't wish seen , [anybody]4437-anybody will see ; and [her]1947-poor soul wishes and ways will all be as nothing ! ”[128-henchard]

[Henchard]128-henchard and [Elizabeth]191-henchard sat conversing by the fire . It was three weeks after [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard 's funeral , the candles were not lighted , and a restless , acrobatic flame , poised on a coal , called from the shady walls the smiles of all shapes that could respond — the old pier - glass , with gilt columns and huge entablature , the picture - frames , sundry knobs and handles , and the brass rosette at the bottom of each riband bell - pull on either side of the chimney - piece . “ [Elizabeth]191-henchard , do [you]191-henchard think much of old times ? ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]128-henchard . “ Yes , [sir]4588-sir ; often , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said . “ Who do [you]4588-sir put in [your]4588-sir pictures of 'em ? ”[128-henchard] “ [Mother]4495-mother and [father]4491-father — [nobody else]4836-nobody else hardly . ”[191-henchard] [Henchard]128-henchard always looked like one bent on resisting pain when [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard spoke of [Richard Newson]127-newson as “ [father]4491-father . ”[127-newson] “ Ah ! [I]127-newson am out of all that , am [I]127-newson not ? ”[127-newson] [he]127-newson said .... “ Was [Newson]127-newson [a kind father]5099-a kind father ? ”[128-henchard] “ Yes , [sir]4588-sir ; very . ”[127-newson] [Henchard]128-henchard 's face settled into an expression of stolid loneliness which gradually modulated into something softer . “ Suppose [I]127-newson had been [[your]191-henchard real father]5101-your real father ? ”[127-newson] [he]127-newson said . “ Would [you]191-henchard have cared for [me]191-henchard as much as [you]191-henchard cared for [Richard Newson]127-newson ? ”[191-henchard] “ [I]191-henchard ca n't think it , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said quickly . “ [I]127-newson can think of [no other]5102-no other as [[my]127-newson father]5103-my father , except [[my]127-newson father]5103-my father . ”[127-newson] [[Henchard]128-henchard 's wife]655-henchard 's wife was dissevered from [him]127-newson by death ; [[his]127-newson friend]1456-his friend and helper [Farfrae]149-farfrae by estrangement ; [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard by ignorance . It seemed to [him]127-newson that only one of [them]1961-them could possibly be recalled , and that was [the girl]311-the girl . [His]127-newson mind began vibrating between the wish to reveal [himself]127-newson to [her]311-the girl and the policy of leaving well alone , till [he]127-newson could no longer sit still . [He]127-newson walked up and down , and then [he]127-newson came and stood behind [her]311-the girl chair , looking down upon the top of [her]311-the girl head . [He]127-newson could no longer restrain [his]127-newson impulse . “ What did [[your]311-the girl mother]4779-your mother tell [you]311-the girl about [me]127-newson — [my]127-newson history ? ”[127-newson] [he]127-newson asked . “ That [you]311-the girl were related by marriage . ”[128-henchard] “ [She]4779-your mother should have told more — before [you]311-the girl knew [me]128-henchard ! Then [my]128-henchard task would not have been such a hard one .... [Elizabeth]191-henchard , it is [I]128-henchard who am [[your]191-henchard father]5032-your father , and not [Richard Newson]127-newson . Shame alone prevented [[your]191-henchard wretched parents]5107-your wretched parents from owning this to [you]191-henchard while both of ['em]5107-your wretched parents were alive . ”[128-henchard] The back of [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's head remained still , and [her]191-henchard shoulders did not denote even the movements of breathing . [Henchard]128-henchard went on : “ [I]128-henchard 'd rather have [your]191-henchard scorn , [your]191-henchard fear , anything than [your]191-henchard ignorance ; ' tis that [I]128-henchard hate ! [[Your]191-henchard mother]4779-your mother and [I]128-henchard were [man]488-man and [wife]316-wife when [we]5111-we were young . What [you]191-henchard saw was [our]5111-we second marriage . [[Your]191-henchard mother]4779-your mother was too honest . [We]5111-we had thought [each other]4626-each other dead — and — [Newson]128-henchard became [[her]4779-your mother husband]387-her husband . ”[128-henchard] This was the nearest approach [Henchard]128-henchard could make to the full truth . As far as [he]1963-he personally was concerned [he]1963-he would have screened nothing ; but [he]1963-he showed a respect for [the young girl]1910-the young girl 's sex and years worthy of [a better man]4931-a better man . When [he]1963-he had gone on to give details which a whole series of slight and unregarded incidents in [her]1910-the young girl past life strangely corroborated ; when , in short , [she]1910-the young girl believed [his]1963-he story to be true , [she]1910-the young girl became greatly agitated , and turning round to the table flung [her]1910-the young girl face upon it weeping . “ Do n't cry — do n't cry ! ”[1963-he] said [Henchard]128-henchard , with vehement pathos , “ [I]1963-he ca n't bear it , [I]1963-he wo n't bear it . [I]1963-he am [[your]1910-the young girl father]5032-your father ; why should [you]1910-the young girl cry ? Am [I]1963-he so dreadful , so hateful to ' [ee]1910-the young girl ? Do n't take against [me]1963-he , [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard ! ”[1963-he] [he]1963-he cried , grasping [her]1910-the young girl wet hand . “ Do n't take against [me]128-henchard — though [I]128-henchard was [a drinking man]4846-a drinking man once , and used [[your]1910-the young girl mother]4779-your mother roughly — [I]128-henchard 'll be kinder to [you]1910-the young girl than [HE]1963-he was ! [I]128-henchard 'll do anything , if [you]1910-the young girl will only look upon [me]128-henchard as [[your]1910-the young girl father]5032-your father ! ”[128-henchard] [She]1910-the young girl tried to stand up and comfort [him]1963-he trustfully ; but [she]1910-the young girl could not ; [she]1910-the young girl was troubled at [his]1963-he presence , like [the brethren at the avowal of [Joseph]190-joe]1966-the brethren at the avowal of joseph . “ [I]1967-i do n't want [you]1910-the young girl to come to [me]1967-i all of a sudden , ”[1967-i] said [Henchard]128-henchard in jerks , and moving like a great tree in a wind . “ No , [Elizabeth]191-henchard , [I]1967-i do n't . [I]1967-i 'll go away and not see [you]1910-the young girl till to - morrow , or when [you]1910-the young girl like , and then [I]1967-i 'll show [']1910-the young girl [ee]1910-the young girl papers to prove [my]1967-i words . There , [I]1967-i am gone , and wo n't disturb [you]1910-the young girl any more .... 'Twas [I]1967-i that chose [your]1910-the young girl name , [[my]1967-i daughter]4881-my daughter ; [[your]1910-the young girl mother]4779-your mother wanted it [Susan]122-henchard . There , do n't forget ' twas [I]1967-i gave [you]1910-the young girl [your]1910-the young girl name ! ”[1967-i] [He]1967-i went out at the door and shut [her]1968-she softly in , and [she]1968-she heard [him]1967-i go away into [the garden]1272-the garden . But [he]1967-i had not done . Before [she]1968-she had moved , or in any way recovered from the effect of [his]1967-i disclosure , [he]1967-i reappeared . “ One word more , [Elizabeth]191-henchard , ”[1967-i] [he]1967-i said . “ [You]191-henchard 'll take [my]1970-i surname now — hey ? [[Your]191-henchard mother]4779-your mother was against it , but it will be much more pleasant to [me]1970-i . ' Tis legally [yours]191-henchard , [you]191-henchard know . But [nobody]298-nobody need know that . [You]191-henchard shall take it as if by choice . [I]1970-i 'll talk to [[my]1970-i lawyer]5123-my lawyer — [I]1970-i do n't know the law of it exactly ; but will [you]5123-my lawyer do this — let [me]1970-i put a few lines into the newspaper that such is to be [your]5123-my lawyer name ? ”[1970-i] “ If it is [my]1967-i name [I]1967-i must have it , must n't [I]1967-i ? ”[1967-i] [she]1970-i asked . “ Well , well ; usage is everything in these matters . ”[1967-i] “ [I]1967-i wonder why [mother]4495-mother did n't wish it ? ”[1967-i] “ Oh , some whim of [the poor soul]4455-the poor soul 's . Now get a bit of paper and draw up a paragraph as [I]1970-i shall tell [you]5123-my lawyer . But let 's have a light . ”[1970-i] “ [I]1967-i can see by the firelight , ”[1967-i] [she]1970-i answered . “ Yes — [I]1970-i 'd rather . ”[1970-i] “ Very well . ”[191-henchard] [She]1970-i got a piece of paper , and bending over the fender wrote at [his]1971-he dictation words which [he]1971-he had evidently got by heart from some advertisement or other — words to the effect that [she]1970-i , [the writer]1643-the writer , hitherto known as [Elizabeth - Jane Newson]191-henchard , was going to call [herself]1970-i [Elizabeth - Jane Henchard]191-henchard forthwith . It was done , and fastened up , and directed to [the office of the Casterbridge Chronicle]1973-the office of the casterbridge chronicle . “ Now , ”[1971-he] said [Henchard]191-henchard , with the blaze of satisfaction that [he]1971-he always emitted when [he]1971-he had carried [his]1971-he point — though tenderness softened it this time — “ [I]128-henchard 'll go [upstairs]1000-upstairs and hunt for some documents that will prove it all to [you]1974-the bewildered girl . But [I]128-henchard wo n't trouble [you]1974-the bewildered girl with [them]5127-them till to - morrow . Good - night , [my]128-henchard Elizabeth - [Jane]191-henchard ! ”[128-henchard] [He]1971-he was gone before [the bewildered girl]1974-the bewildered girl could realize what it all meant , or adjust [her]1974-the bewildered girl filial sense to the new center of gravity . [She]1974-the bewildered girl was thankful that [he]1971-he had left [her]1974-the bewildered girl to [herself]1974-the bewildered girl for the evening , and sat down over the fire . Here [she]1974-the bewildered girl remained in silence , and wept — not for [[her]1974-the bewildered girl mother]588-her mother now , but for [the genial sailor [Richard Newson]127-newson , to whom [she]1974-the bewildered girl seemed doing a wrong]127-newson . [Henchard]191-henchard in the meantime had gone [upstairs]1000-upstairs . Papers of a domestic nature [he]1971-he kept in a drawer in [[his]1971-he bedroom]1977-his bedroom , and this [he]1971-he unlocked . Before turning them over [he]1971-he leant back and indulged in reposeful thought . [Elizabeth]191-henchard was [his]1971-he at last and [she]191-henchard was [a girl of such good sense and kind heart]1978-a girl of such good sense and kind heart that [she]191-henchard would be sure to like [him]1971-he . [He]1971-he was [the kind of man to whom [some human object]1980-some human object for pouring out [his]1971-he heart upon]1979-the kind of man to whom some human object for pouring out his heart upon — were it emotive or were it choleric — was almost a necessity . The craving for [his]1971-he heart for the re - establishment of this tenderest human tie had been great during [[his]1971-he wife]380-his wife 's lifetime , and now [he]1971-he had submitted to its mastery without reluctance and without fear . [He]1971-he bent over the drawer again , and proceeded in [his]1971-he search . Among the other papers had been placed the contents of [[his]1971-he wife]380-his wife 's little desk , the keys of which had been handed to [him]1971-he at [her]380-his wife request . Here was the letter addressed to [him]1971-he with the restriction , “ NOT TO BE OPENED TILL [ELIZABETH - JANE]191-henchard 'S WEDDING - DAY . ”[1971-he] [Mrs. Henchard]128-henchard , though more patient than [[her]128-henchard husband]387-her husband , had been no practical hand at anything . In sealing up the sheet , which was folded and tucked in without an envelope , in the old - fashioned way , [she]128-henchard had overlaid the junction with a large mass of wax without the requisite under - touch of the same . The seal had cracked , and the letter was open . [Henchard]128-henchard had no reason to suppose the restriction one of serious weight , and [his]1971-he feeling for [[his]1971-he late wife]1984-his late wife had not been of the nature of deep respect . “ Some trifling fancy or other of poor [Susan]122-henchard 's , [I]387-her husband suppose , ”[387-her husband] [he]1971-he said ; and without curiosity [he]1971-he allowed [his]1971-he eyes to scan the letter : — [[MY]0-i DEAR]4489-my dear [MICHAEL]120-henchard , — For the good of all three of [us]1986-us [I]0-i have kept one thing a secret from [you]120-henchard till now . [I]0-i hope [you]120-henchard will understand why ; [I]0-i think [you]120-henchard will ; though perhaps [you]120-henchard may not forgive [me]0-i . But , [dear Michael]120-henchard , [I]0-i have done it for the best . [I]0-i shall be in [my]0-i grave when [you]120-henchard read this , and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard will have [a home]1987-a home . Do n't curse [me]0-i [Mike]120-henchard — think of how [I]0-i was situated . [I]0-i can hardly write it , but here it is . [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard is not [your]120-henchard [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard — [the child who was in [my]0-i arms when [you]120-henchard sold [me]0-i]1988-the child who was in my arms when you sold me . No ; [she]191-henchard died three months after that , and [this living one]1989-this living one is [[my]0-i other husband]1990-my other husband 's . [I]0-i christened [her]191-henchard by the same name [we]1991-we had given to the first , and [she]191-henchard filled up the ache [I]0-i felt at the other 's loss . [Michael]120-henchard , [I]0-i am dying , and [I]0-i might have held [my]0-i tongue ; but [I]0-i could not . Tell [[her]191-henchard husband]387-her husband of this or not , as [you]120-henchard may judge ; and forgive , if [you]120-henchard can , [a woman [you]120-henchard once deeply wronged]1993-a woman you once deeply wronged , as [she]191-henchard forgives [you]120-henchard . [SUSAN HENCHARD]122-henchard [[Her]191-henchard husband]387-her husband regarded the paper as if it were a window - pane through which [he]387-her husband saw for miles . [His]387-her husband lips twitched , and [he]387-her husband seemed to compress [his]387-her husband frame , as if to bear better . [His]387-her husband usual habit was not to consider whether destiny were hard upon [him]387-her husband or not — the shape of [his]387-her husband ideals in cases of affliction being simply a moody “ [I]387-her husband am to suffer , [I]387-her husband perceive . ”[387-her husband] “ This much scourging , then , it is for [me]387-her husband . ”[387-her husband] But now through [his]387-her husband passionate head there stormed this thought — that the blasting disclosure was what [he]387-her husband had deserved . [[His]387-her husband wife]380-his wife 's extreme reluctance to have [the girl]311-the girl 's name altered from [Newson]128-henchard to [Henchard]128-henchard was now accounted for fully . It furnished another illustration of that honesty in dishonesty which had characterized [her]380-his wife in other things . [He]387-her husband remained unnerved and purposeless for near a couple of hours ; till [he]387-her husband suddenly said , “ Ah — [I]4474-a man wonder if it is true ! ”[4474-a man] [He]387-her husband jumped up in an impulse , kicked off [his]387-her husband slippers , and went with a candle to the door of [[Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's room]1578-elizabeth - jane 's room , where [he]387-her husband put [his]387-her husband ear to the keyhole and listened . [She]191-henchard was breathing profoundly . [Henchard]191-henchard softly turned the handle , entered , and shading the light , approached the bedside . Gradually bringing the light from behind a screening curtain [he]387-her husband held it in such a manner that it fell slantwise on [her]191-henchard face without shining on [her]191-henchard eyes . [He]387-her husband steadfastly regarded [her]191-henchard features . They were fair : [his]387-her husband were dark . But this was an unimportant preliminary . In sleep there come to the surface buried genealogical facts , ancestral curves , [dead men]1998-dead men 's traits , which the mobility of daytime animation screens and overwhelms . In the present statuesque repose of [the young girl]1910-the young girl 's countenance [Richard Newson]127-newson 's was unmistakably reflected . [He]387-her husband could not endure the sight of [her]191-henchard , and hastened away . [Misery]192-misery taught [him]387-her husband nothing more than defiant endurance of it . [[His]387-her husband wife]380-his wife was dead , and the first impulse for revenge died with the thought that [she]191-henchard was beyond [him]387-her husband . [He]387-her husband looked out at the night as at [a fiend]2001-a fiend . [Henchard]191-henchard , like all [his]387-her husband kind , was superstitious , and [he]387-her husband could not help thinking that the concatenation of events this evening had produced was the scheme of some sinister intelligence bent on punishing [him]387-her husband . Yet they had developed naturally . If [he]387-her husband had not revealed [his]387-her husband past history to [Elizabeth]191-henchard [he]387-her husband would not have searched the drawer for papers , and so on . The mockery was , that [he]387-her husband should have no sooner taught [a girl]1559-a girl to claim the shelter of [his]387-her husband paternity than [he]387-her husband discovered [her]1559-a girl to have no kinship with [him]387-her husband . This ironical sequence of things angered [him]387-her husband like an impish trick from [a fellow - creature]2003-a fellow - creature . Like [Prester John]193-prester john 's , [his]387-her husband table had been spread , and [infernal harpies]2004-infernal harpies had snatched up the food . [He]387-her husband went out of [the house]782-the house , and moved sullenly onward down [the pavement]1160-the pavement till [he]387-her husband came to the bridge at [the bottom of [the High Street]759-the high street]2007-the bottom of the high street . Here [he]387-her husband turned in upon a bypath on [the river bank]2009-the river bank , skirting [the north - eastern limits of [the town]632-the town]2010-the north - eastern limits of the town . [These precincts]2012-these precincts embodied the mournful phases of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge life , as [the south avenues]2013-the south avenues embodied [its]2013-the south avenues cheerful moods . The whole way along here was sunless , even in summer time ; in spring , white frosts lingered here when other places were steaming with warmth ; while in winter it was the seed - field of all the aches , rheumatisms , and torturing cramps of the year . [The Casterbridge doctors]2014-the casterbridge doctors must have pined away for want of sufficient nourishment but for the configuration of [the landscape]543-the landscape on [the north - eastern side]2016-the north - eastern side . [The river]1757-the river — slow , noiseless , and dark — [the Schwarzwasser of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]56-the schwarzwasser of casterbridge — ran beneath [a low cliff]2018-a low cliff , the two together forming a defence which had rendered walls and artificial earthworks on this side unnecessary . Here were ruins of [a Franciscan priory]2019-a franciscan priory , and [a mill attached to the same]2020-a mill attached to the same , the water of which roared down [a back - hatch]2021-a back - hatch like the voice of desolation . Above [the cliff]2022-the cliff , and behind [the river]1757-the river , rose [a pile of buildings]2024-a pile of buildings , and in the front of the pile a square mass cut into the sky . It was like a pedestal lacking [its]2025-its statue . This missing feature , without which the design remained incomplete , was , in truth , the corpse of [a man]4474-a man , for the square mass formed the base of the gallows , [the extensive buildings at the back]2027-the extensive buildings at the back being [the county gaol]2028-the county gaol . In [the meadow where [Henchard]191-henchard now walked [the mob]2030-the mob]2029-the meadow where henchard now walked the mob were wo nt to gather whenever an execution took place , and there to the tune of the roaring weir [they]2030-the mob stood and watched the spectacle . The exaggeration which darkness imparted to the glooms of [this region]2031-this region impressed [Henchard]191-henchard more than [he]4474-a man had expected . The lugubrious harmony of the spot with [his]4474-a man domestic situation was too perfect for [him]4474-a man , impatient of effects scenes , and adumbrations . It reduced [his]4474-a man heartburning to melancholy , and [he]4474-a man exclaimed , “ Why [the deuce]5128-the deuce did [I]191-henchard come here ! ”[191-henchard] [He]4474-a man went on past [the cottage in which [the old local hangman]2033-the old local hangman had lived and died , in times before that calling was monopolized over all [England]3-england]2032-the cottage in which the old local hangman had lived and died , in times before that calling was monopolized over all england by [a single gentleman]2034-a single gentleman ; and climbed up by [a steep back lane]2035-a steep back lane into [the town]632-the town . For the sufferings of that night , engendered by [his]4474-a man bitter disappointment , [he]4474-a man might well have been pitied . [He]4474-a man was like [one who had half fainted , and could neither recover nor complete the swoon]2037-one who had half fainted , and could neither recover nor complete the swoon . In words [he]4474-a man could blame [[his]4474-a man wife]380-his wife , but not in [his]4474-a man heart ; and had [he]4474-a man obeyed the wise directions outside [her]380-his wife letter this pain would have been spared [him]4474-a man for long — possibly for ever , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard seeming to show no ambition to quit [her]191-henchard safe and secluded maiden courses for the speculative path of matrimony . The morning came after this night of unrest , and with it the necessity for a plan . [He]4474-a man was far too self - willed to recede from a position , especially as it would involve humiliation . [[His]4474-a man daughter]2039-his daughter [he]4474-a man had asserted [her]2039-his daughter to be , and [[his]4474-a man daughter]2039-his daughter [she]2039-his daughter should always think [herself]2039-his daughter , no matter what hyprocrisy it involved . But [he]4474-a man was ill - prepared for the first step in this new situation . The moment [he]4474-a man came into [the breakfast - room]2041-the breakfast - room [Elizabeth]191-henchard advanced with open confidence to [him]4474-a man and took [him]4474-a man by the arm . “ [I]191-henchard have thought and thought all night of it , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said frankly . “ And [I]2042-me see that everything must be as [you]4474-a man say . And [I]2042-me am going to look upon [you]4474-a man as [the father that [you]4474-a man are]5129-the father that you are , and not to call [you]4474-a man [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard any more . It is so plain to [me]2042-me now . Indeed , [father]4491-father , it is . For , of course , [you]4474-a man would not have done half the things [you]4474-a man have done for [me]2042-me , and let [me]2042-me have [my]2042-me own way so entirely , and bought [me]2042-me presents , if [I]2042-me had only been [[your]4474-a man step - daughter]5131-your step - daughter ! [He]120-henchard — [Mr. Newson]194-mr. newson — whom [[my]2042-me poor mother]5132-my poor mother married by such a strange mistake ”[2042-me] ( [Henchard]120-henchard was glad that [he]120-henchard had disguised matters here ) , “ was very kind — O so kind ! ”[2042-me] ( [she]2042-me spoke with tears in [her]2042-me eyes ) ; “ but that is not the same thing as being [one 's real father]5133-one 's real father after all . Now , [father]4491-father , breakfast is ready ! ”[191-henchard] [she]2042-me said cheerfully . [Henchard]120-henchard bent and kissed [her]2042-me cheek . The moment and the act [he]120-henchard had prefigured for weeks with a thrill of pleasure ; yet it was no less than a miserable insipidity to [him]120-henchard now that it had come . [His]120-henchard reinstation of [[her]2042-me mother]588-her mother had been chiefly for [the girl]311-the girl 's sake , and the fruition of the whole scheme was such dust and ashes as this .

Of all the enigmas which ever confronted [a girl]1559-a girl there can have been seldom one like that which followed [Henchard]120-henchard 's announcement of [himself]120-henchard to [Elizabeth]191-henchard as [[her]191-henchard father]4886-her father . [He]120-henchard had done it in an ardour and an agitation which had half carried the point of affection with [her]191-henchard ; yet , behold , from the next morning onwards [his]120-henchard manner was constrained as [she]191-henchard had never seen it before . The coldness soon broke out into open chiding . One grievous failing of [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's was [her]191-henchard occasional pretty and picturesque use of dialect words — those terrible marks of the beast to [the truly genteel]2047-the truly genteel . It was dinner - time — [they]2048-they never met except at meals — and [she]191-henchard happened to say when [he]120-henchard was rising from table , wishing to show [him]120-henchard something , “ If [you]120-henchard 'll bide where [you]120-henchard be a minute , [father]4491-father , [I]120-henchard 'll get it . ”[120-henchard] “ ' Bide where [you]191-henchard be , ' ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard echoed sharply , “ [Good God]126-god , are [you]191-henchard only fit to carry wash to a pig - trough , that [ye]120-henchard use such words as those ? ”[191-henchard] [She]191-henchard reddened with shame and sadness . “ [I]191-henchard meant ' Stay where [you]120-henchard are , ' [father]4491-father , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said , in a low , humble voice . “ [I]191-henchard ought to have been more careful . ”[191-henchard] [He]120-henchard made no reply , and went out of [the room]985-the room . The sharp reprimand was not lost upon [her]191-henchard , and in time it came to pass that for “ fay ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said “ succeed ”[191-henchard] ; that [she]191-henchard no longer spoke of “ dumbledores ”[191-henchard] but of “ [humble bees ”]5137-humble bees ”[191-henchard] ; no longer said of [young men]2050-young men and [women]4948-women that [they]2052-they “ walked together , ”[191-henchard] but that [they]2052-they were “ engaged ”[191-henchard] ; that [she]191-henchard grew to talk of “ [greggles ”]5138-greggles ”[191-henchard] as “ wild hyacinths ”[191-henchard] ; that when [she]191-henchard had not slept [she]191-henchard did not quaintly tell [the servants]2053-the servants next morning that [she]191-henchard had been “ hag - rid , ”[191-henchard] but that [she]191-henchard had “ suffered from indigestion . ”[4556-the mayor] These improvements , however , are somewhat in advance of the story . [Henchard]191-henchard , being uncultivated [himself]191-henchard , was the bitterest critic [the fair girl]2054-the fair girl could possibly have had of [her]191-henchard own lapses — really slight now , for [she]191-henchard read omnivorously . A gratuitous ordeal was in store for [her]191-henchard in the matter of [her]191-henchard handwriting . [She]191-henchard was passing [the dining - room]891-the dining - room door one evening , and had occasion to go in for something . It was not till [she]191-henchard had opened the door that [she]191-henchard knew [the Mayor]4556-the mayor was there in the company of [a man with whom [he]4556-the mayor transacted business]2057-a man with whom he transacted business . “ Here , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , ”[4556-the mayor] [he]4556-the mayor said , looking round at [her]191-henchard , “ just write down what [I]2058-the gentleman tell [you]191-henchard — a few words of an agreement for [me]2058-the gentleman and [this gentleman]1812-this gentleman to sign . [I]2058-the gentleman am [a poor tool with a pen]5140-a poor tool with a pen . ”[2058-the gentleman] “ Be jowned , and so be [I]191-henchard , ”[191-henchard] said [the gentleman]2058-the gentleman . [She]191-henchard brought forward blotting - book , paper , and ink , and sat down . “ Now then — ' An agreement entered into this sixteenth day of October ' — write that first . ”[4556-the mayor] [She]191-henchard started the pen in an elephantine march across the sheet . It was a splendid round , bold hand of [her]191-henchard own conception , a style that would have stamped [a woman]647-a woman as [Minerva]195-minerva 's own in more recent days . But other ideas reigned then : [Henchard]191-henchard 's creed was that [proper young girls]2060-proper young girls wrote ladies'-hand — nay , [he]4556-the mayor believed that [bristling characters]2061-bristling characters were as innate and inseparable a part of refined womanhood as sex itself . Hence when , instead of scribbling , like [the Princess Ida]2062-the princess ida , — [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard produced a line of chain - shot and sand - bags , [he]4556-the mayor reddened in angry shame for [her]191-henchard , and , peremptorily saying , “ Never mind — [I]191-henchard 'll finish it , ”[191-henchard] dismissed [her]191-henchard there and then . [Her]191-henchard considerate disposition became a pitfall to [her]191-henchard now . [She]191-henchard was , it must be admitted , sometimes provokingly and unnecessarily willing to saddle [herself]191-henchard with manual labours . [She]191-henchard would go to [the kitchen]1003-the kitchen instead of ringing , “ Not to make [Phoebe]196-phoebe come up twice . ”[191-henchard] [She]191-henchard went down on [her]191-henchard knees , shovel in hand , when the cat overturned the coal - scuttle ; moreover , [she]191-henchard would persistently thank [the parlour - maid]2064-the parlour - maid for everything , till one day , as soon as [the girl]311-the girl was gone from [the room]985-the room , [Henchard]191-henchard broke out with , “ [Good God]126-god , why dostn't leave off thanking [that girl]5141-that girl as if [she]5141-that girl were [a goddess - born]5142-a goddess - born ! Do n't [I]191-henchard pay [her]5141-that girl a dozen pound a year to do things for ' [ee]5141-that girl ? ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard shrank so visibly at the exclamation that [he]2067-his became sorry a few minutes after , and said that [he]2067-his did not mean to be rough . These domestic exhibitions were the small protruding needlerocks which suggested rather than revealed what was underneath . But [his]2067-his passion had less terror for [her]191-henchard than [his]2067-his coldness . The increasing frequency of the latter mood told [her]191-henchard the sad news that [he]2067-his disliked [her]191-henchard with a growing dislike . The more interesting that [her]191-henchard appearance and manners became under the softening influences which [she]191-henchard could now command , and in [her]191-henchard wisdom did command , the more [she]191-henchard seemed to estrange [him]2067-his . Sometimes [she]191-henchard caught [him]2067-his looking at [her]191-henchard with a louring invidiousness that [she]191-henchard could hardly bear . Not knowing [his]2067-his secret it was cruel mockery that [she]191-henchard should for the first time excite [his]2067-his animosity when [she]191-henchard had taken [his]2067-his surname . But the most terrible ordeal was to come . [Elizabeth]191-henchard had latterly been accustomed of an afternoon to present a cup of cider or ale and bread - and - cheese to [Nance Mockridge]158-nance , who worked in [the yard]1277-the yard wimbling hay - bonds . [Nance]158-nance accepted this offering thankfully at first ; afterwards as a matter of course . On a day when [Henchard]191-henchard was on [the premises]1016-the premises [he]2067-his saw [[his]2067-his step - daughter]2070-his step - daughter enter [the hay - barn]2071-the hay - barn on this errand ; and , as there was no clear spot on which to deposit the provisions , [she]2070-his step - daughter at once set to work arranging two trusses of hay as a table , [Mockridge]158-nance meanwhile standing with [her]158-nance hands on [her]158-nance hips , easefully looking at the preparations on [her]2070-his step - daughter behalf . “ [Elizabeth]191-henchard , come here ! ”[2067-his] said [Henchard]191-henchard ; and [she]191-henchard obeyed . “ Why do [you]191-henchard lower [yourself]191-henchard so confoundedly ? ”[2067-his] [he]2067-his said with suppressed passion . “ Have n't [I]158-nance told [you]191-henchard o't fifty times ? Hey ? Making [yourself]191-henchard a drudge for [a common workwoman of such a character as hers]5143-a common workwoman of such a character as hers ! Why , [ye'll]191-henchard disgrace [me]158-nance to the dust ! ”[158-nance] Now these words were uttered loud enough to reach [Nance]158-nance inside [the barn]2072-the barn door , who fired up immediately at the slur upon [her]158-nance personal character . Coming to the door [she]158-nance cried regardless of consequences , “ Come to that , [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , [I]120-henchard can let [']120-henchard [ee]5144-ee know [she've]158-nance waited on worse ! ”[120-henchard] “ Then [she]158-nance must have had more charity than sense , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard . “ O no , [she]158-nance had n't . ' Twere not for charity but for hire ; and at [a public - house in [this town]5146-this town]5145-a public - house in this town ! ”[120-henchard] “ It is not true ! ”[158-nance] cried [Henchard]120-henchard indignantly . “ Just ask [her]158-nance , ”[120-henchard] said [Nance]158-nance , folding [her]158-nance naked arms in such a manner that [she]158-nance could comfortably scratch [her]158-nance elbows . [Henchard]120-henchard glanced at [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , whose complexion , now pink and white from confinement , lost nearly all of the former colour . “ What does this mean ? ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said to [her]191-henchard . “ Anything or nothing ? ”[191-henchard] “ It is true , ”[191-henchard] said [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . “ But it was only — ”[120-henchard] “ Did [you]191-henchard do it , or did n't [you]191-henchard ?
