[HIGH - PLACE HALL]2292-high - place hall [[MY]0-i DEAR]4489-my dear [MR . HENCHARD]120-henchard , — Do n't be surprised . It is for [your]120-henchard good and [mine]0-i , as [I]0-i hope , that [I]0-i have come to live at [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge — for how long [I]0-i can not tell . That depends upon another ; and [he]2294-he is [a man]4474-a man , and [a merchant]2296-a merchant , and [a Mayor]2297-a mayor , and one who has the first right to [my]0-i affections . Seriously , [mon ami]2298-mon ami , [I]0-i am not so light - hearted as [I]0-i may seem to be from this . [I]0-i have come here in consequence of hearing of the death of [[your]120-henchard wife]4877-your wife — whom [you]120-henchard used to think of as dead so many years before ! [Poor woman]2300-poor woman , [she]2300-poor woman seems to have been [a sufferer]2301-a sufferer , though uncomplaining , and though weak in intellect not [an imbecile]2302-an imbecile . [I]0-i am glad [you]120-henchard acted fairly by [her]2300-poor woman . As soon as [I]0-i knew [she]2300-poor woman was no more , it was brought [home]675-home to [me]0-i very forcibly by [my]0-i conscience that [I]0-i ought to endeavour to disperse the shade which [my]0-i etourderie flung over [my]0-i name , by asking [you]120-henchard to carry out [your]120-henchard promise to [me]0-i . [I]0-i hope [you]120-henchard are of the same mind , and that [you]120-henchard will take steps to this end . As , however , [I]0-i did not know how [you]120-henchard were situated , or what had happened since [our]2304-our separation , [I]0-i decided to come and establish [myself]0-i here before communicating with [you]120-henchard . [You]120-henchard probably feel as [I]0-i do about this . [I]0-i shall be able to see [you]120-henchard in a day or two . Till then , farewell . — [Yours]120-henchard , [LUCETTA]188-lucetta . P.S. — [I]0-i was unable to keep [my]0-i appointment to meet [you]120-henchard for a moment or two in passing through [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge the other day . [My]0-i plans were altered by a family event , which it will surprise [you]120-henchard to hear of . [Henchard]188-lucetta had already heard that [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall was being prepared for [a tenant]2305-a tenant . [He]188-lucetta said with a puzzled air to [the first person [he]188-lucetta encountered]2306-the first person he encountered , “ Who is coming to live at [the Hall]1877-the hall ? ”[2307-his informant] “ [A lady of the name of Templeman]5207-a lady of the name of templeman , [I]188-lucetta believe , [sir]4588-sir , ”[188-lucetta] said [[his]188-lucetta informant]2307-his informant . [Henchard]188-lucetta thought it over . “ [Lucetta]188-lucetta is related to [her]5207-a lady of the name of templeman , [I]188-lucetta suppose , ”[188-lucetta] [he]188-lucetta said to [himself]188-lucetta . “ Yes , [I]204-miss le sueur must put [her]5207-a lady of the name of templeman in [her]5207-a lady of the name of templeman proper position , undoubtedly . ”[204-miss le sueur] It was by no means with the oppression that would once have accompanied the thought that [he]188-lucetta regarded the moral necessity now ; it was , indeed , with interest , if not warmth . [His]188-lucetta bitter disappointment at finding [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard to be none of [his]188-lucetta , and [himself]188-lucetta [a childless man]2308-a childless man , had left an emotional void in [Henchard]191-henchard that [he]188-lucetta unconsciously craved to fill . In this frame of mind , though without strong feeling , [he]188-lucetta had strolled up [the alley]2211-the alley and into [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall by [the postern at which [Elizabeth]191-henchard had so nearly encountered [him]188-lucetta]2310-the postern at which elizabeth had so nearly encountered him . [He]188-lucetta had gone on thence into [the court]2311-the court , and inquired of [a man whom [he]188-lucetta saw unpacking china from a crate if [Miss Le Sueur]204-miss le sueur was living [there]447-there]2312-a man whom he saw unpacking china from a crate if miss le sueur was living there . [Miss Le Sueur]204-miss le sueur had been the name under which [he]188-lucetta had known [Lucetta]188-lucetta — or “ [Lucette]205-lucette , ”[2324-i] as [she]191-henchard had called [herself]191-henchard at that time . [The man]291-the man replied in the negative ; that [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman only had come . [Henchard]188-lucetta went away , concluding that [Lucetta]188-lucetta had not as yet settled in . [He]188-lucetta was in this interested stage of the inquiry when [he]188-lucetta witnessed [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's departure the next day . On hearing [her]191-henchard announce the address there suddenly took possession of [him]188-lucetta the strange thought that [Lucetta]188-lucetta and [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman were [one and the same person]2315-one and the same person , for [he]188-lucetta could recall that in [her]191-henchard season of intimacy with [him]188-lucetta the name of [the rich relative whom [he]188-lucetta had deemed somewhat [a mythical personage]2317-a mythical personage]2316-the rich relative whom he had deemed somewhat a mythical personage had been given as [Templeman]203-miss templeman . Though [he]188-lucetta was not [a fortune - hunter]2318-a fortune - hunter , the possibility that [Lucetta]188-lucetta had been sublimed into [a lady of means]2319-a lady of means by some munificent testament on the part of [this relative]2320-this relative lent a charm to [her]191-henchard image which it might not otherwise have acquired . [He]188-lucetta was getting on towards the dead level of middle age , when material things increasingly possess the mind . But [Henchard]188-lucetta was not left long in suspense . [Lucetta]188-lucetta was rather addicted to scribbling , as had been shown by the torrent of letters after the fiasco in [their]2321-their marriage arrangements , and hardly had [Elizabeth]191-henchard gone away when another note came to [[the Mayor]4556-the mayor 's house]2323-the mayor 's house from [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall . “ [I]2324-i am in [residence]5209-residence , ”[2324-i] [she]2324-i said , “ and comfortable , though getting [here]4417-here has been a wearisome undertaking . [You]188-lucetta probably know what [I]188-lucetta am going to tell [you]188-lucetta , or do [you]188-lucetta not ? [[My]188-lucetta good Aunt Templeman]206-my good aunt templeman , [[the banker]5211-the banker 's widow]5212-the banker 's widow , whose very existence [you]188-lucetta used to doubt , much more [her]206-my good aunt templeman affluence , has lately died , and bequeathed some of [her]206-my good aunt templeman property to [me]188-lucetta . [I]188-lucetta will not enter into details except to say that [I]188-lucetta have taken [her]206-my good aunt templeman name — as a means of escape from [mine]188-lucetta , and its wrongs . “[188-lucetta] [I]0-i am now [[my]0-i own mistress]2325-my own mistress , and have chosen to reside in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge — to be tenant of [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall , that at least [you]2326-you may be put to no trouble if [you]2326-you wish to see [me]0-i . [My]0-i first intention was to keep [you]2326-you in ignorance of the changes in [my]0-i life till [you]2326-you should meet [me]0-i in [the street]797-the street ; but [I]0-i have thought better of this . “ [You]2326-you probably are aware of [my]188-lucetta arrangement with [[your]2326-you daughter]5213-your daughter , and have doubtless laughed at the — what shall [I]188-lucetta call it ? — practical joke ( in all affection ) of [my]188-lucetta getting [her]5213-your daughter to live with [me]188-lucetta . But [my]188-lucetta first meeting with [her]5213-your daughter was purely an accident . Do [you]2326-you see , [Michael]120-henchard , partly why [I]188-lucetta have done it ? — why , to give [you]2326-you an excuse for coming here as if to visit [HER]5213-your daughter , and thus to form [my]188-lucetta acquaintance naturally . [She]5213-your daughter is [a dear , good girl]5214-a dear , good girl , and [she]5213-your daughter thinks [you]2326-you have treated [her]5213-your daughter with undue severity . [You]2326-you may have done so in [your]2326-you haste , but not deliberately , [I]188-lucetta am sure . As the result has been to bring [her]5213-your daughter to [me]188-lucetta [I]188-lucetta am not disposed to upbraid [you]2326-you . — In haste , [yours]2326-you always , “[188-lucetta] [LUCETTA]188-lucetta . ” The excitement which these announcements produced in [Henchard]188-lucetta 's gloomy soul was to [him]188-lucetta most pleasurable . [He]188-lucetta sat over [his]188-lucetta dining - table long and dreamily , and by an almost mechanical transfer the sentiments which had run to waste since [his]188-lucetta estrangement from [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard and [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae gathered around [Lucetta]188-lucetta before [they]5215-they had grown dry . [She]5213-your daughter was plainly in a very coming - on disposition for marriage . But what else could [a poor woman]5216-a poor woman be who had given [her]5216-a poor woman time and [her]5216-a poor woman heart to [him]188-lucetta so thoughtlessly , at that former time , as to lose [her]5216-a poor woman credit by it ? Probably conscience no less than affection had brought [her]5213-your daughter [here]4417-here . On the whole [he]188-lucetta did not blame [her]5213-your daughter . “[2328-the artful little woman] [The artful little woman]2328-the artful little woman ! ” [he]188-lucetta said , smiling ( with reference to [Lucetta]188-lucetta 's adroit and pleasant manoeuvre with [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard ) . To feel that [he]188-lucetta would like to see [Lucetta]188-lucetta was with [Henchard]188-lucetta to start for [[her]2328-the artful little woman house]5218-her house . [He]188-lucetta put on [his]188-lucetta hat and went . It was between eight and nine o'clock when [he]188-lucetta reached [her]2328-the artful little woman door . The answer brought [him]188-lucetta was that [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman was engaged for that evening ; but that [she]2328-the artful little woman would be happy to see [him]188-lucetta the next day . “[2328-the artful little woman] That 's rather like giving [herself]2328-the artful little woman airs ! ” [he]188-lucetta thought . “[2329-we] And considering what [we]2329-we — ” But after all , [she]2328-the artful little woman plainly had not expected [him]188-lucetta , and [he]188-lucetta took the refusal quietly . Nevertheless [he]188-lucetta resolved not to go next day . “[2329-we] [These cursed women]2330-these cursed women — there 's not an inch of straight grain in 'em ! ” [he]188-lucetta said . Let [us]2329-we follow the train of [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard 's thought as if it were a clue line , and view the interior of [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall on this particular evening . On [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's arrival [she]191-henchard had been phlegmatically asked by [an elderly woman]5219-an elderly woman to go [upstairs]1000-upstairs and take off [her]191-henchard things . [She]191-henchard replied with great earnestness that [she]191-henchard would not think of giving that trouble , and on the instant divested [herself]191-henchard of [her]191-henchard bonnet and cloak in [the passage]1731-the passage . [She]191-henchard was then conducted to [the first floor on [the landing]1070-the landing]5222-the first floor on the landing , and left to find [her]191-henchard way further alone . [The room]985-the room disclosed was prettily furnished as a boudoir or [small drawing - room]5225-small drawing - room , and on a sofa with two cylindrical pillows reclined [a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably French extraction on one side or the other]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other . [She]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other was probably some years older than [Elizabeth]191-henchard , and had a sparkling light in [her]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other eye . In front of the sofa was a small table , with a pack of cards scattered upon it faces upward . The attitude had been so full of abandonment that [she]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other bounded up like a spring on hearing the door open . Perceiving that it was [Elizabeth]191-henchard [she]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other lapsed into ease , and came across to [her]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other with a reckless skip that innate grace only prevented from being boisterous . “[2331-you] Why , [you]2331-you are late , ” [she]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other said , taking hold of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's hands . “[2331-you] There were so many little things to put up . ” “[2331-you] And [you]2331-you seem dead - alive and tired . Let [me]0-i try to enliven [you]2331-you by some wonderful tricks [I]0-i have learnt , to kill time . Sit there and do n't move . ” [She]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other gathered up the pack of cards , pulled the table in front of [her]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other , and began to deal them rapidly , telling [Elizabeth]191-henchard to choose some . “[2331-you] Well , have [you]2331-you chosen ? ” [she]5226-a dark - haired , large - eyed , pretty woman , of unmistakably french extraction on one side or the other asked flinging down the last card . “[2331-you] No , ” stammered [Elizabeth]191-henchard , arousing [herself]191-henchard from a reverie . “[0-i] [I]0-i forgot , [I]0-i was thinking of — [you]2331-you , and [me]0-i — and how strange it is that [I]0-i am here . ” [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman looked at [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard with interest , and laid down the cards . “[0-i] Ah ! never mind , ” [she]203-miss templeman said . “[2332-we] [I]0-i 'll lie here while [you]2331-you sit by [me]0-i ; and [we]2332-we 'll talk . ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard drew up silently to the head of the sofa , but with obvious pleasure . It could be seen that though in years [she]191-henchard was younger than [her]191-henchard entertainer in manner and general vision [she]191-henchard seemed more of [the sage]5227-the sage . [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman deposited [herself]191-henchard on the sofa in [her]191-henchard former flexuous position , and throwing [her]191-henchard arm above [her]191-henchard brow — somewhat in the pose of a well - known conception of [Titian]207-titian 's — talked up at [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard invertedly across [her]191-henchard forehead and arm . “[0-i] [I]0-i must tell [you]2331-you something , ” [she]203-miss templeman said . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder if [you]2331-you have suspected it . [I]0-i have only been mistress of [a large house]2333-a large house and fortune a little while . ” “[0-i] Oh — only a little while ? ” murmured [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , [her]191-henchard countenance slightly falling . “[0-i] As [a girl]1559-a girl [I]0-i lived about in [garrison towns]2335-garrison towns and elsewhere with [[my]0-i father]5103-my father , till [I]0-i was quite flighty and unsettled . [He]5103-my father was [an officer in [the army]2338-the army]2337-an officer in the army . [I]0-i should not have mentioned this had [I]0-i not thought it best [you]2331-you should know the truth . ” “[0-i] Yes , yes . ” [She]191-henchard looked thoughtfully round [the room]985-the room — at the little square piano with brass inlayings , at the window - curtains , at the lamp , at the fair and dark kings and [queens]5229-queens on the card - table , and finally at the inverted face of [Lucetta Templeman]188-lucetta , whose large lustrous eyes had such an odd effect upside down . [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's mind ran on acquirements to an almost morbid degree . “[2331-you] [You]2331-you speak French and Italian fluently , no doubt , ” [she]191-henchard said . “[0-i] [I]0-i have not been able to get beyond a wretched bit of Latin yet . ” “[2341-they] Well , for that matter , in [[my]0-i native isle]2339-my native isle speaking French does not go for much . It is rather the other way . ” “[2341-they] Where is [[your]0-i native isle]2340-your native isle ? ” It was with rather more reluctance that [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman said , “[2351-thy] [Jersey]43-jersey . There [they]2341-they speak French on one side of [the street]797-the street and English on the other , and a mixed tongue in the middle of [the road]320-the road . But it is a long time since [I]0-i was [there]447-there . [Bath]59-bath is where [[my]0-i people]2345-my people really belong to , though [[my]0-i ancestors in [Jersey]43-jersey]2346-my ancestors in jersey were as good as anybody in [England]3-england . [They]2346-my ancestors in jersey were the Le Sueurs , [an old family who have done great things in [their]2346-my ancestors in jersey time]2347-an old family who have done great things in their time . [I]0-i went back and lived [there]447-there after [[my]0-i father]5103-my father 's death . But [I]0-i do n't value such past matters , and am quite [an English person]2350-an english person in [my]0-i feelings and tastes . ” [Lucetta]188-lucetta 's tongue had for a moment outrun [her]5230-her discretion . [She]5230-her had arrived at [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge as [a Bath lady]5231-a bath lady , and there were obvious reasons why [Jersey]43-jersey should drop out of [her]5230-her life . But [Elizabeth]191-henchard had tempted [her]5230-her to make free , and a deliberately formed resolve had been broken . It could not , however , have been broken in safer company . [Lucetta]188-lucetta 's words went no further , and after this day [she]5230-her was so much upon [her]5230-her guard that there appeared no chance of [her]5230-her identification with [the young Jersey woman who had been [[Henchard]191-henchard 's dear comrade]5233-henchard 's dear comrade at a critical time]5232-the young jersey woman who had been henchard 's dear comrade at a critical time . Not the least amusing of [her]5230-her safeguards was [her]5230-her resolute avoidance of a French word if one by accident came to [her]5230-her tongue more readily than its English equivalent . [She]5230-her shirked it with the suddenness of [the weak Apostle]5234-the weak apostle at the accusation , “[2351-thy] [Thy]2351-thy speech bewrayeth [thee]2351-thy ! ” Expectancy sat visibly upon [Lucetta]188-lucetta the next morning . [She]5230-her dressed [herself]5230-her for [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , and restlessly awaited [his]120-henchard call before mid - day ; as [he]120-henchard did not come [she]5230-her waited on through the afternoon . But [she]5230-her did not tell [Elizabeth]191-henchard that [the person]1251-the person expected was [[the girl]311-the girl 's stepfather]5237-the girl 's stepfather . [They]5238-they sat in adjoining windows of [the same room]687-the same room in [[Lucetta]188-lucetta 's great stone mansion]5240-lucetta 's great stone mansion , netting , and looking out upon [the market]5183-the market , which formed an animated scene . [Elizabeth]191-henchard could see the crown of [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather 's hat among the rest beneath , and was not aware that [Lucetta]188-lucetta watched the same object with yet intenser interest . [He]120-henchard moved about amid the throng , at this point lively as an ant - hill ; elsewhere more reposeful , and broken up by [stalls of fruit and vegetables]5243-stalls of fruit and vegetables . [The farmers]2077-the farmers as a rule preferred the open carrefour for [their]2077-the farmers transactions , despite its inconvenient jostlings and the danger from crossing [vehicles]5245-vehicles , to [the gloomy sheltered market - room]5246-the gloomy sheltered market - room provided for [them]2077-the farmers . Here [they]2077-the farmers surged on this one day of the week , forming a little world of leggings , switches , and sample - bags ; [men of extensive stomachs , sloping like mountain sides]5247-men of extensive stomachs , sloping like mountain sides ; [men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in November gales]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales ; who in conversing varied [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales attitudes much , lowering [themselves]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales by spreading [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales knees , and thrusting [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales hands into the pockets of remote inner jackets . [Their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales faces radiated tropical warmth ; for though when at [home]675-home [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales countenances varied with the seasons , [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales market - faces all the year round were glowing little fires . All over - clothes here were worn as if [they]2077-the farmers were an inconvenience , a hampering necessity . [Some men]5250-some men were well dressed ; but [the majority]5251-the majority were careless in that respect , appearing in suits which were historical records of [[their]5251-the majority wearer]5252-their wearer 's deeds , sun - scorchings , and daily struggles for many years past . Yet [many]5253-many carried ruffled cheque - books in [their]5253-many pockets which regulated at the bank hard by a balance of never less than four figures . In fact , what these gibbous human shapes specially represented was ready money — money insistently ready — not ready next year like [a nobleman]5254-a nobleman 's — often not merely ready at [the bank]325-the bank like [a professional man]5256-a professional man 's , but ready in [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales large plump hands . It happened that to - day there rose in the midst of [them]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales all two or three tall apple - trees standing as if they grew on the spot ; till it was perceived that [they]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales were held by [men from [the cider - districts who came here to sell [them]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales]5258-the cider - districts who came here to sell them , bringing the clay of [[their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales county]5259-their county on [their]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales boots]5257-men from the cider - districts who came here to sell them , bringing the clay of their county on their boots . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , who had often observed [them]5248-men whose heads in walking swayed as the trees in november gales , said , “[2351-thy] [I]0-i wonder if the same trees come every week ? ” “[2351-thy] What trees ? ” said [Lucetta]188-lucetta , absorbed in watching for [Henchard]191-henchard . [Elizabeth]191-henchard replied vaguely , for an incident checked [her]191-henchard . Behind one of the trees stood [Farfrae]139-farfrae , briskly discussing a sample - bag with [a farmer]5260-a farmer . [Henchard]191-henchard had come up , accidentally encountering [the young man]371-the young man , whose face seemed to inquire , “[2351-thy] Do [we]2352-we speak to [each other]4626-each other ? ” [She]191-henchard saw [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather throw a shine into [his]371-the young man eye which answered “[2351-thy] No ! ” [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard sighed . “[2354-you] Are [you]2354-you particularly interested in [anybody out there]2355-anybody out there ? ” said [Lucetta]188-lucetta . “[2354-you] O , no , ” said [[her]191-henchard companion]583-her companion , a quick red shooting over [her]583-her companion face . [Luckily Farfrae]209-luckily farfrae 's figure was immediately covered by the apple - tree . [Lucetta]188-lucetta looked hard at [her]583-her companion . “[2354-you] Quite sure ? ” [she]191-henchard said . “[2354-you] O yes , ” said [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . Again [Lucetta]188-lucetta looked out . “[712-farmers] [They]2356-they are all [farmers]712-farmers , [I]0-i suppose ? ” [she]191-henchard said . “[5032-your father] No . There 's [Mr. Bulge]210-mr. bulge — [he]210-mr. bulge 's [a wine merchant]2358-a wine merchant ; there 's [Benjamin Brownlet]211-benjamin brownlet — [a horse dealer]2359-a horse dealer ; and [Kitson]212-kitson , [the pig breeder]2360-the pig breeder ; and [Yopper]213-yopper , [the auctioneer]436-the auctioneer ; besides maltsters , and [millers]1923-millers — and so on . ” [Farfrae]209-luckily farfrae stood out quite distinctly now ; but [she]191-henchard did not mention [him]210-mr. bulge . The Saturday afternoon slipped on thus desultorily . [The market]5183-the market changed from the sample - showing hour to the idle hour before starting homewards , when tales were told . [Henchard]191-henchard had not called on [Lucetta]188-lucetta though [he]210-mr. bulge had stood so near . [He]210-mr. bulge must have been too busy , [she]191-henchard thought . [He]210-mr. bulge would come on Sunday or Monday . The days came but not [the visitor]5265-the visitor , though [Lucetta]188-lucetta repeated [her]191-henchard dressing with scrupulous care . [She]191-henchard got disheartened . It may at once be declared that [Lucetta]188-lucetta no longer bore towards [Henchard]191-henchard all that warm allegiance which had characterized [her]191-henchard in [their]5266-their first acquaintance , the then unfortunate issue of things had chilled pure love considerably . But there remained a conscientious wish to bring about [her]191-henchard union with [him]210-mr. bulge , now that there was nothing to hinder it — to right [her]191-henchard position — which in itself was a happiness to sigh for . With strong social reasons on [her]191-henchard side why [their]5266-their marriage should take place there had ceased to be any worldly reason on [his]210-mr. bulge why it should be postponed , since [she]191-henchard had succeeded to fortune . Tuesday was the great Candlemas fair . At breakfast [she]191-henchard said to [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard quite coolly : “[5032-your father] [I]0-i imagine [[your]2363-you father]5032-your father may call to see [you]2363-you to - day . [I]0-i suppose [he]5032-your father stands close by in [the market - place]1919-the market - place with [the rest of [the corn - dealers]2367-the corn - dealers]2366-the rest of the corn - dealers ? ” [She]191-henchard shook [her]191-henchard head . “[5032-your father] [He]5032-your father wo n't come . ” “[5032-your father] Why ? ” “[5032-your father] [He]5032-your father has taken against [me]0-i , ” [she]191-henchard said in a husky voice . “[2363-you] [You]2363-you have quarreled more deeply than [I]0-i know of . ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard , wishing to shield [the man [she]191-henchard believed to be [[her]191-henchard father]4886-her father]5267-the man she believed to be her father from any charge of unnatural dislike , said “[2363-you] Yes . ” “[2363-you] Then where [you]2363-you are is , of all places , the one [he]5032-your father will avoid ? ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard nodded sadly . [Lucetta]188-lucetta looked blank , twitched up [her]5269-her lovely eyebrows and lip , and burst into hysterical sobs . Here was a disaster — [her]191-henchard ingenious scheme completely stultified . “[203-miss templeman] O , [[my]0-i dear]4489-my dear [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman — what 's the matter ? ” cried [[her]191-henchard companion]583-her companion . “[0-i] [I]0-i like [your]2363-you company much ! ” said [Lucetta]188-lucetta , as soon as [she]5269-her could speak . “[0-i] Yes , yes — and so do [I]0-i yours ! ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard chimed in soothingly . “[166-miss henchard] But — but — ” [She]191-henchard could not finish the sentence , which was , naturally , that if [Henchard]191-henchard had such a rooted dislike for [the girl]311-the girl as now seemed to be the case , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard would have to be got rid of — a disagreeable necessity . A provisional resource suggested itself . “[166-miss henchard] [Miss Henchard]166-miss henchard — will [you]166-miss henchard go on an errand for [me]0-i as soon as breakfast is over ? — Ah , that 's very good of [you]166-miss henchard . Will [you]166-miss henchard go and order — ” Here [she]191-henchard enumerated several commissions at [sundry shops]5272-sundry shops , which would occupy [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's time for the next hour or two , at least . “[166-miss henchard] And have [you]166-miss henchard ever seen [the Museum]2369-the museum ? ” [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had not . “[0-i] Then [you]166-miss henchard should do so at once . [You]166-miss henchard can finish the morning by going [there]447-there . It is [an old house in [a back street]2372-a back street]2371-an old house in a back street — [I]0-i forget where — but [you]166-miss henchard 'll find out — and there are crowds of interesting things — skeletons , teeth , old pots and pans , ancient boots and shoes , birds ' eggs — all charmingly instructive . [You]166-miss henchard 'll be sure to stay till [you]166-miss henchard get quite hungry . ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard hastily put on [her]191-henchard things and departed . “[2373-she] [I]0-i wonder why [she]2373-she wants to get rid of [me]0-i to - day ! ” [she]191-henchard said sorrowfully as [she]191-henchard went . That [her]191-henchard absence , rather than [her]191-henchard services or instruction , was in request , had been readily apparent to [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , simple as [she]191-henchard seemed , and difficult as it was to attribute a motive for the desire . [She]191-henchard had not been gone ten minutes when [one of [[Lucetta]188-lucetta 's servants]5274-lucetta 's servants]5273-one of lucetta 's servants was sent to [Henchard]191-henchard 's with a note . The contents were briefly : — DEAR [MICHAEL]120-henchard , — [You]166-miss henchard will be standing in view of [[my]214-lucetta house]4643-my house to - day for two or three hours in the course of [your]166-miss henchard business , so do please call and see [me]214-lucetta . [I]214-lucetta am sadly disappointed that [you]166-miss henchard have not come before , for can [I]214-lucetta help anxiety about [my]214-lucetta own equivocal relation to [you]166-miss henchard ? — especially now [[my]214-lucetta aunt]5276-my aunt 's fortune has brought [me]214-lucetta more prominently before society ? [[Your]191-henchard daughter]5213-your daughter 's presence [here]4417-here may be the cause of [your]166-miss henchard neglect ; and [I]214-lucetta have therefore sent [her]5213-your daughter away for the morning . Say [you]166-miss henchard come on business — [I]214-lucetta shall be quite alone . [LUCETTA]188-lucetta . When [the messenger]1716-the messenger returned [[her]214-lucetta mistress]5280-her mistress gave directions that if [a gentleman]4562-a gentleman called [he]4562-a gentleman was to be admitted at once , and sat down to await results . Sentimentally [she]5280-her mistress did not much care to see [him]4562-a gentleman — [his]4562-a gentleman delays had wearied [her]5280-her mistress , but it was necessary ; and with a sigh [she]5280-her mistress arranged [herself]5280-her mistress picturesquely in the chair ; first this way , then that ; next so that the light fell over [her]5280-her mistress head . Next [she]5280-her mistress flung [herself]5280-her mistress on the couch in the cyma - recta curve which so became [her]5280-her mistress , and with [her]5280-her mistress arm over [her]5280-her mistress brow looked towards the door . This , [she]5280-her mistress decided , was the best position after all , and thus [she]5280-her mistress remained till [a man]4474-a man 's step was heard on the stairs . [Whereupon Lucetta]214-lucetta , forgetting [her]5280-her mistress curve ( for Nature was too strong for [Art]148-arthur as yet ) , jumped up and ran and hid [herself]5280-her mistress behind one of the window - curtains in a freak of timidity . In spite of the waning of passion the situation was an agitating one — [she]5280-her mistress had not seen [Henchard]120-henchard since [his]120-henchard ( supposed ) temporary parting from [her]5280-her mistress in [Jersey]43-jersey . [She]5280-her mistress could hear [the servant]5283-the servant showing [the visitor]5265-the visitor into [the room]985-the room , shutting the door upon [him]5265-the visitor , and leaving as if to go and look for [[her]5280-her mistress mistress]5280-her mistress . [Lucetta]214-lucetta flung back the curtain with a nervous greeting . [The man before [her]214-lucetta]5287-the man before her was not [Henchard]120-henchard .[214-lucetta]

A conjecture that [[her]2374-her visitor]2375-her visitor might be [some other person]2376-some other person had , indeed , flashed through [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's mind when [she]214-lucetta was on the point of bursting out ; but it was just too late to recede . [He]2375-her visitor was years younger than [the Mayor of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]4896-the mayor of casterbridge ; fair , fresh , and slenderly handsome . [He]2375-her visitor wore genteel cloth leggings with white buttons , polished boots with infinite lace holes , light cord breeches under a black velveteen coat and waistcoat ; and [he]2375-her visitor had a silver - topped switch in [his]2375-her visitor hand . [Lucetta]214-lucetta blushed , and said with a curious mixture of pout and laugh on [her]214-lucetta face — “ O , [I]2375-her visitor 've made a mistake ! ”[2375-her visitor] [The visitor]5265-the visitor , on the contrary , did not laugh half a wrinkle . “ But [I]2375-her visitor 'm very sorry ! ”[2375-her visitor] [he]2375-her visitor said , in deprecating tones . “ [I]214-lucetta came and [I]214-lucetta inquired for [Miss Henchard]166-miss henchard , and [they]5288-they showed [me]214-lucetta up [here]4417-here , and in no case would [I]214-lucetta have caught [ye]214-lucetta so unmannerly if [I]214-lucetta had known ! ”[214-lucetta] “ [I]149-farfrae was [the unmannerly one]5290-the unmannerly one , ”[149-farfrae] [she]214-lucetta said . “ But is it that [I]214-lucetta have come to [the wrong house]5291-the wrong house , [madam]5292-madam ? ”[214-lucetta] said [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae , blinking a little in [his]149-farfrae bewilderment and nervously tapping [his]149-farfrae legging with [his]149-farfrae switch . “ O no , [sir]4588-sir , — sit down . [You]149-farfrae must come and sit down now [you]149-farfrae are here , ”[214-lucetta] replied [Lucetta]214-lucetta kindly , to relieve [his]149-farfrae embarrassment . “ [Miss Henchard]166-miss henchard will be [here]4417-here directly . ”[191-henchard] Now this was not strictly true ; but that something about [the young man]371-the young man — that hyperborean crispness , stringency , and charm , as of a well - braced musical instrument , which had awakened the interest of [Henchard]166-miss henchard , and of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard and of [the Three Mariners ' jovial crew]2380-the three mariners ' jovial crew , at sight , made [his]371-the young man unexpected presence [here]4417-here attractive to [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [He]149-farfrae hesitated , looked at the chair , thought there was no danger in it ( though there was ) , and sat down . [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's sudden entry was simply the result of [Henchard]166-miss henchard 's permission to [him]149-farfrae to see [Elizabeth]191-henchard if [he]149-farfrae were minded to woo [her]191-henchard . At first [he]149-farfrae had taken no notice of [Henchard]166-miss henchard 's brusque letter ; but an exceptionally fortunate business transaction put [him]149-farfrae on good terms with [everybody]1670-everybody , and revealed to [him]149-farfrae that [he]149-farfrae could undeniably marry if [he]149-farfrae chose . Then who so pleasing , thrifty , and satisfactory in every way as [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard ? Apart from [her]191-henchard personal recommendations a reconciliation with [[his]149-farfrae former friend]1896-his former friend [Henchard]191-henchard would , in the natural course of things , flow from such a union . [He]149-farfrae therefore forgave [the Mayor]133-mr. mayor [his]149-farfrae curtness ; and this morning on [his]149-farfrae way to the fair [he]149-farfrae had called at [[her]191-henchard house]5218-her house , where [he]149-farfrae learnt that [she]191-henchard was staying at [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman 's . A little stimulated at not finding [her]191-henchard ready and waiting — so fanciful are [men]4432-men ! — [he]149-farfrae hastened on to [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall to encounter [no [Elizabeth]191-henchard but [its mistress]2387-its mistress [herself]191-henchard]2386-no elizabeth but its mistress herself . “ The fair to - day seems a large one , ”[149-farfrae] [she]191-henchard said when , by natural deviation , [their]2388-their eyes sought the busy scene without . “ [Your]149-farfrae numerous fairs and markets keep [me]149-farfrae interested . How many things [I]149-farfrae think of while [I]149-farfrae watch from here ! ”[149-farfrae] [He]149-farfrae seemed in doubt how to answer , and the babble without reached [them]2388-their as [they]2388-their sat — voices as of wavelets on [a looping sea]2389-a looping sea , [one ever and anon rising above the rest]2390-one ever and anon rising above the rest . “ Do [you]191-henchard look out often ? ”[149-farfrae] [he]149-farfrae asked . “ Yes — very often . ”[191-henchard] “ Do [you]149-farfrae look for [any one [you]149-farfrae know]5295-any one you know ? ”[191-henchard] Why should [she]191-henchard have answered as [she]191-henchard did ? “ [I]191-henchard look as at a picture merely . But , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard went on , turning pleasantly to [him]149-farfrae , “ [I]149-farfrae may do so now — [I]149-farfrae may look for [you]149-farfrae . [You]149-farfrae are always there , are [you]149-farfrae not ? Ah — [I]149-farfrae do n't mean it seriously ! But it is amusing to look for [somebody one]5296-somebody one knows in a crowd , even if [one]1127-one does not want [him]5296-somebody one . It takes off the terrible oppressiveness of being surrounded by [a throng]5298-a throng , and having no point of junction with it through [a single individual]5299-a single individual . ”[149-farfrae] “ Ay ! Maybe [you]149-farfrae 'll be very lonely , [ma'am]618-ma'am ? ”[191-henchard] “ [Nobody]298-nobody knows how lonely . ”[191-henchard] “ But [you]149-farfrae are rich , [they]5302-they say ? ”[149-farfrae] “ If so , [I]149-farfrae do n't know how to enjoy [my]149-farfrae riches . [I]149-farfrae came to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge thinking [I]149-farfrae should like to live [here]4417-here . But [I]149-farfrae wonder if [I]149-farfrae shall . ”[149-farfrae] “ Where did [ye]149-farfrae come from , [ma'am]618-ma'am ? ”[191-henchard] “ [The neighbourhood of [Bath]59-bath]5305-the neighbourhood of bath . ”[2391-he] “ And [I]2391-he from near [Edinboro]26-edinboro ' , ”[2391-he] [he]2391-he murmured . “ It 's better to stay at [home]675-home , and that 's true ; but [a man]4474-a man must live where [his]4474-a man money is made . It is a great pity , but it 's always so ! Yet [I]149-farfrae 've done very well this year . O yes , ”[149-farfrae] [he]2391-he went on with ingenuous enthusiasm . “ [You]618-ma'am see [that man with the drab kerseymere coat]5308-that man with the drab kerseymere coat ? [I]149-farfrae bought largely of [him]5308-that man with the drab kerseymere coat in the autumn when wheat was down , and then afterwards when it rose a little [I]149-farfrae sold off all [I]149-farfrae had ! It brought only a small profit to [me]149-farfrae ; while [the farmers]2077-the farmers kept [theirs]2077-the farmers , expecting higher figures — yes , though the rats were gnawing the ricks hollow . Just when [I]149-farfrae sold [the markets]5310-the markets went lower , and [I]149-farfrae bought up the corn of [those who had been holding back at less price than [my]149-farfrae first purchases]5311-those who had been holding back at less price than my first purchases . And then , ”[149-farfrae] cried [Farfrae]149-farfrae impetuously , [his]149-farfrae face alight , “ [I]149-farfrae sold it a few weeks after , when it happened to go up again ! And so , by contenting [mysel]149-farfrae ' with small profits frequently repeated , [I]149-farfrae soon made five hundred pounds — yes ! ”[149-farfrae] — ( bringing down [his]149-farfrae hand upon the table , and quite forgetting where [he]149-farfrae was ) — “ while [the others]854-the others by keeping [theirs]854-the others in hand made nothing at all ! ”[149-farfrae] [Lucetta]214-lucetta regarded [him]149-farfrae with a critical interest . [He]149-farfrae was quite [a new type of person to [her]214-lucetta]2392-a new type of person to her . At last [his]149-farfrae eye fell upon [the lady]2110-the lady 's and [their]2394-their glances met . “ Ay , now , [I]214-lucetta 'm wearying [you]214-lucetta ! ”[214-lucetta] [he]149-farfrae exclaimed . [She]214-lucetta said , “ No , indeed , ”[214-lucetta] colouring a shade . “ What then ? ”[214-lucetta] “ Quite otherwise . [You]149-farfrae are most interesting . ”[214-lucetta] It was now [Farfrae]149-farfrae who showed the modest pink . “ [I]214-lucetta mean all [you]149-farfrae [Scotchmen]5313-scotchmen , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta added in hasty correction . “ So free from Southern extremes . [We]2394-their [common people]5314-common people are all one way or the other — warm or cold , passionate or frigid . [You]149-farfrae have both temperatures going on in [you]149-farfrae at the same time . ”[214-lucetta] “ But how do [you]214-lucetta mean that ? [Ye]149-farfrae were best to explain clearly , [ma'am]618-ma'am . ”[214-lucetta] “ [You]149-farfrae are animated — then [you]149-farfrae are thinking of getting on . [You]149-farfrae are sad the next moment — then [you]149-farfrae are thinking of [Scotland]21-scotland and [friends]1944-friends . ”[149-farfrae] “ Yes . [I]149-farfrae think of [home]675-home sometimes ! ”[149-farfrae] [he]149-farfrae said simply . “ So do [I]214-lucetta — as far as [I]214-lucetta can . But it was [an old house where [I]214-lucetta was born , and [they]5319-they pulled [it]782-the house down for improvements , so [I]214-lucetta seem hardly to have [any home]5320-any home to think of now]5318-an old house where i was born , and they pulled it down for improvements , so i seem hardly to have any home to think of now . ”[214-lucetta] [Lucetta]214-lucetta did not add , as [she]214-lucetta might have done , that [the house]782-the house was in [St. Helier]60-st. helier , and not in [Bath]59-bath . “ But [the mountains]5321-the mountains , and the mists and the rocks , they are there ! And do n't they seem like [home]675-home ? ”[2396-you] [She]214-lucetta shook [her]214-lucetta head . “ [They]5319-they do to [me]214-lucetta — [they]5319-they do to [me]214-lucetta , ”[214-lucetta] [he]2396-you murmured . And [his]2396-you mind could be seen flying away northwards . Whether its origin were national or personal , it was quite true what [Lucetta]214-lucetta had said , that the curious double strands in [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's thread of life — the commercial and the romantic — were very distinct at times . Like the colours in a variegated cord those contrasts could be seen intertwisted , yet not mingling . “ [You]2396-you are wishing [you]2396-you were back again , ”[149-farfrae] [she]214-lucetta said . “ Ah , no , [ma'am]618-ma'am , ”[371-the young man] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae , suddenly recalling [himself]149-farfrae . The fair without the windows was now raging thick and loud . It was the chief hiring fair of the year , and differed quite from the market of a few days earlier . In substance it was a whitey - brown crowd flecked with white — this being the body of [labourers waiting for places]2397-labourers waiting for places . The long bonnets of [the women , like waggon - tilts]2398-the women , like waggon - tilts , [their]2398-the women , like waggon - tilts cotton gowns and checked shawls , mixed with [the carters]2399-the carters ' smockfrocks ; for [they]2398-the women , like waggon - tilts , too , entered into the hiring . Among the rest , at the corner of [the pavement]1160-the pavement , stood [an old shepherd]2401-an old shepherd , who attracted the eyes of [Lucetta]214-lucetta and [Farfrae]149-farfrae by [his]2401-an old shepherd stillness . [He]2401-an old shepherd was evidently [a chastened man]2402-a chastened man . The battle of life had been a sharp one with [him]2401-an old shepherd , for , to begin with , [he]2401-an old shepherd was [a man of small frame]2403-a man of small frame . [He]2401-an old shepherd was now so bowed by hard work and years that , approaching from behind , [a person]2404-a person could hardly see [his]2401-an old shepherd head . [He]2401-an old shepherd had planted the stem of [his]2401-an old shepherd crook in the gutter and was resting upon the bow , which was polished to silver brightness by the long friction of [his]2401-an old shepherd hands . [He]2401-an old shepherd had quite forgotten where [he]2401-an old shepherd was , and what [he]2401-an old shepherd had come for , [his]2401-an old shepherd eyes being bent on the ground . A little way off negotiations were proceeding which had reference to [him]2401-an old shepherd ; but [he]2401-an old shepherd did not hear them , and there seemed to be passing through [his]2401-an old shepherd mind pleasant visions of the hiring successes of [his]2401-an old shepherd prime , when [his]2401-an old shepherd skill laid open to [him]2401-an old shepherd [any farm for the asking]2405-any farm for the asking . The negotiations were between [a farmer from [a distant county]2407-a distant county]2406-a farmer from a distant county and [[the old man]818-the old man 's son]2409-the old man 's son . In these there was a difficulty . [The farmer]1607-the farmer would not take the crust without the crumb of the bargain , in other words , [the old man]818-the old man without [the younger]2412-the younger ; and [the son]2413-the son had [a sweetheart on [[his]2413-the son present farm]2415-his present farm]2414-a sweetheart on his present farm , who stood by , waiting the issue with pale lips . “ [I]371-the young man 'm sorry to leave [ye]311-the girl , [Nelly]215-nelly , ”[371-the young man] said [the young man]371-the young man with emotion . “ But , [you]311-the girl see , [I]311-the girl ca n't starve [father]4491-father , and [he]4491-father 's out o ' work at [Lady]61-lady - day . ' Tis only thirty - five mile . ”[311-the girl] [The girl]311-the girl 's lips quivered . “ Thirty - five mile ! ”[311-the girl] [she]311-the girl murmured . “ Ah ! ' tis enough ! [I]311-the girl shall never see [']311-the girl [ee]311-the girl again ! ”[311-the girl] It was , indeed , a hopeless length of traction for [[Dan Cupid]216-dan cupid 's magnet]2418-dan cupid 's magnet ; for [young men]2050-young men were [young men at [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge as elsewhere]2420-young men at casterbridge as elsewhere . “ O ! no , no — [I]311-the girl never shall , ”[311-the girl] [she]311-the girl insisted , when [he]371-the young man pressed [her]311-the girl hand ; and [she]311-the girl turned [her]311-the girl face to [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's wall to hide [her]311-the girl weeping . [The farmer]1607-the farmer said [he]1607-the farmer would give [the young man]371-the young man half - an - hour for [his]1607-the farmer answer , and went away , leaving [the group]2423-the group sorrowing . [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's eyes , full of tears , met [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's . [His]149-farfrae , too , to [her]214-lucetta surprise , were moist at the scene . “ It is very hard , ”[311-the girl] [she]311-the girl said with strong feelings . “ [Lovers]5325-lovers ought not to be parted like that ! O , if [I]149-farfrae had [my]149-farfrae wish , [I]149-farfrae 'd let [people]1161-people live and love at [their]1161-people pleasure ! ”[149-farfrae] “ Maybe [I]149-farfrae can manage that [they]1161-people 'll not be parted , ”[149-farfrae] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae . “ [I]311-the girl want [a young carter]5327-a young carter ; and perhaps [I]311-the girl 'll take [the old man]818-the old man too — yes ; [he]818-the old man 'll not be very expensive , and doubtless [he]818-the old man will answer [my]311-the girl pairrpose somehow . ”[311-the girl] “ O , [you]149-farfrae are so good ! ”[311-the girl] [she]311-the girl cried , delighted . “ Go and tell [them]1161-people , and let [me]214-lucetta know if [you]149-farfrae have succeeded ! ”[214-lucetta] [Farfrae]149-farfrae went out , and [she]311-the girl saw [him]149-farfrae speak to [the group]2423-the group . The eyes of all brightened ; the bargain was soon struck . [Farfrae]149-farfrae returned to [her]311-the girl immediately it was concluded . “ It is kind - hearted of [you]149-farfrae , indeed , ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ For [my]149-farfrae part , [I]149-farfrae have resolved that [all [my]149-farfrae servants]5329-all my servants shall have [lovers]5325-lovers if [they]5329-all my servants want [them]5325-lovers ! Do make the same resolve ! ”[149-farfrae] [Farfrae]149-farfrae looked more serious , waving [his]149-farfrae head a half turn . “ [I]149-farfrae must be a little stricter than that , ”[149-farfrae] [he]149-farfrae said . “ Why ? ”[214-lucetta] “ [You]149-farfrae are a — [a thriving woman]5331-a thriving woman ; and [I]139-farfrae am [a struggling hay - and - corn merchant]5332-a struggling hay - and - corn merchant . ”[139-farfrae] “ [I]139-farfrae am [a very ambitious woman]5333-a very ambitious woman . ”[139-farfrae] “ Ah , well , [I]139-farfrae cannet explain . Under this revelation of insight [Farfrae]139-farfrae again looked out of the window into the thick of the fair . [Two farmers]2426-two farmers met and shook hands , and being quite near the window [their]2426-two farmers remarks could be heard as [others]860-others ' had been . “ Have [you]149-farfrae seen [young Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae this morning ? ”[1127-one] asked [one]1127-one . “ [He]149-farfrae promised to meet [me]149-farfrae here at the stroke of twelve ; but [I]149-farfrae 've gone athwart and about the fair half - a - dozen times , and never a sign of [him]149-farfrae : though [he]149-farfrae 's mostly [a man]4474-a man to [his]149-farfrae word . ”[149-farfrae] “ [I]2425-she quite forgot the engagement , ”[2425-she] murmured [Farfrae]149-farfrae . “ Now [you]149-farfrae must go , ”[2425-she] said [she]2425-she ; “ must [you]149-farfrae not ? ”[149-farfrae] “ Yes , ”[2425-she] [he]149-farfrae replied . But [he]149-farfrae still remained . “ [You]149-farfrae had better go , ”[2425-she] [she]2425-she urged . “ [You]149-farfrae will lose [a customer]2176-a customer . “[203-miss templeman] Now , [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman , [you]203-miss templeman will make [me]0-i angry , ” exclaimed [Farfrae]149-farfrae . “[0-i] Then suppose [you]203-miss templeman do n't go ; but stay a little longer ? ” [He]149-farfrae looked anxiously at [the farmer who was seeking [him]149-farfrae and who just then ominously walked across to where [Henchard]191-henchard was standing]5338-the farmer who was seeking him and who just then ominously walked across to where henchard was standing , and [he]149-farfrae looked into [the room]985-the room and at [her]203-miss templeman . “[0-i] [I]0-i like staying ; but [I]0-i fear [I]0-i must go ! ” [he]149-farfrae said . “[618-ma'am] Business ought not to be neglected , ought it ? ” “[618-ma'am] Not for a single minute . ” “[0-i] It 's true . O no ! ” “[0-i] Well , whatever it has been , it is now over ; and [the market]5183-the market calls [you]0-i to be gone . ” “[0-i] Yes , yes . Market — business ! [I]0-i wish there were no business in [the warrld]62-the warrld . ” [Lucetta]214-lucetta almost laughed — [she]214-lucetta would quite have laughed — but that there was a little emotion going in [her]214-lucetta at the time . “[0-i] How [you]0-i change ! ” [she]203-miss templeman said . “[886-the scotchman] [You]0-i should not change like this . “ [I]886-the scotchman have never wished such things before , ”[886-the scotchman] said [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman , with a simple , shamed , apologetic look for [his]886-the scotchman weakness . “ It is only since coming [here]4417-here and seeing [you]0-i ! ”[0-i] “ If that 's the case , [you]0-i had better not look at [me]886-the scotchman any longer . Dear [me]886-the scotchman , [I]886-the scotchman feel [I]886-the scotchman have quite demoralized [you]0-i ! ”[886-the scotchman] “ But look or look not , [I]886-the scotchman will see [you]0-i in [my]886-the scotchman thoughts . Well , [I]886-the scotchman 'll go — thank [you]0-i for the pleasure of this visit . ”[886-the scotchman] “ Thank [you]0-i for staying . ”[886-the scotchman] “ Maybe [I]886-the scotchman 'll get into [my]886-the scotchman market - mind when [I]886-the scotchman 've been out a few minutes , ”[886-the scotchman] [he]886-the scotchman murmured . “ But [I]2433-i do n't know — [I]2433-i do n't know ! ”[2433-i] As [he]886-the scotchman went [she]2433-i said eagerly , “ [You]0-i may hear [them]5341-them speak of [me]886-the scotchman in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge as time goes on . Thus [the two]2165-the two . [She]2433-i had enkindled [the young man]371-the young man 's enthusiasm till [he]371-the young man was quite brimming with sentiment ; while [he]371-the young man from merely affording [her]2433-i a new form of idleness , had gone on to wake [her]2433-i serious solicitude . Why was this ? [They]2165-the two could not have told . [Lucetta]214-lucetta as [a young girl]2436-a young girl would hardly have looked at [a tradesman]2437-a tradesman . But [her]214-lucetta ups and downs , capped by [her]214-lucetta indiscretions with [Henchard]191-henchard had made [her]214-lucetta uncritical as to station . In [her]214-lucetta poverty [she]214-lucetta had met with repulse from [the society to which [she]214-lucetta had belonged]2438-the society to which she had belonged , and [she]214-lucetta had no great zest for renewing an attempt upon it now . [Her]214-lucetta heart longed for some ark into which it could fly and be at rest . Rough or smooth [she]214-lucetta did not care so long as it was warm . [Farfrae]149-farfrae was shown out , it having entirely escaped [him]149-farfrae that [he]149-farfrae had called to see [Elizabeth]191-henchard . [Lucetta]214-lucetta at the window watched [him]149-farfrae threading the maze of [farmers]712-farmers and [farmers ' men]2440-farmers ' men . [She]214-lucetta could see by [his]149-farfrae gait that [he]149-farfrae was conscious of [her]214-lucetta eyes , and [her]214-lucetta heart went out to [him]149-farfrae for [his]149-farfrae modesty — pleaded with [her]214-lucetta sense of [his]149-farfrae unfitness that [he]149-farfrae might be allowed to come again . [He]149-farfrae entered [the market - house]2441-the market - house , and [she]214-lucetta could see [him]149-farfrae no more . Three minutes later , when [she]214-lucetta had left the window , knocks , not of multitude but of strength , sounded through [the house]782-the house , and [the waiting - maid]2443-the waiting - maid tripped up . “ [The Mayor]4556-the mayor , ”[4481-the maid] [she]2443-the waiting - maid said . [Lucetta]214-lucetta had come to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge to quicken [Henchard]191-henchard 's feelings with regard to [her]214-lucetta . [She]214-lucetta had quickened them , and now [she]214-lucetta was indifferent to the achievement . [Her]214-lucetta morning view of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard as a disturbing element changed , and [she]214-lucetta no longer felt strongly the necessity of getting rid of [the girl]311-the girl for [[her]311-the girl stepfather]5242-her stepfather 's sake . When [the young woman]310-the young woman came in , sweetly unconscious of the turn in the tide , [Lucetta]214-lucetta went up to [her]310-the young woman , and said quite sincerely — “ [I]191-henchard 'm so glad [you]310-the young woman 've come . [You]310-the young woman 'll live with [me]191-henchard a long time , wo n't [you]310-the young woman ? ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard as a watch - dog to keep [[her]311-the girl father]4886-her father off — what a new idea . Yet it was not unpleasing . [Henchard]191-henchard had neglected [her]214-lucetta all these days , after compromising [her]214-lucetta indescribably in the past . The least [he]4886-her father could have done when [he]4886-her father found [himself]4886-her father free , and [herself]214-lucetta affluent , would have been to respond heartily and promptly to [her]214-lucetta invitation . [Her]214-lucetta emotions rose , fell , undulated , filled [her]214-lucetta with wild surmise at [their]2449-their suddenness ; and so passed [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's experiences of that day .

Poor [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , little thinking what [her]191-henchard malignant star had done to blast the budding attentions [she]191-henchard had won from [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae , was glad to hear [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's words about remaining . For in addition to [[Lucetta]214-lucetta 's house]2450-lucetta 's house being [a home]1987-a home , that raking view of [the market - place which [it]2450-lucetta 's house afforded]2452-the market - place which it afforded had as much attraction for [her]191-henchard as for [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [The carrefour]2453-the carrefour was like [the regulation Open Place]2454-the regulation open place in [spectacular dramas]2455-spectacular dramas , where the incidents that occur always happen to bear on the lives of [the adjoining residents]2456-the adjoining residents . [Farmers]712-farmers , [merchants]2458-merchants , [dairymen]1243-dairymen , [quacks]2460-quacks , [hawkers]2461-hawkers , appeared [there]447-there from week to week , and disappeared as the afternoon wasted away . It was [the node of all orbits]2463-the node of all orbits . From Saturday to Saturday was as from day to day with [the two young women]2464-the two young women now . In an emotional sense [they]2464-the two young women did not live at all during the intervals . Wherever [they]2464-the two young women might go wandering on other days , on market - day [they]2464-the two young women were sure to be at [home]675-home . [Both]2466-both stole sly glances out of the window at [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's shoulders and poll . [His]2467-his face [they]2464-the two young women seldom saw , for , either through shyness , or not to disturb [his]2467-his mercantile mood , [he]2467-his avoided looking towards [[their]2464-the two young women quarters]2468-their quarters . Thus things went on , till a certain market - morning brought a new sensation . [Elizabeth]191-henchard and [Lucetta]214-lucetta were sitting at breakfast when a parcel containing two dresses arrived for the latter from [London]63-london . [She]191-henchard called [Elizabeth]191-henchard from [her]191-henchard breakfast , and entering [[[her]191-henchard friend]2164-her friend 's bedroom]2470-her friend 's bedroom [Elizabeth]191-henchard saw the gowns spread out on the bed , one of a deep cherry colour , the other lighter — a glove lying at the end of each sleeve , a bonnet at the top of each neck , and parasols across the gloves , [Lucetta]214-lucetta standing beside [the suggested human figure]2471-the suggested human figure in an attitude of contemplation . “ [I]214-lucetta would n't think so hard about it , ”[214-lucetta] said [Elizabeth]191-henchard , marking the intensity with which [Lucetta]214-lucetta was alternating the question whether this or that would suit best . “ But settling upon new clothes is so trying , ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ [You]5345-you are [that person]5346-that person ”[214-lucetta] ( pointing to one of the arrangements ) , “ or [you]5345-you are [THAT totally different person]5347-that totally different person ”[214-lucetta] ( pointing to the other ) , “ for the whole of the coming spring and one of the two , [you]5345-you do n't know which , may turn out to be very objectionable . ”[191-henchard] It was finally decided by [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman that [she]214-lucetta would be [the cherry - coloured person]2472-the cherry - coloured person at all hazards . The dress was pronounced to be a fit , and [Lucetta]214-lucetta walked with [it]2473-it into [the front room]4621-the front room , [Elizabeth]191-henchard following [her]214-lucetta . The morning was exceptionally bright for the time of year . The sun fell so flat on [the houses]2475-the houses and pavement opposite [[Lucetta]214-lucetta 's residence]2476-lucetta 's residence that [they]2477-they poured [their]2477-they brightness into [[her]214-lucetta rooms]2478-her rooms . Suddenly , after a rumbling of wheels , there were added to this steady light a fantastic series of circling irradiations upon the ceiling , and [the companions]2479-the companions turned to the window . Immediately opposite [a vehicle]2480-a vehicle of strange description had come to a standstill , as if it had been placed there for exhibition . It was the new - fashioned agricultural implement called a horse - drill , till then unknown , in its modern shape , in [this part of [the country]633-the country]2481-this part of the country , where the venerable seed - lip was still used for sowing as in the days of the Heptarchy . Its arrival created about as much sensation in the corn - market as a flying machine would create at [Charing Cross]64-charing cross . [The farmers]2077-the farmers crowded round [it]2480-a vehicle , [women]4948-women drew near it , [children]4419-children crept under and into [it]2480-a vehicle . The machine was painted in bright hues of green , yellow , and red , and it resembled as a whole a compound of hornet , grasshopper , and shrimp , magnified enormously . Or it might have been likened to an upright musical instrument with the front gone . That was how it struck [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ Why , it is a sort of agricultural piano , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said . “ It has something to do with corn , ”[191-henchard] said [Elizabeth]191-henchard . “ [I]214-lucetta wonder who thought of introducing it here ? ”[214-lucetta] [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae was in the minds of [both]2466-both as [the innovator]2487-the innovator , for though not a farmer [he]2488-he was closely leagued with farming operations . And as if in response to [their]2466-both thought [he]2488-he came up at that moment , looked at the machine , walked round [it]2480-a vehicle , and handled [it]2480-a vehicle as if [he]2488-he knew something about its make . [The two watchers]2489-the two watchers had inwardly started at [his]2488-he coming , and [Elizabeth]191-henchard left the window , went to the back of [the room]985-the room , and stood as if absorbed in the panelling of the wall . [She]191-henchard hardly knew that [she]191-henchard had done this till [Lucetta]214-lucetta , animated by the conjunction of [her]214-lucetta new attire with the sight of [Farfrae]139-farfrae , spoke out : “ Let [us]2466-both go and look at the instrument , whatever it is . ”[4446-somebody] [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's bonnet and shawl were pitchforked on in a moment , and [they]2466-both went out . Among all the agriculturists gathered round [the only appropriate possessor of the new machine]2491-the only appropriate possessor of the new machine seemed to be [Lucetta]214-lucetta , because [she]214-lucetta alone rivalled it in colour . [They]2466-both examined it curiously ; observing the rows of trumpet - shaped tubes one within the other , the little scoops , like revolving salt - spoons , which tossed the seed into the upper ends of the tubes that conducted it to the ground ; till [somebody]4446-somebody said , “ Good morning , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . ”[191-henchard] [She]191-henchard looked up , and there was [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather . Yet [Lucetta]214-lucetta seemed silent , and then all thought of the incident was dissipated by the humming of a song , which sounded as though from the interior of the machine . [Henchard]191-henchard had by this time vanished into [the market - house]2441-the market - house , and both [the women]4997-the women glanced towards the corn - drill . O no ! ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae gravely . “ It will revolutionize sowing heerabout ! No more sowers flinging [their]5355-their seed about broadcast , so that some falls by the wayside and some among thorns , and all that . Each grain will go straight to [its]5356-its intended place , and nowhere else whatever ! ”[191-henchard] “ Then the romance of the sower is gone for good , ”[191-henchard] observed [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , who felt [herself]191-henchard at one with [Farfrae]139-farfrae in Bible - reading at least . “ ' [He]371-the young man that observeth the wind shall not sow , ' so [the Preacher]5357-the preacher said ; but [his]5357-the preacher words will not be to the point any more . How things change ! ”[139-farfrae] “ Ay ; ay .... [The latter]4511-the latter felt that [she]214-lucetta had been in the way , though why was unaccountable to [her]214-lucetta . [Lucetta]214-lucetta explained the matter somewhat by saying when [they]2509-they were again in [the sitting - room]2510-the sitting - room — “ [I]214-lucetta had occasion to speak to [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae the other day , and so [I]214-lucetta knew [him]149-farfrae this morning . ”[214-lucetta] [Lucetta]214-lucetta was very kind towards [Elizabeth]191-henchard that day . Together [they]2509-they saw [the market]5183-the market thicken , and in course of time thin away with the slow decline of the sun towards [the upper end of [town]727-town]2512-the upper end of town , its rays taking [the street]797-the street endways and enfilading [the long thoroughfare]2515-the long thoroughfare from top to bottom . The time of [the riding world]2518-the riding world was over ; [the pedestrian world]2519-the pedestrian world held sway . [Field labourers]2520-field labourers and [[their]2520-field labourers wives]550-their wives and [children]4419-children trooped in from [the villages]2523-the villages for [their]2520-field labourers weekly shopping , and instead of a rattle of wheels and a tramp of horses ruling the sound as earlier , there was nothing but the shuffle of many feet . All the implements were gone ; all [the farmers]2077-the farmers ; all [the moneyed class]2525-the moneyed class . The character of [[the town]632-the town 's trading]2527-the town 's trading had changed from bulk to multiplicity and pence were handled now as pounds had been handled earlier in the day . [Lucetta]214-lucetta and [Elizabeth]191-henchard looked out upon this , for though it was night and the street lamps were lighted , [they]2520-field labourers had kept [their]2520-field labourers shutters unclosed . In the faint blink of the fire [they]2520-field labourers spoke more freely . “ [[Your]214-lucetta father]5032-your father was distant with [you]214-lucetta , ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ Yes . ”[214-lucetta] And having forgotten the momentary mystery of [Henchard]191-henchard 's seeming speech to [Lucetta]214-lucetta [she]214-lucetta continued , “ It is because [he]5032-your father does not think [I]214-lucetta am respectable . [Her]214-lucetta past was by no means secure from investigation , even in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge . [Lucetta]214-lucetta passed on and closed the street door . [A seer]2535-a seer 's spirit took possession of [Elizabeth]191-henchard , impelling [her]191-henchard to sit down by the fire and divine events so surely from data already [her]191-henchard own that they could be held as witnessed . [She]191-henchard followed [Lucetta]214-lucetta thus mentally — saw [her]191-henchard encounter [Donald]139-farfrae somewhere as if by chance — saw [him]2531-her brilliant and amiable companion wear [his]2531-her brilliant and amiable companion special look when meeting [women]4948-women , with an added intensity because this one was [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [She]191-henchard depicted [his]2531-her brilliant and amiable companion impassioned manner ; beheld the indecision of both between [[their]2537-their lothness]2538-their lothness to separate and [their]2537-their desire not to be observed ; depicted [their]2537-their shaking of hands ; how [they]2537-their probably parted with frigidity in [their]2537-their general contour and movements , only in the smaller features showing the spark of passion , thus invisible to all but [themselves]2537-their . [This discerning silent witch]2539-this discerning silent witch had not done thinking of these things when [Lucetta]214-lucetta came noiselessly behind [her]191-henchard and made [her]191-henchard start . It was all true as [she]191-henchard had pictured — [she]191-henchard could have sworn it .
