That night [she]214-lucetta became restless ; in the morning [she]214-lucetta was feverish ; and at breakfast - time [she]214-lucetta told [[her]214-lucetta companion]583-her companion that [she]214-lucetta had something on [her]214-lucetta mind — something which concerned [a person in whom [she]214-lucetta was interested much]2542-a person in whom she was interested much . [Elizabeth]191-henchard was earnest to listen and sympathize . “ [This person]5367-this person — [a lady]2109-a lady — once admired [a man]4474-a man much — very much , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said tentatively . “ Ah , ”[191-henchard] said [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . “ [They]5370-they were intimate — rather . [He]2164-her friend did not think so deeply of [her]2109-a lady as [she]2109-a lady did of [him]2164-her friend . But in an impulsive moment , purely out of reparation , [he]2164-her friend proposed to make [her]2109-a lady [[his]2164-her friend wife]380-his wife . [She]191-henchard agreed . But there was an unsuspected hitch in the proceedings ; though [she]2109-a lady had been so far compromised with [him]2164-her friend that [she]2109-a lady felt [she]2109-a lady could never belong to [another man]5372-another man , as a pure matter of conscience , even if [she]2109-a lady should wish to . After that [they]5370-they were much apart , heard nothing of [each other]4626-each other for a long time , and [she]2109-a lady felt [her]2109-a lady life quite closed up for [her]2109-a lady . ”[191-henchard] “ Ah — [poor girl]5374-poor girl ! ”[191-henchard] “ [She]2109-a lady suffered much on account of [him]2164-her friend ; though [I]191-henchard should add that [he]2164-her friend could not altogether be blamed for what had happened . At last the obstacle which separated [them]5370-they was providentially removed ; and [he]2164-her friend came to marry [her]2109-a lady . ”[191-henchard] “ How delightful ! ”[191-henchard] “ But in the interval [she]2109-a lady — [[my]191-henchard poor friend]5375-my poor friend — had seen [a man]4474-a man , [she]2109-a lady liked better than [him]2164-her friend . Now comes the point : Could [she]2109-a lady in honour dismiss the first ? ”[191-henchard] “ [A new man]5377-a new man [she]2109-a lady liked better — that 's bad ! ”[214-lucetta] “ Yes , ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta , looking pained at [a boy who was swinging the town pump - handle]2543-a boy who was swinging the town pump - handle . “ It is bad ! Though [you]5378-you must remember that [she]2109-a lady was forced into an equivocal position with [the first man]5379-the first man by an accident — that [he]5379-the first man was not so well educated or refined as [the second]4874-the second , and that [she]2109-a lady had discovered some qualities in the first that rendered [him]5379-the first man less desirable as [a husband]4477-a husband than [she]2109-a lady had at first thought [him]5379-the first man to be . ”[191-henchard] “ [I]191-henchard can not answer , ”[191-henchard] said [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard thoughtfully . “ It is so difficult . [It]5382-it wants [a Pope]5383-a pope to settle that ! ”[214-lucetta] “ [You]214-lucetta prefer not to perhaps ? ”[191-henchard] [Lucetta]214-lucetta showed in [her]214-lucetta appealing tone how much [she]214-lucetta leant on [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's judgment . “ Yes , [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman , ”[191-henchard] admitted [Elizabeth]191-henchard . “ [I]214-lucetta would rather not say . ”[214-lucetta] Nevertheless , [Lucetta]214-lucetta seemed relieved by the simple fact of having opened out the situation a little , and was slowly convalescent of [her]214-lucetta headache . “ Bring [me]191-henchard a looking - glass . How do [I]191-henchard appear to [people]1161-people ? ”[191-henchard] [she]214-lucetta said languidly . “ Well — a little worn , ”[214-lucetta] answered [Elizabeth]191-henchard , eyeing [her]214-lucetta as [a critic eyes a doubtful painting]2544-a critic eyes a doubtful painting ; fetching the glass [she]191-henchard enabled [Lucetta]214-lucetta to survey [herself]214-lucetta in it , which [Lucetta]214-lucetta anxiously did . “ [I]214-lucetta wonder if [I]214-lucetta wear well , as times go ! ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta observed after a while . “ Yes — fairly . “[0-i] Where am [I]0-i worst ? ” “[0-i] Under [your]191-henchard eyes — [I]0-i notice a little brownness there . ” “[191-henchard] Yes . That is [my]0-i worst place , [I]0-i know . How many years more do [you]191-henchard think [I]0-i shall last before [I]0-i get hopelessly plain ? ” There was something curious in the way in which [Elizabeth]191-henchard , though the younger , had come to play the part of [experienced sage]5385-experienced sage in these discussions . “[191-henchard] It may be five years , ” [she]214-lucetta said judicially . “[2545-she] Or , with a quiet life , as many as ten . With no love [you]191-henchard might calculate on ten . ” [Lucetta]214-lucetta seemed to reflect on this as on an unalterable , impartial verdict . [She]214-lucetta told [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard no more of the past attachment [she]191-henchard had roughly adumbrated as the experiences of [a third person]5386-a third person ; and [Elizabeth]191-henchard , who in spite of [her]191-henchard philosophy was very tender - hearted , sighed that night in bed at the thought that [her]191-henchard pretty , rich [Lucetta]214-lucetta did not treat [her]191-henchard to the full confidence of names and dates in [her]191-henchard confessions . For by the “[2545-she] [she]2545-she ” of [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's story [Elizabeth]191-henchard had not been beguiled .[191-henchard]

The next phase of the supersession of [Henchard]191-henchard in [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's heart was an experiment in calling on [her]191-henchard performed by [Farfrae]149-farfrae with some apparent trepidation . Conventionally speaking [he]149-farfrae conversed with both [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman and [[her]203-miss templeman companion]583-her companion ; but in fact it was rather that [Elizabeth]191-henchard sat invisible in [the room]985-the room . [Donald]139-farfrae appeared not to see [her]191-henchard at all , and answered [her]191-henchard wise little remarks with curtly indifferent monosyllables , [his]149-farfrae looks and faculties hanging on [the woman who could boast of a more Protean variety in [her]191-henchard phases , moods , opinions , and also principles , than could [Elizabeth]191-henchard]2548-the woman who could boast of a more protean variety in her phases , moods , opinions , and also principles , than could elizabeth . [Lucetta]214-lucetta had persisted in dragging [her]191-henchard into the circle ; but [she]191-henchard had remained like an awkward third point which that circle would not touch . [[Susan Henchard]122-henchard 's daughter]2549-susan henchard 's daughter bore up against the frosty ache of the treatment , as [she]2549-susan henchard 's daughter had borne up under worse things , and contrived as soon as possible to get out of [the inharmonious room]2550-the inharmonious room without being missed . [The Scotchman]886-the scotchman seemed hardly [the same Farfrae who had danced with [her]191-henchard and walked with [her]191-henchard in a delicate poise between love and friendship]2552-the same farfrae who had danced with her and walked with her in a delicate poise between love and friendship — that period in the history of a love when alone it can be said to be unalloyed with pain . [She]191-henchard stoically looked from [her]191-henchard bedroom window , and contemplated [her]191-henchard fate as if it were written on the top of [the church - tower hard by]2553-the church - tower hard by . “ Yes , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said at last , bringing down [her]191-henchard palm upon the sill with a pat : “ [HE]122-henchard is [the second man of that story [she]214-lucetta told [me]122-henchard]5387-the second man of that story she told me ! ”[122-henchard] All this time [Henchard]122-henchard 's smouldering sentiments towards [Lucetta]214-lucetta had been fanned into higher and higher inflammation by the circumstances of the case . [He]122-henchard was discovering that [the young woman for whom [he]122-henchard once felt a pitying warmth which had been almost chilled out of [him]122-henchard by reflection]2554-the young woman for whom he once felt a pitying warmth which had been almost chilled out of him by reflection , was , when now qualified with a slight inaccessibility and a more matured beauty , the very being to make [him]122-henchard satisfied with life . Day after day proved to [him]122-henchard , by [her]214-lucetta silence , that it was no use to think of bringing [her]214-lucetta round by holding aloof ; so [he]122-henchard gave in , and called upon [her]214-lucetta again , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard being absent . [He]122-henchard crossed [the room]985-the room to [her]214-lucetta with a heavy tread of some awkwardness , [his]122-henchard strong , warm gaze upon [her]214-lucetta — like the sun beside the moon in comparison with [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's modest look — and with something of [a hail - fellow bearing]2556-a hail - fellow bearing , as , indeed , was not unnatural . But [she]214-lucetta seemed so transubstantiated by [her]214-lucetta change of position , and held out [her]214-lucetta hand to [him]122-henchard in such cool friendship , that [he]122-henchard became deferential , and sat down with a perceptible loss of power . [He]122-henchard understood but little of fashion in dress , yet enough to feel [himself]122-henchard inadequate in appearance beside [her]214-lucetta whom [he]122-henchard had hitherto been dreaming of as almost [[his]122-henchard property]2557-his property . [She]214-lucetta said something very polite about [his]122-henchard being good enough to call . This caused [him]122-henchard to recover balance . [He]122-henchard looked [her]214-lucetta oddly in the face , losing [his]122-henchard awe . “ Why , of course [I]122-henchard have called , [Lucetta]214-lucetta , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said . “ What does that nonsense mean ? [You]214-lucetta know [I]2558-i could n't have helped [myself]2558-i if [I]2558-i had wished — that is , if [I]2558-i had any kindness at all . [He]2559-he looked about [the room]985-the room at the novel hangings and ingenious furniture with which [she]2563-you had surrounded [herself]2563-you . “ Upon [my]2563-you life [I]2563-you did n't know such furniture as this could be bought in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , ”[2563-you] [he]2559-he said . “ Nor can it be , ”[2559-he] said [she]2563-you . “ Nor will it till fifty years more of civilization have passed over [the town]632-the town . It took a waggon and four horses to get it [here]4417-here . ”[2559-he] “ H'm . It looks as if [you]2559-he were living on [capital]5392-capital . ”[2559-he] “ O no , [I]2559-he am not . ”[2559-he] “ So much the better . But the fact is , [your]2559-he setting up like this makes [my]2559-he beaming towards [you]2559-he rather awkward . ”[2559-he] “ Why ? ”[2559-he] An answer was not really needed , and [he]2559-he did not furnish one . “ Well , ”[2559-he] [he]2559-he went on , “ there 's nobody in [the world]4424-the world [I]2563-you would have wished to see enter into this wealth before [you]2563-you , [Lucetta]214-lucetta , and [nobody]298-nobody , [I]2563-you am sure , who will become it more . ”[2563-you] [He]2559-he turned to [her]2563-you with congratulatory admiration so fervid that [she]2563-you shrank somewhat , notwithstanding that [she]2563-you knew [him]2559-he so well . “ [I]122-henchard am greatly obliged to [you]2559-he for all that , ”[122-henchard] said [she]2563-you , rather with an air of speaking ritual . The stint of reciprocal feeling was perceived , and [Henchard]122-henchard showed chagrin at once — [nobody]298-nobody was more quick to show that than [he]122-henchard . “ [You]2563-you may be obliged or not for't . [I]214-lucetta come with an honest proposal for silencing [[your]2563-you Jersey enemies]5397-your jersey enemies , and [you]2563-you ought to be thankful . ”[214-lucetta] “ How can [you]122-henchard speak so ! ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta answered , firing quickly . “ Knowing that [my]2565-i only crime was the indulging in [a foolish girl]5398-a foolish girl 's passion for [you]122-henchard with too little regard for correctness , and that [I]2565-i was what [I]2565-i call innocent all the time [they]5399-they called [me]2565-i guilty , [you]122-henchard ought not to be so cutting ! Time will — ”[2567-he] [She]214-lucetta stopped ; and [he]2567-he said nothing to fill the gap for awhile , there being no pressure of half acquaintance to drive [them]2566-their into speech if [they]2566-their were not minded for it . “ That 's the way the wind blows , is it ? ”[122-henchard] [he]2567-he said at last grimly , nodding an affirmative to [his]2567-he own thoughts . A yellow flood of reflected sunlight filled [the room]985-the room for a few instants . It was produced by the passing of a load of newly trussed hay from [the country]633-the country , in a waggon marked with [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's name . Beside it rode [Farfrae]139-farfrae [himself]139-farfrae on horseback . [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's face became — as [a woman]647-a woman 's face becomes when [the man [she]647-a woman loves]2571-the man she loves rises upon [her]647-a woman gaze like an apparition . A turn of the eye by [Henchard]122-henchard , a glance from the window , and the secret of [her]214-lucetta inaccessibility would have been revealed . But [Henchard]122-henchard in estimating [her]214-lucetta tone was looking down so plumb - straight that [he]122-henchard did not note the warm consciousness upon [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's face . “ [I]122-henchard should n't have thought it — [I]122-henchard should n't have thought it of [women]4948-women ! ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said emphatically by - and - by , rising and shaking [himself]122-henchard into activity ; while [Lucetta]214-lucetta was so anxious to divert [him]122-henchard from any suspicion of the truth that [she]214-lucetta asked [him]122-henchard to be in no hurry . Bringing [him]122-henchard some apples [she]214-lucetta insisted upon paring one for [him]122-henchard . [He]122-henchard would not take it . “ No , no ; such is not for [me]122-henchard , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said drily , and moved to the door . At going out [he]122-henchard turned [his]122-henchard eye upon [her]214-lucetta . “ [You]214-lucetta came to live in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge entirely on [my]122-henchard account , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said . “ Yet now [you]214-lucetta are here [you]214-lucetta wo n't have anything to say to [my]214-lucetta offer ! ”[214-lucetta] [He]122-henchard had hardly gone down the staircase when [she]214-lucetta dropped upon the sofa and jumped up again in a fit of desperation . “ [I]214-lucetta WILL love [him]122-henchard ! ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta cried passionately ; “ as for [HIM]122-henchard — [he]122-henchard 's hot - tempered and stern , and it would be madness to bind [myself]139-farfrae to [him]122-henchard knowing that . [I]139-farfrae wo n't be [a slave to the past]5406-a slave to the past — [I]139-farfrae 'll love where [I]139-farfrae choose ! ”[139-farfrae] Yet having decided to break away from [Henchard]122-henchard one might have supposed [her]214-lucetta capable of aiming higher than [Farfrae]139-farfrae . But [Lucetta]214-lucetta reasoned nothing : [she]214-lucetta feared hard words from [the people with whom [she]214-lucetta had been earlier associated]2572-the people with whom she had been earlier associated ; [she]214-lucetta had [no relatives left ; and with native lightness of heart]2573-no relatives left ; and with native lightness of heart took kindly to what fate offered . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , surveying the position of [Lucetta]214-lucetta between [[her]191-henchard two lovers]2574-her two lovers from the crystalline sphere of a straightforward mind , did not fail to perceive that [[her]191-henchard father]4886-her father , as [she]191-henchard called [him]4886-her father , and [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae became more desperately enamoured of [[her]191-henchard friend]2164-her friend every day . On [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's side it was the unforced passion of youth . On [Henchard]122-henchard 's the artificially stimulated coveting of maturer age . The pain [she]214-lucetta experienced from the almost absolute obliviousness to [her]214-lucetta existence that was shown by [the pair of [them]2577-the pair of them]2577-the pair of them became at times half dissipated by [her]214-lucetta sense of its humourousness . When [Lucetta]214-lucetta had pricked [her]214-lucetta finger [they]2577-the pair of them were as deeply concerned as if [she]214-lucetta were dying ; when [she]214-lucetta [herself]214-lucetta had been seriously sick or in danger [they]2577-the pair of them uttered a conventional word of sympathy at the news , and forgot all about it immediately . But , as regarded [Henchard]122-henchard , this perception of [hers]214-lucetta also caused [her]214-lucetta some filial grief ; [she]214-lucetta could not help asking what [she]214-lucetta had done to be neglected so , after the professions of solicitude [he]122-henchard had made . As regarded [Farfrae]139-farfrae , [she]214-lucetta thought , after honest reflection , that it was quite natural . What was [she]139-farfrae beside [Lucetta]214-lucetta ? — as one of the “ meaner beauties of the night , ”[122-henchard] when the moon had risen in the skies . [She]214-lucetta had learnt the lesson of renunciation , and was as familiar with the wreck of each day 's wishes as with the diurnal setting of the sun . If [her]214-lucetta earthly career had taught [her]214-lucetta few book philosophies it had at least well practised [her]214-lucetta in this . Yet [her]214-lucetta experience had consisted less in a series of pure disappointments than in a series of substitutions . Continually it had happened that what [she]214-lucetta had desired had not been granted [her]214-lucetta , and that what had been granted [her]214-lucetta [she]214-lucetta had not desired . So [she]214-lucetta viewed with an approach to equanimity the now cancelled days when [Donald]139-farfrae had been [[her]214-lucetta undeclared lover]2578-her undeclared lover , and wondered what unwished - for thing [Heaven]123-heaven might send [her]214-lucetta in place of [him]122-henchard .

It chanced that on a fine spring morning [Henchard]122-henchard and [Farfrae]139-farfrae met in the chestnut - walk which ran along [the south wall of [the town]632-the town]2579-the south wall of the town . [Each]217-each had just come out from [his]217-each early breakfast , and there was [not another soul near]2581-not another soul near . [Henchard]122-henchard was reading a letter from [Lucetta]214-lucetta , sent in answer to a note from [him]122-henchard , in which [she]214-lucetta made some excuse for not immediately granting [him]122-henchard a second interview that [he]122-henchard had desired . [Donald]139-farfrae had no wish to enter into conversation with [[his]122-henchard former friend]1896-his former friend on [their]2583-their present constrained terms ; neither would [he]122-henchard pass [him]122-henchard in scowling silence . [He]122-henchard nodded , and [Henchard]122-henchard did the same . [They]2583-their receded from each other several paces when a voice cried “ [Farfrae]139-farfrae ! ”[122-henchard] It was [Henchard]122-henchard 's , who stood regarding [him]122-henchard . “ Do [you]122-henchard remember , ”[122-henchard] said [Henchard]122-henchard , as if it were the presence of the thought and not of the man which made [him]122-henchard speak , “ do [you]122-henchard remember [my]139-farfrae story of [that second woman]5407-that second woman — who suffered for [her]2584-her thoughtless intimacy with [me]139-farfrae ? ”[139-farfrae] “ [I]139-farfrae do , ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “ Do [you]122-henchard remember [my]139-farfrae telling ' [ee]122-henchard how it all began and how it ended ? “[139-farfrae] Yes . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i have offered to marry [her]2584-her now that [I]0-i can ; but [she]2584-her wo n't marry [me]0-i . Now what would [you]122-henchard think of [her]2584-her — [I]0-i put it to [you]122-henchard ? ” “[122-henchard] Well , [ye]122-henchard owe [her]2584-her nothing more now , ” said [Farfrae]139-farfrae heartily . “[2585-pleasant young fellow] It is true , ” said [Henchard]122-henchard , and went on . That [he]122-henchard had looked up from a letter to ask [his]122-henchard questions completely shut out from [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's mind all vision of [Lucetta]214-lucetta as [the culprit]5408-the culprit . Indeed , [her]2584-her present position was so different from that of [the young woman of [Henchard]122-henchard]5409-the young woman of henchard 's story as of itself to be sufficient to blind [him]122-henchard absolutely to [her]2584-her identity . As for [Henchard]122-henchard , [he]122-henchard was reassured by [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's words and manner against a suspicion which had crossed [his]122-henchard mind . They were not those of [a conscious rival]5410-a conscious rival . Yet that there was rivalry by some one [he]122-henchard was firmly persuaded . [He]122-henchard could feel it in the air around [Lucetta]214-lucetta , see it in the turn of [her]214-lucetta pen . There was an antagonistic force in exercise , so that when [he]122-henchard had tried to hang near [her]214-lucetta [he]122-henchard seemed standing in a refluent current . That it was not innate caprice [he]122-henchard was more and more certain . [Her]214-lucetta windows gleamed as if they did not want [him]122-henchard ; [her]214-lucetta curtains seem to hang slily , as if they screened an ousting presence . To discover whose presence that was — whether really [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's after all , or another 's — [he]122-henchard exerted [himself]122-henchard to the utmost to see [her]214-lucetta again ; and at length succeeded . At the interview , when [she]214-lucetta offered [him]122-henchard tea , [he]122-henchard made it a point to launch a cautious inquiry if [she]214-lucetta knew [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae . O yes , [she]214-lucetta knew [him]149-farfrae , [she]214-lucetta declared ; [she]214-lucetta could not help knowing [almost everybody in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]5411-almost everybody in casterbridge , living in such [a gazebo over [the centre and arena of [the town]632-the town]5413-the centre and arena of the town]5412-a gazebo over the centre and arena of the town . “[2585-pleasant young fellow] [Pleasant young fellow]2585-pleasant young fellow , ” said [Henchard]122-henchard . “[2585-pleasant young fellow] Yes , ” said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “[2586-we] [We]2586-we both know [him]2585-pleasant young fellow , ” said [kind Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , to relieve [[her]191-henchard companion]583-her companion 's divined embarrassment . There was a knock at the door ; literally , three full knocks and a little one at the end . “[2585-pleasant young fellow] That kind of knock means half - and - half — somebody between gentle and simple , ” said [the corn - merchant]1288-the corn - merchant to [himself]1288-the corn - merchant . “[2585-pleasant young fellow] [I]0-i should n't wonder therefore if it is [he]2585-pleasant young fellow . ” In a few seconds surely enough [Donald]139-farfrae walked in . [Lucetta]214-lucetta was full of little fidgets and flutters , which increased [Henchard]122-henchard 's suspicions without affording any special proof of [their]5417-their correctness . [He]122-henchard was well - nigh ferocious at the sense of the queer situation in which [he]122-henchard stood towards [this woman]5418-this woman . [One who had reproached [him]122-henchard for deserting [her]5418-this woman when calumniated , who had urged claims upon [his]122-henchard consideration on that account , who had lived waiting for [him]122-henchard , who at the first decent opportunity had come to ask [him]122-henchard to rectify , by making [her]5418-this woman [his]122-henchard , the false position into which [she]5418-this woman had placed [herself]5418-this woman for [his]122-henchard sake]5419-one who had reproached him for deserting her when calumniated , who had urged claims upon his consideration on that account , who had lived waiting for him , who at the first decent opportunity had come to ask him to rectify , by making her his , the false position into which she had placed herself for his sake ; such [she]5418-this woman had been . And now [he]122-henchard sat at [her]5418-this woman tea - table eager to gain [her]5418-this woman attention , and in [his]122-henchard amatory rage feeling [the other man]1691-the other man present to be [a villain]5421-a villain , just as [any young fool of a lover]5422-any young fool of a lover might feel . [They]5423-they sat stiffly side by side at the darkening table , like some Tuscan painting of [the two disciples]5424-the two disciples supping at [Emmaus]218-emmaus . [Lucetta]214-lucetta , forming [the third and haloed figure]5425-the third and haloed figure , was opposite [them]5423-they ; [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , being out of the game , and out of [the group]2423-the group , could observe all from afar , like [the evangelist who had to write it down]5427-the evangelist who had to write it down : that there were long spaces of taciturnity , when all exterior circumstances were subdued to the touch of spoons and china , the click of a heel on the pavement under the window , the passing of a wheelbarrow or cart , the whistling of the carter , the gush of water into [householders]5428-householders ' buckets at [the town - pump opposite]5429-the town - pump opposite , the exchange of greetings among [[their]5423-they neighbours]1093-their neighbours , and the rattle of the yokes by which [they]5423-they carried off [their]5423-they evening supply . “[2585-pleasant young fellow] More bread - and - butter ? ” said [Lucetta]214-lucetta to [Henchard]191-henchard and [Farfrae]139-farfrae equally , holding out between [them]5423-they a plateful of long slices . [Henchard]191-henchard took a slice by one end and [Donald]139-farfrae by the other ; each feeling certain [he]5431-he was [the man]291-the man meant ; neither let go , and the slice came in two . “[0-i] Oh — [I]0-i am so sorry ! ” cried [Lucetta]214-lucetta , with a nervous titter . [Farfrae]139-farfrae tried to laugh ; but [he]5431-he was too much in love to see the incident in any but a tragic light . “[0-i] How ridiculous of [all three of [them]2587-all three of them]2587-all three of them ! ” said [Elizabeth]191-henchard to [herself]191-henchard . [Henchard]191-henchard left [the house]782-the house with a ton of conjecture , though without a grain of proof , that the counterattraction was [Farfrae]139-farfrae ; and therefore [he]5431-he would not make up [his]5431-he mind . Yet to [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard it was plain as [the town - pump]5434-the town - pump that [Donald]139-farfrae and [Lucetta]214-lucetta were [incipient lovers]5435-incipient lovers . More than once , in spite of [her]214-lucetta care , [Lucetta]214-lucetta had been unable to restrain [her]214-lucetta glance from flitting across into [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's eyes like a bird to its nest . But [Henchard]191-henchard was constructed upon too large a scale to discern such minutiae as these by an evening light , which to [him]5431-he were as the notes of an insect that lie above the compass of the human ear . But [he]5431-he was disturbed . And the sense of occult rivalry in [suitorship]5436-suitorship was so much superadded to the palpable rivalry of [their]5437-their business lives . To the coarse materiality of that rivalry it added an inflaming soul . The thus vitalized antagonism took the form of action by [Henchard]191-henchard sending for [Jopp]137-jopp , [the manager originally displaced by [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's arrival]5438-the manager originally displaced by farfrae 's arrival . [Henchard]191-henchard had frequently met [this man]542-this man about [the streets]1748-the streets , observed that [his]5431-he clothing spoke of neediness , heard that [he]5431-he lived in [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane — [a back slum of [the town]632-the town]5441-a back slum of the town , [the pis aller of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge domiciliation]5443-the pis aller of casterbridge domiciliation — itself almost a proof that [a man]4474-a man had reached a stage when [he]4474-a man would not stick at trifles . [Jopp]137-jopp came after dark , by the gates of [the storeyard]5445-the storeyard , and felt [his]137-jopp way through the hay and straw to [the office where [Henchard]191-henchard sat in solitude awaiting [him]137-jopp]5446-the office where henchard sat in solitude awaiting him . “[0-i] [I]0-i am again out of [a foreman]2588-a foreman , ” said [the corn - factor]4538-the corn - factor . “[0-i] Are [you]0-i in a place ? ” “[0-i] Not so much as [a beggar]2589-a beggar 's , [sir]4588-sir . ” “[0-i] How much do [you]0-i ask ? ” [Jopp]137-jopp named [his]137-jopp price , which was very moderate . “[0-i] When can [you]0-i come ? ” “[4588-sir] At this hour and moment , [sir]4588-sir , ” said [Jopp]137-jopp , who , standing hands - pocketed at [the street corner]5448-the street corner till the sun had faded the shoulders of [his]137-jopp coat to scarecrow green , had regularly watched [Henchard]191-henchard in [the market - place]1919-the market - place , measured [him]137-jopp , and learnt [him]137-jopp , by virtue of the power which [the still man]5450-the still man has in [his]5450-the still man stillness of knowing the busy one better than [he]5450-the still man knows [himself]5450-the still man . [Jopp]137-jopp too , had had a convenient experience ; [he]137-jopp was [the only one in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge besides [Henchard]191-henchard and [the close - lipped [Elizabeth]191-henchard who knew that [Lucetta]214-lucetta came truly from [Jersey]43-jersey , and but proximately from [Bath]59-bath]5452-the close - lipped elizabeth who knew that lucetta came truly from jersey , and but proximately from bath]5451-the only one in casterbridge besides henchard and the close - lipped elizabeth who knew that lucetta came truly from jersey , and but proximately from bath . “[4588-sir] [I]0-i know [Jersey]43-jersey too , [sir]4588-sir , ” [he]0-i said . “[4588-sir] Was living [there]447-there when [you]4588-sir used to do business that way . [Jopp]137-jopp said , “[4588-sir] Thank [you]4588-sir , ” and stood more firmly , in the consciousness that at last [he]137-jopp officially belonged to that spot . “[2598-d'ye] Now , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard , digging [his]0-i strong eyes into [Jopp]137-jopp 's face , “[0-i] one thing is necessary to [me]0-i , as [the biggest corn - and - hay dealer in [these parts]2595-these parts]2594-the biggest corn - and - hay dealer in these parts . [The Scotchman]886-the scotchman , who 's taking [the town]632-the town trade so bold into [his]886-the scotchman hands , must be cut out . [D'ye]2598-d'ye hear ? [We]2599-we two ca n't live side by side — that 's clear and certain . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i 've seen it all , ” said [Jopp]137-jopp . “[0-i] By fair competition [I]0-i mean , of course , ” [Henchard]191-henchard continued . “[0-i] But as hard , keen , and unflinching as fair — rather more so .
