' ... Yes , what did [she]2762-she say ? ” “[2762-she] [She]2762-she said , ' Put away that dee lantern , ' [she]2762-she says . ” “[2762-she] Yes . ” “[4510-the old woman] Says [she]2762-she , ' Dost hear , [old turmit - head]2764-old turmit - head ? Put away that dee lantern . [I]0-i have floored [fellows]2765-fellows a dee sight finer - looking than [a dee fool like [thee]2767-thee]2766-a dee fool like thee , [you]2767-thee son of a bee , dee [me]0-i if [I]0-i haint , ' [she]2762-she says . “ [I]4510-the old woman object to that conversation ! ”[4510-the old woman] interposed [the old woman]4510-the old woman . “ [I]191-henchard was not capable enough to hear what [I]191-henchard said , and what is said out of [my]191-henchard hearing is not evidence . ”[191-henchard] There was another stoppage for consultation , a book was referred to , and finally [Stubberd]223-stubberd was allowed to go on again . The truth was that [the old woman]4510-the old woman had appeared in [court]2770-court so many more times than [the magistrates themselves]2771-the magistrates themselves , that [they]2771-the magistrates themselves were obliged to keep a sharp look - out upon [their]2771-the magistrates themselves procedure . However , when [Stubberd]223-stubberd had rambled on a little further [Henchard]191-henchard broke out impatiently , “ Come — [we]2771-the magistrates themselves do n't want to hear any more of [them]2771-the magistrates themselves cust dees and bees ! Say the words out like [a man]4474-a man , and do n't be so modest , [Stubberd]223-stubberd ; or else leave it alone ! ”[191-henchard] Turning to [the woman]300-the woman , “ Now then , have [you]300-the woman any questions to ask [him]223-stubberd , or anything to say ? ”[300-the woman] “ Yes , ”[5576-the clerk] [she]300-the woman replied with a twinkle in [her]300-the woman eye ; and [the clerk]5576-the clerk dipped [his]5576-the clerk pen . “ Twenty years ago or thereabout [I]5576-the clerk was selling of furmity in [a tent at [Weydon Fair]8-weydon fair]5588-a tent at weydon fair — — ”[5576-the clerk] “ ' Twenty years ago ' — well , that 's beginning at the beginning ; suppose [you]300-the woman go back to [the Creation]5589-the creation ! ”[300-the woman] said [the clerk]5576-the clerk , not without satire . But [Henchard]191-henchard stared , and quite forgot what was evidence and what was not . “ [A man]4474-a man and [a woman with [a little child]5592-a little child]5591-a woman with a little child came into [[my]300-the woman tent]5593-my tent , ”[300-the woman] [the woman]300-the woman continued . “ [They]5594-they sat down and had a basin apiece . Ah , [Lord]5595-lord 's [my]2755-the second magistrate life ! [I]2755-the second magistrate was of [a more respectable station in [the world]4424-the world]5596-a more respectable station in the world then than [I]2755-the second magistrate am now , being [a land smuggler]5598-a land smuggler in a large way of business ; and [I]2755-the second magistrate used to season [my]2755-the second magistrate furmity with rum for [them]5594-they who asked for't . [I]2755-the second magistrate did it for [the man]291-the man ; and then [he]291-the man had more and more ; till at last [he]291-the man quarrelled with [[his]291-the man wife]380-his wife , and offered to sell [her]380-his wife to [the highest bidder]5601-the highest bidder . [A sailor]1192-a sailor came in and bid five guineas , and paid the money , and led [her]380-his wife away . And [the man who sold [[his]291-the man wife]380-his wife in that fashion]5603-the man who sold his wife in that fashion is [the man sitting there in the great big chair]5605-the man sitting there in the great big chair . ”[2755-the second magistrate] [The speaker]803-the speaker concluded by nodding [her]803-the speaker head at [Henchard]191-henchard and folding [her]803-the speaker arms . [Everybody]1670-everybody looked at [Henchard]191-henchard . [His]2778-his face seemed strange , and in tint as if it had been powdered over with ashes . “ [We]2755-the second magistrate do n't want to hear [your]191-henchard life and adventures , ”[2755-the second magistrate] said [the second magistrate]2755-the second magistrate sharply , filling the pause which followed . “ [You]191-henchard 've been asked if [you]191-henchard 've anything to say bearing on the case . ”[2755-the second magistrate] “ That bears on the case . It proves that [he]291-the man 's no better than [I]5576-the clerk , and has no right to sit there in judgment upon [me]5576-the clerk . ”[5576-the clerk] “ ' Tis a concocted story , ”[5576-the clerk] said [the clerk]5576-the clerk . “ So hold [your]191-henchard tongue ! ”[191-henchard] “ No — ' tis true . ”[2778-his] The words came from [Henchard]191-henchard . “ ' Tis as true as the light , ”[2778-his] [he]2778-his said slowly . “ And upon [my]214-lucetta soul it does prove that [I]214-lucetta 'm no better than [she]291-the man ! And to keep out of any temptation to treat [her]291-the man hard for [her]291-the man revenge , [I]214-lucetta 'll leave [her]291-the man to [you]191-henchard . ”[214-lucetta] The sensation in [the court]2311-the court was indescribably great . [Henchard]191-henchard left the chair , and came out , passing through [a group of [people on the steps]2783-people on the steps and outside that was much larger than usual]2782-a group of people on the steps and outside that was much larger than usual ; for it seemed that [the old furmity dealer]2784-the old furmity dealer had mysteriously hinted to [the denizens of [the lane in which [she]2784-the old furmity dealer had been lodging since [her]2784-the old furmity dealer arrival]2786-the lane in which she had been lodging since her arrival]2785-the denizens of the lane in which she had been lodging since her arrival , that [she]2784-the old furmity dealer knew a queer thing or two about [[their]2785-the denizens of the lane in which she had been lodging since her arrival great local man]2787-their great local man [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , if [she]2784-the old furmity dealer chose to tell it . This had brought [them]2785-the denizens of the lane in which she had been lodging since her arrival hither . “ Why are there so many idlers round [the Town Hall]5606-the town hall to - day ? ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta to [[her]214-lucetta servant]2788-her servant when the case was over . [She]214-lucetta had risen late , and had just looked out of the window . “ Oh , please , [ma'am]618-ma'am , ' tis this larry about [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard . [A woman]647-a woman has proved that before [he]120-henchard became [a gentleman]4562-a gentleman [he]120-henchard sold [[his]120-henchard wife]380-his wife for five guineas in a booth at a fair . ”[2798-he] In all the accounts which [Henchard]120-henchard had given [her]214-lucetta of the separation from [[his]120-henchard wife]380-his wife [Susan]122-henchard for so many years , of [his]120-henchard belief in [her]380-his wife death , and so on , [he]120-henchard had never clearly explained the actual and immediate cause of that separation . The story [she]214-lucetta now heard for the first time . A gradual misery overspread [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's face as [she]214-lucetta dwelt upon the promise wrung from [her]214-lucetta the night before . At bottom , then , [Henchard]122-henchard was this . How terrible a contingency for [a woman who should commit [herself]2790-a woman who should commit herself to his care to [his]120-henchard care]2790-a woman who should commit herself to his care . During the day [she]214-lucetta went out to [the Ring]2791-the ring and to [other places]2792-other places , not coming in till nearly dusk . As soon as [she]214-lucetta saw [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard after [her]191-henchard return indoors [she]214-lucetta told [her]191-henchard that [she]214-lucetta had resolved to go away from [home]675-home to [the seaside]2794-the seaside for a few days — to [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy ; [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge was so gloomy . [Elizabeth]191-henchard , seeing that [she]191-henchard looked wan and disturbed , encouraged [her]191-henchard in the idea , thinking a change would afford [her]191-henchard relief . [She]191-henchard could not help suspecting that the gloom which seemed to have come over [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge in [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's eyes might be partially owing to the fact that [Farfrae]139-farfrae was away from [home]675-home . [Elizabeth]191-henchard saw [[her]191-henchard friend]2164-her friend depart for [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy , and took charge of [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall till [her]191-henchard return . After two or three days of solitude and incessant rain [Henchard]191-henchard called at [the house]782-the house . [He]2798-he seemed disappointed to hear of [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's absence and though [he]2798-he nodded with outward indifference [he]2798-he went away handling [his]2798-he beard with a nettled mien . The next day [he]2798-he called again . “ Is [she]214-lucetta come now ? ”[2495-his stepdaughter] [he]2798-he asked . “ Yes . [She]214-lucetta returned this morning , ”[2798-he] replied [[his]2798-he stepdaughter]2495-his stepdaughter . “ But [she]214-lucetta is not [indoors]4777-indoors . [She]214-lucetta has gone for a walk along [the turnpike - road]1405-the turnpike - road to [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy . [She]214-lucetta will be [home]675-home by dusk . ”[2798-he] After a few words , which only served to reveal [his]2798-he restless impatience , [he]2798-he left [the house]782-the house again .

At this hour [Lucetta]214-lucetta was bounding along [the road]320-the road to [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy just as [Elizabeth]191-henchard had announced . That [she]191-henchard had chosen for [her]191-henchard afternoon walk [the road along which [she]191-henchard had returned to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]2802-the road along which she had returned to casterbridge three hours earlier in [a carriage]1523-a carriage was curious — if anything should be called curious in concatenations of phenomena wherein each is known to have its accounting cause . It was the day of [the chief market]2804-the chief market — Saturday — and [Farfrae]139-farfrae for once had been missed from [his]2798-he corn - stand in [[the dealers]2805-the dealers ' room]2806-the dealers ' room . Nevertheless , it was known that [he]2798-he would be [home]675-home that night — “ for Sunday , ”[214-lucetta] as [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge expressed it . [Lucetta]214-lucetta , in continuing [her]214-lucetta walk , had at length reached the end of the ranked trees which bordered [the highway]301-the highway in this and other directions out of [the town]632-the town . This end marked a mile ; and here [she]214-lucetta stopped . [The spot]521-the spot was [a vale between two gentle acclivities]2811-a vale between two gentle acclivities , and [the road]320-the road , still adhering to [its]320-the road Roman foundation , stretched onward straight as [a surveyor]2813-a surveyor 's line till lost to sight on [the most distant ridge]2814-the most distant ridge . There was neither hedge nor tree in the prospect now , [the road]320-the road clinging to [the stubby expanse of corn - land]2816-the stubby expanse of corn - land like a strip to an undulating garment . Near [her]214-lucetta was [a barn]2817-a barn — [the single building of any kind within [her]214-lucetta horizon]2818-the single building of any kind within her horizon . [She]214-lucetta strained [her]214-lucetta eyes up [the lessening road]2819-the lessening road , but nothing appeared thereon — not so much as a speck . [She]214-lucetta sighed one word — “ [Donald]139-farfrae ! ”[191-henchard] and turned [her]214-lucetta face to [the town]632-the town for retreat . Here the case was different . A single figure was approaching [her]214-lucetta — [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's . [Lucetta]214-lucetta , in spite of [her]214-lucetta loneliness , seemed a little vexed . [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's face , as soon as [she]191-henchard recognized [[her]191-henchard friend]2164-her friend , shaped itself into affectionate lines while yet beyond speaking distance . “ [I]214-lucetta suddenly thought [I]214-lucetta would come and meet [you]214-lucetta , ”[214-lucetta] [she]191-henchard said , smiling . [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's reply was taken from [her]214-lucetta lips by an unexpected diversion . [A by - road]2822-a by - road on [her]214-lucetta right hand descended from [the fields]2699-the fields into [the highway]301-the highway at the point where [she]214-lucetta stood , and down the track a bull was rambling uncertainly towards [her]214-lucetta and [Elizabeth]191-henchard , who , facing the other way , did not observe [him]2164-her friend . In the latter quarter of each year cattle were at once the mainstay and the terror of families about [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge and [[its]6-casterbridge neighbourhood]1080-its neighbourhood , where breeding was carried on with Abrahamic success . The head of stock driven into and out of [the town]632-the town at this season to be sold by [the local auctioneer]2827-the local auctioneer was very large ; and all these horned beasts , in travelling to and fro , sent [women]4948-women and [children]4419-children to shelter as nothing else could do . In the main the animals would have walked along quietly enough ; but the [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge tradition was that to drive stock it was indispensable that hideous cries , coupled with Yahoo antics and gestures , should be used , large sticks flourished , stray dogs called in , and in general everything done that was likely to infuriate the viciously disposed and terrify [the mild]2830-the mild . Nothing was commoner than for [a house - holder]2831-a house - holder on going out of [[his]2831-a house - holder parlour]2832-his parlour to find [[his]2831-a house - holder hall or passage full of [little children]2834-little children]2833-his hall or passage full of little children , [nursemaids]2835-nursemaids , [aged women]2836-aged women , or [[a ladies]2837-a ladies ' school]2838-a ladies ' school , who apologized for [their]2839-their presence by saying , “ A bull passing down [street]5614-street from the sale . ”[191-henchard] [Lucetta]214-lucetta and [Elizabeth]191-henchard regarded the animal in doubt , [he]2840-his meanwhile drawing vaguely towards [them]2841-they . [It]2840-his was [a large specimen of the breed]2842-a large specimen of the breed , in colour rich dun , though disfigured at present by splotches of mud about [his]2840-his seamy sides . [His]2840-his horns were thick and tipped with brass ; [his]2840-his two nostrils like the Thames Tunnel as seen in the perspective toys of yore . Between [them]2841-they , through the gristle of [his]2840-his nose , was a stout copper ring , welded on , and irremovable as [Gurth]227-gurth 's collar of brass . To the ring was attached an ash staff about a yard long , which the bull with the motions of [his]2840-his head flung about like a flail . It was not till [they]2841-they observed this dangling stick that [the young women]2843-the young women were really alarmed ; for it revealed to [them]2841-they that the bull was [an old one]2844-an old one , too savage to be driven , which had in some way escaped , the staff being the means by which [the drover]2845-the drover controlled [him]2840-his and kept [his]2840-his horns at arms ' length . [They]2841-they looked round for some shelter or hiding - place , and thought of [the barn]2072-the barn hard by . As long as [they]2841-they had kept [their]2841-they eyes on the bull [he]2840-his had shown some deference in [his]2840-his manner of approach ; but no sooner did [they]2841-they turn [their]2841-they backs to seek [the barn]2072-the barn than [he]2840-his tossed [his]2840-his head and decided to thoroughly terrify [them]2841-they . This caused [the two helpless girls]2848-the two helpless girls to run wildly , whereupon the bull advanced in a deliberate charge . [The barn]2072-the barn stood behind [a green slimy pond]2850-a green slimy pond , and [it]2072-the barn was closed save as to one of the usual pair of doors facing [them]2841-they , which had been propped open by a hurdle - stick , and for this opening [they]2841-they made . [The interior]2851-the interior had been cleared by a recent bout of threshing except at one end , where there was a stack of dry clover . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard took in the situation . “ [We]2841-they must climb up there , ”[214-lucetta] [she]191-henchard said . But before [they]2841-they had even approached it [they]2841-they heard the bull scampering through [the pond]2852-the pond without , and in a second [he]2840-his dashed into [the barn]2072-the barn , knocking down the hurdle - stake in passing ; the heavy door slammed behind [him]2840-his ; and [all three]2854-all three were imprisoned in [the barn]2072-the barn together . [The mistaken creature]2856-the mistaken creature saw [them]2841-they , and stalked towards the end of [the barn into which [they]2841-they had fled]2857-the barn into which they had fled . [The girls]2858-the girls doubled so adroitly that [[their]2841-they pursuer]2859-their pursuer was against the wall when [the fugitives]2860-the fugitives were already half way to the other end . By the time that [his]2840-his length would allow [him]2840-his to turn and follow [them]2841-they thither [they]2841-they had crossed over ; thus the pursuit went on , the hot air from [his]2840-his nostrils blowing over [them]2841-they like a sirocco , and not a moment being attainable by [Elizabeth]191-henchard or [Lucetta]214-lucetta in which to open the door . What might have happened had [their]2841-they situation continued can not be said ; but in a few moments a rattling of the door distracted [[their]2841-they adversary]2861-their adversary 's attention , and [a man]4474-a man appeared . [He]4474-a man ran forward towards the leading - staff , seized it , and wrenched the animal 's head as if [he]4474-a man would snap it off . The wrench was in reality so violent that the thick neck seemed to have lost its stiffness and to become half - paralyzed , whilst the nose dropped blood . The premeditated human contrivance of the nose - ring was too cunning for impulsive brute force , and [the creature]2863-the creature flinched . [The man]291-the man was seen in the partial gloom to be large - framed and unhesitating . [He]291-the man led the bull to the door , and the light revealed [Henchard]191-henchard . [He]291-the man made the bull fast without , and re - entered to the succour of [Lucetta]214-lucetta ; for [he]291-the man had not perceived [Elizabeth]191-henchard , who had climbed on to the clover - heap . [Lucetta]214-lucetta was hysterical , and [Henchard]191-henchard took [her]214-lucetta in [his]291-the man arms and carried [her]214-lucetta to the door . “ [You]191-henchard — have saved [me]291-the man ! ”[291-the man] [she]214-lucetta cried , as soon as [she]214-lucetta could speak . “ [I]291-the man have returned [your]191-henchard kindness , ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man responded tenderly . “ [You]191-henchard once saved [me]214-lucetta . ”[214-lucetta] “ How — comes it to be [you]291-the man — [you]291-the man ? ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta asked , not heeding [his]291-the man reply . “ [I]191-henchard came out here to look for [you]291-the man . [I]191-henchard have been wanting to tell [you]291-the man something these two or three days ; but [you]291-the man have been away , and [I]191-henchard could not . Perhaps [you]291-the man can not talk now ? ”[191-henchard] “ Oh — no ! Where is [Elizabeth]191-henchard ? ”[2865-the missing one] “ Here am [I]191-henchard ! ”[191-henchard] cried [the missing one]2865-the missing one cheerfully ; and without waiting for the ladder to be placed [she]214-lucetta slid down the face of the clover - stack to the floor . [Henchard]191-henchard supporting [Lucetta]214-lucetta on one side , and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard on the other , [they]2866-they went slowly along [the rising road]2867-the rising road . [They]2866-they had reached the top and were descending again when [Lucetta]214-lucetta , now much recovered , recollected that [she]214-lucetta had dropped [her]214-lucetta muff in [the barn]2072-the barn . “ [I]191-henchard 'll run back , ”[191-henchard] said [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . “ [I]2872-a green - and - black gig do n't mind it at all , as [I]2872-a green - and - black gig am not tired as [you]191-henchard are . ”[2872-a green - and - black gig] [She]191-henchard thereupon hastened down again to [the barn]2072-the barn , [the others]854-the others pursuing [their]854-the others way . [Elizabeth]191-henchard soon found the muff , such an article being by no means small at that time . Coming out [she]191-henchard paused to look for a moment at the bull , now rather to be pitied with [his]2871-his bleeding nose , having perhaps rather intended a practical joke than a murder . [Henchard]191-henchard had secured [him]2871-his by jamming the staff into the hinge of the barn - door , and wedging it there with a stake . At length [she]191-henchard turned to hasten onward after [her]191-henchard contemplation , when [she]191-henchard saw [a green - and - black gig]2872-a green - and - black gig approaching from the contrary direction , [the vehicle]2873-the vehicle being driven by [Farfrae]139-farfrae . [His]2872-a green - and - black gig presence [here]4417-here seemed to explain [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's walk that way . [Donald]139-farfrae saw [her]191-henchard , drew up , and was hastily made acquainted with what had occurred . At [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard mentioning how greatly [Lucetta]214-lucetta had been jeopardized , [he]2872-a green - and - black gig exhibited an agitation different in kind no less than in intensity from any [she]191-henchard had seen in [him]2872-a green - and - black gig before . [He]2872-a green - and - black gig became so absorbed in the circumstance that [he]2872-a green - and - black gig scarcely had sufficient knowledge of what [he]2872-a green - and - black gig was doing to think of helping [her]191-henchard up beside [him]2872-a green - and - black gig . “ [She]214-lucetta has gone on with [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , [you]191-henchard say ? ”[2872-a green - and - black gig] [he]2872-a green - and - black gig inquired at last . “ Yes . [He]120-henchard is taking [her]214-lucetta [home]675-home . [They]5616-they are almost [there]447-there by this time . ”[191-henchard] “ And [you]191-henchard are sure [she]214-lucetta can get [home]675-home ? ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard was quite sure . “ [[Your]191-henchard stepfather]5033-your stepfather saved [her]214-lucetta ? ”[139-farfrae] “ Entirely . ”[2872-a green - and - black gig] [Farfrae]139-farfrae checked [his]2872-a green - and - black gig horse 's pace ; [she]191-henchard guessed why . [He]2872-a green - and - black gig was thinking that it would be best not to intrude on [the other two]2875-the other two just now . [Henchard]191-henchard had saved [Lucetta]214-lucetta , and to provoke a possible exhibition of [her]191-henchard deeper affection for [himself]191-henchard was as ungenerous as it was unwise . The immediate subject of [their]2876-their talk being exhausted [she]191-henchard felt more embarrassed at sitting thus beside [[her]191-henchard past lover]2877-her past lover ; but soon [the two figures of [the others]854-the others]2878-the two figures of the others were visible at the entrance to [the town]632-the town . The face of [the woman]300-the woman was frequently turned back , but [Farfrae]139-farfrae did not whip on the horse . When these reached [the town]632-the town walls [Henchard]191-henchard and [[his]2872-a green - and - black gig companion]1462-his companion had disappeared down [the street]797-the street ; [Farfrae]139-farfrae set down [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard on [her]191-henchard expressing a particular wish to alight there , and drove round to [the stables]2885-the stables at the back of [[his]2872-a green - and - black gig lodgings]1455-his lodgings . On this account [he]2872-a green - and - black gig entered [the house]782-the house through [[his]2872-a green - and - black gig garden]5499-his garden , and going up to [[his]2872-a green - and - black gig apartments]2889-his apartments found [them]2889-his apartments in a particularly disturbed state , [his]2872-a green - and - black gig boxes being hauled out upon [the landing]1070-the landing , and [his]2872-a green - and - black gig bookcase standing in three pieces . These phenomena , however , seemed to cause [him]2872-a green - and - black gig not the least surprise . “ When will everything be sent up ? ”[993-the mistress of the house] [he]2872-a green - and - black gig said to [the mistress of [the house]782-the house]993-the mistress of the house , who was superintending . “ [I]993-the mistress of the house am afraid not before eight , [sir]4588-sir , ”[993-the mistress of the house] said [she]993-the mistress of the house . “ [You]4588-sir see [we]5621-we was n't aware till this morning that [you]4588-sir were going to move , or [we]5621-we could have been forwarder . ”[139-farfrae] “ A — well , never mind , never mind ! ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae cheerily . “ Eight o'clock will do well enough if it be not later . Now , do n't [ye]4588-sir be standing here talking , or it will be twelve , [I]1288-the corn - merchant doubt . ”[1288-the corn - merchant] Thus speaking [he]2872-a green - and - black gig went out by the front door and up [the street]797-the street . During this interval [Henchard]191-henchard and [Lucetta]214-lucetta had had experiences of a different kind . After [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's departure for [the muff]2894-the muff [the corn - merchant]1288-the corn - merchant opened [himself]1288-the corn - merchant frankly , holding [her]191-henchard hand within [his]1288-the corn - merchant arm , though [she]191-henchard would fain have withdrawn it . “ [Dear Lucetta]214-lucetta , [I]1288-the corn - merchant have been very , very anxious to see [you]214-lucetta these two or three days , ”[1288-the corn - merchant] [he]1288-the corn - merchant said , “ ever since [I]214-lucetta saw [you]214-lucetta last ! [I]214-lucetta have thought over the way [I]214-lucetta got [your]214-lucetta promise that night . [You]214-lucetta said to [me]214-lucetta , ' If [I]214-lucetta were [a man]4474-a man [I]214-lucetta should not insist . ' That cut [me]214-lucetta deep . [I]214-lucetta felt that there was some truth in it . [I]214-lucetta do n't want to make [you]214-lucetta wretched ; and to marry [me]214-lucetta just now would do that as nothing else could — it is but too plain . Therefore [I]214-lucetta agree to an indefinite engagement — to put off all thought of marriage for a year or two . ”[214-lucetta] “ But — but — can [I]214-lucetta do nothing of a different kind ? ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ [I]2896-i am full of gratitude to [you]191-henchard — [you]191-henchard have saved [my]2896-i life . And [your]191-henchard care of [me]2896-i is like coals of fire on [my]2896-i head ! [I]2896-i am [a monied person]5623-a monied person now . Surely [I]2896-i can do something in return for [your]191-henchard goodness — something practical ? ”[2896-i] [Henchard]191-henchard remained in thought . [He]2896-i had evidently not expected this . “ There is one thing [you]214-lucetta might do , [Lucetta]214-lucetta , ”[2896-i] [he]2896-i said . “ But not exactly of that kind . ”[214-lucetta] “ Then of what kind is it ? ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta asked with renewed misgiving . “ [I]2896-i must tell [you]191-henchard a secret to ask it . — [You]191-henchard may have heard that [I]2896-i have been unlucky this year ? [I]2896-i did what [I]2896-i have never done before — speculated rashly ; and [I]2896-i lost . That 's just put [me]2896-i in a strait . “[2896-i] And [you]2896-i would wish [me]0-i to advance some money ? ” “[2896-i] No , no ! ” said [Henchard]191-henchard , almost in anger . “[214-lucetta] [I]0-i 'm not [the man to sponge on [a woman]647-a woman]2897-the man to sponge on a woman , even though [she]647-a woman may be so nearly [my]0-i own as [you]214-lucetta . No , [Lucetta]214-lucetta ; what [you]214-lucetta can do is this and it would save [me]0-i . [[My]0-i great creditor]2899-my great creditor is [Grower]2900-grower , and it is at [his]2900-grower hands [I]0-i shall suffer if at [anybody]4437-anybody 's ; while a fortnight 's forbearance on [his]2900-grower part would be enough to allow [me]0-i to pull through . This may be got out of [him]2900-grower in one way — that [you]214-lucetta would let it be known to [him]2900-grower that [you]214-lucetta are [my]0-i intended — that [we]2902-we are to be quietly married in the next fortnight . — Now stop , [you]214-lucetta have n't heard all ! Let [him]2900-grower have this story , without , of course , any prejudice to the fact that the actual engagement between [us]2902-we is to be a long one . [Nobody else]4836-nobody else need know : [you]214-lucetta could go with [me]0-i to [Mr. Grower]229-mr. grower and just let [me]0-i speak to ' [ee]2904-ee before [him]2900-grower as if [we]2902-we were on such terms . [We]2902-we 'll ask [him]2900-grower to keep it secret . [He]2900-grower will willingly wait then . At the fortnight 's end [I]0-i shall be able to face [him]2900-grower ; and [I]0-i can coolly tell [him]2900-grower all is postponed between [us]2902-we for a year or two . [Not a soul in [the town]632-the town]2905-not a soul in the town need know how [you]214-lucetta 've helped [me]0-i . Since [you]214-lucetta wish to be of use , there 's [your]214-lucetta way . ” It being now what [the people called the “[214-lucetta] pinking in ” of the day]5624-the people called the “ pinking in ” of the day , that is , the quarter - hour just before dusk , [he]2900-grower did not at first observe the result of [his]2900-grower own words upon [her]214-lucetta . “[214-lucetta] If it were anything else , ” [she]214-lucetta began , and the dryness of [her]214-lucetta lips was represented in [her]214-lucetta voice . “[214-lucetta] But it is such a little thing ! ” [he]2900-grower said , with a deep reproach . “[2900-grower] Less than [you]214-lucetta have offered — just the beginning of what [you]214-lucetta have so lately promised ! [I]0-i could have told [him]2900-grower as much [myself]0-i , but [he]2900-grower would not have believed [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] It is not because [I]0-i wo n't — it is because [I]0-i absolutely ca n't , ” [she]214-lucetta said , with rising distress . “[214-lucetta] [You]214-lucetta are provoking ! ” [he]0-i burst out . “[0-i] It is enough to make [me]0-i force [you]214-lucetta to carry out at once what [you]214-lucetta have promised . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not ! ” [she]214-lucetta insisted desperately . “[0-i] Why ? When [I]0-i have only within these few minutes released [you]214-lucetta from [your]214-lucetta promise to do the thing offhand . ” “[2908-witness] Because — [he]2900-grower was [a witness]5565-a witness ! ” “[2908-witness] [Witness]2908-witness ? Of what ? “ If [I]5565-a witness must tell [you]214-lucetta — — . Do n't , do n't upbraid [me]5565-a witness ! ”[5565-a witness] “ Well ! Let 's hear what [you]214-lucetta mean ? ”[2908-witness] “ Witness of [my]2908-witness marriage — [Mr. Grower]229-mr. grower was ! ”[2908-witness] “ Marriage ? ”[5565-a witness] “ Yes . With [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae . [O Michael]120-henchard ! [I]120-henchard am already [[his]229-mr. grower wife]380-his wife . [We]5626-we were married this week at [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy . There were reasons against [our]5626-we doing it here . [Mr. Grower]229-mr. grower was [a witness]5565-a witness because [he]229-mr. grower happened to be at [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy at the time . ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard stood as if idiotized . [She]2909-she was so alarmed at [his]120-henchard silence that [she]2909-she murmured something about lending [him]120-henchard sufficient money to tide over the perilous fortnight . “ Married [him]229-mr. grower ? ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard at length . “ [My]2909-she good — what , married [him]229-mr. grower whilst — bound to marry [me]2909-she ? ”[2909-she] “ It was like this , ”[2909-she] [she]2909-she explained , with tears in [her]2909-she eyes and quavers in [her]2909-she voice ; “ do n't — do n't be cruel ! [I]2910-i loved [him]229-mr. grower so much , and [I]2910-i thought [you]120-henchard might tell [him]229-mr. grower of the past — and that grieved [me]2910-i ! And then , when [I]2910-i had promised [you]120-henchard , [I]2910-i learnt of the rumour that [you]120-henchard had — sold [[your]120-henchard first wife]5628-your first wife at a fair like a horse or cow ! How could [I]2910-i keep [my]2910-i promise after hearing that ? [I]2910-i could not risk [myself]2910-i in [your]120-henchard hands ; it would have been letting [myself]2910-i down to take [your]120-henchard name after such a scandal . But [I]2910-i knew [I]2910-i should lose [Donald]139-farfrae if [I]2910-i did not secure [him]229-mr. grower at once — for [you]120-henchard would carry out [your]120-henchard threat of telling [him]229-mr. grower of [[our]5629-our former acquaintance]5630-our former acquaintance , as long as there was a chance of keeping [me]2910-i for [yourself]120-henchard by doing so . But [you]120-henchard will not do so now , will [you]120-henchard , [Michael]120-henchard ? for it is too late to separate [us]5629-our . ”[2910-i] The notes of [St. Peter]230-peter 's bells in full peal had been wafted to them while [he]2910-i spoke , and now the genial thumping of the town band , renowned for its unstinted use of the drum - stick , throbbed down [the street]797-the street . “ Then this racket [they]5631-they are making is on account of it , [I]2910-i suppose ? ”[2910-i] said [he]2910-i . “ Yes — [I]2909-she think [he]229-mr. grower has told [them]5631-they , or else [Mr. Grower]229-mr. grower has .... May [I]2909-she leave [you]120-henchard now ? [My]2909-she — [he]229-mr. grower was detained at [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy to - day , and sent [me]2909-she on a few hours before [him]229-mr. grower . ”[2909-she] “ Then it is [[HIS]229-mr. grower WIFE]380-his wife 'S life [I]2910-i have saved this afternoon . ”[2910-i] “ Yes — and [he]229-mr. grower will be for ever grateful to [you]2910-i . ”[120-henchard] “ [I]120-henchard am much obliged to [him]229-mr. grower .... O [[you]2910-i false woman]5633-you false woman ! ”[120-henchard] burst from [Henchard]120-henchard . “ [You]2910-i promised [me]2910-i ! ”[2910-i] “ Yes , yes ! But it was under compulsion , and [I]120-henchard did not know all [your]2910-i past — — ”[120-henchard] “ And now [I]120-henchard 've a mind to punish [you]2910-i as [you]2910-i deserve ! One word to [this bran - new husband of how [you]2910-i courted [me]120-henchard]5634-this bran - new husband of how you courted me , and [your]2910-i precious happiness is blown to atoms ! ”[120-henchard] “ [Michael]120-henchard — pity [me]2910-i , and be generous ! ”[2910-i] “ [You]2910-i do n't deserve pity ! [You]2910-i did ; but [you]2910-i do n't now . ”[120-henchard] “ [I]2912-i 'll help [you]2910-i to pay off [your]2910-i debt . ”[2912-i] “ [A pensioner of [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's wife]5636-farfrae 's wife]5635-a pensioner of farfrae 's wife — not [I]214-lucetta ! Do n't stay with [me]214-lucetta longer — [I]214-lucetta shall say something worse . Go [home]675-home ! ”[214-lucetta] [She]2912-i disappeared under the trees of [the south walk]2629-the south walk as [the band]849-the band came round the corner , awaking the echoes of every stock and stone in celebration of [her]2912-i happiness . [Lucetta]214-lucetta took no heed , but ran up [the back street]5541-the back street and reached [[her]214-lucetta own home]2916-her own home unperceived .

[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's words to [[his]2917-his landlady]2918-his landlady had referred to the removal of [his]2917-his boxes and other effects from [[his]2917-his late lodgings]2919-his late lodgings to [[Lucetta]214-lucetta 's house]2450-lucetta 's house . The work was not heavy , but it had been much hindered on account of the frequent pauses necessitated by exclamations of surprise at the event , of which [the good woman]2921-the good woman had been briefly informed by letter a few hours earlier . At the last moment of leaving [Port - Bredy]70-port - bredy , [Farfrae]139-farfrae , like [John Gilpin]231-john gilpin , had been detained by [important customers]2922-important customers , whom , even in the exceptional circumstances , [he]2917-his was not the man to neglect . Moreover , there was a convenience in [Lucetta]214-lucetta arriving first at [[her]214-lucetta house]5218-her house . [Nobody there]2924-nobody there as yet knew what had happened ; and [she]214-lucetta was best in a position to break the news to [the inmates]1700-the inmates , and give directions for [[[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband 's accommodation]2927-her husband 's accommodation . [He]387-her husband had , therefore , sent on [[his]387-her husband two - days ' bride]2928-his two - days ' bride in a hired brougham , whilst [he]387-her husband went across [the country]633-the country to [a certain group of wheat and barley ricks a few miles off]2930-a certain group of wheat and barley ricks a few miles off , telling [her]214-lucetta the hour at which [he]387-her husband might be expected the same evening . This accounted for [her]214-lucetta trotting out to meet [him]387-her husband after [their]2931-their separation of four hours . By a strenuous effort , after leaving [Henchard]120-henchard [she]214-lucetta calmed [herself]214-lucetta in readiness to receive [Donald]139-farfrae at [High - Place Hall]58-high - place hall when [he]387-her husband came on from [[his]387-her husband lodgings]1455-his lodgings . One supreme fact empowered [her]214-lucetta to this , the sense that , come what would , [she]214-lucetta had secured [him]387-her husband . Half - an - hour after [her]214-lucetta arrival [he]387-her husband walked in , and [she]214-lucetta met [him]387-her husband with a relieved gladness , which a month 's perilous absence could not have intensified . “ There is one thing [I]214-lucetta have not done ; and yet it is important , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta said earnestly , when [she]214-lucetta had finished talking about the adventure with [the bull]2933-the bull . “ That is , broken the news of [our]5638-our marriage to [[my]387-her husband dear]4489-my dear [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . ”[387-her husband] “ Ah , and [you]214-lucetta have not ? ”[387-her husband] [he]387-her husband said thoughtfully . “ [I]214-lucetta gave [her]191-henchard a lift from [the barn]2072-the barn homewards ; but [I]214-lucetta did not tell [her]191-henchard either ; for [I]214-lucetta thought [she]191-henchard might have heard of it in [the town]632-the town , and was keeping back [her]191-henchard congratulations from shyness , and all that . ”[214-lucetta] “ [She]191-henchard can hardly have heard of it . But [I]387-her husband 'll find out ; [I]387-her husband 'll go to [her]191-henchard now . And , [Donald]139-farfrae , [you]139-farfrae do n't mind [her]191-henchard living on with [me]387-her husband just the same as before ? [She]191-henchard is so quiet and unassuming . ”[387-her husband] “ O no , indeed [I]139-farfrae do n't , ”[139-farfrae] [Farfrae]139-farfrae answered with , perhaps , a faint awkwardness . “ But [I]214-lucetta wonder if [she]191-henchard would care to ? ”[214-lucetta] “ O yes ! ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta eagerly . “ [I]2935-he am sure [she]191-henchard would like to . Besides , poor thing , [she]191-henchard has no other [home]675-home . ”[2935-he] [Farfrae]139-farfrae looked at [her]214-lucetta and saw that [she]214-lucetta did not suspect the secret of [[her]214-lucetta more reserved friend]2934-her more reserved friend . [He]2935-he liked [her]214-lucetta all the better for the blindness . “ Arrange as [you]214-lucetta like with [her]191-henchard by all means , ”[2935-he] [he]2935-he said . “ It is [I]214-lucetta who have come to [[your]214-lucetta house]5643-your house , not [you]214-lucetta to [mine]214-lucetta . ”[214-lucetta] “ [I]214-lucetta 'll run and speak to [her]191-henchard , ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . When [she]214-lucetta got [upstairs]1000-upstairs to [[Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's room]1578-elizabeth - jane 's room [the latter]4511-the latter had taken off [her]4511-the latter out - door things , and was resting over a book . [Lucetta]214-lucetta found in a moment that [she]214-lucetta had not yet learnt the news . “ [I]214-lucetta did not come down to [you]214-lucetta , [Miss Templeman]203-miss templeman , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta said simply . “ [I]214-lucetta was coming to ask if [you]214-lucetta had quite recovered from [your]214-lucetta fright , but [I]214-lucetta found [you]214-lucetta had [a visitor]5644-a visitor . [Somebody]4446-somebody must be married ; or else [they]4446-somebody are practising for Christmas . ”[214-lucetta] [Lucetta]214-lucetta uttered a vague “ Yes , ”[214-lucetta] and seating [herself]214-lucetta by [the other young woman]2939-the other young woman looked musingly at [her]214-lucetta . “ What [a lonely creature]5647-a lonely creature [you]214-lucetta are , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta presently said ; “ never knowing what 's going on , or what [people]1161-people are talking about everywhere with keen interest . [You]214-lucetta should get out , and gossip about as [other women]5649-other women do , and then [you]214-lucetta would n't be obliged to ask [me]214-lucetta a question of that kind . ' ”[214-lucetta] “ O no ; [she]5652-your friend did n't follow evil exactly ! ”[191-henchard] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta hastily . “ But [you]214-lucetta said that [she]5652-your friend — or as [I]191-henchard may say [you]214-lucetta ”[191-henchard] — answered [Elizabeth]191-henchard , dropping the mask , “ were in honour and conscience bound to marry [the first]5656-the first ? ”[214-lucetta] [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's blush at being seen through came and went again before [she]214-lucetta replied anxiously , “ [You]214-lucetta will never breathe this , will [you]214-lucetta , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard ? ”[214-lucetta] “ Certainly not , if [you]214-lucetta say not . “[2948-the other woman] Then [I]0-i will tell [you]2940-you that the case is more complicated — worse , in fact — than it seemed in [my]0-i story . [I]0-i and [the first man]5379-the first man were thrown together in a strange way , and felt that [we]2942-we ought to be united , as [the world]4424-the world had talked of [us]2942-we . Not on account of [[her]214-lucetta friend]2164-her friend [Elizabeth]191-henchard did [she]214-lucetta feel it : for of the bearings of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's emotions [she]214-lucetta had not the least suspicion ; but on [Henchard]191-henchard 's alone . Now the instant decision of [[Susan Henchard]122-henchard 's daughter]2549-susan henchard 's daughter was to dwell in [that house]5668-that house no more . It was still early in the evening when [she]214-lucetta hastily put on [her]214-lucetta things and went out . In a few minutes , knowing the ground , [she]214-lucetta had found [a suitable lodging]5671-a suitable lodging , and arranged to enter [it]5671-a suitable lodging that night . Returning and entering noiselessly [she]214-lucetta took off [her]214-lucetta pretty dress and arrayed [herself]214-lucetta in a plain one , packing up the other to keep as [her]214-lucetta best ; for [she]214-lucetta would have to be very economical now . [She]214-lucetta wrote a note to leave for [Lucetta]214-lucetta , who was closely shut up in [the drawing - room]5672-the drawing - room with [Farfrae]139-farfrae ; and then [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard called [a man with a wheel - barrow]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow ; and seeing [her]191-henchard boxes put into it [she]214-lucetta trotted off down [the street]797-the street to [[her]191-henchard rooms]2478-her rooms . [They]2478-her rooms were in [the street in which [Henchard]191-henchard lived]5676-the street in which henchard lived , and almost opposite [his]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow door . Here [she]214-lucetta sat down and considered the means of subsistence . The little annual sum settled on [her]214-lucetta by [[her]214-lucetta stepfather]5242-her stepfather would keep body and soul together . A wonderful skill in netting of all sorts — acquired in childhood by making seines in [[Newson]128-henchard 's home]5678-newson 's home — might serve [her]214-lucetta in good stead ; and [her]214-lucetta studies , which were pursued unremittingly , might serve [her]214-lucetta in still better . By this time the marriage that had taken place was known throughout [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge ; had been discussed noisily on kerbstones , confidentially behind counters , and jovially at [the Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners . Whether [Farfrae]139-farfrae would sell [his]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow business and set up for [a gentleman]4562-a gentleman on [[his]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow wife]380-his wife 's money , or whether [he]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow would show independence enough to stick to [his]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow trade in spite of [his]5673-a man with a wheel - barrow brilliant alliance , was a great point of interest .[120-henchard]

The retort of [the furmity - woman before the magistrates]2970-the furmity - woman before the magistrates had spread ; and in four - and - twenty hours there was not [a person in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of [Henchard]128-henchard 's mad]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad freak at [Weydon - Priors Fair]72-weydon - priors fair , long years before . The amends [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad had made in after life were lost sight of in the dramatic glare of the original act . Had the incident been well known of old and always , it might by this time have grown to be lightly regarded as the rather tall wild oat , but well - nigh the single one , of [a young man with whom [the steady and mature ( if somewhat headstrong ) burgher of to - day]2973-the steady and mature ( if somewhat headstrong ) burgher of to - day]2972-a young man with whom the steady and mature ( if somewhat headstrong ) burgher of to - day had scarcely a point in common . But the act having lain as dead and buried ever since , the interspace of years was unperceived ; and the black spot of [his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad youth wore the aspect of a recent crime . Small as the police - court incident had been in itself , it formed the edge or turn in the incline of [Henchard]128-henchard 's fortunes . On that day — almost at that minute — [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad passed the ridge of prosperity and honour , and began to descend rapidly on the other side . It was strange how soon [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad sank in esteem . Socially [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad had received a startling fillip downwards ; and , having already lost commercial buoyancy from rash transactions , the velocity of [his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad descent in both aspects became accelerated every hour . [He]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad now gazed more at the pavements and less at the house - fronts when [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad walked about ; more at the feet and leggings of [men]4432-men , and less into the pupils of [their]4432-men eyes with the blazing regard which formerly had made [them]4432-men blink . New events combined to undo [him]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad . It had been a bad year for [others besides [himself]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad]2975-others besides himself , and the heavy failure of [a debtor whom [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad had trusted]2976-a debtor whom he had trusted generously completed the overthrow of [his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad tottering credit . And now , in [his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad desperation , [he]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad failed to preserve that strict correspondence between bulk and sample which is the soul of commerce in grain . For this , [one of [[his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad men]4575-his men]2977-one of his men was mainly to blame ; that worthy , in [his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad great unwisdom , having picked over the sample of an enormous quantity of second - rate corn which [Henchard]128-henchard had in hand , and removed the pinched , blasted , and smutted grains in great numbers . The produce if honestly offered would have created no scandal ; but the blunder of misrepresentation , coming at such a moment , dragged [Henchard]128-henchard 's name into the ditch . The details of [his]2971-a person in casterbridge who remained unacquainted with the story of henchard 's mad failure were of the ordinary kind . One day [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard was passing [[the King]1084-the king 's Arms]945-the king 's arms , when [she]191-henchard saw [people bustling in and out more than usual where there was no market]2981-people bustling in and out more than usual where there was no market . [A bystander]2982-a bystander informed [her]191-henchard , with some surprise at [her]191-henchard ignorance , that it was a meeting of [the Commissioners under [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard 's bankruptcy]2983-the commissioners under mr. henchard 's bankruptcy . [She]191-henchard felt quite tearful , and when [she]191-henchard heard that [he]120-henchard was present in [the hotel]879-the hotel [she]191-henchard wished to go in and see [him]120-henchard , but was advised not to intrude that day . [The room in which [debtor]2986-debtor and [creditors]2987-creditors had assembled]2985-the room in which debtor and creditors had assembled was a front one , and [Henchard]120-henchard , looking out of the window , had caught sight of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard through the wire blind . [His]120-henchard examination had closed , and [the creditors]2988-the creditors were leaving . The appearance of [Elizabeth]191-henchard threw [him]120-henchard into a reverie , till , turning [his]120-henchard face from the window , and towering above all the rest , [he]120-henchard called [their]2988-the creditors attention for a moment more . [His]120-henchard countenance had somewhat changed from its flush of prosperity ; the black hair and whiskers were the same as ever , but a film of ash was over the rest . “ [Gentlemen]4449-gentlemen , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said , “ over and above the assets that [we]5683-we 've been talking about , and that appear on the balance - sheet , there be these . It all belongs to [ye]4449-gentlemen , as much as everything else [I]120-henchard 've got , and [I]120-henchard do n't wish to keep it from [you]4449-gentlemen , not [I.]120-henchard ”[120-henchard] Saying this , [he]120-henchard took [his]120-henchard gold watch from [his]120-henchard pocket and laid it on the table ; then [his]120-henchard purse — the yellow canvas moneybag , such as was carried by all [farmers]712-farmers and [dealers]2990-dealers — untying it , and shaking the money out upon the table beside the watch . The latter [he]120-henchard drew back quickly for an instant , to remove the hair - guard made and given [him]120-henchard by [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ There , now [you]4449-gentlemen have all [I]120-henchard 've got in [the world]4424-the world , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said . “ And [I]185-everdene wish for [your]4449-gentlemen sakes ' twas more . ”[185-everdene] [The creditors]2988-the creditors , [farmers]712-farmers almost to [a man]4474-a man , looked at the watch , and at the money , and into [the street]797-the street ; when [Farmer James Everdene of Weatherbury]185-everdene spoke . “ No , no , [Henchard]191-henchard , ”[185-everdene] [he]185-everdene said warmly . “ [We]2988-the creditors do n't want that . ' Tis honourable in [ye]191-henchard ; but keep it . [I]3000-his 've proved the balance - sheet to be as honestly made out as it could possibly be ; [we]5686-we have had no trouble ; there have been no evasions and no concealments . The rashness of dealing which led to this unhappy situation is obvious enough ; but as far as [I]3000-his can see every attempt has been made to avoid wronging [anybody]4437-anybody . ”[3000-his] [Henchard]191-henchard was more affected by this than [he]3000-his cared to let [them]3001-they perceive , and [he]3000-his turned aside to the window again . A general murmur of agreement followed [the Commissioner]3002-the commissioner 's words , and the meeting dispersed . When [they]3001-they were gone [Henchard]191-henchard regarded the watch [they]3001-they had returned to [him]3000-his . “ ' Tisn't mine by rights , ”[3000-his] [he]3000-his said to [himself]3000-his . “ Why the devil did n't [they]3001-they take it ? — [I]191-henchard do n't want what do n't belong to [me]191-henchard ! ”[191-henchard] Moved by a recollection [he]3000-his took the watch to [[the maker]3003-the maker 's just opposite]3004-the maker 's just opposite , sold it there and then for what [the tradesman]3005-the tradesman offered , and went with the proceeds to [one among the smaller of [[his]3000-his creditors]3007-his creditors , [a cottager of [Durnover]15-durnover]3008-a cottager of durnover in straitened circumstances , to whom [he]3000-his handed the money]3006-one among the smaller of his creditors , a cottager of durnover in straitened circumstances , to whom he handed the money . When everything was ticketed that [Henchard]191-henchard had owned , and the auctions were in progress , there was quite a sympathetic reaction in [the town]632-the town , which till then for some time past had done nothing but condemn [him]3000-his . Now that [Henchard]191-henchard 's whole career was pictured distinctly to [[his]3000-his neighbours]2614-his neighbours , and [they]2614-his neighbours could see how admirably [he]3000-his had used [his]3000-his one talent of energy to create a position of affluence out of absolutely nothing — which was really all [he]3000-his could show when [he]3000-his came to [the town]632-the town as [a journeyman hay - trusser]3012-a journeyman hay - trusser , with [his]3000-his wimble and knife in [his]3000-his basket — [they]2614-his neighbours wondered and regretted [his]3000-his fall . Try as [she]3013-she might , [Elizabeth]191-henchard could never meet with [him]3000-his . [She]191-henchard believed in [him]3000-his still , though [nobody else]4836-nobody else did ; and [she]191-henchard wanted to be allowed to forgive [him]3000-his for [his]3000-his roughness to [her]191-henchard , and to help [him]3000-his in [his]3000-his trouble . [She]191-henchard wrote to [him]3000-his ; [he]3000-his did not reply . [She]191-henchard then went to [[his]3000-his house]1329-his house — [the great house [she]191-henchard had lived in so happily for a time — with [its]3016-the great house she had lived in so happily for a time — with its front of dun brick , vitrified here and there and its heavy sash - bars front of dun brick , vitrified here and there and [its]3016-the great house she had lived in so happily for a time — with its front of dun brick , vitrified here and there and its heavy sash - bars heavy sash - bars]3016-the great house she had lived in so happily for a time — with its front of dun brick , vitrified here and there and its heavy sash - bars — but [Henchard]191-henchard was to be found there no more . [The ex - Mayor]3017-the ex - mayor had left [the home of [[his]3000-his prosperity]3019-his prosperity]3018-the home of his prosperity , and gone into [[Jopp]137-jopp 's cottage]3020-jopp 's cottage by [the Priory Mill]3021-the priory mill — [the sad purlieu to which [he]3000-his had wandered on the night of [his]3000-his discovery]3022-the sad purlieu to which he had wandered on the night of his discovery that [she]191-henchard was not [[his]3000-his daughter]2039-his daughter . Thither [she]191-henchard went . [Elizabeth]191-henchard thought it odd that [he]3000-his had fixed on [this spot]1420-this spot to retire to , but assumed that necessity had no choice . Trees which seemed old enough to have been planted by [the friars]3025-the friars still stood around , and the back hatch of [the original mill]3026-the original mill yet formed a cascade which had raised its terrific roar for centuries . [The cottage]5487-the cottage itself was built of old stones from [the long dismantled Priory]3028-the long dismantled priory , scraps of tracery , moulded window - jambs , and arch - labels , being mixed in with the rubble of the walls . In [this cottage]3029-this cottage [he]3000-his occupied [a couple of rooms]3030-a couple of rooms , [Jopp]137-jopp , whom [Henchard]191-henchard had employed , abused , cajoled , and dismissed by turns , being [the householder]5505-the householder . But even here [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather could not be seen . “ Not by [[his]3000-his daughter]2039-his daughter ? ”[191-henchard] pleaded [Elizabeth]191-henchard . “ By [nobody]298-nobody — at present : that 's [his]3000-his order , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard was informed . Afterwards [she]191-henchard was passing by [the corn - stores]3033-the corn - stores and [hay - barns]1279-hay - barns which had been the headquarters of [[his]3000-his business]1861-his business . [She]191-henchard knew that [he]3000-his ruled [there]447-there no longer ; but it was with amazement that [she]191-henchard regarded [the familiar gateway]3037-the familiar gateway . A smear of decisive lead - coloured paint had been laid on to obliterate [Henchard]191-henchard 's name , though its letters dimly loomed through like ships in a fog . Over these , in fresh white , spread the name of [Farfrae]139-farfrae . [Abel Whittle]171-whittle was edging [his]171-whittle skeleton in at the wicket , and [she]191-henchard said , “ [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae is [master]5003-master [here]4417-here ? ”[3000-his] “ Yaas , [Miss Henchet]234-miss henchet , ”[3000-his] [he]3000-his said , “ [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae have bought the concern and [all of [we]5693-we work - folk]5692-all of we work - folk with it ; and ' tis better for [us]5693-we than ' twas — though [I]3068-persons who were what is called “ out of a situation ” from fault or lucklessness should n't say that to [you]234-miss henchet as [a daughter - law]5694-a daughter - law . [We]5693-we work harder , but [we]5693-we bain't made afeard now . It was fear made [my]3068-persons who were what is called “ out of a situation ” from fault or lucklessness few poor hairs so thin ! No busting out , no slamming of doors , no meddling with [yer]234-miss henchet eternal soul and all that ; and though ' tis a shilling a week less [I]3068-persons who were what is called “ out of a situation ” from fault or lucklessness 'm [the richer man]5695-the richer man ; for what 's all [the world]4424-the world if [yer]234-miss henchet mind is always in a larry , [Miss Henchet]234-miss henchet ? ”[3068-persons who were what is called “ out of a situation ” from fault or lucklessness] The intelligence was in a general sense true ; and [[Henchard]191-henchard 's stores]1895-henchard 's stores , which had remained in a paralyzed condition during the settlement of [his]3000-his bankruptcy , were stirred into activity again when [the new tenant]3039-the new tenant had possession . Thenceforward the full sacks , looped with the shining chain , went scurrying up and down under the cat - head , hairy arms were thrust out from the different door - ways , and the grain was hauled in ; trusses of hay were tossed anew in and out of [the barns]3040-the barns , and the wimbles creaked ; while the scales and steel - yards began to be busy where guess - work had formerly been the rule .

[Two bridges]3041-two bridges stood near [the lower part of [Casterbridge town]2694-casterbridge town]3042-the lower part of casterbridge town . [The first , of weather - stained brick]3044-the first , of weather - stained brick , was immediately at the end of [High Street]27-high street , where a diverging branch from [that thoroughfare]3045-that thoroughfare ran round to [the low - lying Durnover lanes]3046-the low - lying durnover lanes ; so that [the precincts of the bridge]3047-the precincts of the bridge formed the merging point of respectability and indigence . [The second bridge , of stone]3048-the second bridge , of stone , was further out on [the highway]301-the highway — in fact , fairly in [the meadows]3050-the meadows , though still within [the town]632-the town boundary . [These bridges]3052-these bridges had speaking countenances . Every projection in each was worn down to obtuseness , partly by weather , more by friction from generations of [loungers , whose toes and heels had from year to year made restless movements against these parapets]3053-loungers , whose toes and heels had from year to year made restless movements against these parapets , as [they]3053-loungers , whose toes and heels had from year to year made restless movements against these parapets had stood there meditating on the aspect of affairs . In the case of the more friable bricks and stones even the flat faces were worn into hollows by the same mixed mechanism . The masonry of the top was clamped with iron at each joint ; since it had been no uncommon thing for [desperate men]3054-desperate men to wrench the coping off and throw it down [the river]1757-the river , in reckless defiance of [the magistrates]5583-the magistrates . For to this pair of bridges gravitated all the failures of [the town]632-the town ; [those who had failed in business]3058-those who had failed in business , in love , in sobriety , in crime . Why [the unhappy hereabout]3059-the unhappy hereabout usually chose [the bridges]3060-the bridges for [their]3059-the unhappy hereabout meditations in preference to a railing , a gate , or a stile , was not so clear . There was a marked difference of quality between [the personages who haunted the near bridge of brick]3061-the personages who haunted the near bridge of brick and [the personages who haunted the far one of stone]3062-the personages who haunted the far one of stone . [Those of lowest character]3063-those of lowest character preferred the former , adjoining [the town]632-the town ; [they]3063-those of lowest character did not mind the glare of the public eye . [They]3063-those of lowest character had been of comparatively no account during [their]3063-those of lowest character successes ; and though [they]3063-those of lowest character might feel dispirited , [they]3063-those of lowest character had no particular sense of shame in [their]3063-those of lowest character ruin . [Their]3063-those of lowest character hands were mostly kept in [their]3063-those of lowest character pockets ; [they]3063-those of lowest character wore a leather strap round [their]3063-those of lowest character hips or knees , and boots that required a great deal of lacing , but seemed never to get any . Instead of sighing at [their]3063-those of lowest character adversities [they]3063-those of lowest character spat , and instead of saying the iron had entered into [their]3063-those of lowest character souls [they]3063-those of lowest character said [they]3063-those of lowest character were down on [their]3063-those of lowest character luck . [Jopp]137-jopp in [his]137-jopp time of distress had often stood [here]4417-here ; so had [Mother Cuxsom]145-mother cuxsom , [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney , and poor [Abel Whittle]171-whittle . [The miserables who would pause on the remoter bridge]3066-the miserables who would pause on the remoter bridge were of a politer stamp . [They]3066-the miserables who would pause on the remoter bridge included [bankrupts]3067-bankrupts , hypochondriacs , [persons who were what is called “ out of a situation ”[137-jopp] from fault or lucklessness]3068-persons who were what is called “ out of a situation ” from fault or lucklessness , the inefficient of [the professional class]3069-the professional class — [shabby - genteel men , who did not know how to get rid of the weary time between breakfast and dinner , and the yet more weary time between dinner and dark]3070-shabby - genteel men , who did not know how to get rid of the weary time between breakfast and dinner , and the yet more weary time between dinner and dark . The eye of [this species]3071-this species were mostly directed over the parapet upon the running water below . [A man seen there looking thus fixedly into]3072-a man seen there looking thus fixedly into [the river]1757-the river was pretty sure to be one whom [the world]4424-the world did not treat kindly for some reason or other . While [one in straits on [the townward bridge]3076-the townward bridge]3075-one in straits on the townward bridge did not mind who saw [him]3075-one in straits on the townward bridge so , and kept [his]3075-one in straits on the townward bridge back to the parapet to survey [the passers - by]3077-the passers - by , one in [straits on this]3078-straits on this never faced [the road]320-the road , never turned [his]3075-one in straits on the townward bridge head at coming footsteps , but , sensitive to [his]3075-one in straits on the townward bridge own condition , watched the current whenever [a stranger]4470-a stranger approached , as if some strange fish interested [him]3075-one in straits on the townward bridge , though every finned thing had been poached out of [the river]1757-the river years before . There and thus [they]3082-they would muse ; if [their]3082-they grief were the grief of oppression [they]3082-they would wish [themselves]3082-they kings ; if [their]3082-they grief were poverty , wish [themselves]3082-they [millionaires]3083-millionaires ; if sin , [they]3082-they would wish [they]3082-they were [saints]3084-saints or [angels]3085-angels ; if despised love , that [they]3082-they were [some much - courted Adonis of county fame]3086-some much - courted adonis of county fame . [Some]895-some had been known to stand and think so long with this fixed gaze downward that eventually [they]895-some had allowed [their]895-some poor carcases to follow that gaze ; and [they]895-some were discovered the next morning out of reach of [their]895-some troubles , either here or in [the deep pool called Blackwater]3088-the deep pool called blackwater , a little higher up [the river]1757-the river . To [this bridge]3090-this bridge came [Henchard]191-henchard , as [other unfortunates]3091-other unfortunates had come before [him]3092-him , [his]3092-him way thither being by the riverside path on [the chilly edge of [the town]632-the town]3093-the chilly edge of the town . Here [he]3092-him was standing one windy afternoon when [Durnover church]15-durnover clock struck five . While the gusts were bringing the notes to [his]3092-him ears across [the damp intervening flat]3095-the damp intervening flat [a man]4474-a man passed behind [him]3092-him and greeted [Henchard]191-henchard by name . [Henchard]191-henchard turned slightly and saw that the corner was [Jopp]137-jopp , [[his]3092-him old foreman]3097-his old foreman , now employed elsewhere , to whom , though [he]3092-him hated [him]137-jopp , [he]3092-him had gone for lodgings because [Jopp]137-jopp was [the one man in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge whose observation and opinion [the fallen corn - merchant]3099-the fallen corn - merchant]3098-the one man in casterbridge whose observation and opinion the fallen corn - merchant despised to the point of indifference . [Henchard]191-henchard returned [him]3092-him a scarcely perceptible nod , and [Jopp]137-jopp stopped . “ [He]3099-the fallen corn - merchant and [she]5697-she are gone into [[their]5698-their new house]5699-their new house to - day , ”[191-henchard] said [Jopp]137-jopp . “ Oh , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard absently . “ Which house is that ? ”[191-henchard] “ [[Your]191-henchard old one]5700-your old one . ”[191-henchard] “ Gone into [[my]191-henchard house]4643-my house ? ”[191-henchard] And starting up [Henchard]191-henchard added , “ [[MY]3100-my house of all others in [the town]632-the town]5702-my house of all others in the town ! ”[3100-my] “ Well , as [somebody]4446-somebody was sure to live [there]447-there , and [you]191-henchard could n't , it can do ' [ee]5706-ee no harm that [he]4446-somebody 's [the man]291-the man . ”[137-jopp] It was quite true : [he]3100-my felt that it was doing [him]3100-my no harm . [Farfrae]149-farfrae , who had already taken [the yards]3101-the yards and [stores]3102-stores , had acquired possession of [the house]782-the house for the obvious convenience of its contiguity . And yet this act of [his]149-farfrae taking up residence within [those roomy chambers]3104-those roomy chambers while [he]149-farfrae , [[their]3105-their former tenant]3106-their former tenant , lived in [a cottage]4825-a cottage , galled [Henchard]191-henchard indescribably . [Jopp]137-jopp continued : “ And [you]191-henchard heard of [that fellow who bought all the best furniture at [your]191-henchard sale]5708-that fellow who bought all the best furniture at your sale ? [He]5708-that fellow who bought all the best furniture at your sale was bidding for no other than [Farfrae]149-farfrae all the while ! It has never been moved out of [the house]782-the house , as [he]5708-that fellow who bought all the best furniture at your sale 'd already got the lease . ”[137-jopp] “ [My]137-jopp furniture too ! Surely [he]5708-that fellow who bought all the best furniture at your sale 'll buy [my]137-jopp body and soul likewise ! ”[137-jopp] “ There 's no saying [he]5708-that fellow who bought all the best furniture at your sale wo n't , if [you]191-henchard be willing to sell . ”[149-farfrae] And having planted these wounds in the heart of [[his]137-jopp once imperious master]3108-his once imperious master [Jopp]137-jopp went on [his]137-jopp way ; while [Henchard]191-henchard stared and stared into [the racing river]3109-the racing river till [the bridge]3110-the bridge seemed moving backward with [him]137-jopp . [The low land]3111-the low land grew blacker , and the sky a deeper grey , When the landscape looked like a picture blotted in with ink , [another traveller]3112-another traveller approached [the great stone bridge]3113-the great stone bridge . [He]3112-another traveller was driving [a gig]3114-a gig , [his]3112-another traveller direction being also townwards . On the round of the middle of the arch the gig stopped . “ [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard ? ”[149-farfrae] came from it in the voice of [Farfrae]149-farfrae . [Henchard]120-henchard turned [his]120-henchard face . Finding that [he]120-henchard had guessed rightly [Farfrae]149-farfrae told [the man who accompanied [him]120-henchard to drive [home]675-home]3115-the man who accompanied him to drive home ; while [he]149-farfrae alighted and went up to [[his]149-farfrae former friend]1896-his former friend . “ [I]149-farfrae have heard that [you]120-henchard think of emigrating , [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard ? ”[149-farfrae] [he]149-farfrae said . “ Is it true ? [I]120-henchard have a real reason for asking . ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard withheld [his]120-henchard answer for several instants , and then said , “ Yes ; it is true . ' Tis turn and turn about , is n't it ! Do [ye]120-henchard mind how [we]5711-we stood like this in [the Chalk Walk]74-the chalk walk when [I]149-farfrae persuaded ' [ee]120-henchard to stay ? [You]120-henchard then stood without a chattel to [your]120-henchard name , and [I]149-farfrae was [the master of [the house in [Corn Street]75-corn street]5713-the house in corn street]5712-the master of the house in corn street . It 's the way o ' the warrld , ”[120-henchard] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae . “ Ha , ha , true ! ”[120-henchard] cried [Henchard]120-henchard , throwing [himself]120-henchard into a mood of jocularity . “ Up and down ! [I]149-farfrae 'm used to it . What 's the odds after all ! ”[149-farfrae] “ Now listen to [me]149-farfrae , if it 's no taking up [your]120-henchard time , ”[149-farfrae] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae , “ just as [I]120-henchard listened to [you]120-henchard . Do n't go . Stay at [home]675-home . ”[120-henchard] “ But [I]120-henchard can do nothing else , [man]488-man ! ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard scornfully . “ The little money [I]120-henchard have will just keep body and soul together for a few weeks , and no more . [I]120-henchard have not felt inclined to go back to journey - work yet ; but [I]120-henchard ca n't stay doing nothing , and [my]120-henchard best chance is elsewhere . ”[120-henchard] “ No ; but what [I]120-henchard propose is this — if [ye]120-henchard will listen . [We]5719-we can spare [some rooms]5720-some rooms very well — [I]120-henchard am sure [[my]120-henchard wife]4821-my wife would not mind it at all — until there 's an opening for [ye]120-henchard . ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard started . Probably the picture drawn by [the unsuspecting Donald of [himself]120-henchard under the same roof with [Lucetta]214-lucetta]3118-the unsuspecting donald of himself under the same roof with lucetta was too striking to be received with equanimity . “ No , no , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said gruffly ; “ [we]5719-we should quarrel . ”[149-farfrae] “ [You]120-henchard should hae a part to [yourself]120-henchard , ”[149-farfrae] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae ; “ and [nobody]298-nobody to interfere wi ' [you]120-henchard . [I]0-i bought a good deal of [your]3124-your furniture . “[0-i] So [I]0-i have heard . ” “[2988-the creditors] Well , it was no that [I]0-i wanted it so very much for [myself]0-i ; but [I]0-i wish [ye]3124-your to pick out all that [you]3124-your care to have — such things as may be endeared to [ye]3124-your by [associations]3125-associations , or particularly suited to [your]3124-your use . And take [them]3126-them to [[your]3124-your own house]3127-your own house — it will not be depriving [me]0-i , [we]3119-they can do with less very well , and [I]0-i will have plenty of opportunities of getting more . ” “[2988-the creditors] What — give it to [me]0-i for nothing ? ” said [Henchard]120-henchard . “[3124-your] But [you]3124-your paid [the creditors]2988-the creditors for it ! ” “[0-i] Ah , yes ; but maybe it 's worth more to [you]3124-your than it is to [me]0-i . ” [Henchard]120-henchard was a little moved . “[0-i] [I]0-i — sometimes think [I]0-i 've wronged ' [ee]3129-ee ! ” [he]0-i said , in tones which showed the disquietude that the night shades hid in [his]0-i face . [He]0-i shook [Farfrae]149-farfrae abruptly by the hand , and hastened away as if unwilling to betray [himself]0-i further . [Farfrae]149-farfrae saw [him]0-i turn through [the thoroughfare]2763-the thoroughfare into [Bull Stake]68-bull stake and vanish down towards [the Priory Mill]76-the priory mill . Meanwhile [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , in [an upper room no larger than [[the Prophet]5478-the prophet 's chamber]5727-the prophet 's chamber]5725-an upper room no larger than the prophet 's chamber , and with the silk attire of [her]191-henchard palmy days packed away in a box , was netting with great industry between the hours which [she]191-henchard devoted to studying such books as [she]191-henchard could get hold of . [[Her]191-henchard lodgings]5728-her lodgings being nearly opposite [[[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather 's former residence]5730-her stepfather 's former residence , now [[Farfrae]149-farfrae 's]5731-farfrae 's , [she]191-henchard could see [Donald]139-farfrae and [Lucetta]214-lucetta speeding in and out of [their]5732-their door with all the bounding enthusiasm of [their]5732-their situation . [She]191-henchard avoided looking that way as much as possible , but it was hardly in human nature to keep the eyes averted when the door slammed . While living on thus quietly [she]191-henchard heard the news that [Henchard]191-henchard had caught cold and was confined to [[his]149-farfrae room]1135-his room — possibly a result of standing about the meads in damp weather . [She]191-henchard went off to [[his]149-farfrae house]1329-his house at once . This time [she]191-henchard was determined not to be denied admittance , and made [her]191-henchard way [upstairs]1000-upstairs . [He]149-farfrae was sitting up in the bed with a greatcoat round [him]149-farfrae , and at first resented [her]191-henchard intrusion . “[0-i] Go away — go away , ” [he]149-farfrae said . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't like to see [']3130-' [ee]3130-' ! ” “[4491-father] But , [father]4491-father — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't like to see ' ee , ” [he]149-farfrae repeated . However , the ice was broken , and [she]191-henchard remained . [She]191-henchard made [the room]985-the room more comfortable , gave directions to [the people below]5737-the people below , and by the time [she]191-henchard went away had reconciled [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather to [her]191-henchard visiting [him]149-farfrae . The effect , either of [her]191-henchard ministrations or of [her]191-henchard mere presence , was a rapid recovery . [He]149-farfrae soon was well enough to go out ; and now things seemed to wear a new colour in [his]149-farfrae eyes . [He]149-farfrae no longer thought of emigration , and thought more of [Elizabeth]191-henchard . The having nothing to do made [him]149-farfrae more dreary than any other circumstance ; and one day , with better views of [Farfrae]139-farfrae than [he]149-farfrae had held for some time , and a sense that honest work was not a thing to be ashamed of , [he]149-farfrae stoically went down to [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's yard]5739-farfrae 's yard and asked to be taken on as [a journeyman hay - trusser]3012-a journeyman hay - trusser . [He]149-farfrae was engaged at once . This hiring of [Henchard]191-henchard was done through [a foreman]2588-a foreman , [Farfrae]139-farfrae feeling that it was undesirable to come personally in contact with [the ex - corn - factor]5742-the ex - corn - factor more than was absolutely necessary .
