While anxious to help [him]149-farfrae [he]149-farfrae was well aware by this time of [his]149-farfrae uncertain temper , and thought reserved relations best . For the same reason [his]149-farfrae orders to [Henchard]191-henchard to proceed to this and [that country farm]5743-that country farm trussing in the usual way were always given through [a third person]5386-a third person . For a time these arrangements worked well , it being the custom to truss in [the respective stack - yards]5745-the respective stack - yards , before bringing it away , the hay bought at [the different farms about [the neighbourhood]1758-the neighbourhood]5746-the different farms about the neighbourhood ; so that [Henchard]191-henchard was often absent at such places the whole week long . When this was all done , and [Henchard]191-henchard had become in a measure broken in , [he]149-farfrae came to work daily on [the home premises]5748-the home premises like [the rest]494-the rest . And thus [the once flourishing merchant]5750-the once flourishing merchant and [Mayor]1548-mayor and what not stood as [a day - labourer in [the barns and [granaries]5754-granaries [he]149-farfrae formerly had owned]5753-the barns and granaries he formerly had owned]5752-a day - labourer in the barns and granaries he formerly had owned . “[0-i] [I]0-i have worked as [a journeyman]3132-a journeyman before now , ha'n't [I]0-i ? ” [he]0-i would say in [his]0-i defiant way ; “[3133-she] and why should n't [I]0-i do it again ? ” But [he]0-i looked [a far different journeyman from the one [he]0-i had been in [his]0-i earlier days]5755-a far different journeyman from the one he had been in his earlier days . Then [he]0-i had worn clean , suitable clothes , light and cheerful in hue ; leggings yellow as marigolds , corduroys immaculate as new flax , and a neckerchief like a flower - garden . Now [he]0-i wore the remains of an old blue cloth suit of [his]0-i gentlemanly times , a rusty silk hat , and a once black satin stock , soiled and shabby . Clad thus [he]0-i went to and fro , still comparatively [an active man]5756-an active man — for [he]0-i was not much over forty — and saw with [the other men in [the yard]1277-the yard]5757-the other men in the yard [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae going in and out the green door that led to [the garden]1272-the garden , and [the big house]5760-the big house , and [Lucetta]214-lucetta . At the beginning of the winter it was rumoured about [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge that [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae , already in [the Town Council]77-the town council , was to be proposed for [Mayor]1548-mayor in a year or two . “[3133-she] Yes , [she]3133-she was wise , [she]3133-she was wise in [[her]3133-she generation]3134-her generation ! ” said [Henchard]191-henchard to [himself]191-henchard when [he]0-i heard of this one day on [his]0-i way to [[Farfrae]149-farfrae 's hay - barn]5762-farfrae 's hay - barn . [He]0-i thought it over as [he]0-i wimbled [his]0-i bonds , and the piece of news acted as a reviviscent breath to that old view of [his]0-i — of [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae as [[his]0-i triumphant rival who rode rough - shod over [him]0-i]5763-his triumphant rival who rode rough - shod over him . “[1548-mayor] [A fellow of [his]3135-a fellow of his age age]3135-a fellow of his age going to be [Mayor]1548-mayor , indeed ! ” [he]0-i murmured with a corner - drawn smile on [his]0-i mouth . “[3135-a fellow of his age] But ' tis [her]3135-a fellow of his age money that floats en upward . Ha - ha — how cust odd it is ! Here be [I]0-i , [[his]3135-a fellow of his age former master]3137-his former master , working for [him]3135-a fellow of his age as [man]488-man , and [he]3135-a fellow of his age [the man standing as [master]5003-master , with [[my]0-i house]4643-my house and [my]0-i furniture and [[my]0-i what - [you]3143-you - may - call wife]3142-my what - you - may - call wife all [his]3135-a fellow of his age own]3139-the man standing as master , with my house and my furniture and my what - you - may - call wife all his own . ” [He]0-i repeated these things a hundred times a day . During the whole period of [his]0-i acquaintance with [Lucetta]214-lucetta [he]0-i had never wished to claim [her]214-lucetta as [his]0-i own so desperately as [he]0-i now regretted [her]214-lucetta loss . It was no mercenary hankering after [her]214-lucetta fortune that moved [him]0-i , though that fortune had been the means of making [her]214-lucetta so much the more desired by giving [her]214-lucetta the air of independence and sauciness which attracts [men of [his]0-i composition]5764-men of his composition . It had given [her]214-lucetta [servants]5765-servants , [house]5766-house , and fine clothing — a setting that invested [Lucetta]214-lucetta with a startling novelty in the eyes of [him]0-i who had known [her]214-lucetta in [her]214-lucetta narrow days . [He]0-i accordingly lapsed into moodiness , and at every allusion to the possibility of [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's near election to the municipal chair [his]0-i former hatred of [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman returned . Concurrently with this [he]0-i underwent a moral change . It resulted in [his]0-i significantly saying every now and then , in tones of recklessness , “[3135-a fellow of his age] Only a fortnight more ! ” — “[3135-a fellow of his age] Only a dozen days ! ” and so forth , lessening [his]0-i figures day by day . “[3135-a fellow of his age] Why d'ye say only a dozen days ? ” asked [Solomon Longways]131-longways as [he]131-longways worked beside [Henchard]191-henchard in the granary weighing oats . “[3135-a fellow of his age] Because in twelve days [I]0-i shall be released from [my]0-i oath . ” “[3135-a fellow of his age] What oath ? ” “[126-god] The oath to drink no spirituous liquid . In twelve days it will be twenty - one years since [I]0-i swore it , and then [I]0-i mean to enjoy [myself]0-i , please [God]126-god ! ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard sat at [her]191-henchard window one Sunday , and while there [she]191-henchard heard in [the street]797-the street below a conversation which introduced [Henchard]191-henchard 's name . [She]191-henchard was wondering what was the matter , when [a third person who was passing by]5769-a third person who was passing by asked the question in [her]191-henchard mind . “[120-henchard] [Michael Henchard]120-henchard have busted out drinking after taking nothing for twenty - one years ! ” [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard jumped up , put on [her]191-henchard things , and went out .[3169-a few of whom]

At this date there prevailed in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge a convivial custom — scarcely recognized as such , yet none the less established . On the afternoon of every Sunday [a large contingent of [the Casterbridge journeymen]3145-the casterbridge journeymen]3144-a large contingent of the casterbridge journeymen — [steady churchgoers]3146-steady churchgoers and [sedate characters]3147-sedate characters — having attended service , filed from the church doors across the way to [the Three Mariners Inn]3148-the three mariners inn . The rear was usually brought up by [the choir]3149-the choir , with [their]3149-the choir bass - viols , fiddles , and flutes under [their]3149-the choir arms . The great point , the point of honour , on these sacred occasions was for [each man]3150-each man to strictly limit [himself]3150-each man to half - a - pint of liquor . This scrupulosity was so well understood by [the landlord]952-the landlord that [the whole company]3152-the whole company was served in cups of that measure . [They]3153-they were all exactly alike — straight - sided , with two leafless lime - trees done in eel - brown on the sides — one towards [the drinker]3154-the drinker 's lips , the other confronting [[his]952-the landlord comrade]3155-his comrade . To wonder how many of these cups [the landlord]952-the landlord possessed altogether was a favourite exercise of [children]4419-children in the marvellous . Forty at least might have been seen at these times in [the large room]3158-the large room , forming a ring round the margin of the great sixteen - legged oak table , like the monolithic circle of [Stonehenge]78-stonehenge in [its]78-stonehenge pristine days . Outside and above the forty cups came a circle of forty smoke - jets from forty clay pipes ; outside the pipes the countenances of [the forty church - goers , supported at the back by a circle of forty chairs]3159-the forty church - goers , supported at the back by a circle of forty chairs . The conversation was not the conversation of week - days , but a thing altogether finer in point and higher in tone . [They]3153-they invariably discussed the sermon , dissecting it , weighing it , as above or below the average — the general tendency being to regard it as a scientific feat or performance which had no relation to [their]3153-they own lives , except as between [critics]3160-critics and the thing criticized . [The bass - viol player]3161-the bass - viol player and [the clerk]5576-the clerk usually spoke with more authority than the rest on account of [their]3153-they official connection with [the preacher]5357-the preacher . Now [the Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners was [the inn chosen by [Henchard]120-henchard as the place for closing [his]120-henchard long term of dramless years]3165-the inn chosen by henchard as the place for closing his long term of dramless years . [He]120-henchard had so timed [his]120-henchard entry as to be well established in [the large room]3158-the large room by the time [the forty church - goers]3167-the forty church - goers entered to [their]3167-the forty church - goers customary cups . The flush upon [his]120-henchard face proclaimed at once that the vow of twenty - one years had lapsed , and the era of recklessness begun anew . [He]120-henchard was seated on a small table , drawn up to the side of the massive oak board reserved for [the churchmen]3168-the churchmen , [a few of whom]3169-a few of whom nodded to [him]120-henchard as [they]3169-a few of whom took [their]3169-a few of whom places and said , “ How be [ye]120-henchard , [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard ? Quite a stranger here . ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard did not take the trouble to reply for a few moments , and [his]120-henchard eyes rested on [his]120-henchard stretched - out legs and boots . “ Yes , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said at length ; “ that 's true . [I]3170-the first fiddle 've been down in spirit for weeks ; some of [ye]3167-the forty church - goers know the cause . [I]3170-the first fiddle am better now , but not quite serene . [I]3170-the first fiddle want [[you]3167-the forty church - goers fellows of [the choir]3149-the choir]5770-you fellows of the choir to strike up a tune ; and what with that and this brew of [Stannidge]136-mrs. stannidge 's , [I]3170-the first fiddle am in hopes of getting altogether out of [my]3170-the first fiddle minor key . ”[3170-the first fiddle] “ With all [my]3170-the first fiddle heart , ”[3170-the first fiddle] said [the first fiddle]3170-the first fiddle . “ [We]5772-we 've let back [our]5772-we strings , that 's true , but [we]5772-we can soon pull ['em]5773-'em up again . Sound A , [neighbours]5685-neighbours , and give [the man a stave]5775-the man a stave . ”[120-henchard] “ [I]120-henchard do n't care a curse what the words be , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard . “ Hymns , ballets , or rantipole rubbish ; [the Rogue]5776-the rogue 's March or [the cherubim]5777-the cherubim 's warble — ' tis all the same to [me]3171-the leader of the band if ' tis good harmony , and well put out . ”[3171-the leader of the band] “ Well — heh , heh — it may be [we]5772-we can do that , and not [a man among [us]5772-we that have sat in [the gallery]5779-the gallery less than twenty year]5778-a man among us that have sat in the gallery less than twenty year , ”[3171-the leader of the band] said [the leader of [the band]849-the band]3171-the leader of the band . “ As ' tis Sunday , [neighbours]5685-neighbours , suppose [we]5772-we raise the Fourth Psa'am , to [Samuel Wakely]221-samuel wakely 's tune , as improved by [me]120-henchard ? ”[120-henchard] “ Hang [Samuel Wakely]221-samuel wakely 's tune , as improved by [thee]5781-thee ! ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard . “ [Chuck]235-chuck across one of [[your]5685-neighbours psalters]5782-your psalters — old [Wiltshire]236-wiltshire is the only tune worth singing — the psalm - tune that would make [my]120-henchard blood ebb and flow like [the sea]5783-the sea when [I]120-henchard was [a steady chap]5784-a steady chap . [I]120-henchard 'll find some words to fit en . ”[120-henchard] [He]120-henchard took one of the psalters and began turning over the leaves . Chancing to look out of the window at that moment [he]120-henchard saw [a flock of people]3173-a flock of people passing by , and perceived [them]3173-a flock of people to be [the congregation of [the upper church]3175-the upper church]3174-the congregation of the upper church , now just dismissed , [their]3173-a flock of people sermon having been a longer one than that [the lower parish]3176-the lower parish was favoured with . Among [the rest of [the leading inhabitants]3178-the leading inhabitants]3177-the rest of the leading inhabitants walked [Mr. Councillor Farfrae]149-farfrae with [Lucetta]214-lucetta upon [his]149-farfrae arm , the observed and imitated of [all the smaller tradesmen]3179-all the smaller tradesmen 's womankind . [Henchard]120-henchard 's mouth changed a little , and [he]120-henchard continued to turn over the leaves . “ Now then , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said , “ Psalm the Hundred - and - Ninth , to the tune of Wiltshire : verses ten to fifteen . [I]0-i gi'e [ye]5785-ye the words : “[0-i] [I]0-i know the Psa'am — [I]0-i know the Psa'am ! ” said [the leader]5786-the leader hastily ; “[0-i] but [I]0-i would as lief not sing it . ' Twasn't made for singing . [We]3180-we chose it once when [the gipsy]3181-the gipsy stole [the pa'son]3182-the pa'son 's mare , thinking to please [him]3182-the pa'son , but [pa'son]237-pa'son were quite upset . [Whatever Servant [David]238-david]3183-whatever servant david were thinking about when [he]238-david made a Psalm that [nobody]298-nobody can sing without disgracing [himself]238-david , [I]0-i ca n't fathom ! Now then , the Fourth Psalm , to [Samuel Wakely]221-samuel wakely 's tune , as improved by [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] ' Od seize [your]3185-ye sauce — [I]0-i tell [ye]3185-ye to sing the Hundred - and - Ninth to Wiltshire , and sing it [you]3185-ye shall ! ” roared [Henchard]120-henchard . “[0-i] Not a single one of [all the droning crew of [ye]3185-ye]3186-all the droning crew of ye goes out of [this room]811-this room till that Psalm is sung ! ” [He]120-henchard slipped off the table , seized the poker , and going to the door placed [his]120-henchard back against it . “[3185-ye] Now then , go ahead , if [you]3185-ye do n't wish to have [your]3185-ye cust pates broke ! ” “[3188-ours] Do n't ' ee , don't'ee take on so ! — As ' tis the Sabbath - day , and ' tis [Servant David]238-david 's words and not [ours]3188-ours , perhaps [we]3188-ours do n't mind for once , hey ? ” said one of [the terrified choir]5787-the terrified choir , looking round upon the rest . So the instruments were tuned and the comminatory verses sung . “[3185-ye] Thank [ye]3185-ye , thank [ye]3185-ye , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard in a softened voice , [his]120-henchard eyes growing downcast , and [his]120-henchard manner that of [a man much moved by the strains]5788-a man much moved by the strains . “[238-david] Do n't [you]3185-ye blame [David]238-david , ” [he]120-henchard went on in low tones , shaking [his]120-henchard head without raising [his]120-henchard eyes . “[3189-the man we 've been singing about] [He]238-david knew what [he]238-david was about when [he]238-david wrote that ! ... If [I]0-i could afford it , be hanged if [I]0-i would n't keep a church choir at [my]0-i own expense to play and sing to [me]0-i at these low , dark times of [my]0-i life . But the bitter thing is , that when [I]0-i was rich [I]0-i did n't need what [I]0-i could have , and now [I]0-i be poor [I]0-i ca n't have what [I]0-i need ! ” While [they]3190-their paused , [Lucetta]214-lucetta and [Farfrae]149-farfrae passed again , this time homeward , it being [their]3190-their custom to take , like others , a short walk out on [the highway]301-the highway and back , between [church]1525-church and tea - time . “[3189-the man we 've been singing about] There 's [the man [we]3190-their 've been singing about]3189-the man we 've been singing about , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard . [The players]5791-the players and [singers]5792-singers turned [their]3190-their heads and saw [his]120-henchard meaning . “[291-the man] Heaven forbid ! ” said [the bass - player]5793-the bass - player . “[291-the man] ' Tis [the man]291-the man , ” repeated [Henchard]120-henchard doggedly . “[0-i] Then if [I]0-i 'd known , ” said [the performer on the clarionet]5794-the performer on the clarionet solemnly , “[0-i] that ' twas meant for [a living man]3192-a living man , nothing should have drawn out of [my]0-i wynd - pipe the breath for that Psalm , so help [me]0-i ! ” “[0-i] Nor from [mine]0-i , ” said [the first singer]5795-the first singer . “[291-the man] But , thought [I]0-i , as it was made so long ago perhaps there is n't much in it , so [I]0-i 'll oblige [a neighbour]3193-a neighbour ; for there 's nothing to be said against the tune . ” “[3194-my boys] Ah , [[my]0-i boys]3194-my boys , [you]3194-my boys 've sung it , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard triumphantly . “[0-i] As for [him]291-the man , it was partly by [his]291-the man songs that [he]291-the man got over [me]0-i , and heaved [me]0-i out .... [I]0-i could double [him]291-the man up like that — and yet [I]0-i do n't . ” [He]120-henchard laid the poker across [his]120-henchard knee , bent it as if it were a twig , flung it down , and came away from the door . It was at this time that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , having heard where [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather was , entered [the room]985-the room with a pale and agonized countenance . [The choir]3149-the choir and [the rest of [the company]388-the company]5799-the rest of the company moved off , in accordance with [their]5799-the rest of the company half - pint regulation . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard went up to [Henchard]191-henchard , and entreated [him]120-henchard to accompany [her]191-henchard [home]675-home . By this hour the volcanic fires of [his]120-henchard nature had burnt down , and having drunk no great quantity as yet [he]120-henchard was inclined to acquiesce . [She]191-henchard took [his]120-henchard arm , and together [they]5799-the rest of the company went on . [Henchard]191-henchard walked blankly , like [a blind man]5802-a blind man , repeating to [himself]191-henchard the last words of [the singers]5803-the singers — At length [he]120-henchard said to [her]191-henchard , “[0-i] [I]0-i am [a man]4474-a man to [my]0-i word . [I]0-i have kept [my]0-i oath for twenty - one years ; and now [I]0-i can drink with a good conscience .... If [I]0-i do n't do for [him]0-i — well , [I]0-i am [a fearful practical joker]3196-a fearful practical joker when [I]0-i choose ! [He]0-i has taken away everything from [me]0-i , and by heavens , if [I]0-i meet [him]0-i [I]0-i wo n't answer for [my]0-i deeds ! ” These half - uttered words alarmed [Elizabeth]191-henchard — all the more by reason of the still determination of [[Henchard]191-henchard 's mien]5804-henchard 's mien . “[0-i] What will [you]0-i do ? ” [she]191-henchard asked cautiously , while trembling with disquietude , and guessing [Henchard]191-henchard 's allusion only too well . [Henchard]191-henchard did not answer , and [they]5805-they went on till [they]5805-they had reached [[his]0-i cottage]5806-his cottage . “[0-i] May [I]0-i come in ? ” [she]191-henchard said . “[0-i] No , no ; not to - day , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard ; and [she]191-henchard went away ; feeling that to caution [Farfrae]149-farfrae was almost [her]191-henchard duty , as it was certainly [her]191-henchard strong desire . As on the Sunday , so on the week - days , [Farfrae]149-farfrae and [Lucetta]214-lucetta might have been seen flitting about [the town]632-the town like two butterflies — or rather like a bee and a butterfly in league for life . [She]191-henchard seemed to take no pleasure in going anywhere except in [[her]191-henchard husband]387-her husband 's company ; and hence when business would not permit [him]387-her husband to waste an afternoon [she]191-henchard remained indoors waiting for the time to pass till [his]387-her husband return , [her]191-henchard face being visible to [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard from [her]191-henchard window aloft . [The latter]4511-the latter , however , did not say to [herself]191-henchard that [Farfrae]149-farfrae should be thankful for such devotion , but , full of [her]191-henchard reading , [she]191-henchard cited [Rosalind]239-rosalind 's exclamation : “[3199-his] [Mistress]3197-mistress , know [yourself]3197-mistress ; down on [your]3197-mistress knees and thank [Heaven]123-heaven fasting for [a good man]4726-a good man 's love . ” [She]191-henchard kept [her]191-henchard eye upon [Henchard]191-henchard also . One day [he]3199-his answered [her]191-henchard inquiry for [his]3199-his health by saying that [he]3199-his could not endure [Abel Whittle]171-whittle 's pitying eyes upon [him]3199-his while [they]5810-they worked together in [the yard]1277-the yard . “[4995-a fool] [He]3199-his is such [a fool]4995-a fool , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard , “[0-i] that [he]3199-his can never get out of [his]3199-his mind the time when [I]0-i was [master there]3201-master there . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i 'll come and wimble for [you]3199-his instead of [him]3199-his , if [you]3199-his will allow [me]0-i , ” said [she]191-henchard . [Her]191-henchard motive on going to [the yard]1277-the yard was to get an opportunity of observing the general position of affairs on [[Farfrae]149-farfrae 's premises]5813-farfrae 's premises now that [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather was [a workman there]5815-a workman there . [Henchard]191-henchard 's threats had alarmed [her]191-henchard so much that [she]191-henchard wished to see [his]3199-his behaviour when [the two]2165-the two were face to face . For two or three days after [her]191-henchard arrival [Donald]139-farfrae did not make any appearance . Then one afternoon the green door opened , and through came , first [Farfrae]139-farfrae , and at [his]3199-his heels [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [Donald]139-farfrae brought [[his]3199-his wife]380-his wife forward without hesitation , it being obvious that [he]3199-his had no suspicion whatever of any antecedents in common between [her]191-henchard and [the now journeyman hay - trusser]5818-the now journeyman hay - trusser . [Henchard]191-henchard did not turn [his]3199-his eyes toward either of [the pair]5819-the pair , keeping them fixed on the bond [he]3199-his twisted , as if that alone absorbed [him]3199-his . A feeling of delicacy , which ever prompted [Farfrae]139-farfrae to avoid anything that might seem like triumphing over a fallen rivel , led [him]3199-his to keep away from [the hay - barn]2071-the hay - barn where [Henchard]191-henchard and [[his]3199-his daughter]2039-his daughter were working , and to go on to [the corn department]5822-the corn department . Meanwhile [Lucetta]214-lucetta , never having been informed that [Henchard]191-henchard had entered [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband 's service , rambled straight on to [the barn]2072-the barn , where [she]214-lucetta came suddenly upon [Henchard]191-henchard , and gave vent to a little “[0-i] Oh ! ” which [the happy and busy Donald]5825-the happy and busy donald was too far off to hear . [Henchard]191-henchard , with withering humility of demeanour , touched the brim of [his]3199-his hat to [her]214-lucetta as Whittle and [the rest]494-the rest had done , to which [she]214-lucetta breathed a dead - alive “[0-i] Good afternoon . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]3202-you pardon , [ma'am]618-ma'am ? ” said [Henchard]191-henchard , as if [he]0-i had not heard . “[0-i] [I]0-i said good afternoon , ” [she]214-lucetta faltered . “[618-ma'am] O yes , good afternoon , [ma'am]618-ma'am , ” [he]3199-his replied , touching [his]3199-his hat again . “[0-i] [I]0-i am glad to see [you]3202-you , [ma'am]618-ma'am . ” [Lucetta]214-lucetta looked embarrassed , and [Henchard]191-henchard continued : “[2109-a lady] For [[we]3206-we humble [workmen here]3208-workmen here]3207-we humble workmen here feel it a great honour that [a lady]2109-a lady should look in and take an interest in [us]3206-we . ” [She]214-lucetta glanced at [him]0-i entreatingly ; the sarcasm was too bitter , too unendurable . “[3202-you] Can [you]3202-you tell [me]0-i the time , [ma'am]618-ma'am ? ” [he]0-i asked . “[3202-you] Yes , ” [she]214-lucetta said hastily ; “[618-ma'am] half - past four . ” “[3214-you] Thank ' ee . An hour and a half longer before [we]3206-we are released from work . Ah , [ma'am]618-ma'am , [[we]3206-we of [the lower classes]3213-the lower classes]3212-we of the lower classes know nothing of the gay leisure that such as [you]618-ma'am enjoy ! ” As soon as [she]214-lucetta could do so [Lucetta]214-lucetta left [him]0-i , nodded and smiled to [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , and joined [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband at the other end of [the enclosure]5828-the enclosure , where [she]214-lucetta could be seen leading [him]0-i away by the outer gates , so as to avoid passing [Henchard]191-henchard again . That [she]214-lucetta had been taken by surprise was obvious . The result of this casual rencounter was that the next morning a note was put into [Henchard]191-henchard 's hand by [the postman]5829-the postman . “[3214-you] Will [you]3214-you , ” said [Lucetta]214-lucetta , with as much bitterness as [she]214-lucetta could put into a small communication , “[191-henchard] will [you]3214-you kindly undertake not to speak to [me]0-i in the biting undertones [you]3214-you used to - day , if [I]0-i walk through [the yard]1277-the yard at any time ? [I]0-i bear [you]3214-you no ill - will , and [I]0-i am only too glad that [you]3214-you should have employment of [[my]0-i dear husband]3216-my dear husband ; but in common fairness treat [me]0-i as [[his]3216-my dear husband wife]380-his wife , and do not try to make [me]0-i wretched by covert sneers . [I]0-i have committed no crime , and done [you]3214-you no injury . “ [Poor fool]5830-poor fool ! ”[3216-my dear husband] said [Henchard]191-henchard with fond savagery , holding out the note . “ To know no better than commit [herself]191-henchard in writing like this ! Why , if [I]371-the young man were to show that to [[her]191-henchard dear husband]5831-her dear husband — pooh ! ”[371-the young man] [He]3216-my dear husband threw the letter into the fire . [Lucetta]214-lucetta took care not to come again among the hay and corn . [She]214-lucetta would rather have died than run the risk of encountering [Henchard]191-henchard at such close quarters a second time . The gulf between [them]3218-them was growing wider every day . [Farfrae]139-farfrae was always considerate to [[his]3216-my dear husband fallen acquaintance]3219-his fallen acquaintance ; but it was impossible that [he]3216-my dear husband should not , by degrees , cease to regard [the ex - corn - merchant]3220-the ex - corn - merchant as more than [one of [[his]3216-my dear husband other workmen]3222-his other workmen]3221-one of his other workmen . [Henchard]191-henchard saw this , and concealed [his]3216-my dear husband feelings under a cover of stolidity , fortifying [his]3216-my dear husband heart by drinking more freely at the Three Mariners every evening . Often did [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , in [her]191-henchard endeavours to prevent [his]3216-my dear husband taking other liquor , carry tea to [him]3216-my dear husband in a little basket at five o'clock . Arriving one day on this errand [she]191-henchard found [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather was measuring up clover - seed and rape - seed in [the corn - stores on the top floor]3224-the corn - stores on the top floor , and [she]191-henchard ascended to [him]3216-my dear husband . [Each floor]3225-each floor had a door opening into the air under a cat - head , from which a chain dangled for hoisting the sacks . When [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's head rose through the trap [she]191-henchard perceived that the upper door was open , and that [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather and [Farfrae]139-farfrae stood just within [it]3227-it in conversation , [Farfrae]139-farfrae being nearest the dizzy edge , and [Henchard]191-henchard a little way behind . Not to interrupt [them]3228-them [she]191-henchard remained on the steps without raising [her]191-henchard head any higher . While waiting thus [she]191-henchard saw — or fancied [she]191-henchard saw , for [she]191-henchard had a terror of feeling certain — [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather slowly raise [his]3216-my dear husband hand to a level behind [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's shoulders , a curious expression taking possession of [his]3216-my dear husband face . [The young man]371-the young man was quite unconscious of the action , which was so indirect that , if [Farfrae]139-farfrae had observed it , [he]371-the young man might almost have regarded it as an idle outstretching of the arm . But it would have been possible , by a comparatively light touch , to push [Farfrae]139-farfrae off [his]371-the young man balance , and send [him]371-the young man head over heels into the air . [Elizabeth]191-henchard felt quite sick at heart on thinking of what this MIGHT have meant . As soon as [they]3228-them turned [she]191-henchard mechanically took the tea to [Henchard]191-henchard , left it , and went away . Reflecting , [she]191-henchard endeavoured to assure [herself]191-henchard that the movement was an idle eccentricity , and no more . Yet , on the other hand , [his]371-the young man subordinate position in [an establishment where [he]371-the young man once had been [master]5003-master]3231-an establishment where he once had been master might be acting on [him]371-the young man like an irritant poison ; and [she]191-henchard finally resolved to caution [Donald]139-farfrae .

Next morning , accordingly , [she]191-henchard rose at five o'clock and went into [the street]797-the street . It was not yet light ; a dense fog prevailed , and [the town]632-the town was as silent as it was dark , except that from [the rectangular avenues which framed in [the borough]1619-the borough]3235-the rectangular avenues which framed in the borough there came a chorus of tiny rappings , caused by the fall of water - drops condensed on the boughs ; now it was wafted from [the West Walk]1763-the west walk , now from [the South Walk]2629-the south walk ; and then from [both quarters]3239-both quarters simultaneously . [She]191-henchard moved on to [the bottom of [Corn Street]75-corn street]3240-the bottom of corn street , and , knowing [his]371-the young man time well , waited only a few minutes before [she]191-henchard heard the familiar bang of [his]371-the young man door , and then [his]371-the young man quick walk towards [her]191-henchard . [She]191-henchard met [him]371-the young man at the point where the last tree of [the engirding avenue]3241-the engirding avenue flanked [the last house in [the street]797-the street]3242-the last house in the street . [He]371-the young man could hardly discern [her]191-henchard till , glancing inquiringly , [he]371-the young man said , “ What — [Miss Henchard]166-miss henchard — and are [ye]191-henchard up so airly ? ”[191-henchard] [She]191-henchard asked [him]371-the young man to pardon [her]191-henchard for waylaying [him]371-the young man at such an unseemly time . “ But [I]191-henchard am anxious to mention something , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said . “ And [I]371-the young man wished not to alarm [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae by calling . ”[371-the young man] “ Yes ? ”[371-the young man] said [he]371-the young man , with the cheeriness of [a superior]3244-a superior . “ And what may it be ? It 's very kind of [ye]191-henchard , [I]191-henchard 'm sure . ”[191-henchard] [She]191-henchard now felt the difficulty of conveying to [his]371-the young man mind the exact aspect of possibilities in [her]191-henchard own . But [she]191-henchard somehow began , and introduced [Henchard]166-miss henchard 's name . “ [I]191-henchard sometimes fear , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said with an effort , “ that [he]371-the young man may be betrayed into some attempt to — insult [you]371-the young man , [sir]4588-sir . “[191-henchard] But [we]3245-we are [the best of friends]3246-the best of friends ? ” “[371-the young man] Or to play some practical joke upon [you]371-the young man , [sir]4588-sir . Remember that [he]371-the young man has been hardly used . ” “[3245-we] But [we]3245-we are quite friendly ? ” “[3245-we] Or to do something — that would injure [you]371-the young man — hurt [you]371-the young man — wound [you]371-the young man . ” Every word cost [her]191-henchard twice its length of pain . And [she]191-henchard could see that [Farfrae]139-farfrae was still incredulous . [Henchard]166-miss henchard , [a poor man in [his]371-the young man employ]5833-a poor man in his employ , was not to [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's view [the Henchard who had ruled [him]371-the young man]5834-the henchard who had ruled him . Yet [he]371-the young man was not only [the same man]5835-the same man , but [that man with [his]371-the young man sinister qualities , formerly latent , quickened into life by [his]371-the young man buffetings]5836-that man with his sinister qualities , formerly latent , quickened into life by his buffetings . [Farfrae]139-farfrae , happy , and thinking no evil , persisted in making light of [her]191-henchard fears . Thus [they]3245-we parted , and [she]191-henchard went homeward , [journeymen]349-journeymen now being in [the street]797-the street , [waggoners]5839-waggoners going to [the harness - makers]5840-the harness - makers for articles left to be repaired , farm - horses going to [the shoeing - smiths]5841-the shoeing - smiths , and [the sons of labour]5842-the sons of labour showing [themselves]5842-the sons of labour generally on the move . [Elizabeth]191-henchard entered [[her]191-henchard lodging]5843-her lodging unhappily , thinking [she]191-henchard had done no good , and only made [herself]191-henchard appear foolish by [her]191-henchard weak note of warning . But [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae was one of [those men upon whom an incident]5844-those men upon whom an incident is never absolutely lost . [He]371-the young man revised impressions from a subsequent point of view , and the impulsive judgment of the moment was not always [his]371-the young man permanent one . The vision of [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's earnest face in the rimy dawn came back to [him]371-the young man several times during the day . Knowing the solidity of [her]191-henchard character [he]371-the young man did not treat [her]191-henchard hints altogether as idle sounds . But [he]371-the young man did not desist from a kindly scheme on [Henchard]191-henchard 's account that engaged [him]371-the young man just then ; and when [he]371-the young man met [Lawyer Joyce]240-lawyer joyce , [the town - clerk]1610-the town - clerk , later in the day , [he]371-the young man spoke of it as if nothing had occurred to damp it . “[2127-the council] About [[that little seedsman]3248-that little seedsman 's shop]3249-that little seedsman 's shop , ” [he]371-the young man said , “[139-farfrae] [the shop overlooking [the churchyard]2102-the churchyard]3250-the shop overlooking the churchyard , which is to let . It is not for [myself]0-i [I]0-i want it , but for [[our]3252-our unlucky fellow - townsman [Henchard]191-henchard]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard . It would be a new beginning for [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard , if a small one ; and [I]0-i have told [the Council]2127-the council that [I]0-i would head a private subscription among [them]2127-the council to set [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard up in it — that [I]0-i would be fifty pounds , if [they]2127-the council would make up the other fifty among [them]2127-the council . ” “[139-farfrae] Yes , yes ; so [I]0-i 've heard ; and there 's nothing to say against it for that matter , ” [the town - clerk]1610-the town - clerk replied , in [his]1610-the town - clerk plain , frank way . “[3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard] But , [Farfrae]139-farfrae , [others]860-others see what [you]139-farfrae do n't . [Henchard]191-henchard hates ' ee — ay , hates ' ee ; and ' tis right that [you]139-farfrae should know it . To [my]0-i knowledge [he]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard was at [the Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners last night , saying in public that about [you]139-farfrae which [a man]4474-a man ought not to say about another . ” “[3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard] Is that so — ah , is that so ? ” said [Farfrae]139-farfrae , looking down . “[3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard] Why should [he]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard do it ? ” added [the young man]371-the young man bitterly ; “[3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard] what harm have [I]0-i done [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard that [he]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard should try to wrong [me]0-i ? ” “[3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard] God only knows , ” said [Joyce]240-lawyer joyce , lifting [his]0-i eyebrows . “[3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard] It shows much long - suffering in [you]139-farfrae to put up with [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard , and keep [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard in [your]139-farfrae employ . ” “[0-i] But [I]0-i cannet discharge [a man who was once [a good friend to [me]0-i]3259-a good friend to me]3258-a man who was once a good friend to me . How can [I]0-i forget that when [I]0-i came here ' twas [he]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard enabled [me]0-i to make a footing for [mysel]3260-mysel ' ? No , no . As long as [I]0-i 've a day 's work to offer [he]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard shall do it if [he]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard chooses . ' Tis not [I]0-i who will deny [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard such a little as that . But [I]0-i 'll drop the idea of establishing [him]3253-our unlucky fellow - townsman henchard in [a shop]3261-a shop till [I]0-i can think more about it . ” It grieved [Farfrae]139-farfrae much to give up this scheme . But a damp having been thrown over it by these and other voices in the air , [he]0-i went and countermanded [his]0-i orders . [The then occupier of [the shop]804-the shop]5848-the then occupier of the shop was in [it]804-the shop when [Farfrae]139-farfrae spoke to [him]5848-the then occupier of the shop and feeling it necessary to give some explanation of [his]5848-the then occupier of the shop withdrawal from the negotiation [Donald]139-farfrae mentioned [Henchard]191-henchard 's name , and stated that the intentions of [the Council]2127-the council had been changed . [The occupier]5488-the occupier was much disappointed , and straight - way informed [Henchard]191-henchard , as soon as [he]5488-the occupier saw [him]5848-the then occupier of the shop , that a scheme of [the Council]2127-the council for setting [him]5848-the then occupier of the shop up in [a shop]3261-a shop had been knocked on the head by [Farfrae]139-farfrae . And thus out of error enmity grew . When [Farfrae]139-farfrae got [indoors]4777-indoors that evening the tea - kettle was singing on the high hob of the semi - egg - shaped grate . [Lucetta]214-lucetta , light as a sylph , ran forward and seized [his]5848-the then occupier of the shop hands , whereupon [Farfrae]139-farfrae duly kissed [her]214-lucetta . “[0-i] Oh ! ” [she]214-lucetta cried playfully , turning to the window . “[4635-the people] See — the blinds are not drawn down , and [the people]4635-the people can look in — what a scandal ! ” When the candles were lighted , the curtains drawn , and [the twain]5855-the twain sat at tea , [she]214-lucetta noticed that [he]5848-the then occupier of the shop looked serious . Without directly inquiring why [she]214-lucetta let [her]214-lucetta eyes linger solicitously on [his]5848-the then occupier of the shop face . “[4635-the people] Who has called ? ” [he]5848-the then occupier of the shop absently asked . “[4635-the people] Any folk for [me]0-i ? ” “[4635-the people] No , ” said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “[139-farfrae] What 's the matter , [Donald]139-farfrae ? ” “[139-farfrae] Well — nothing worth talking of , ” [he]5848-the then occupier of the shop responded sadly . “[5313-scotchmen] Then , never mind it . [You]3263-you will get through it , [Scotchmen]5313-scotchmen are always lucky . ” “[5313-scotchmen] No — not always ! ” [he]5848-the then occupier of the shop said , shaking [his]5848-the then occupier of the shop head gloomily as [he]5848-the then occupier of the shop contemplated a crumb on the table . “[3265-they] [I]0-i know many who have not been so ! There was [Sandy Macfarlane]241-sandy macfarlane , who started to [America]19-america to try [his]241-sandy macfarlane fortune , and [he]241-sandy macfarlane was drowned ; and [Archibald Leith]242-archibald leith , [he]241-sandy macfarlane was murdered ! And poor [Willie Dunbleeze]243-willie dunbleeze and [Maitland Macfreeze]244-maitland macfreeze — [they]3265-they fell into bad courses , and went the way of all such ! ” “[3269-he] Why — [you]139-farfrae old goosey — [I]0-i was only speaking in a general sense , of course ! [You]3263-you are always so literal . Now when [we]3266-we have finished tea , sing [me]0-i that funny song about [high - heeled shoon and siller tags]3267-high - heeled shoon and siller tags , and [the one - and - forty wooers]3268-the one - and - forty wooers . ” “[3263-you] No , no . [I]0-i couldna sing to - night ! It 's [Henchard]191-henchard — [he]3269-he hates [me]0-i ; so that [I]0-i may not be [[his]3269-he friend]1456-his friend if [I]0-i would . [I]0-i would understand why there should be a wee bit of envy ; but [I]0-i cannet see a reason for the whole intensity of what [he]3269-he feels . Now , can [you]3263-you , [Lucetta]214-lucetta ? It is more like old - fashioned rivalry in love than just a bit of rivalry in trade . ” [Lucetta]214-lucetta had grown somewhat wan . “[3263-you] No , ” [she]214-lucetta replied . “[3263-you] [I]0-i give [him]3269-he employment — [I]0-i cannet refuse it . But neither can [I]0-i blind [myself]0-i to the fact that with [a man of passions such as [his]3269-he]3271-a man of passions such as his , there is no safeguard for conduct ! ” “[3263-you] What have [you]3263-you heard — [O Donald]139-farfrae , [dearest]3272-dearest ? ” said [Lucetta]214-lucetta in alarm . The words on [her]214-lucetta lips were “[3263-you] anything about [me]0-i ? ” — but [she]214-lucetta did not utter them . [She]214-lucetta could not , however , suppress [her]214-lucetta agitation , and [her]214-lucetta eyes filled with tears . “[0-i] No , no — it is not so serious as [ye]214-lucetta fancy , ” declared [Farfrae]139-farfrae soothingly ; though [he]3263-you did not know its seriousness so well as [she]214-lucetta . “[3263-you] [I]0-i wish [you]3263-you would do what [we]3273-we have talked of , ” mournfully remarked [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “[3263-you] Give up business , and go away from [here]4417-here . [We]3273-we have plenty of money , and why should [we]3273-we stay ? ” [Farfrae]139-farfrae seemed seriously disposed to discuss this move , and [they]3273-we talked thereon till [a visitor]5644-a visitor was announced . [[Their]3273-we neighbour]5857-their neighbour [Alderman Vatt]245-alderman vatt came in . “[246-doctor chalkfield] [You]3263-you 've heard , [I]0-i suppose of poor [Doctor Chalkfield]246-doctor chalkfield 's death ? Yes — died this afternoon at five , ” said [Mr. Vatt]247-mr. vatt . [Chalkfield]246-doctor chalkfield was [the Councilman who had succeeded to the Mayoralty in the preceding November]5858-the councilman who had succeeded to the mayoralty in the preceding november . [Farfrae]139-farfrae was sorry at the intelligence , and [Mr. Vatt]247-mr. vatt continued : “[3263-you] Well , [we]3273-we know [he]246-doctor chalkfield 's been going some days , and as [[his]246-doctor chalkfield family]342-his family is well provided for [we]3273-we must take it all as it is . Now [I]0-i have called to ask [']3263-you [ee]3263-you this — quite privately . If [I]0-i should nominate [']3263-you [ee]3263-you to succeed [him]246-doctor chalkfield , and there should be no particular opposition , will ' [ee]3263-you accept the chair ? ” “[0-i] But there are [folk]5018-folk whose turn is before [mine]0-i ; and [I]0-i 'm over young , and may be thought pushing ! ” said [Farfrae]139-farfrae after a pause . “[0-i] Not at all . [I]0-i do n't speak for [myself]0-i only , [several]3277-several have named it . [You]0-i wo n't refuse ? ” “[3273-we] [We]3273-we thought of going away , ” interposed [Lucetta]214-lucetta , looking at [Farfrae]139-farfrae anxiously . “[0-i] It was only a fancy , ” [Farfrae]139-farfrae murmured . “[3278-a respectable majority in the council] [I]0-i wouldna refuse if it is the wish of [a respectable majority in [the Council]79-the council]3278-a respectable majority in the council . ” “[3279-older men] Very well , then , look upon [yourself]0-i as elected . [We]3273-we have had [older men]3279-older men long enough . ” When [he]0-i was gone [Farfrae]139-farfrae said musingly , “[3283-he] See now how it 's [ourselves]3273-we that are ruled by [the Powers above [us]3273-we]3280-the powers above us ! [We]3273-we plan this , but [we]3273-we do that . If [they]3281-they want to make [me]0-i [Mayor]1548-mayor [I]0-i will stay , and [Henchard]191-henchard must rave as [he]3283-he will . ” From this evening onward [Lucetta]214-lucetta was very uneasy . If [she]214-lucetta had not been imprudence incarnate [she]214-lucetta would not have acted as [she]214-lucetta did when [she]214-lucetta met [Henchard]191-henchard by accident a day or two later . It was in the bustle of [the market]5183-the market , when [no one]437-no one could readily notice [their]5861-their discourse . “[120-henchard] [Michael]120-henchard , ” said [she]214-lucetta , “[300-the woman] [I]0-i must again ask [you]120-henchard what [I]0-i asked [you]120-henchard months ago — to return [me]0-i any letters or papers of [mine]0-i that [you]120-henchard may have — unless [you]120-henchard have destroyed them ? [You]120-henchard must see how desirable it is that the time at [Jersey]43-jersey should be blotted out , for the good of [all parties]3284-all parties . ” “[120-henchard] Why , bless [the woman]300-the woman ! — [I]0-i packed up every scrap of [your]120-henchard handwriting to give [you]120-henchard in [the coach]4720-the coach — but [you]120-henchard never appeared . ” [She]214-lucetta explained how the death of [[her]214-lucetta aunt]5862-her aunt had prevented [her]214-lucetta taking the journey on that day . “[0-i] And what became of the parcel then ? ” [she]214-lucetta asked . [He]120-henchard could not say — [he]120-henchard would consider . When [she]214-lucetta was gone [he]120-henchard recollected that [he]120-henchard had left a heap of useless papers in [[his]120-henchard former dining - room safe]5863-his former dining - room safe — built up in the wall of [[his]120-henchard old house]5864-his old house — now occupied by [Farfrae]139-farfrae . The letters might have been amongst them . A grotesque grin shaped itself on [Henchard]120-henchard 's face . Had that safe been opened ? On the very evening which followed this there was a great ringing of bells in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , and the combined brass , wood , catgut , and leather bands played round [the town]632-the town with more prodigality of percussion - notes than ever . [Farfrae]139-farfrae was [Mayor]1548-mayor — the two - hundredth odd of a series forming an elective dynasty dating back to the days of [Charles I]235-chuck — and the fair [Lucetta]214-lucetta was the courted of [the town]632-the town .... But , Ah ! the worm [i]0-i ' the bud — [Henchard]120-henchard ; what [he]120-henchard could tell ! [He]120-henchard , in the meantime , festering with indignation at some erroneous intelligence of [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's opposition to the scheme for installing [him]120-henchard in [the little seed - shop]5868-the little seed - shop , was greeted with the news of the municipal election ( which , by reason of [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's comparative youth and [his]120-henchard Scottish nativity — a thing unprecedented in the case — had an interest far beyond the ordinary ) . The bell - ringing and the band - playing , loud as [Tamerlane]248-tamerlane 's trumpet , goaded [the downfallen Henchard]120-henchard indescribably : the ousting now seemed to [him]120-henchard to be complete . The next morning [he]120-henchard went to [the corn - yard]5869-the corn - yard as usual , and about eleven o'clock [Donald]139-farfrae entered through the green door , with no trace of the worshipful about [him]120-henchard . The yet more emphatic change of places between [him]120-henchard and [Henchard]120-henchard which this election had established renewed a slight embarrassment in the manner of [the modest young man]5870-the modest young man ; but [Henchard]120-henchard showed the front of one who had overlooked all this ; and [Farfrae]139-farfrae met [his]120-henchard amenities half - way at once . “[0-i] [I]0-i was going to ask [you]3287-you , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard , “[0-i] about a packet that [I]0-i may possibly have left in [my]0-i old safe in [the dining - room]891-the dining - room . ” [He]0-i added particulars . “[0-i] If so , it is there now , ” said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “[0-i] [I]0-i have never opened [the safe]3289-the safe at all as yet ; for [I]0-i keep [ma]3290-ma papers at [the bank]325-the bank , to sleep easy o ' nights . ” “[0-i] It was not of much consequence — to [me]0-i , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard . “[0-i] But [I]0-i 'll call for it this evening , if [you]3287-you do n't mind ? ” It was quite late when [he]0-i fulfilled [his]0-i promise . [He]0-i had primed [himself]0-i with grog , as [he]0-i did very frequently now , and a curl of sardonic humour hung on [his]0-i lip as [he]0-i approached [the house]782-the house , as though [he]0-i were contemplating some terrible form of amusement . Whatever it was , the incident of [his]0-i entry did not diminish its force , this being [his]0-i first visit to [the house]782-the house since [he]0-i had lived [there]447-there as [owner]5874-owner . The ring of the bell spoke to [him]0-i like the voice of [a familiar drudge who had been bribed to forsake [him]0-i]5875-a familiar drudge who had been bribed to forsake him ; the movements of the doors were revivals of dead days . [Farfrae]139-farfrae invited [him]0-i into [the dining - room]891-the dining - room , where [he]0-i at once unlocked the iron safe built into the wall , [HIS]0-i , [[Henchard]120-henchard 's safe]5877-henchard 's safe , made by [an ingenious locksmith under [his]0-i direction]5878-an ingenious locksmith under his direction . [Farfrae]139-farfrae drew thence the parcel , and other papers , with apologies for not having returned them . “[0-i] Never mind , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard drily . “[0-i] The fact is they are letters mostly .... Yes , ” [he]0-i went on , sitting down and unfolding [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's passionate bundle , “[139-farfrae] here they be . That ever [I]0-i should see ['em]3292-'em again ! [I]0-i hope [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae is well after [her]139-farfrae exertions of yesterday ? ” “[139-farfrae] [She]139-farfrae has felt a bit weary ; and has gone to bed airly on that account . ” [Henchard]120-henchard returned to the letters , sorting them over with interest , [Farfrae]139-farfrae being seated at the other end of the dining - table . “[139-farfrae] [You]3293-you do n't forget , of course , ” [he]0-i resumed , “[126-god] that curious chapter in the history of [my]0-i past which [I]0-i told [you]3293-you of , and that [you]3293-you gave [me]0-i some assistance in ? These letters are , in fact , related to that unhappy business . Though , thank [God]126-god , it is all over now . ” “[126-god] What became of [the poor woman]1434-the poor woman ? ” asked [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “[1434-the poor woman] Luckily [she]1434-the poor woman married , and married well , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard . “[3296-an angry woman] So that these reproaches [she]1434-the poor woman poured out on [me]0-i do not now cause [me]0-i any twinges , as [they]3295-they might otherwise have done .... Just listen to what [an angry woman]3296-an angry woman will say ! ” [Farfrae]139-farfrae , willing to humour [Henchard]120-henchard , though quite uninterested , and bursting with yawns , gave well - mannered attention . “[3296-an angry woman] ' For [me]0-i , ' ” [Henchard]120-henchard read , “[3302-your present wife] ' there is practically no future . [A creature too unconventionally devoted to [you]3293-you — who feels it impossible that [she]1434-the poor woman can be [the wife of [any other man]3299-any other man]3298-the wife of any other man ; and who is yet no more to [you]3293-you than [the first woman [you]3293-you meet in [the street]797-the street]3300-the first woman you meet in the street]3297-a creature too unconventionally devoted to you — who feels it impossible that she can be the wife of any other man ; and who is yet no more to you than the first woman you meet in the street — such am [I.]0-i [I]0-i quite acquit [you]3293-you of any intention to wrong [me]0-i , yet [you]3293-you are the door through which wrong has come to [me]0-i . That in the event of [[your]3293-you present wife]3302-your present wife 's death [you]3293-you will place [me]0-i in [her]3302-your present wife position is a consolation so far as it goes — but how far does it go ? Thus [I]0-i sit here , forsaken by [[my]0-i few acquaintance]3303-my few acquaintance , and forsaken by [you]3293-you ! ' ” “[3302-your present wife] That 's how [she]3302-your present wife went on to [me]0-i , ” said [Henchard]120-henchard , “[3302-your present wife] acres of words like that , when what had happened was what [I]0-i could not cure . ” “[3302-your present wife] Yes , ” said [Farfrae]139-farfrae absently , “[4948-women] it is the way wi ' [women]4948-women . ” But the fact was that [he]0-i knew very little of the sex ; yet detecting a sort of resemblance in style between the effusions of [the woman [he]0-i worshipped]5879-the woman he worshipped and those of [the supposed stranger]5880-the supposed stranger , [he]0-i concluded that [Aphrodite]249-aphrodite ever spoke thus , whosesoever the personality [she]3302-your present wife assumed . [Henchard]120-henchard unfolded another letter , and read it through likewise , stopping at the subscription as before . “[0-i] [Her]3302-your present wife name [I]0-i do n't give , ” [he]0-i said blandly . “[0-i] As [I]0-i did n't marry [her]3302-your present wife , and [another man]5372-another man did , [I]0-i can scarcely do that in fairness to [her]3302-your present wife . ” “[0-i] Tr - rue , tr - rue , ” said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “[0-i] But why did n't [you]0-i marry [her]3302-your present wife when [[your]0-i wife]4877-your wife [Susan]122-henchard died ? ” [Farfrae]139-farfrae asked this and the other questions in the comfortably indifferent tone of [one whom the matter]5881-one whom the matter very remotely concerned . “[3302-your present wife] Ah — well [you]0-i may ask that ! ” said [Henchard]122-henchard , the new - moon - shaped grin adumbrating itself again upon [his]122-henchard mouth . “[3302-your present wife] In spite of all [her]3302-your present wife protestations , when [I]0-i came forward to do so , as in generosity bound , [she]3302-your present wife was not the woman for [me]0-i . ” “[3302-your present wife] [She]3302-your present wife had already married another — maybe ? ” [Henchard]122-henchard seemed to think it would be sailing too near the wind to descend further into particulars , and [he]122-henchard answered “[3302-your present wife] Yes . ” “[3302-your present wife] [The young lady]4876-the young lady must have had a heart that bore transplanting very readily ! ” “[3302-your present wife] [She]3302-your present wife had , [she]3302-your present wife had , ” said [Henchard]122-henchard emphatically . [He]122-henchard opened a third and fourth letter , and read . This time [he]122-henchard approached the conclusion as if the signature were indeed coming with the rest . But again [he]122-henchard stopped short . The truth was that , as may be divined , [he]122-henchard had quite intended to effect a grand catastrophe at the end of this drama by reading out the name , [he]122-henchard had come to [the house]782-the house with no other thought . But sitting here in cold blood [he]122-henchard could not do it . Such a wrecking of hearts appalled even [him]122-henchard . [His]122-henchard quality was such that [he]122-henchard could have annihilated [them]5883-them both in the heat of action ; but to accomplish the deed by oral poison was beyond the nerve of [his]122-henchard enmity .[122-henchard]

As [Donald]139-farfrae stated , [Lucetta]214-lucetta had retired early to [[her]214-lucetta room]1935-her room because of fatigue . [She]214-lucetta had , however , not gone to rest , but sat in the bedside chair reading and thinking over the events of the day . At the ringing of the door - bell by [Henchard]122-henchard [she]214-lucetta wondered who it should be that would call at that comparatively late hour . [The dining - room]891-the dining - room was almost under [[her]214-lucetta bed - room]3310-her bed - room ; [she]214-lucetta could hear that [somebody]4446-somebody was admitted [there]447-there , and presently the indistinct murmur of [a person]2404-a person reading became audible . The usual time for [Donald]139-farfrae 's arrival [upstairs]1000-upstairs came and passed , yet still the reading and conversation went on . This was very singular . [She]214-lucetta could think of nothing but that some extraordinary crime had been committed , and that [the visitor]5265-the visitor , whoever [he]5265-the visitor might be , was reading an account of it from a special edition of the Casterbridge Chronicle . At last [she]214-lucetta left [the room]985-the room , and descended the stairs . [The dining - room]891-the dining - room door was ajar , and in the silence of [the resting household]3318-the resting household the voice and the words were recognizable before [she]214-lucetta reached the lower flight . [She]214-lucetta stood transfixed . [Her]214-lucetta own words greeted [her]214-lucetta in [Henchard]122-henchard 's voice , like spirits from the grave . [Lucetta]214-lucetta leant upon the banister with [her]214-lucetta cheek against the smooth hand - rail , as if [she]214-lucetta would make [a friend of it in [her]214-lucetta misery]3319-a friend of it in her misery . Rigid in this position , more and more words fell successively upon [her]214-lucetta ear . But what amazed [her]214-lucetta most was the tone of [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband . [He]122-henchard spoke merely in the accents of [a man who made a present of [his]122-henchard time]3321-a man who made a present of his time . “ One word , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard was saying , as the crackling of paper denoted that [Henchard]122-henchard was unfolding yet another sheet . “ Is it quite fair to [this young woman]5884-this young woman 's memory to read at such length to [a stranger]4470-a stranger what was intended for [your]122-henchard eye alone ? ”[122-henchard] “ Well , yes , ”[122-henchard] said [Henchard]122-henchard . “ By not giving [her]5884-this young woman name [I]122-henchard make it an example of [all womankind]5886-all womankind , and not a scandal to one . ”[122-henchard] “ If [I]122-henchard were [you]122-henchard [I]122-henchard would destroy them , ”[122-henchard] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae , giving more thought to the letters than [he]122-henchard had hitherto done . “ As [[another man]5372-another man 's wife]5888-another man 's wife it would injure [the woman]300-the woman if it were known . ”[122-henchard] “ No , [I]387-her husband shall not destroy [them]5890-them , ”[387-her husband] murmured [Henchard]122-henchard , putting the letters away . Then [he]122-henchard arose , and [Lucetta]214-lucetta heard no more . [She]214-lucetta went back to [[her]214-lucetta bedroom]2688-her bedroom in a semi - paralyzed state . For very fear [she]214-lucetta could not undress , but sat on the edge of the bed , waiting . Would [Henchard]122-henchard let out the secret in [his]122-henchard parting words ? [Her]214-lucetta suspense was terrible . Had [she]214-lucetta confessed all to [Donald]139-farfrae in [their]3323-their early acquaintance [he]122-henchard might possibly have got over it , and married [her]214-lucetta just the same — unlikely as it had once seemed ; but for [her]214-lucetta or [any one else]3324-any one else to tell [him]122-henchard now would be fatal . The door slammed ; [she]214-lucetta could hear [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband bolting it . After looking round in [his]387-her husband customary way [he]387-her husband came leisurely up [the stairs]3326-the stairs . The spark in [her]214-lucetta eyes well - nigh went out when [he]387-her husband appeared round [the bedroom]5077-the bedroom door . [Her]214-lucetta gaze hung doubtful for a moment , then to [her]214-lucetta joyous amazement [she]214-lucetta saw that [he]387-her husband looked at [her]214-lucetta with the rallying smile of one who had just been relieved of a scene that was irksome . [She]214-lucetta could hold out no longer , and sobbed hysterically . When [he]387-her husband had restored [her]214-lucetta [Farfrae]139-farfrae naturally enough spoke of [Henchard]122-henchard . “ Of [all men]5891-all men [he]122-henchard was the least desirable as [a visitor]5644-a visitor , ”[387-her husband] [he]387-her husband said ; “ but it is [my]122-henchard belief that [he]122-henchard 's just a bit crazed . [He]122-henchard has been reading to [me]122-henchard a long lot of letters relating to [his]122-henchard past life ; and [I]122-henchard could do no less than indulge [him]122-henchard by listening . ”[122-henchard] This was sufficient . [Henchard]122-henchard , then , had not told . [Henchard]122-henchard 's last words to [Farfrae]139-farfrae , in short , as [he]387-her husband stood on the doorstep , had been these : “ Well — [I]214-lucetta 'm obliged to [']122-henchard [ee]139-farfrae for listening . [I]214-lucetta may tell more about [her]139-farfrae some day . ”[214-lucetta] Finding this , [she]139-farfrae was much perplexed as to [Henchard]122-henchard 's motives in opening the matter at all ; for in such cases [we]3328-we attribute to [an enemy]1172-an enemy a power of consistent action which [we]3328-we never find in [ourselves]3328-we or in [[our]3328-we friends]3330-our friends ; and forget that abortive efforts from want of heart are as possible to revenge as to generosity . Next morning [Lucetta]214-lucetta remained in bed , meditating how to parry this incipient attack . The bold stroke of telling [Donald]139-farfrae the truth , dimly conceived , was yet too bold ; for [she]214-lucetta dreaded lest in doing so [he]387-her husband , like the rest of [the world]4424-the world , should believe that the episode was rather [her]214-lucetta fault than [her]214-lucetta misfortune . [She]214-lucetta decided to employ persuasion — not with [Donald]139-farfrae but with [the enemy]3332-the enemy [himself]139-farfrae . It seemed the only practicable weapon left [her]214-lucetta as [a woman]647-a woman . Having laid [her]214-lucetta plan [she]214-lucetta rose , and wrote to [him]387-her husband who kept [her]214-lucetta on these tenterhooks : — “ [I]3334-she overheard [your]387-her husband interview with [[my]3334-she husband]2965-my husband last night , and saw the drift of [your]387-her husband revenge . The very thought of it crushes [me]3334-she ! Have pity on [a distressed woman]5894-a distressed woman ! If [you]387-her husband could see [me]3334-she [you]387-her husband would relent . [You]387-her husband do not know how anxiety has told upon [me]3334-she lately . [I]3334-she will be at [the Ring]80-the ring at the time [you]387-her husband leave work — just before the sun goes down . Please come that way . [I]3334-she can not rest till [I]3334-she have seen [you]387-her husband face to face , and heard from [your]387-her husband mouth that [you]387-her husband will carry this horse - play no further . ”[3334-she] To [herself]3334-she [she]3334-she said , on closing up [her]3334-she appeal : “ If ever tears and pleadings have served [the weak]5895-the weak to fight the strong , let [them]5895-the weak do so now ! ”[3341-he] With this view [she]3334-she made a toilette which differed from all [she]3334-she had ever attempted before . To heighten [her]3334-she natural attraction had hitherto been the unvarying endeavour of [her]3334-she adult life , and one in which [she]3334-she was [no novice]3335-no novice . But now [she]3334-she neglected this , and even proceeded to impair the natural presentation . Beyond a natural reason for [her]3334-she slightly drawn look , [she]3334-she had not slept all the previous night , and this had produced upon [her]3334-she pretty though slightly worn features the aspect of a countenance ageing prematurely from extreme sorrow . [She]3334-she selected — as much from want of spirit as design — [her]3334-she poorest , plainest and longest discarded attire . To avoid the contingency of being recognized [she]3334-she veiled [herself]3334-she , and slipped out of [the house]782-the house quickly . The sun was resting on [the hill]328-the hill like a drop of blood on an eyelid by the time [she]3334-she had got up [the road]320-the road opposite [the amphitheatre]1383-the amphitheatre , which [she]3334-she speedily entered . [The interior]2851-the interior was shadowy , and emphatic of the absence of every living thing . [She]3334-she was not disappointed in the fearful hope with which [she]3334-she awaited [him]3341-he . [Henchard]122-henchard came over the top , descended and [Lucetta]214-lucetta waited breathlessly . But having reached [the arena]1388-the arena [she]214-lucetta saw a change in [his]3341-he bearing : [he]3341-he stood still at a little distance from [her]214-lucetta ; [she]214-lucetta could not think why . Nor could [any one else]3324-any one else have known . The truth was that in appointing this spot , and this hour , for the rendezvous , [Lucetta]214-lucetta had unwittingly backed up [her]214-lucetta entreaty by the strongest argument [she]214-lucetta could have used outside words , with [this man of moods , glooms , and superstitions]3344-this man of moods , glooms , and superstitions . [Her]214-lucetta figure in the midst of [the huge enclosure]3345-the huge enclosure , the unusual plainness of [her]214-lucetta dress , [her]214-lucetta attitude of hope and appeal , so strongly revived in [his]3341-he soul the memory of [another ill - used woman who had stood there and thus in bygone days]3346-another ill - used woman who had stood there and thus in bygone days , and had now passed away into [her]214-lucetta rest , that [he]3341-he was unmanned , and [his]3341-he heart smote [him]3341-he for having attempted reprisals on one of a sex so weak . When [he]3341-he approached [her]214-lucetta , and before [she]214-lucetta had spoken a word , [her]214-lucetta point was half gained . [His]3341-he manner as [he]3341-he had come down had been one of cynical carelessness ; but [he]3341-he now put away [his]3341-he grim half - smile , and said , in a kindly subdued tone , “ Goodnight t'ye . Of course [I]214-lucetta 'm glad to come if [you]214-lucetta want [me]214-lucetta . ”[214-lucetta] “ O , thank [you]122-henchard , ”[3341-he] [she]214-lucetta said apprehensively . “ [I]214-lucetta am sorry to see ' [ee]214-lucetta looking so ill , ”[214-lucetta] [he]3341-he stammered with unconcealed compunction . [She]214-lucetta shook [her]214-lucetta head . “ How can [you]122-henchard be sorry , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta asked , “ when [you]122-henchard deliberately cause it ? ”[122-henchard] “ What ! ”[122-henchard] said [Henchard]122-henchard uneasily . “ Is it anything [I]214-lucetta have done that has pulled [you]214-lucetta down like that ? ”[214-lucetta] “ It is all [your]122-henchard doing , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta said . “ [I]122-henchard have no other grief . [My]122-henchard happiness would be secure enough but for [your]122-henchard threats . O [Michael]120-henchard ! do n't wreck [me]122-henchard like this ! [You]122-henchard might think that [you]122-henchard have done enough ! When [I]122-henchard came [here]4417-here [I]122-henchard was [a young woman]5897-a young woman ; now [I]122-henchard am rapidly becoming [an old one]2844-an old one . Neither [[my]122-henchard husband]2965-my husband nor [any other man]3299-any other man will regard [me]122-henchard with interest long . ”[122-henchard] [Henchard]122-henchard was disarmed . [His]122-henchard old feeling of supercilious pity for [womankind]4868-womankind in general was intensified by this suppliant appearing here as [the double of the first]3348-the double of the first . Moreover that thoughtless want of foresight which had led to all [her]3349-you trouble remained with poor [Lucetta]214-lucetta still ; [she]3349-you had come to meet [him]122-henchard here in this compromising way without perceiving the risk . [Such a woman]3350-such a woman was very small deer to hunt ; [he]122-henchard felt ashamed , lost all zest and desire to humiliate [Lucetta]214-lucetta there and then , and no longer envied [Farfrae]139-farfrae [his]122-henchard bargain . [He]122-henchard had married money , but nothing more . [Henchard]122-henchard was anxious to wash [his]122-henchard hands of the game . “ Well , what do [you]3349-you want [me]122-henchard to do ? ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said gently . “ [I]122-henchard am sure [I]122-henchard shall be very willing . [My]122-henchard reading of those letters was only a sort of practical joke , and [I]122-henchard revealed nothing . ”[122-henchard] “ To give [me]122-henchard back the letters and any papers [you]3349-you may have that breathe of matrimony or worse . ”[122-henchard] “ So be it . Every scrap shall be [yours]3349-you .... But , between [you]3349-you and [me]214-lucetta , [Lucetta]214-lucetta , [he]5901-he is sure to find out something of the matter , sooner or later . ”[214-lucetta] “ Ah ! ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta said with eager tremulousness ; “ but not till [I]122-henchard have proved [myself]122-henchard [a faithful and deserving wife to [him]5901-he]5902-a faithful and deserving wife to him , and then [he]5901-he may forgive [me]122-henchard everything ! ”[122-henchard] [Henchard]122-henchard silently looked at [her]214-lucetta : [he]122-henchard almost envied [Farfrae]139-farfrae such love as that , even now . “ H'm — [I]122-henchard hope so , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said . “ But [you]214-lucetta shall have the letters without fail . And [your]214-lucetta secret shall be kept . [I]122-henchard swear it . ”[122-henchard] “ How good [you]214-lucetta are ! — how shall [I]122-henchard get them ? ”[122-henchard] [He]122-henchard reflected , and said [he]122-henchard would send them the next morning . “ Now do n't doubt [me]122-henchard , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard added . “ [I]214-lucetta can keep [my]214-lucetta word . ”[214-lucetta]

Returning from [her]214-lucetta appointment [Lucetta]214-lucetta saw [a man]4474-a man waiting by the lamp nearest to [her]214-lucetta own door . When [she]214-lucetta stopped to go in [he]4474-a man came and spoke to [her]214-lucetta . It was [Jopp]137-jopp . [He]4474-a man begged [her]214-lucetta pardon for addressing [her]214-lucetta . But [he]4474-a man had heard that [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae had been applied to by [a neighbouring corn - merchant]3352-a neighbouring corn - merchant to recommend [a working partner]3353-a working partner ; if so [he]149-farfrae wished to offer [himself]149-farfrae . [He]149-farfrae could give good security , and had stated as much to [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae in a letter ; but [he]4474-a man would feel much obliged if [Lucetta]214-lucetta would say a word in [his]4474-a man favour to [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband . “ It is a thing [I]137-jopp know nothing about , ”[137-jopp] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta coldly . “ But [you]214-lucetta can testify to [my]137-jopp trustworthiness better than [anybody]4437-anybody , [ma'am]618-ma'am , ”[137-jopp] said [Jopp]137-jopp . “ [I]214-lucetta was in [Jersey]43-jersey several years , and knew [you]214-lucetta there by sight . ”[214-lucetta] “ Indeed , ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta replied . “ But [I]137-jopp knew nothing of [you]137-jopp . ”[137-jopp] “ [I]122-henchard think , [ma'am]618-ma'am , that a word or two from [you]618-ma'am would secure for [me]122-henchard what [I]122-henchard covet very much , ”[122-henchard] [he]137-jopp persisted . [She]214-lucetta steadily refused to have anything to do with the affair , and cutting [him]137-jopp short , because of [her]214-lucetta anxiety to get indoors before [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband should miss [her]214-lucetta , left [him]137-jopp on [the pavement]1160-the pavement . [He]137-jopp watched [her]214-lucetta till [she]214-lucetta had vanished , and then went [home]675-home . When [he]137-jopp got [there]447-there [he]137-jopp sat down in the fireless chimney corner looking at the iron dogs , and the wood laid across [them]3359-them for heating the morning kettle . A movement [upstairs]1000-upstairs disturbed [him]137-jopp , and [Henchard]122-henchard came down from [[his]122-henchard bedroom]1977-his bedroom , where [he]122-henchard seemed to have been rummaging boxes . “ [I]122-henchard wish , ”[122-henchard] said [Henchard]122-henchard , “ [you]137-jopp would do [me]3363-his lodger a service , [Jopp]137-jopp , now — to - night , [I]3363-his lodger mean , if [you]137-jopp can . Leave this at [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae 's for [her]139-farfrae . [I]3363-his lodger should take it [myself]3363-his lodger , of course , but [I]3363-his lodger do n't wish to be seen [there]447-there . ”[3363-his lodger] [He]122-henchard handed a package in brown paper , sealed . [Henchard]122-henchard had been as good as [his]122-henchard word . Immediately on coming [indoors]4777-indoors [he]122-henchard had searched over [his]122-henchard few belongings , and every scrap of [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's writing that [he]122-henchard possessed was here . [Jopp]137-jopp indifferently expressed [his]137-jopp willingness . “ Well , how have [ye]137-jopp got on to - day ? ”[3363-his lodger] [[his]122-henchard lodger]3363-his lodger asked . “ Any prospect of an opening ? ”[137-jopp] “ [I]122-henchard am afraid not , ”[122-henchard] said [Jopp]137-jopp , who had not told the other of [his]137-jopp application to [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “ There never will be in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , ”[122-henchard] declared [Henchard]122-henchard decisively . “ [You]137-jopp must roam further afield . ”[159-mrs. cuxsom] [He]122-henchard said goodnight to [Jopp]137-jopp , and returned to [[his]122-henchard own part of [the house]782-the house]3364-his own part of the house . [Jopp]137-jopp sat on till [his]137-jopp eyes were attracted by the shadow of the candle - snuff on the wall , and looking at the original [he]137-jopp found that it had formed itself into a head like a red - hot cauliflower . [Henchard]122-henchard 's packet next met [his]137-jopp gaze . [He]137-jopp knew there had been something of the nature of wooing between [Henchard]122-henchard and [the now Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae ; and [his]137-jopp vague ideas on the subject narrowed themselves down to these : [Henchard]122-henchard had a parcel belonging to [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae , and [he]122-henchard had reasons for not returning that parcel to [her]139-farfrae in person . What could be inside it ? So [he]137-jopp went on and on till , animated by resentment at [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's haughtiness , as [he]137-jopp thought it , and curiosity to learn if there were any weak sides to this transaction with [Henchard]122-henchard , [he]137-jopp examined the package . The pen and all its relations being awkward tools in [Henchard]122-henchard 's hands [he]137-jopp had affixed the seals without an impression , it never occurring to [him]137-jopp that the efficacy of such a fastening depended on this . [Jopp]137-jopp was far less of [a tyro]3366-a tyro ; [he]137-jopp lifted one of the seals with [his]137-jopp penknife , peeped in at the end thus opened , saw that the bundle consisted of letters ; and , having satisfied [himself]137-jopp thus far , sealed up the end again by simply softening the wax with the candle , and went off with the parcel as requested . [His]137-jopp path was by [the river - side]3367-the river - side at [the foot of [the town]632-the town]3368-the foot of the town . Coming into the light at [the bridge which stood at the end of [High Street]3371-high street]3370-the bridge which stood at the end of high street [he]137-jopp beheld lounging thereon [Mother Cuxsom]145-mother cuxsom and [Nance Mockridge]158-nance . “ [We]5907-we be just going down [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane way , to look into [Peter]230-peter 's Finger afore creeping to bed , ”[159-mrs. cuxsom] said [Mrs. Cuxsom]159-mrs. cuxsom . “ There 's a fiddle and tambourine going on there . [Lord]5908-lord , what 's all [the world]4424-the world — do [ye]137-jopp come along too , [Jopp]137-jopp — ' twon't hinder [ye]137-jopp five minutes . ”[3433-copyholders] [Jopp]137-jopp had mostly kept [himself]137-jopp out of this company , but present circumstances made [him]137-jopp somewhat more reckless than usual , and without many words [he]137-jopp decided to go to [his]137-jopp destination that way . Though [the upper part of [Durnover]15-durnover]3372-the upper part of durnover was mainly composed of [a curious congeries of [barns]1627-barns and [farm - steads]3375-farm - steads]3373-a curious congeries of barns and farm - steads , there was [a less picturesque side to [the parish]3377-the parish]3376-a less picturesque side to the parish . This was [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane , now in great part pulled down . [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane was [the Adullam of [all [the surrounding villages]3380-the surrounding villages]3379-all the surrounding villages]3378-the adullam of all the surrounding villages .
