[It]66-mixen lane was the hiding - place of [those who were in distress , and in debt , and trouble of every kind]3381-those who were in distress , and in debt , and trouble of every kind . [Farm - labourers]3382-farm - labourers and [other peasants , who combined a little poaching with [their]3383-other peasants , who combined a little poaching with their farming , and a little brawling and bibbing with their poaching farming , and a little brawling and bibbing with [their]3383-other peasants , who combined a little poaching with their farming , and a little brawling and bibbing with their poaching poaching]3383-other peasants , who combined a little poaching with their farming , and a little brawling and bibbing with their poaching , found [themselves]3383-other peasants , who combined a little poaching with their farming , and a little brawling and bibbing with their poaching sooner or later in [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane . [Rural mechanics]3384-rural mechanics too idle to mechanize , [rural servants]3385-rural servants too rebellious to serve , drifted or were forced into [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane . [The lane]5182-the lane and [[its]5182-the lane surrounding thicket of [thatched cottages]3388-thatched cottages]3387-its surrounding thicket of thatched cottages stretched out like a spit into [the moist and misty lowland]3389-the moist and misty lowland . Much that was sad , much that was low , some things that were baneful , could be seen in [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane . [Vice]250-vice ran freely in and out certain of the doors in [the neighbourhood]1758-the neighbourhood ; recklessness dwelt under the roof with the crooked chimney ; shame in some bow - windows ; theft ( in times of privation ) in [the thatched and mud - walled houses by the sallows]3391-the thatched and mud - walled houses by the sallows . Even slaughter had not been altogether unknown [here]4417-here . In [a block of cottages up an alley]3393-a block of cottages up an alley there might have been erected an altar to disease in years gone by . Such was [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane in the times when [Henchard]122-henchard and [Farfrae]139-farfrae were [Mayors]251-mayors . Yet this mildewed leaf in the sturdy and flourishing Casterbridge plant lay close to [the open country]3394-the open country ; not a hundred yards from a row of noble elms , and commanding a view across [the moor]3395-the moor of [airy uplands]3396-airy uplands and [corn - fields]3397-corn - fields , and [mansions of the great]3398-mansions of the great . [A brook]3399-a brook divided [the moor]3395-the moor from [the tenements]3401-the tenements , and to outward view there was no way across [it]3399-a brook — no way to [the houses]2475-the houses but round about by [the road]320-the road . But under [every householder]3404-every householder 's stairs there was kept a mysterious plank nine inches wide ; which plank was [a secret bridge]3405-a secret bridge . If [you]3406-you , as [one of [those refugee householders]3408-those refugee householders]3407-one of those refugee householders , came in from business after dark — and this was the business time here — [you]3406-you stealthily crossed [the moor]3395-the moor , approached [the border of [the aforesaid brook]3411-the aforesaid brook]3410-the border of the aforesaid brook , and whistled opposite [the house to which [you]3406-you belonged]3412-the house to which you belonged . A shape thereupon made its appearance on the other side bearing the bridge on end against the sky ; it was lowered ; [you]3406-you crossed , and a hand helped [you]3406-you to land [yourself]3406-you , together with the pheasants and hares gathered from [neighbouring manors]3413-neighbouring manors . [You]3406-you sold [them]3414-them slily the next morning , and the day after [you]3406-you stood before [the magistrates]5583-the magistrates with the eyes of all [[your]3406-you sympathizing neighbours]3416-your sympathizing neighbours concentrated on [your]3406-you back . [You]3406-you disappeared for a time ; then [you]3406-you were again found quietly living in [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane . Walking along [the lane]5182-the lane at dusk [the stranger]2118-the stranger was struck by two or three peculiar features therein . One was an intermittent rumbling from [the back premises of [the inn]939-the inn]3419-the back premises of the inn half - way up ; this meant [a skittle alley]3421-a skittle alley . Another was the extensive prevalence of whistling in [the various domiciles]3422-the various domiciles — a piped note of some kind coming from nearly every open door . Another was the frequency of white aprons over dingy gowns among [the women around the doorways]3423-the women around the doorways . A white apron is a suspicious vesture in situations where spotlessness is difficult ; moreover , the industry and cleanliness which the white apron expressed were belied by the postures and gaits of [the women who wore it]3424-the women who wore it — [their]3424-the women who wore it knuckles being mostly on [their]3424-the women who wore it hips ( an attitude which lent [them]3424-the women who wore it the aspect of two - handled mugs ) , and [their]3424-the women who wore it shoulders against door - posts ; while there was a curious alacrity in the turn of [each honest woman]3425-each honest woman 's head upon [her]3425-each honest woman neck and in the twirl of [her]3425-each honest woman honest eyes , at any noise resembling a masculine footfall along [the lane]5182-the lane . Yet amid so much that was bad needy respectability also found [a home]1987-a home . [Families from [decayed villages]3431-decayed villages]3430-families from decayed villages — [families of that once bulky]3432-families of that once bulky , but now nearly extinct , section of village society called “ [liviers , ”[3473-a deposed keeper] or lifeholders]5910-liviers , ” or lifeholders — [copyholders]3433-copyholders and others , whose roof - trees had fallen for some reason or other , compelling [them]3430-families from decayed villages to quit the rural spot that had been [[their]3430-families from decayed villages home for generations]3434-their home for generations — came [here]4417-here , unless [they]3430-families from decayed villages chose to lie under a hedge by the wayside . [The inn called [Peter]230-peter 's Finger]3436-the inn called peter 's finger was [the church of [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane]3437-the church of mixen lane . [It]3436-the inn called peter 's finger was centrally situate , as [such places]3438-such places should be , and bore about the same social relation to the Three Mariners as the latter bore to [[the King]1084-the king 's Arms]945-the king 's arms . At first sight [the inn]939-the inn was so respectable as to be puzzling . The front door was kept shut , and the step was so clean that evidently but [few persons]3442-few persons entered over [its]3436-the inn called peter 's finger sanded surface . But at the corner of [the public - house]3443-the public - house was [an alley]3444-an alley , a mere slit , dividing [it]3436-the inn called peter 's finger from [the next building]3445-the next building . Half - way up [the alley]2211-the alley was a narrow door , shiny and paintless from the rub of infinite hands and shoulders . This was the actual entrance to [the inn]939-the inn . [A pedestrian]3448-a pedestrian would be seen abstractedly passing along [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane ; and then , in a moment , [he]3448-a pedestrian would vanish , causing [the gazer]3449-the gazer to blink like [Ashton]252-ashton at the disappearance of [Ravenswood]253-ravenswood . [That abstracted pedestrian]3450-that abstracted pedestrian had edged into the slit by the adroit fillip of [[his]3448-a pedestrian person]3451-his person sideways ; from the slit [he]3448-a pedestrian edged into [the tavern]3452-the tavern by a similar exercise of skill . [Waifs and strays of all sorts]3458-waifs and strays of all sorts loitered about here . [The landlady]972-the landlady was [a virtuous woman who years ago had been unjustly sent to gaol as an accessory to something or other after the fact]3460-a virtuous woman who years ago had been unjustly sent to gaol as an accessory to something or other after the fact . [She]972-the landlady underwent [her]972-the landlady twelvemonth , and had worn [a martyr]3461-a martyr 's countenance ever since , except at times of meeting [the constable who apprehended [her]972-the landlady]3462-the constable who apprehended her , when [she]972-the landlady winked [her]972-the landlady eye . To [this house]5155-this house [Jopp]137-jopp and [[his]137-jopp acquaintances]3464-his acquaintances had arrived . The settles on which [they]3465-they sat down were thin and tall , their tops being guyed by pieces of twine to hooks in the ceiling ; for when [the guests]404-the guests grew boisterous the settles would rock and overturn without some such security . The thunder of bowls echoed from [the backyard]3467-the backyard ; swingels hung behind the blower of the chimney ; and [ex - poachers]3468-ex - poachers and [ex - gamekeepers]3469-ex - gamekeepers , whom [squires]3470-squires had persecuted without a cause , sat elbowing [each other]4626-each other — [men who in past times had met in fights under the moon , till lapse of sentences on the one part , and loss of favour and expulsion from service on the other]3472-men who in past times had met in fights under the moon , till lapse of sentences on the one part , and loss of favour and expulsion from service on the other , brought [them]3465-they here together to a common level , where [they]3465-they sat calmly discussing old times . “ Dost mind how [you]3473-a deposed keeper could jerk a trout ashore with a bramble , and not ruffle [the stream]5911-the stream , [Charl]254-charl ? ”[3473-a deposed keeper] [a deposed keeper]3473-a deposed keeper was saying . “ ' Twas at that [I]3474-the keeper caught ' [ee]5912-ee once , if [you]3473-a deposed keeper can mind ? ”[3474-the keeper] “ That [I]137-jopp can . But the worst larry for [me]137-jopp was that pheasant business at [Yalbury Wood]81-yalbury wood . [[Your]3473-a deposed keeper wife]4877-your wife swore false that time , [Joe]190-joe — O , by [Gad]255-gad , [she]4877-your wife did — there 's no denying it . ”[137-jopp] “ How was that ? ”[137-jopp] asked [Jopp]137-jopp . “ Why — [Joe]190-joe closed wi ' [me]3474-the keeper , and [we]5914-we rolled down together , close to [[his]190-joe garden hedge]5915-his garden hedge . Ah well — ' tis over now . ”[3474-the keeper] “ [I]3474-the keeper might have had ' ee days afore that , ”[3474-the keeper] said [the keeper]3474-the keeper . “ [I]3475-the furmity - woman , who , lately settled in this purlieu was within a few yards of ' ee dozens of times , with a sight more of birds than that poor one . ”[3475-the furmity - woman , who , lately settled in this purlieu] “ Yes — ' tis not [our]5914-we greatest doings that [the world]4424-the world gets wind of , ”[137-jopp] said [the furmity - woman , who , lately settled in this purlieu]3475-the furmity - woman , who , lately settled in this purlieu , sat among [the rest]494-the rest . [He]2118-the stranger was dressed with a certain clumsy richness — [his]2118-the stranger coat being furred , and [his]2118-the stranger head covered by a cap of seal - skin , which , though the nights were chilly , must have been warm for the daytime , spring being somewhat advanced . In [his]2118-the stranger hand [he]2118-the stranger carried a small mahogany case , strapped , and clamped with brass . This was barred , and while [the landlady]972-the landlady was unfastening it the conversation about [the skimmington]3509-the skimmington was continued in [the sitting - room]2510-the sitting - room , and reached [his]2118-the stranger ears . “ What do [they]5940-they mean by a ' skimmity - ride ' ? ”[972-the landlady] [he]2118-the stranger asked . “ O , [sir]4588-sir ! ”[972-the landlady] said [the landlady]972-the landlady , swinging [her]972-the landlady long earrings with deprecating modesty ; “ ' tis a ' old foolish thing [they]3512-they do in these parts when [[a man]4474-a man 's wife]5943-a man 's wife is — well , not too particularly [his]4474-a man own . But as [a respectable householder]5944-a respectable householder [I]0-i do n't encourage it . “[0-i] Still , are [they]3512-they going to do it shortly ? Wait a moment . ” [He]0-i turned back , entered [the sitting - room]2510-the sitting - room , and said , “[256-george] [Here]4417-here , [good folks]3515-good folks ; [I]0-i should like to see the old custom [you]3515-good folks are talking of , and [I]0-i do n't mind being something towards it — take that . ” [He]0-i threw a sovereign on the table and returned to [the landlady]972-the landlady at the door , of whom , having inquired the way into [the town]632-the town , [he]0-i took [his]0-i leave . “[256-george] There were more where that one came from , ” said [Charl]254-charl when [the sovereign]5948-the sovereign had been taken up and handed to [the landlady]972-the landlady for safe keeping . “[126-god] By [George]256-george ! [we]3516-we ought to have got a few more while [we]3516-we had [him]256-george [here]4417-here . ” “[126-god] No , no , ” answered [the landlady]972-the landlady . “[0-i] This is [a respectable house]3518-a respectable house , thank [God]126-god ! And [I]0-i 'll have nothing done but what 's honourable . ” “[0-i] Well , ” said [Jopp]137-jopp ; “[3516-we] now [we]3516-we 'll consider the business begun , and will soon get it in train . ” “[3516-we] [We]3516-we will ! ” said [Nance]158-nance . “[3516-we] A good laugh warms [my]0-i heart more than a cordial , and that 's the truth on't . ” [Jopp]137-jopp gathered up the letters , and it being now somewhat late [he]137-jopp did not attempt to call at [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's with [them]5951-its that night . [He]137-jopp reached [home]675-home , sealed them up as before , and delivered the parcel at [its]5951-its address next morning . Within an hour [its]5951-its contents were reduced to ashes by [Lucetta]214-lucetta , who , [poor soul]1947-poor soul ! was inclined to fall down on [her]214-lucetta knees in thankfulness that at last no evidence remained of the unlucky episode with [Henchard]122-henchard in [her]214-lucetta past . For though [hers]214-lucetta had been rather the laxity of inadvertence than of intention , that episode , if known , was not the less likely to operate fatally between [herself]214-lucetta and [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband .[122-henchard]

Such was the state of things when the current affairs of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge were interrupted by an event of such magnitude that its influence reached to the lowest social stratum there , stirring the depths of [its]6-casterbridge society simultaneously with the preparations for the skimmington . It was one of those excitements which , when [they]3519-they move [a country town]3520-a country town , leave permanent mark upon [its]3520-a country town chronicles , as a warm summer permanently marks the ring in the tree - trunk corresponding to its date . [A Royal Personage]3521-a royal personage was about to pass through [the borough]1619-the borough on [his]3521-a royal personage course further west , to inaugurate an immense engineering work out that way . [He]3521-a royal personage had consented to halt half - an - hour or so in [the town]632-the town , and to receive an address from [the corporation of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]3524-the corporation of casterbridge , which , as [a representative centre of husbandry]3525-a representative centre of husbandry , wished thus to express [its]3524-the corporation of casterbridge sense of the great services [he]3521-a royal personage had rendered to agricultural science and economics , by [his]3521-a royal personage zealous promotion of designs for placing the art of farming on a more scientific footing . [Royalty]3526-royalty had not been seen in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge since the days of [the third King George]3527-the third king george , and then only by candlelight for a few minutes , when [that monarch , on a night - journey]3528-that monarch , on a night - journey , had stopped to change horses at [the King 's Arms]945-the king 's arms . [The inhabitants]780-the inhabitants therefore decided to make a thorough fete carillonee of the unwonted occasion . Half - an - hour 's pause was not long , it is true ; but much might be done in it by a judicious grouping of incidents , above all , if the weather were fine . The address was prepared on parchment by [an artist who was handy at ornamental lettering , and was laid on with the best gold - leaf and colours that [the sign - painter]3532-the sign - painter had in [his]3532-the sign - painter shop]3531-an artist who was handy at ornamental lettering , and was laid on with the best gold - leaf and colours that the sign - painter had in his shop . [The Council]2127-the council had met on the Tuesday before the appointed day , to arrange the details of the procedure . While [they]2127-the council were sitting , the door of [the Council Chamber]3534-the council chamber standing open , [they]2127-the council heard a heavy footstep coming up the stairs . [It]3535-it advanced along [the passage]1731-the passage , and [Henchard]122-henchard entered [the room]985-the room , in clothes of frayed and threadbare shabbiness , the very clothes which [he]122-henchard had used to wear in the primal days when [he]122-henchard had sat among [them]2127-the council . “ [I]122-henchard have a feeling , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said , advancing to the table and laying [his]122-henchard hand upon the green cloth , “ that [I]122-henchard should like to join [ye]2127-the council in this reception of [[our]2127-the council illustrious visitor]5955-our illustrious visitor . [I]122-henchard suppose [I]122-henchard could walk with the rest ? ”[122-henchard] Embarrassed glances were exchanged by [the Council]2127-the council and [Grower]229-mr. grower nearly ate the end of [his]229-mr. grower quill - pen off , so gnawed [he]229-mr. grower it during the silence . [Farfrae]139-farfrae [the young Mayor , who by virtue of [his]122-henchard office]3539-the young mayor , who by virtue of his office sat in the large chair , intuitively caught the sense of the meeting , and as spokesman was obliged to utter it , glad as [he]122-henchard would have been that the duty should have fallen to another tongue . “ [I]122-henchard hardly see that it would be proper , [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard , ”[122-henchard] said [he]122-henchard . “ [The Council]79-the council are [the Council]79-the council , and as [ye]2127-the council are no longer [one of [the body]5957-the body]5956-one of the body , there would be an irregularity in the proceeding . If [ye]2127-the council were included , why not [others]860-others ? ”[139-farfrae] “ [I]122-henchard have a particular reason for wishing to assist at the ceremony . ”[122-henchard] [Farfrae]139-farfrae looked round . “ [I]122-henchard think [I]122-henchard have expressed the feeling of [the Council]2127-the council , ”[122-henchard] [he]122-henchard said . “ Yes , yes , ”[260-lawyer long] from [Dr. Bath]259-dr. bath , [Lawyer Long]260-lawyer long , [Alderman Tubber]176-alderman tubber , and several more . “ Then [I]120-henchard am not to be allowed to have anything to do with it officially ? ”[120-henchard] “ [I]120-henchard am afraid so ; it is out of the question , indeed . But of course [you]2127-the council can see the doings full well , such as they are to be , like the rest of [the spectators]452-the spectators . ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard did not reply to that very obvious suggestion , and , turning on [his]120-henchard heel , went away . It had been only a passing fancy of [his]120-henchard , but opposition crystallized it into a determination . “ [I]120-henchard 'll welcome [[his]120-henchard Royal Highness]5961-his royal highness , or [nobody]298-nobody shall ! ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard went about saying . “ [I]120-henchard am not going to be sat upon by [Farfrae]139-farfrae , or any of [the rest of [the paltry crew]5964-the paltry crew]5963-the rest of the paltry crew ! [You]139-farfrae shall see . ”[120-henchard] The eventful morning was bright , a full - faced sun confronting [early window - gazers]3540-early window - gazers eastward , and all perceived ( for [they]3540-early window - gazers were practised in weather - lore ) that there was permanence in the glow . [Visitors]348-visitors soon began to flock in from [county houses]3542-county houses , [villages]3543-villages , [remote copses]3544-remote copses , and [lonely uplands]3545-lonely uplands , [the latter in oiled boots and tilt bonnets]3546-the latter in oiled boots and tilt bonnets , to see the reception , or if not to see it , at any rate to be near [it]3547-it . There was hardly [a workman in [the town]632-the town who did not put a clean shirt on]3548-a workman in the town who did not put a clean shirt on . [Solomon Longways]131-longways , [Christopher Coney]132-christopher coney , [Buzzford]142-buzzford , and [the rest of [that fraternity]3551-that fraternity]3550-the rest of that fraternity , showed [their]3540-early window - gazers sense of the occasion by advancing [their]3540-early window - gazers customary eleven o'clock pint to half - past ten ; from which [they]3540-early window - gazers found a difficulty in getting back to the proper hour for several days . [Henchard]120-henchard had determined to do no work that day . [He]120-henchard primed [himself]120-henchard in the morning with a glass of rum , and walking down [the street]797-the street met [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , whom [he]120-henchard had not seen for a week . “ It was lucky , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said to [her]191-henchard , “ [my]191-henchard twenty - one years had expired before this came on , or [I]191-henchard should never have had the nerve to carry it out . ”[191-henchard] “ Carry out what ? ”[191-henchard] said [she]191-henchard , alarmed . “ This welcome [I]191-henchard am going to give [[our]5965-our Royal visitor]5966-our royal visitor . ”[191-henchard] [She]191-henchard was perplexed . “ Shall [we]5965-our go and see it together ? ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said . “ See it ! [I]3603-all the ladies have other fish to fry . [You]5242-her stepfather see it . It will be worth seeing ! ”[3603-all the ladies] [She]191-henchard could do nothing to elucidate this , and decked [herself]191-henchard out with a heavy heart . As the appointed time drew near [she]191-henchard got sight again of [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather . [She]191-henchard thought [he]5242-her stepfather was going to [the Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners ; but no , [he]5242-her stepfather elbowed [his]5242-her stepfather way through [the gay throng]3555-the gay throng to [the shop of Woolfrey]3556-the shop of woolfrey , [the draper]3557-the draper . [She]191-henchard waited in [the crowd]347-the crowd without . In a few minutes [he]5242-her stepfather emerged , wearing , to [her]191-henchard surprise , a brilliant rosette , while more surprising still , in [his]5242-her stepfather hand [he]5242-her stepfather carried a flag of somewhat homely construction , formed by tacking one of the small Union Jacks , which abounded in [the town]632-the town to - day , to the end of a deal wand — probably the roller from a piece of calico . [Henchard]191-henchard rolled up [his]5242-her stepfather flag on the doorstep , put it under [his]5242-her stepfather arm , and went down [the street]797-the street . Suddenly [the taller members of [the crowd]347-the crowd]3561-the taller members of the crowd turned [their]3561-the taller members of the crowd heads , and [the shorter]3563-the shorter stood on tiptoe . It was said that [the Royal cortege]3564-the royal cortege approached . [The railway]3565-the railway had stretched out an arm towards [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge at this time , but had not reached [it]6-casterbridge by several miles as yet ; so that the intervening distance , as well as the remainder of the journey , was to be traversed by [road]3566-road in the old fashion . [People]1161-people thus waited — [the county families]3568-the county families in [[their]3568-the county families carriages]3569-their carriages , [the masses on foot]3570-the masses on foot — and watched [the far - stretching [London]63-london highway]3571-the far - stretching london highway to the ringing of bells and chatter of tongues . From the background [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard watched the scene . Some seats had been arranged from which [ladies]5334-ladies could witness the spectacle , and the front seat was occupied by [Lucetta]214-lucetta , [[the Mayor]4556-the mayor 's wife]3574-the mayor 's wife , just at present . In [the road]320-the road under [her]214-lucetta eyes stood [Henchard]191-henchard . [She]191-henchard appeared so bright and pretty that , as it seemed , [he]4556-the mayor was experiencing the momentary weakness of wishing for [her]214-lucetta notice . But [he]4556-the mayor was far from attractive to [a woman]647-a woman 's eye , ruled as that is so largely by the superficies of things . [He]4556-the mayor was not only [a journeyman]3132-a journeyman , unable to appear as [he]4556-the mayor formerly had appeared , but [he]4556-the mayor disdained to appear as well as [he]4556-the mayor might . [Everybody else]3578-everybody else , from [the Mayor]4556-the mayor to [the washerwoman]3580-the washerwoman , shone in new vesture according to means ; but [Henchard]191-henchard had doggedly retained the fretted and weather - beaten garments of bygone years . Hence , alas , this occurred : [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's eyes slid over [him]4556-the mayor to this side and to that without anchoring on [his]4556-the mayor features — as [gaily dressed women]3581-gaily dressed women 's eyes will too often do on such occasions . [Her]214-lucetta manner signified quite plainly that [she]214-lucetta meant to know [him]4556-the mayor in public no more . But [she]214-lucetta was never tired of watching [Donald]139-farfrae , as [he]4556-the mayor stood in animated converse with [[his]4556-the mayor friends]2136-his friends a few yards off , wearing round [his]4556-the mayor young neck the official gold chain with great square links , like that round the Royal unicorn . Every trifling emotion that [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband showed as [he]387-her husband talked had its reflex on [her]214-lucetta face and lips , which moved in little duplicates to [his]387-her husband . [She]214-lucetta was living [his]4556-the mayor part rather than [her]214-lucetta own , and cared for [no one]437-no one 's situation but [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's that day . At length [a man stationed at the furthest turn of [the high road]3586-the high road]3585-a man stationed at the furthest turn of the high road , namely , on [the second bridge of which mention has been made]3587-the second bridge of which mention has been made , gave a signal , and [the Corporation]1875-the corporation in [their]1875-the corporation robes proceeded from the front of [the Town Hall]5606-the town hall to the archway erected at the entrance to [the town]632-the town . [The carriages containing [the Royal visitor]3592-the royal visitor and [[his]4556-the mayor suite]3593-his suite]3591-the carriages containing the royal visitor and his suite arrived at [the spot]521-the spot in a cloud of dust , a procession was formed , and [the whole]3595-the whole came on to [the Town Hall]5606-the town hall at a walking pace . [This spot]1420-this spot was the centre of interest . There were a few clear yards in front of [the Royal carriage]3598-the royal carriage , sanded ; and into [this space]3599-this space [a man]4474-a man stepped before any one could prevent [him]4474-a man . It was [Henchard]191-henchard . [He]4474-a man had unrolled [his]4474-a man private flag , and removing [his]4474-a man hat [he]4474-a man staggered to the side of [the slowing vehicle]3601-the slowing vehicle , waving the Union Jack to and fro with [his]4474-a man left hand while [he]4474-a man blandly held out [his]4474-a man right to [the Illustrious Personage]3602-the illustrious personage . [All the ladies]3603-all the ladies said with bated breath , “ O , look there ! ”[262-mrs. blowbody] and [Lucetta]214-lucetta was ready to faint . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard peeped through the shoulders of [those in front]3604-those in front , saw what it was , and was terrified ; and then [her]191-henchard interest in the spectacle as a strange phenomenon got the better of [her]191-henchard fear . [Farfrae]139-farfrae , with Mayoral authority , immediately rose to the occasion . [He]3605-his seized [Henchard]191-henchard by the shoulder , dragged [him]4474-a man back , and told [him]4474-a man roughly to be off . [Henchard]191-henchard 's eyes met [his]3605-his , and [Farfrae]139-farfrae observed the fierce light in [them]3606-them despite [his]3605-his excitement and irritation . For a moment [Henchard]191-henchard stood [his]4474-a man ground rigidly ; then by an unaccountable impulse gave way and retired . [Farfrae]139-farfrae glanced to [[the ladies]4695-the ladies ' gallery]3608-the ladies ' gallery , and saw that [his]3605-his [Calphurnia]261-calphurnia 's cheek was pale . “ Why — it is [[your]3605-his husband]5967-your husband ['s old patron]5968-'s old patron ! ”[139-farfrae] said [Mrs. Blowbody]262-mrs. blowbody , [a lady of [the neighbourhood]1758-the neighbourhood who sat beside [Lucetta]214-lucetta]3609-a lady of the neighbourhood who sat beside lucetta . “ [Patron]5969-patron ! ”[263-mrs. bath] said [[Donald]139-farfrae 's wife]3611-donald 's wife with quick indignation . “ Do [you]3605-his say [the man]291-the man is an acquaintance of [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae 's ? ”[214-lucetta] observed [Mrs. Bath]263-mrs. bath , [[the physician]3612-the physician 's wife]3613-the physician 's wife , [a new - comer to [the town]632-the town]3614-a new - comer to the town through [her]263-mrs. bath recent marriage with [the doctor]2617-the doctor . “ [He]291-the man works for [[my]214-lucetta husband]2965-my husband , ”[214-lucetta] said [Lucetta]214-lucetta . “ Oh — is that all ? [They]5972-they have been saying to [me]214-lucetta that it was through [him]291-the man [[your]3605-his husband]5967-your husband first got a footing in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge . What stories [people]1161-people will tell ! ”[214-lucetta] “ [They]5972-they will indeed . It was not so at all . [Donald]139-farfrae 's genius would have enabled [him]291-the man to get a footing anywhere , without [anybody]4437-anybody 's help ! [He]291-the man would have been just the same if there had been no Henchard in [the world]4424-the world ! ”[5656-the first] It was partly [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's ignorance of the circumstances of [Donald]139-farfrae 's arrival which led [her]214-lucetta to speak thus , partly the sensation that [everybody]1670-everybody seemed bent on snubbing [her]214-lucetta at this triumphant time . The incident had occupied but a few moments , but it was necessarily witnessed by [the Royal Personage]3618-the royal personage , who , however , with practised tact affected not to have noticed anything unusual . [He]3618-the royal personage alighted , [the Mayor]4556-the mayor advanced , the address was read ; [the Illustrious Personage]3602-the illustrious personage replied , then said a few words to [Farfrae]139-farfrae , and shook hands with [Lucetta]214-lucetta as [[the Mayor]4556-the mayor 's wife]3574-the mayor 's wife . The ceremony occupied but a few minutes , and [the carriages]3623-the carriages rattled heavily as [[Pharaoh]264-pharaoh 's chariots]3624-pharaoh 's chariots down [Corn Street]75-corn street and out upon [the Budmouth Road]4795-the budmouth road , in continuation of the journey coastward . In [the crowd]347-the crowd stood [Coney]132-christopher coney , [Buzzford]142-buzzford , and Longways “ Some difference between [him]3618-the royal personage now and when [he]3618-the royal personage zung at [the Dree Mariners]5977-the dree mariners , ”[5656-the first] said [the first]5656-the first . “ ' Tis wonderful how [he]3618-the royal personage could get [a lady of [her]3618-the royal personage quality]5978-a lady of her quality to go snacks wi ' en in such quick time . ”[347-the crowd] “ True . Yet how [folk]5018-folk do worship fine clothes ! Now there 's [a better - looking woman]5980-a better - looking woman than [she]3618-the royal personage that [nobody]298-nobody notices at all , because [she]5980-a better - looking woman 's akin to [that hontish fellow Henchard]5982-that hontish fellow henchard . ”[158-nance] “ [I]158-nance could worship [ye]158-nance , [Buzz]265-buzz , for saying that , ”[158-nance] remarked [Nance Mockridge]158-nance . “ [I]131-longways do like to see the trimming pulled off such Christmas candles . [I]131-longways am quite unequal to the part of [villain]5983-villain [myself]131-longways , or [I]131-longways 'd gi'e all [my]131-longways small silver to see [that lady]1536-that lady toppered .... And perhaps [I]131-longways shall soon , ”[131-longways] [she]158-nance added significantly . “ That 's not a noble passiont for [a ' oman]5985-a ' oman to keep up , ”[142-buzzford] said [Longways]131-longways . [Nance]158-nance did not reply , but [every one]3628-every one knew what [she]158-nance meant . The ideas diffused by the reading of [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's letters at [Peter]230-peter 's Finger had condensed into a scandal , which was spreading like a miasmatic fog through [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane , and thence up [the back streets of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]3629-the back streets of casterbridge . The mixed assemblage of [idlers known to each other]3630-idlers known to each other presently fell apart into two bands by a process of natural selection , [the frequenters of [Peter]230-peter 's Finger]3631-the frequenters of peter 's finger going off [Mixen Lanewards]84-mixen lanewards , where [most of [them]3631-the frequenters of peter 's finger lived]3632-most of them lived , while [Coney]132-christopher coney , [Buzzford]142-buzzford , [Longways]131-longways , and that connection remained in [the street]797-the street . “ [You]854-the others know what 's brewing down there , [I]132-christopher coney suppose ? ”[132-christopher coney] said [Buzzford]142-buzzford mysteriously to [the others]854-the others . [Coney]132-christopher coney looked at [him]142-buzzford . “ Not the skimmity - ride ? ”[131-longways] [Buzzford]142-buzzford nodded . “ [I]131-longways have [my]131-longways doubts if it will be carried out , ”[131-longways] said [Longways]131-longways . “ If [they]3635-they are getting it up [they]3635-they are keeping it mighty close . “[3635-they] [I]0-i heard [they]3635-they were thinking of it a fortnight ago , at all events . ” “[0-i] If [I]0-i were sure o't [I]0-i 'd lay information , ” said [Longways]131-longways emphatically . “[3635-they] ' Tis too rough a joke , and apt to wake riots in [towns]3636-towns . [We]3637-we know that [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman is [a right enough man]3639-a right enough man , and that [[his]886-the scotchman lady]3640-his lady has been [a right enough ' oman]3641-a right enough ' oman since [she]3640-his lady came here , and if there was anything wrong about [her]3640-his lady afore , that 's [their]3635-they business , not [ours]3637-we . ” [Coney]132-christopher coney reflected . [Farfrae]139-farfrae was still liked in [the community]5986-the community ; but it must be owned that , as [the Mayor]4556-the mayor and [man of money , engrossed with affairs and ambitions]5988-man of money , engrossed with affairs and ambitions , [he]886-the scotchman had lost in the eyes of [the poorer inhabitants]5989-the poorer inhabitants something of that wondrous charm which [he]886-the scotchman had had for [them]5989-the poorer inhabitants as [a light - hearted penniless young man , who sang ditties as readily as the birds in the trees]5990-a light - hearted penniless young man , who sang ditties as readily as the birds in the trees . Hence the anxiety to keep [him]886-the scotchman from annoyance showed not quite the ardour that would have animated it in former days . “[132-christopher coney] Suppose [we]3637-we make inquiration into it , [Christopher]132-christopher coney , ” continued [Longways]131-longways ; “[132-christopher coney] and if [we]3637-we find there 's really anything in it , drop a letter to [them]3635-they most concerned , and advise ['em]3642-'em to keep out of the way ? ” This course was decided on , and [the group]2423-the group separated , [Buzzford]142-buzzford saying to [Coney]132-christopher coney , “[132-christopher coney] Come , [[my]0-i ancient friend]3643-my ancient friend ; let 's move on . There 's nothing more to see here . ” [These well - intentioned ones]5992-these well - intentioned ones would have been surprised had [they]5992-these well - intentioned ones known how ripe the great jocular plot really was . “[132-christopher coney] Yes , to - night , ” [Jopp]137-jopp had said to [the [Peter]230-peter 's party at [the corner of [Mixen Lane]66-mixen lane]5994-the corner of mixen lane]5993-the peter 's party at the corner of mixen lane . “[3635-they] As a wind - up to [the Royal visit the hit]3644-the royal visit the hit will be all the more pat by reason of [their]3635-they great elevation to - day . ” To [him]137-jopp , at least , it was not a joke , but a retaliation .[137-jopp]

The proceedings had been brief — too brief — to [Lucetta]214-lucetta whom [an intoxicating Weltlust]3645-an intoxicating weltlust had fairly mastered ; but [they]3635-they had brought [her]214-lucetta a great triumph nevertheless . The shake of the Royal hand still lingered in [her]214-lucetta fingers ; and the chit - chat [she]214-lucetta had overheard , that [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband might possibly receive the honour of knighthood , though idle to a degree , seemed not the wildest vision ; stranger things had occurred to [men]4432-men so good and captivating as [[her]214-lucetta Scotchman]3648-her scotchman was . After the collision with [the Mayor]4556-the mayor , [Henchard]191-henchard had withdrawn behind [the ladies]4695-the ladies ' stand ; and there [he]387-her husband stood , regarding with a stare of abstraction the spot on the lapel of [his]387-her husband coat where [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's hand had seized it . [He]387-her husband put [his]387-her husband own hand there , as if [he]387-her husband could hardly realize such an outrage from one whom it had once been [his]387-her husband wo nt to treat with ardent generosity . While pausing in this half - stupefied state the conversation of [Lucetta]214-lucetta with [the other ladies]3651-the other ladies reached [his]387-her husband ears ; and [he]387-her husband distinctly heard [her]214-lucetta deny [him]387-her husband — deny that [he]387-her husband had assisted [Donald]139-farfrae , that [he]387-her husband was anything more than [a common journeyman]3652-a common journeyman . [He]387-her husband moved on homeward , and met [Jopp]137-jopp in [the archway to [the Bull Stake]68-bull stake]3653-the archway to the bull stake . “ So [you]387-her husband 've had a snub , ”[191-henchard] said [Jopp]137-jopp . “ And what if [I]387-her husband have ? ”[387-her husband] answered [Henchard]191-henchard sternly . “ Why , [I]387-her husband 've had one too , so [we]5995-we are both under the same cold shade . ”[387-her husband] [He]387-her husband briefly related [his]387-her husband attempt to win [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's intercession . [Henchard]191-henchard merely heard [his]387-her husband story , without taking it deeply in . [His]387-her husband own relation to [Farfrae]139-farfrae and [Lucetta]214-lucetta overshadowed [all kindred ones]3654-all kindred ones . [He]387-her husband went on saying brokenly to [himself]387-her husband , “ [She]214-lucetta has supplicated to [me]3655-the fallen merchant in [her]214-lucetta time ; and now [her]214-lucetta tongue wo n't own [me]3655-the fallen merchant nor [her]214-lucetta eyes see [me]3655-the fallen merchant ! ... And [he]387-her husband — how angry [he]387-her husband looked . [He]387-her husband drove [me]3655-the fallen merchant back as if [I]3655-the fallen merchant were a bull breaking fence .... [I]3655-the fallen merchant took it like a lamb , for [I]3655-the fallen merchant saw it could not be settled there . [He]387-her husband can rub brine on a green wound ! ... But [he]387-her husband shall pay for it , and [she]214-lucetta shall be sorry . It must come to a tussle — face to face ; and then [we]5996-we 'll see how [a coxcomb]5997-a coxcomb can front [a man]4474-a man ! ”[3655-the fallen merchant] Without further reflection [the fallen merchant]3655-the fallen merchant , bent on some wild purpose , ate a hasty dinner and went forth to find [Farfrae]139-farfrae . After being injured by [him]3655-the fallen merchant as [a rival]1889-a rival , and snubbed by [him]3655-the fallen merchant as [a journeyman]3132-a journeyman , the crowning degradation had been reserved for this day — that [he]3655-the fallen merchant should be shaken at the collar by [him]3655-the fallen merchant as [a vagabond]3658-a vagabond in the face of [the whole town]2698-the whole town . [The crowds]3660-the crowds had dispersed . But for the green arches which still stood as they were erected [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge life had resumed its ordinary shape . [Henchard]191-henchard went down [Corn Street]75-corn street till [he]3655-the fallen merchant came to [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's house]3661-farfrae 's house , where [he]3655-the fallen merchant knocked , and left a message that [he]3655-the fallen merchant would be glad to see [[his]3655-the fallen merchant employer]1363-his employer at [the granaries]3663-the granaries as soon as [he]3655-the fallen merchant conveniently could come [there]447-there . Having done this [he]3655-the fallen merchant proceeded round to the back and entered [the yard]1277-the yard . [Nobody]298-nobody was present , for , as [he]3655-the fallen merchant had been aware , [the labourers]3667-the labourers and [carters]3668-carters were enjoying a half - holiday on account of the events of the morning — though [the carters]2399-the carters would have to return for a short time later on , to feed and litter down the horses . [He]3655-the fallen merchant had reached [the granary steps]3670-the granary steps and was about to ascend , when [he]3655-the fallen merchant said to [himself]3655-the fallen merchant aloud , “ [I]3655-the fallen merchant 'm stronger than [he]3655-the fallen merchant . ”[3655-the fallen merchant] [Henchard]191-henchard returned to [a shed]3671-a shed , where [he]3655-the fallen merchant selected a short piece of rope from several pieces that were lying about ; hitching one end of this to a nail , [he]3655-the fallen merchant took the other in [his]3655-the fallen merchant right hand and turned [himself]3655-the fallen merchant bodily round , while keeping [his]3655-the fallen merchant arm against [his]3655-the fallen merchant side ; by this contrivance [he]3655-the fallen merchant pinioned the arm effectively . [He]3655-the fallen merchant now went up the ladders to [the top floor of [the corn - stores]3033-the corn - stores]3672-the top floor of the corn - stores . [It]3672-the top floor of the corn - stores was empty except of a few sacks , and at the further end was the door often mentioned , opening under the cathead and chain that hoisted the sacks . [He]3655-the fallen merchant fixed the door open and looked over the sill . There was a depth of thirty or forty feet to the ground ; here was the spot on which [he]3655-the fallen merchant had been standing with [Farfrae]139-farfrae when [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had seen [him]3655-the fallen merchant lift [his]3655-the fallen merchant arm , with many misgivings as to what the movement portended . [He]3655-the fallen merchant retired a few steps into [the loft]3674-the loft and waited . From [this elevated perch]3675-this elevated perch [his]3655-the fallen merchant eyes could sweep [the roofs]3676-the roofs round about , the upper parts of the luxurious chestnut trees , now delicate in leaves of a week 's age , and the drooping boughs of the lines ; [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's garden]3677-farfrae 's garden and the green door leading therefrom . In course of time — [he]3655-the fallen merchant could not say how long — that green door opened and [Farfrae]139-farfrae came through . [He]3655-the fallen merchant was dressed as if for a journey . The low light of the nearing evening caught [his]3655-the fallen merchant head and face when [he]3655-the fallen merchant emerged from the shadow of the wall , warming them to a complexion of flame - colour . [Henchard]191-henchard watched [him]3655-the fallen merchant with [his]3655-the fallen merchant mouth firmly set , the squareness of [his]3655-the fallen merchant jaw and the verticality of [his]3655-the fallen merchant profile being unduly marked . [Farfrae]139-farfrae came on with one hand in [his]3655-the fallen merchant pocket , and humming a tune in a way which told that the words were most in [his]3655-the fallen merchant mind . They were those of the song [he]3655-the fallen merchant had sung when [he]3655-the fallen merchant arrived years before at [the Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners , [a poor young man , adventuring for life and fortune]3679-a poor young man , adventuring for life and fortune , and scarcely knowing witherward : — Nothing moved [Henchard]191-henchard like an old melody . [He]3655-the fallen merchant sank back . “ No ; [I]3655-the fallen merchant ca n't do it ! ”[3655-the fallen merchant] [he]3655-the fallen merchant gasped . “ Why does [the infernal fool]5999-the infernal fool begin that now ! ”[3655-the fallen merchant] At length [Farfrae]139-farfrae was silent , and [Henchard]191-henchard looked out of the loft door . “ Will [ye]3655-the fallen merchant come up here ? ”[139-farfrae] [he]3655-the fallen merchant said . “ Ay , [man]488-man , ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “ [I]3655-the fallen merchant could n't see [ye]488-man . What 's wrang ? ”[3655-the fallen merchant] A minute later [Henchard]191-henchard heard [his]3655-the fallen merchant feet on the lowest ladder . [He]3655-the fallen merchant heard [him]3655-the fallen merchant land on [the first floor]3680-the first floor , ascend and land on [the second]4874-the second , begin the ascent to the third . And then [his]3655-the fallen merchant head rose through the trap behind . “ What are [you]3655-the fallen merchant doing up here at this time ? ”[3655-the fallen merchant] [he]3655-the fallen merchant asked , coming forward . “ Why did n't [ye]3655-the fallen merchant take [your]3655-the fallen merchant holiday like [the rest of [the men]1681-the men]6001-the rest of the men ? ”[191-henchard] [He]3655-the fallen merchant spoke in a tone which had just severity enough in it to show that [he]3655-the fallen merchant remembered the untoward event of the forenoon , and [his]3655-the fallen merchant conviction that [Henchard]191-henchard had been drinking . [Henchard]191-henchard said nothing ; but going back [he]3655-the fallen merchant closed the stair hatchway , and stamped upon it so that it went tight into its frame ; [he]3655-the fallen merchant next turned to [the wondering young man , who by this time observed that one of [Henchard]191-henchard 's arms was bound to [his]3682-the wondering young man , who by this time observed that one of henchard 's arms was bound to his side side]3682-the wondering young man , who by this time observed that one of henchard 's arms was bound to his side . “ Now , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard quietly , “ [we]6003-we stand face to face — [man]488-man and [man]488-man . [Your]191-henchard money and [[your]191-henchard fine wife]6006-your fine wife no longer lift ' [ee]6007-ee above [me]139-farfrae as [they]6008-they did but now , and [my]139-farfrae poverty does not press [me]139-farfrae down . ”[139-farfrae] “ What does it all mean ? ”[139-farfrae] asked [Farfrae]139-farfrae simply . “ Wait a bit , [[my]3683-i lad]4724-my lad . [You]4724-my lad should ha ' thought twice before [you]4724-my lad affronted to extremes [a man who had nothing to lose]6010-a man who had nothing to lose . [I]3683-i 've stood [your]4724-my lad rivalry , which ruined [me]3683-i , and [your]4724-my lad snubbing , which humbled [me]3683-i ; but [your]4724-my lad hustling , that disgraced [me]3683-i , [I]3683-i wo n't stand ! ”[3683-i] [Farfrae]139-farfrae warmed a little at this . “ [Ye'd]4724-my lad no business there , ”[3683-i] [he]3683-i said . “ As much as [any one]4743-any one among [ye]4724-my lad ! What , [you]4724-my lad forward stripling , tell [a man of [my]3683-i age [he]6012-a man of my age he 'd no business there 'd no business [there]447-there]6012-a man of my age he 'd no business there ! ”[3683-i] The anger - vein swelled in [his]3683-i forehead as [he]3683-i spoke . “ [You]4724-my lad insulted [Royalty]3526-royalty , [Henchard]191-henchard ; and ' twas [my]191-henchard duty , as [the chief magistrate]6015-the chief magistrate , to stop [you]4724-my lad . ”[191-henchard] “ [Royalty]3526-royalty be damned , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard . “ [I]3683-i am as loyal as [you]4724-my lad , come to that ! ”[3683-i] “ [I]191-henchard am not here to argue . Wait till [you]4724-my lad cool doon , wait till [you]4724-my lad cool ; and [you]4724-my lad will see things the same way as [I]191-henchard do . ”[191-henchard] “ [You]4724-my lad may be [the one to cool first]6017-the one to cool first , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard grimly . “ Now this is the case . Here be [we]6018-we , in [this four - square loft]6019-this four - square loft , to finish out that little wrestle [you]4724-my lad began this morning . There 's the door , forty foot above ground . One of [us]6018-we two puts [the other]338-the other out by that door — [the master]5001-the master stays inside . If [he]5001-the master likes [he]5001-the master may go down afterwards and give the alarm that [the other]338-the other has fallen out by accident — or [he]5001-the master may tell the truth — that 's [his]5001-the master business . As [the strongest man]6023-the strongest man [I]191-henchard 've tied one arm to take no advantage of ' ee . D'ye understand ? Then here 's at ' ee ! ”[191-henchard] There was no time for [Farfrae]139-farfrae to do aught but one thing , to close with [Henchard]191-henchard , for [the latter]4511-the latter had come on at once . It was a wrestling match , the object of each being to give [[his]4511-the latter antagonist]1916-his antagonist a back fall ; and on [Henchard]191-henchard 's part , unquestionably , that it should be through the door . At the outset [Henchard]191-henchard 's hold by [his]4511-the latter only free hand , the right , was on the left side of [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's collar , which [he]4511-the latter firmly grappled , [the latter]4511-the latter holding [Henchard]191-henchard by [his]4511-the latter collar with the contrary hand . With [his]4511-the latter right [he]4511-the latter endeavoured to get hold of [[his]4511-the latter antagonist]1916-his antagonist 's left arm , which , however , [he]4511-the latter could not do , so adroitly did [Henchard]191-henchard keep it in the rear as [he]4511-the latter gazed upon the lowered eyes of [[his]4511-the latter fair and slim antagonist]3688-his fair and slim antagonist . [Henchard]191-henchard planted the first toe forward , [Farfrae]139-farfrae crossing [him]4511-the latter with [his]4511-the latter ; and thus far the struggle had very much the appearance of the ordinary wrestling of those parts . Several minutes were passed by [them]3689-them in this attitude , [the pair]5819-the pair rocking and writhing like trees in a gale , both preserving an absolute silence . By this time [their]3689-them breathing could be heard . Then [Farfrae]139-farfrae tried to get hold of the other side of [Henchard]191-henchard 's collar , which was resisted by [the larger man]3691-the larger man exerting all [his]3691-the larger man force in a wrenching movement , and this part of the struggle ended by [his]4511-the latter forcing [Farfrae]139-farfrae down on [his]3691-the larger man knees by sheer pressure of one of [his]4511-the latter muscular arms . Hampered as [he]4511-the latter was , however , [he]4511-the latter could not keep [him]3691-the larger man there , and [Farfrae]139-farfrae finding [his]3691-the larger man feet again the struggle proceeded as before . By a whirl [Henchard]191-henchard brought [Donald]139-farfrae dangerously near the precipice ; seeing [his]4511-the latter position [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman for the first time locked [himself]4511-the latter to [[his]4511-the latter adversary]3693-his adversary , and all the efforts of that infuriated [Prince of Darkness]266-prince of darkness — as [he]4511-the latter might have been called from [his]4511-the latter appearance just now — were inadequate to lift or loosen [Farfrae]139-farfrae for a time . By an extraordinary effort [he]4511-the latter succeeded at last , though not until [they]3694-they had got far back again from the fatal door . In doing so [Henchard]191-henchard contrived to turn [Farfrae]139-farfrae a complete somersault . Had [Henchard]191-henchard 's other arm been free it would have been all over with [Farfrae]139-farfrae then . But again [he]4511-the latter regained [his]4511-the latter feet , wrenching [Henchard]191-henchard 's arm considerably , and causing [him]4511-the latter sharp pain , as could be seen from the twitching of [his]4511-the latter face . [He]4511-the latter instantly delivered [the younger man]1588-the younger man an annihilating turn by the left fore - hip , as it used to be expressed , and following up [his]4511-the latter advantage thrust [him]4511-the latter towards the door , never loosening [his]4511-the latter hold till [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's fair head was hanging over the window - sill , and [his]4511-the latter arm dangling down outside the wall . “ Now , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard between [his]4511-the latter gasps , “ this is the end of what [you]4511-the latter began this morning . [Your]4511-the latter life is in [my]139-farfrae hands . ”[139-farfrae] “ Then take it , take it ! ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “ [Ye've]4511-the latter wished to long enough ! ”[4511-the latter] [Henchard]191-henchard looked down upon [him]4511-the latter in silence , and [their]3696-their eyes met . “ [O Farfrae]139-farfrae ! — that 's not true ! ”[4511-the latter] [he]4511-the latter said bitterly . “ [God]126-god is [[my]4511-the latter witness]6024-my witness that [no man]6025-no man ever loved [another]6026-another as [I]4511-the latter did [thee]4511-the latter at one time .... And now — though [I]4511-the latter came here to kill [']4511-the latter [ee]4511-the latter , [I]4511-the latter can not hurt [thee]4511-the latter ! Go and give [me]4511-the latter in charge — do what [you]4511-the latter will — [I]4511-the latter care nothing for what comes of [me]4511-the latter ! ”[4511-the latter] [He]4511-the latter withdrew to the back part of [the loft]3674-the loft , loosened [his]4511-the latter arm , and flung [himself]4511-the latter in a corner upon some sacks , in the abandonment of remorse . [Farfrae]139-farfrae regarded [him]4511-the latter in silence ; then went to the hatch and descended through [it]3698-it . [Henchard]191-henchard would fain have recalled [him]4511-the latter , but [his]4511-the latter tongue failed in its task , and [the young man]371-the young man 's steps died on [his]4511-the latter ear . [Henchard]191-henchard took [his]4511-the latter full measure of shame and self - reproach . The scenes of [his]4511-the latter first acquaintance with [Farfrae]139-farfrae rushed back upon [him]4511-the latter — that time when the curious mixture of romance and thrift in [the young man]371-the young man 's composition so commanded [his]4511-the latter heart that [Farfrae]139-farfrae could play upon [him]4511-the latter as on an instrument . So thoroughly subdued was [he]4511-the latter that [he]4511-the latter remained on the sacks in a crouching attitude , unusual for [a man]4474-a man , and for [such a man]4704-such a man . [Its]3703-its womanliness sat tragically on [the figure of so stern a piece of virility]3704-the figure of so stern a piece of virility . [He]4511-the latter heard a conversation below , the opening of [the coach - house]3705-the coach - house door , and the putting in of a horse , but took no notice . Here [he]4511-the latter stayed till the thin shades thickened to opaque obscurity , and the loft - door became an oblong of gray light — the only visible shape around . At length [he]4511-the latter arose , shook the dust from [his]4511-the latter clothes wearily , felt [his]4511-the latter way to the hatch , and gropingly descended the steps till [he]4511-the latter stood in [the yard]1277-the yard . “ [He]4511-the latter thought highly of [me]4511-the latter once , ”[4511-the latter] [he]4511-the latter murmured . “ Now [he]4511-the latter 'll hate [me]171-whittle and despise [me]171-whittle for ever ! ”[171-whittle] [He]4511-the latter became possessed by an overpowering wish to see [Farfrae]139-farfrae again that night , and by some desperate pleading to attempt the well - nigh impossible task of winning pardon for [his]4511-the latter late mad attack . But as [he]4511-the latter walked towards [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's door [he]4511-the latter recalled the unheeded doings in [the yard]1277-the yard while [he]4511-the latter had lain above in a sort of stupor . [Farfrae]139-farfrae [he]4511-the latter remembered had gone to [the stable]3708-the stable and put the horse into the gig ; while doing so [Whittle]171-whittle had brought [him]4511-the latter a letter ; [Farfrae]139-farfrae had then said that [he]4511-the latter would not go towards [Budmouth]54-budmouth as [he]4511-the latter had intended — that [he]4511-the latter was unexpectedly summoned to [Weatherbury]30-weatherbury , and meant to call at [Mellstock]29-mellstock on [his]4511-the latter way thither , [that place lying but one or two miles out of [his]4511-the latter course]3709-that place lying but one or two miles out of his course . [He]4511-the latter must have come prepared for a journey when [he]4511-the latter first arrived in [the yard]1277-the yard , unsuspecting enmity ; and [he]4511-the latter must have driven off ( though in a changed direction ) without saying a word to [any one]4743-any one on what had occurred between [themselves]3712-themselves . It would therefore be useless to call at [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's house]3661-farfrae 's house till very late . There was no help for it but to wait till [his]4511-the latter return , though waiting was almost torture to [his]4511-the latter restless and self - accusing soul . [He]4511-the latter walked about [the streets]1748-the streets and [outskirts of [the town]632-the town]3715-outskirts of the town , lingering here and there till [he]4511-the latter reached the stone bridge of which mention has been made , an accustomed halting - place with [him]4511-the latter now . Here [he]4511-the latter spent a long time , the purl of waters through the weirs meeting [his]4511-the latter ear , and the Casterbridge lights glimmering at no great distance off . While leaning thus upon the parapet [his]4511-the latter listless attention was awakened by sounds of an unaccustomed kind from [the town quarter]3717-the town quarter . They were a confusion of rhythmical noises , to which [the streets]1748-the streets added yet more confusion by encumbering them with echoes . [His]4511-the latter first incurious thought that the clangour arose from the town band , engaged in an attempt to round off a memorable day in a burst of evening harmony , was contradicted by certain peculiarities of reverberation . But inexplicability did not rouse [him]4511-the latter to more than a cursory heed ; [his]4511-the latter sense of degradation was too strong for the admission of foreign ideas ; and [he]4511-the latter leant against the parapet as before .

When [Farfrae]139-farfrae descended out of [the loft]3674-the loft breathless from [his]4511-the latter encounter with [Henchard]191-henchard , [he]4511-the latter paused at the bottom to recover [himself]4511-the latter . [He]4511-the latter arrived at [the yard]1277-the yard with the intention of putting the horse into the gig [himself]4511-the latter ( [all the men]1704-all the men having a holiday ) , and driving to [a village on [the Budmouth Road]86-the budmouth road]3722-a village on the budmouth road . Despite the fearful struggle [he]4511-the latter decided still to persevere in [his]4511-the latter journey , so as to recover [himself]4511-the latter before going [indoors]4777-indoors and meeting the eyes of [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [He]4511-the latter wished to consider [his]4511-the latter course in a case so serious . When [he]4511-the latter was just on the point of driving off [Whittle]171-whittle arrived with a note badly addressed , and bearing the word “ immediate ”[5656-the first] upon the outside . On opening it [he]171-whittle was surprised to see that it was unsigned . It contained a brief request that [he]4511-the latter would go to [Weatherbury]30-weatherbury that evening about some business which [he]4511-the latter was conducting [there]447-there . [Farfrae]139-farfrae knew nothing that could make it pressing ; but as [he]4511-the latter was bent upon going out [he]4511-the latter yielded to the anonymous request , particularly as [he]4511-the latter had a call to make at [Mellstock]29-mellstock which could be included in the same tour . Thereupon [he]4511-the latter told [Whittle]171-whittle of [his]4511-the latter change of direction , in words which [Henchard]191-henchard had overheard , and set out on [his]4511-the latter way . [Farfrae]139-farfrae had not directed [[his]4511-the latter man]3725-his man to take the message indoors , and [Whittle]171-whittle had not been supposed to do so on [his]171-whittle own responsibility . Now the anonymous letter was a well - intentioned but clumsy contrivance of [Longways]131-longways and [other of [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's men]3727-farfrae 's men]3726-other of farfrae 's men to get [him]4511-the latter out of the way for the evening , in order that the satirical mummery should fall flat , if it were attempted . By giving open information [they]3728-they would have brought down upon [their]3728-they heads the vengeance of those among [[their]3728-they comrades who enjoyed these boisterous old games]3729-their comrades who enjoyed these boisterous old games ; and therefore the plan of sending a letter recommended itself by its indirectness . For poor [Lucetta]214-lucetta [they]3728-they took no protective measure , believing with the majority there was some truth in the scandal , which [she]214-lucetta would have to bear as [she]214-lucetta best might . It was about eight o'clock , and [Lucetta]214-lucetta was sitting in [the drawing - room]5672-the drawing - room alone . Night had set in for more than half an hour , but [she]214-lucetta had not had the candles lighted , for when [Farfrae]139-farfrae was away [she]214-lucetta preferred waiting for [him]4511-the latter by the firelight , and , if it were not too cold , keeping one of the window - sashes a little way open that the sound of [his]4511-the latter wheels might reach [her]214-lucetta ears early . [She]214-lucetta was leaning back in the chair , in a more hopeful mood than [she]214-lucetta had enjoyed since [her]214-lucetta marriage . The day had been such a success , and the temporary uneasiness which [Henchard]191-henchard 's show of effrontery had wrought in [her]214-lucetta disappeared with the quiet disappearance of [Henchard]191-henchard [himself]191-henchard under [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband 's reproof . The floating evidences of [her]214-lucetta absurd passion for [him]4511-the latter , and its consequences , had been destroyed , and [she]214-lucetta really seemed to have no cause for fear . The reverie in which [these and other subjects]3732-these and other subjects mingled was disturbed by a hubbub in the distance , that increased moment by moment . It did not greatly surprise [her]214-lucetta , the afternoon having been given up to recreation by [a majority of [the populace]3734-the populace]3733-a majority of the populace since the passage of the Royal equipages . But [her]214-lucetta attention was at once riveted to the matter by the voice of [a maid - servant next door]3735-a maid - servant next door , who spoke from an upper window across [the street]797-the street to [some other maid even more elevated than [she]214-lucetta]3737-some other maid even more elevated than she . “ Which way be [they]6027-they going now ? ”[4874-the second] inquired [the first]5656-the first with interest . “ [I]4874-the second ca n't be sure for a moment , ”[4874-the second] said [the second]4874-the second , “ because of the malter 's chimbley . O yes — [I]5656-the first can see 'em . Well , [I]5656-the first declare , [I]5656-the first declare ! ”[5656-the first] “ What , what ? ”[5656-the first] from [the first]5656-the first , more enthusiastically . “ [They]6027-they are coming up [Corn Street]75-corn street after all ! [They]6027-they sit back to back ! ”[4874-the second] “ What — two of 'em — are there two figures ? ”[4874-the second] “ Yes . Two images on [a donkey]6028-a donkey , back to back , [their]6027-they elbows tied to one another 's ! [She]214-lucetta 's facing the head , and [he]6029-he 's facing the tail . ”[5656-the first] “ Is it meant for [anybody in particular]6030-anybody in particular ? ”[4874-the second] “ Well — it mid be . [The man]291-the man has got on a blue coat and kerseymere leggings ; [he]6029-he has black whiskers , and a reddish face . ' Tis a stuffed figure , with a falseface . ”[3741-the disappointed first maid] The din was increasing now — then it lessened a little . “ There — [I]3742-the one who occupied the enviable position in the attic sha n't see , after all ! ”[3742-the one who occupied the enviable position in the attic] cried [the disappointed first maid]3741-the disappointed first maid . “ [They]6027-they have gone into [a back street]2372-a back street — that 's all , ”[3742-the one who occupied the enviable position in the attic] said [the one who occupied the enviable position in [the attic]3743-the attic]3742-the one who occupied the enviable position in the attic . “ There — now [I]4874-the second have got 'em all endways nicely ! ”[4874-the second] “ What 's [the woman]300-the woman like ? Just say , and [I]214-lucetta can tell in a moment if ' tis meant for one [I]214-lucetta 've in mind . ”[214-lucetta] “ [My]191-henchard — why — ' tis dressed just as [SHE]300-the woman dressed when [she]300-the woman sat in the front seat at the time [the play - actors]6034-the play - actors came to [the Town Hall]5606-the town hall ! ”[191-henchard] [Lucetta]214-lucetta started to [her]214-lucetta feet , and almost at the instant the door of [the room]985-the room was quickly and softly opened . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard advanced into the firelight . “ [I]191-henchard have come to see [you]214-lucetta , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said breathlessly . “ [I]214-lucetta did not stop to knock — forgive [me]214-lucetta ! [I]214-lucetta see [you]214-lucetta have not shut [your]214-lucetta shutters , and the window is open . ”[214-lucetta] Without waiting for [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's reply [she]191-henchard crossed quickly to the window and pulled out one of the shutters . [Lucetta]214-lucetta glided to [her]191-henchard side . “ Let it be — hush ! ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta said peremporily , in a dry voice , while [she]214-lucetta seized [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard by the hand , and held up [her]214-lucetta finger . [Their]3745-us intercourse had been so low and hurried that not a word had been lost of the conversation without , which had thus proceeded : — “ [Her]191-henchard neck is uncovered , and [her]191-henchard hair in bands , and [her]191-henchard back - comb in place ; [she]191-henchard 's got on a puce silk , and white stockings , and coloured shoes . ”[214-lucetta] Again [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard attempted to close the window , but [Lucetta]214-lucetta held [her]191-henchard by main force . “ ' Tis [me]214-lucetta ! ”[214-lucetta] [she]214-lucetta said , with a face pale as death . “ A procession — a scandal — an effigy of [me]191-henchard , and [him]6036-he ! ”[191-henchard] The look of [Elizabeth]191-henchard betrayed that [the latter]4511-the latter knew it already . “ Let [us]3745-us shut it out , ”[191-henchard] coaxed [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , noting that the rigid wildness of [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's features was growing yet more rigid and wild with the meaning of the noise and laughter . “ Let [us]3745-us shut it out ! ”[191-henchard] “ It is of no use ! ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard shrieked . “ [He]6036-he will see it , wo n't [he]6036-he ? [Donald]139-farfrae will see it ! [He]6036-he is just coming [home]675-home — and it will break [his]6036-he heart — [he]6036-he will never love [me]191-henchard any more — and [O]146-o nannie , it will kill [me]191-henchard — kill [me]191-henchard ! ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard was frantic now . “ O , ca n't something be done to stop it ? ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard cried . “ Is there [nobody]298-nobody to do it — not one ? ”[214-lucetta] [She]191-henchard relinquished [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's hands , and ran to the door . [Lucetta]214-lucetta [herself]214-lucetta , saying recklessly “ [I]191-henchard will see it ! ”[191-henchard] turned to the window , threw up the sash , and went out upon [the balcony]3747-the balcony . [Elizabeth]191-henchard immediately followed , and put [her]191-henchard arm round [her]214-lucetta to pull [her]214-lucetta in . [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's eyes were straight upon the spectacle of the uncanny revel , now dancing rapidly . The numerous lights round the two effigies threw them up into lurid distinctness ; it was impossible to mistake [the pair]5819-the pair for other than [the intended victims]3749-the intended victims . “ Come in , come in , ”[191-henchard] implored [Elizabeth]191-henchard ; “ and let [me]214-lucetta shut the window ! ”[214-lucetta] “ [She]214-lucetta 's [me]2617-the doctor — [she]214-lucetta 's [me]2617-the doctor — even to the parasol — [my]2617-the doctor green parasol ! ”[2617-the doctor] cried [Lucetta]214-lucetta with a wild laugh as [she]214-lucetta stepped in . [She]214-lucetta stood motionless for one second — then fell heavily to the floor . Almost at the instant of [her]214-lucetta fall the rude music of the skimmington ceased . The roars of sarcastic laughter went off in ripples , and the trampling died out like the rustle of a spent wind . [Elizabeth]191-henchard was only indirectly conscious of this ; [she]191-henchard had rung the bell , and was bending over [Lucetta]214-lucetta , who remained convulsed on the carpet in the paroxysms of an epileptic seizure . [She]191-henchard rang again and again , in vain ; the probability being that [the servants]2053-the servants had all run out of [the house]782-the house to see more of the Daemonic Sabbath than [they]2053-the servants could see within . At last [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's man , who had been agape on the doorstep]3752-farfrae 's man , who had been agape on the doorstep , came up ; then [the cook]3753-the cook . The shutters , hastily pushed to by [Elizabeth]191-henchard , were quite closed , a light was obtained , [Lucetta]214-lucetta carried to [[her]214-lucetta room]1935-her room , and [the man]291-the man sent off for [a doctor]3756-a doctor . While [Elizabeth]191-henchard was undressing [her]191-henchard [she]191-henchard recovered consciousness ; but as soon as [she]191-henchard remembered what had passed the fit returned . [The doctor]2617-the doctor arrived with unhoped - for promptitude ; [he]2617-the doctor had been standing at [his]2617-the doctor door , like [others]860-others , wondering what the uproar meant . As soon as [he]2617-the doctor saw [the unhappy sufferer]3759-the unhappy sufferer [he]2617-the doctor said , in answer to [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's mute appeal , “ This is serious . ”[191-henchard] “ It is a fit , ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard said . “ Yes . But a fit in the present state of [her]191-henchard health means mischief . [You]2617-the doctor must send at once for [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae . Where is [he]149-farfrae ? ”[2064-the parlour - maid] “ [He]149-farfrae has driven into [the country]633-the country , [sir]4588-sir , ”[2064-the parlour - maid] said [the parlour - maid]2064-the parlour - maid ; “ to [some place on [the Budmouth Road]86-the budmouth road]6041-some place on the budmouth road . [The man]291-the man was despatched , and [they]3763-they soon heard [him]291-the man clattering out of [the yard]1277-the yard at the back . Meanwhile [Mr. Benjamin Grower]229-mr. grower , [that prominent burgess of whom mention has been already made]3765-that prominent burgess of whom mention has been already made , hearing the din of cleavers , tongs , tambourines , kits , crouds , humstrums , serpents , rams'-horns , and other historical kinds of music as [he]229-mr. grower sat indoors in [the High Street]759-the high street , had put on [his]229-mr. grower hat and gone out to learn the cause . [His]229-mr. grower first move was to search [hither]3770-hither and thither for [the constables]3771-the constables , there were two in [the town]632-the town , [shrivelled men whom [he]229-mr. grower ultimately found in hiding up [an alley]3444-an alley yet more shrivelled than usual , having some not ungrounded fears that [they]3773-shrivelled men whom he ultimately found in hiding up an alley yet more shrivelled than usual , having some not ungrounded fears that they might be roughly handled if seen might be roughly handled if seen]3773-shrivelled men whom he ultimately found in hiding up an alley yet more shrivelled than usual , having some not ungrounded fears that they might be roughly handled if seen . “ What can [we]6042-we [two poor lammigers]6043-two poor lammigers do against [such a multitude]6044-such a multitude ! ”[223-stubberd] expostulated [Stubberd]223-stubberd , in answer to [Mr. Grower]229-mr. grower 's chiding . “ ' Tis tempting ['em]6045-'em to commit felo - de - se upon [us]6042-we , and that would be the death of [the perpetrator]2646-the perpetrator ; and [we]6042-we would n't be the cause of [a fellow - creature]2003-a fellow - creature 's death on no account , not [we]6042-we ! ”[223-stubberd] “ Get some help , then !
