It was no rapid matter to get [there]447-there at night , not a lamp or glimmer of any sort offering itself to light the way , except an occasional pale radiance through some window - curtain , or through the chink of some door which could not be closed because of the smoky chimney within . At last [they]3792-the rusty - jointed executors of the law entered [the inn]939-the inn boldly , by the till then bolted front - door , after a prolonged knocking of loudness commensurate with the importance of [their]3792-the rusty - jointed executors of the law standing . In the settles of [the large room]3158-the large room , guyed to the ceiling by cords as usual for stability , [an ordinary group]3798-an ordinary group sat drinking and smoking with statuesque quiet of demeanour . [The landlady]972-the landlady looked mildly at [the invaders]3800-the invaders , saying in honest accents , “ Good evening , [gentlemen]4449-gentlemen ; there 's plenty of room . [I]223-stubberd hope there 's nothing amiss ? ”[223-stubberd] [They]3792-the rusty - jointed executors of the law looked round [the room]985-the room . “ Surely , ”[223-stubberd] said [Stubberd]223-stubberd to [one of [the men]1681-the men]1709-one of the men , “ [I]291-the man saw [you]1709-one of the men by now in [Corn Street]75-corn street — [Mr. Grower]229-mr. grower spoke to ' [ee]1709-one of the men ? ”[291-the man] [The man]291-the man , who was [Charl]254-charl , shook [his]291-the man head absently . “ [I]291-the man 've been [here]4417-here this last hour , [hain't]6071-hain't [I]291-the man , [Nance]158-nance ? ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man said to [the woman who meditatively sipped [her]3805-the woman who meditatively sipped her ale near him ale near [him]291-the man]3805-the woman who meditatively sipped her ale near him . “ [Faith]269-faith , that [you]3805-the woman who meditatively sipped her ale near him have . [I]3806-the other constable came in for [my]3806-the other constable quiet suppertime half - pint , and [you]3805-the woman who meditatively sipped her ale near him were [here]4417-here then , as well as all the rest . ”[3806-the other constable] [The other constable]3806-the other constable was facing the clock - case , where [he]3806-the other constable saw reflected in the glass a quick motion by [the landlady]972-the landlady . Turning sharply , [he]3806-the other constable caught [her]972-the landlady closing the oven - door . “ Something curious about that oven , [ma'am]618-ma'am ! ”[972-the landlady] [he]3806-the other constable observed advancing , opening it , and drawing out a tambourine . “ Ah , ”[972-the landlady] [she]972-the landlady said apologetically , “ that 's what [we]6074-we keep [here]4417-here to use when there 's a little quiet dancing . [You]2686-the constable see damp weather spoils it , so [I]191-henchard put it there to keep it dry . ”[191-henchard] [The constable]2686-the constable nodded knowingly , but what [he]2686-the constable knew was nothing . Nohow could anything be elicited from [this mute and inoffensive assembly]3809-this mute and inoffensive assembly . In a few minutes [the investigators]3810-the investigators went out , and joining those of [[their]3810-the investigators auxiliaries]3811-their auxiliaries who had been left at the door [they]3810-the investigators pursued [their]3810-the investigators way elsewhither .

Long before this time [Henchard]191-henchard , weary of [his]3806-the other constable ruminations on [the bridge]3110-the bridge , had repaired towards [the town]632-the town . When [he]3806-the other constable stood at the bottom of [the street]797-the street [a procession]3815-a procession burst upon [his]3806-the other constable view , in the act of turning out of [an alley just above [him]3806-the other constable]3816-an alley just above him . The lanterns , horns , and multitude startled [him]3806-the other constable ; [he]3806-the other constable saw the mounted images , and knew what it all meant . [They]3810-the investigators crossed the way , entered [another street]3817-another street , and disappeared . [He]3806-the other constable turned back a few steps and was lost in grave reflection , finally wending [his]3806-the other constable way homeward by [the obscure river - side path]3818-the obscure river - side path . Unable to rest there [he]3806-the other constable went to [[[his]3806-the other constable step - daughter]2070-his step - daughter 's lodging]3820-his step - daughter 's lodging , and was told that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had gone to [[Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae 's]3821-mr. farfrae 's . Like one acting in obedience to a charm , and with a nameless apprehension , [he]3806-the other constable followed in the same direction in the hope of meeting [her]2070-his step - daughter , [the roysterers]3822-the roysterers having vanished . Disappointed in this [he]3806-the other constable gave the gentlest of pulls to the door - bell , and then learnt particulars of what had occurred , together with [the doctor]2617-the doctor 's imperative orders that [Farfrae]149-farfrae should be brought [home]675-home , and how [they]3810-the investigators had set out to meet [him]149-farfrae on [the Budmouth Road]4795-the budmouth road . “ But [he]149-farfrae has gone to [Mellstock]29-mellstock and [Weatherbury]30-weatherbury ! ”[191-henchard] exclaimed [Henchard]191-henchard , now unspeakably grieved . “ Not [Budmouth]54-budmouth way at all . ”[191-henchard] But , alas ! for [Henchard]191-henchard ; [he]3806-the other constable had lost [his]3806-the other constable good name . [They]3810-the investigators would not believe [him]3806-the other constable , taking [his]3806-the other constable words but as the frothy utterances of recklessness . Though [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's life seemed at that moment to depend upon [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband 's return ( [she]214-lucetta being in great mental agony lest [he]387-her husband should never know the unexaggerated truth of [her]214-lucetta past relations with [Henchard]191-henchard ) , [no messenger]3827-no messenger was despatched towards [Weatherbury]30-weatherbury . [Henchard]191-henchard , in a state of bitter anxiety and contrition , determined to seek [Farfrae]149-farfrae [himself]191-henchard . To this end [he]3806-the other constable hastened down [the town]632-the town , ran along [the eastern road]3829-the eastern road over [Durnover Moor]90-durnover moor , up [the hill beyond]3830-the hill beyond , and thus onward in the moderate darkness of this spring night till [he]3806-the other constable had reached a second and almost [a third hill about three miles distant]3831-a third hill about three miles distant . In [Yalbury Bottom]91-yalbury bottom , or [Plain]92-plain , at the foot of [the hill]328-the hill , [he]3806-the other constable listened . At first nothing , beyond [his]3806-the other constable own heart - throbs , was to be heard but the slow wind making its moan among the masses of spruce and larch of [Yalbury Wood]81-yalbury wood which clothed the heights on either hand ; but presently there came the sound of light wheels whetting their felloes against [the newly stoned patches of road]3833-the newly stoned patches of road , accompanied by the distant glimmer of lights . [He]3806-the other constable knew it was [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's gig descending [the hill]328-the hill from an indescribable personality in its noise , [the vehicle]2873-the vehicle having been [his]3806-the other constable own till bought by [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman at the sale of [his]3806-the other constable effects . [Henchard]191-henchard thereupon retraced [his]3806-the other constable steps along [Yalbury Plain]94-yalbury plain , the gig coming up with [him]3806-the other constable as [its]2873-the vehicle driver slackened speed between [two plantations]3837-two plantations . It was a point in [the highway near which [the road]320-the road to [Mellstock]29-mellstock]3838-the highway near which the road to mellstock branched off from [the homeward direction]3840-the homeward direction . By diverging to [that village]3841-that village , as [he]3806-the other constable had intended to do , [Farfrae]149-farfrae might probably delay [his]3806-the other constable return by a couple of hours . It soon appeared that [his]3806-the other constable intention was to do so still , the light swerving towards [Cuckoo Lane]95-cuckoo lane , [the by - road aforesaid]3842-the by - road aforesaid . [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's off gig - lamp flashed in [Henchard]191-henchard 's face . At the same time [Farfrae]149-farfrae discerned [[his]149-farfrae late antagonist]3843-his late antagonist . “ [Farfrae]149-farfrae — [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae ! ”[149-farfrae] cried the breathless [Henchard]191-henchard , holding up [his]149-farfrae hand . [Farfrae]149-farfrae allowed the horse to turn several steps into [the branch lane]3844-the branch lane before [he]149-farfrae pulled up . [He]149-farfrae then drew rein , and said “ Yes ? ”[191-henchard] over [his]149-farfrae shoulder , as one would towards [a pronounced enemy]3845-a pronounced enemy . “ Come back to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge at once ! ”[191-henchard] [Henchard]191-henchard said . “ There 's something wrong at [[your]149-farfrae house]5643-your house — requiring [your]149-farfrae return . [I]149-farfrae 've run all the way here on purpose to tell [ye]149-farfrae . ”[149-farfrae] [Farfrae]149-farfrae was silent , and at [his]149-farfrae silence [Henchard]191-henchard 's soul sank within [him]149-farfrae . Why had [he]149-farfrae not , before this , thought of what was only too obvious ? [He]149-farfrae who , four hours earlier , had enticed [Farfrae]149-farfrae into a deadly wrestle stood now in the darkness of late night - time on [a lonely road]3846-a lonely road , inviting [him]149-farfrae to come a particular way , where [an assailant]3847-an assailant might have confederates , instead of going [his]149-farfrae purposed way , where there might be a better opportunity of guarding [himself]149-farfrae from attack . [Henchard]191-henchard could almost feel this view of things in course of passage through [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's mind . “ [I]149-farfrae have to go to [Mellstock]29-mellstock , ”[149-farfrae] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae coldly , as [he]149-farfrae loosened [his]149-farfrae reins to move on . “ But , ”[149-farfrae] implored [Henchard]191-henchard , “ the matter is more serious than [your]149-farfrae business at [Mellstock]29-mellstock . It is — [[your]149-farfrae wife]4877-your wife ! [She]4877-your wife is ill . [I]149-farfrae can tell [you]149-farfrae particulars as [we]6078-we go along . ”[149-farfrae] The very agitation and abruptness of [Henchard]191-henchard increased [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's suspicion that this was a ruse to decoy [him]149-farfrae on to [the next wood]3848-the next wood , where might be effectually compassed what , from policy or want of nerve , [Henchard]191-henchard had failed to do earlier in the day . [He]149-farfrae started the horse . “ [I]149-farfrae know what [you]149-farfrae think , ”[149-farfrae] deprecated [Henchard]191-henchard running after , almost bowed down with despair as [he]149-farfrae perceived the image of unscrupulous villainy that [he]149-farfrae assumed in [[his]149-farfrae former friend]1896-his former friend 's eyes . “ But [I]149-farfrae am not what [you]149-farfrae think ! ”[149-farfrae] [he]149-farfrae cried hoarsely . “ Believe [me]3863-i , [Farfrae]149-farfrae ; [I]3863-i have come entirely on [your]149-farfrae own and [[your]149-farfrae wife]4877-your wife 's account . [She]4877-your wife is in danger . [I]3863-i know no more ; and [they]6080-they want [you]149-farfrae to come . [[Your]149-farfrae man]4744-your man has gone the other way in a mistake . [O Farfrae]149-farfrae ! do n't mistrust [me]3863-i — [I]3863-i am [a wretched man]6082-a wretched man ; but [my]3863-i heart is true to [you]149-farfrae still ! ”[3863-i] [Farfrae]149-farfrae , however , did distrust [him]149-farfrae utterly . [He]149-farfrae knew [[his]149-farfrae wife]380-his wife was with [child]562-child , but [he]149-farfrae had left [her]380-his wife not long ago in perfect health ; and [Henchard]191-henchard 's treachery was more credible than [his]149-farfrae story . [He]149-farfrae had in [his]149-farfrae time heard bitter ironies from [Henchard]191-henchard 's lips , and there might be ironies now . [He]149-farfrae quickened the horse 's pace , and had soon risen into [the high country lying between there and [Mellstock]29-mellstock]3852-the high country lying between there and mellstock , [Henchard]191-henchard 's spasmodic run after [him]149-farfrae lending yet more substance to [his]149-farfrae thought of evil purposes . [The gig]3853-the gig and [its driver]3854-its driver lessened against the sky in [Henchard]191-henchard 's eyes ; [his]149-farfrae exertions for [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's good had been in vain . Over [this repentant sinner]3855-this repentant sinner , at least , there was to be no joy in heaven . [He]149-farfrae cursed [himself]149-farfrae like [a less scrupulous Job]3856-a less scrupulous job , as [a vehement man]3857-a vehement man will do when [he]3857-a vehement man loses self - respect , the last mental prop under poverty . To this [he]149-farfrae had come after a time of emotional darkness of which [the adjoining woodland shade]3858-the adjoining woodland shade afforded inadequate illustration . Presently [he]149-farfrae began to walk back again along the way by which [he]149-farfrae had arrived . [Farfrae]149-farfrae should at all events have no reason for delay upon [the road]320-the road by seeing [him]149-farfrae [there]447-there when [he]149-farfrae took [his]149-farfrae journey homeward later on . Arriving at [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge [Henchard]191-henchard went again to [[Farfrae]149-farfrae 's house]3661-farfrae 's house to make inquiries . As soon as the door opened anxious faces confronted [his]149-farfrae from the staircase , [hall]2206-hall , and landing ; and [they]3863-i all said in grievous disappointment , “ O — it is not [he]149-farfrae ! ”[2617-the doctor] [The manservant]3864-the manservant , finding [his]3864-the manservant mistake , had long since returned , and all hopes had centred upon [Henchard]191-henchard . “ But have n't [you]191-henchard found [him]149-farfrae ? ”[2617-the doctor] said [the doctor]2617-the doctor . “ Yes .... [I]149-farfrae can not tell [']149-farfrae [ee]149-farfrae ! ”[149-farfrae] [Henchard]191-henchard replied as [he]149-farfrae sank down on a chair within the entrance . “ [He]149-farfrae ca n't be [home]675-home for two hours . ”[3866-the surgeon] “ H'm , ”[191-henchard] said [the surgeon]3866-the surgeon , returning [upstairs]1000-upstairs . “ How is [she]191-henchard ? ”[191-henchard] asked [Henchard]191-henchard of [Elizabeth]191-henchard , who formed [one of [the group]2423-the group]3868-one of the group . “ In great danger , [father]4491-father . [Her]191-henchard anxiety to see [[her]191-henchard husband]387-her husband makes [her]191-henchard fearfully restless . [Poor woman]2300-poor woman — [I]137-jopp fear [they]6087-they have killed [her]191-henchard ! ”[137-jopp] [Henchard]191-henchard regarded [the sympathetic speaker]3870-the sympathetic speaker for a few instants as if [she]3870-the sympathetic speaker struck [him]3871-he in a new light , then , without further remark , went out of the door and onward to [[his]3871-he lonely cottage]3872-his lonely cottage . So much for [man]488-man 's rivalry , [he]3871-he thought . [Death]270-death was to have the oyster , and [Farfrae]149-farfrae and [himself]3871-he the shells . But about [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard ; in the midst of [his]3871-he gloom [she]191-henchard seemed to [him]3871-he as a pin - point of light . [He]3871-he had liked the look on [her]191-henchard face as [she]191-henchard answered [him]3871-he from the stairs . There had been affection in it , and above all things what [he]3871-he desired now was affection from anything that was good and pure . [She]191-henchard was not [his]3871-he own , yet , for the first time , [he]3871-he had a faint dream that [he]3871-he might get to like [her]191-henchard as [his]3871-he own , — if [she]191-henchard would only continue to love [him]3871-he . [Jopp]137-jopp was just going to bed when [Henchard]191-henchard got [home]675-home . As [the latter]4511-the latter entered the door [Jopp]137-jopp said , “ This is rather bad about [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae 's illness . ”[191-henchard] “ Yes , ”[137-jopp] said [Henchard]191-henchard shortly , though little dreaming of [Jopp]137-jopp 's complicity in the night 's harlequinade , and raising [his]3871-he eyes just sufficiently to observe that [Jopp]137-jopp 's face was lined with anxiety . “ [Somebody]4446-somebody has called for [you]191-henchard , ”[191-henchard] continued [Jopp]137-jopp , when [Henchard]191-henchard was shutting [himself]191-henchard into [[his]3871-he own apartment]3876-his own apartment . “ [A kind of traveller]6089-a kind of traveller , or [sea - captain of some sort]6090-sea - captain of some sort . ”[3871-he] “ Oh ? — who could [he]4446-somebody be ? ”[191-henchard] “ [He]4446-somebody seemed [a well - be - doing man]6091-a well - be - doing man — had grey hair and a broadish face ; but [he]4446-somebody gave no name , and no message . ”[191-henchard] “ Nor do [I]191-henchard gi'e [him]4446-somebody any attention . ”[191-henchard] And , saying this , [Henchard]191-henchard closed [his]3871-he door . The divergence to [Mellstock]29-mellstock delayed [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's return very nearly the two hours of [Henchard]191-henchard 's estimate . Among the other urgent reasons for [his]3871-he presence had been the need of [his]3871-he authority to send to [Budmouth]54-budmouth for [a second physician]3877-a second physician ; and when at length [Farfrae]139-farfrae did come back [he]3871-he was in a state bordering on distraction at [his]3871-he misconception of [Henchard]191-henchard 's motives . [A messenger]1715-a messenger was despatched to [Budmouth]54-budmouth , late as it had grown ; the night wore on , and [the other doctor]3879-the other doctor came in the small hours . [Lucetta]214-lucetta had been much soothed by [Donald]139-farfrae 's arrival ; [he]3871-he seldom or never left [her]214-lucetta side ; and when , immediately after [his]3871-he entry , [she]214-lucetta had tried to lisp out to [him]3871-he the secret which so oppressed [her]214-lucetta , [he]3871-he checked [her]214-lucetta feeble words , lest talking should be dangerous , assuring [her]214-lucetta there was plenty of time to tell [him]3871-he everything . Up to this time [he]3871-he knew nothing of the skimmington - ride . The dangerous illness and miscarriage of [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae was soon rumoured through [the town]632-the town , and an apprehensive guess having been given as to its cause by [the leaders in the exploit]3881-the leaders in the exploit , compunction and fear threw a dead silence over all particulars of [their]3881-the leaders in the exploit orgie ; while those immediately around [Lucetta]214-lucetta would not venture to add to [[her]214-lucetta husband]387-her husband 's distress by alluding to the subject . What , and how much , [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's wife]5636-farfrae 's wife ultimately explained to [him]3871-he of [her]214-lucetta past entanglement with [Henchard]191-henchard , when [they]3884-they were alone in the solitude of that sad night , can not be told . That [she]214-lucetta informed [him]3871-he of the bare facts of [her]214-lucetta peculiar intimacy with [the corn - merchant]1288-the corn - merchant became plain from [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's own statements . But in respect of [her]214-lucetta subsequent conduct — [her]214-lucetta motive in coming to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge to unite [herself]214-lucetta with [Henchard]191-henchard — [her]214-lucetta assumed justification in abandoning [him]3871-he when [she]214-lucetta discovered reasons for fearing [him]3871-he ( though in truth [her]214-lucetta inconsequent passion for [another man]5372-another man at first sight had most to do with that abandonment ) — [her]214-lucetta method of reconciling to [her]214-lucetta conscience a marriage with [the second]4874-the second when [she]214-lucetta was in a measure committed to the first : to what extent [she]214-lucetta spoke of these things remained [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's secret alone . Besides [the watchman who called the hours and weather]3888-the watchman who called the hours and weather in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge that night there walked a figure up and down [Corn Street]75-corn street hardly less frequently . [It]3889-it was [Henchard]191-henchard 's , whose retiring to rest had proved itself a futility as soon as attempted ; and [he]3871-he gave it up to go hither and thither , and make inquiries about [the patient]3890-the patient every now and then . [He]3871-he called as much on [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's account as on [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's , and on [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's even more than on either 's . Shorn one by one of all other interests , [his]3871-he life seemed centring on the personality of [the stepdaughter whose presence but recently]3891-the stepdaughter whose presence but recently [he]3871-he could not endure . To see [her]3891-the stepdaughter whose presence but recently on each occasion of [his]3871-he inquiry at [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's was a comfort to [him]3871-he . The last of [his]3871-he calls was made about four o'clock in the morning , in the steely light of dawn . [Lucifer]271-lucifer was fading into day across [Durnover Moor]90-durnover moor , [the sparrows]3892-the sparrows were just alighting into [the street]797-the street , and [the hens]3894-the hens had begun to cackle from [the outhouses]3895-the outhouses . When within a few yards of [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's]5731-farfrae 's [he]3871-he saw the door gently opened , and [a servant]3897-a servant raise [her]3897-a servant hand to the knocker , to untie the piece of cloth which had muffled it . [He]3871-he went across , the sparrows in [his]3871-he way scarcely flying up from [the road - litter]3898-the road - litter , so little did [they]3892-the sparrows believe in human aggression at so early a time . “ Why do [you]3897-a servant take off that ? ”[3897-a servant] said [Henchard]191-henchard . [She]3897-a servant turned in some surprise at [his]3871-he presence , and did not answer for an instant or two . Recognizing [him]3871-he , [she]3897-a servant said , “ Because [they]3892-the sparrows may knock as loud as [they]3892-the sparrows will ; [she]3897-a servant will never hear it any more . ”[3897-a servant]

[Henchard]191-henchard went [home]675-home . The morning having now fully broke [he]3871-he lit [his]3871-he fire , and sat abstractedly beside it . [He]3871-he had not sat there long when a gentle footstep approached [the house]782-the house and entered [the passage]1731-the passage , a finger tapping lightly at the door . [Henchard]191-henchard 's face brightened , for [he]3871-he knew the motions to be [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's . [She]3897-a servant came into [[his]3871-he room]1135-his room , looking wan and sad . “ Have [you]3871-he heard ? ”[3897-a servant] [she]3897-a servant asked . “ [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae ! [She]139-farfrae is — dead ! Yes , indeed — about an hour ago ! ”[191-henchard] “ [I]191-henchard know it , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard . “ [I]2118-the stranger have but lately come in from [there]447-there . It is so very good of ' ee , [Elizabeth]191-henchard , to come and tell [me]2118-the stranger . [You]191-henchard must be so tired out , too , with sitting up . Now do [you]191-henchard bide here with [me]2118-the stranger this morning . [You]191-henchard can go and rest in [the other room]6093-the other room ; and [I]2118-the stranger will call ' [ee]191-henchard when breakfast is ready . ”[2118-the stranger] To please [him]3871-he , and [herself]3897-a servant — for [his]3871-he recent kindliness was winning a surprised gratitude from [the lonely girl]3903-the lonely girl — [she]3897-a servant did as [he]3871-he bade [her]3897-a servant , and lay down on a sort of couch which [Henchard]191-henchard had rigged up out of a settle in [the adjoining room]3904-the adjoining room . [She]3897-a servant could hear [him]3871-he moving about in [his]3871-he preparations ; but [her]3897-a servant mind ran most strongly on [Lucetta]214-lucetta , whose death in such [fulness of life and amid such cheerful hopes of maternity]3905-fulness of life and amid such cheerful hopes of maternity was appallingly unexpected . Presently [she]3897-a servant fell asleep . Meanwhile [[her]3897-a servant stepfather]5242-her stepfather in [the outer room]1350-the outer room had set the breakfast in readiness ; but finding that [she]3897-a servant dozed [he]3871-he would not call [her]3897-a servant ; [he]3871-he waited on , looking into the fire and keeping the kettle boiling with [house]5766-house - wifely care , as if it were an honour to have [her]3897-a servant in [[his]3871-he house]1329-his house . In truth , a great change had come over [him]3871-he with regard to [her]3897-a servant , and [he]3871-he was developing the dream of a future lit by [her]3897-a servant filial presence , as though that way alone could happiness lie . [He]3871-he was disturbed by another knock at the door , and rose to open it , rather deprecating a call from [anybody]4437-anybody just then . [A stoutly built man]3911-a stoutly built man stood on the doorstep , with an alien , unfamiliar air about [his]3911-a stoutly built man figure and bearing — an air which might have been called colonial by [people of cosmopolitan experience]3912-people of cosmopolitan experience . It was [the man who had asked the way at [Peter]230-peter 's finger]3913-the man who had asked the way at peter 's finger . [Henchard]191-henchard nodded , and looked inquiry . “ Good morning , good morning , ”[2118-the stranger] said [the stranger]2118-the stranger with profuse heartiness . “ Is it [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard [I]191-henchard am talking to ? ”[191-henchard] “ [My]2118-the stranger name is [Henchard]120-henchard . ”[2118-the stranger] “ Then [I]120-henchard 've caught ' [ee]6094-ee at [home]675-home — that 's right . Morning 's the time for business , says [I.]120-henchard Can [I]120-henchard have a few words with [you]3915-his visitor ? ”[120-henchard] “ By all means , ”[3915-his visitor] [Henchard]120-henchard answered , showing the way in . “ [You]3915-his visitor may remember [me]120-henchard ? ”[120-henchard] said [[his]120-henchard visitor]3915-his visitor , seating [himself]3915-his visitor . [Henchard]120-henchard observed [him]3915-his visitor indifferently , and shook [his]120-henchard head . “ Well — perhaps [you]3915-his visitor may not . [My]120-henchard name is [Newson]127-newson . ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard 's face and eyes seemed to die . [The other]338-the other did not notice it . “ [I]120-henchard know the name well , ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard said at last , looking on the floor . “ [I]120-henchard make no doubt of that . Well , the fact is , [I]120-henchard 've been looking for ' [ee]6096-ee this fortnight past . [I]120-henchard landed at [Havenpool]97-havenpool and went through [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge on [my]120-henchard way to [Falmouth]10-falmouth , and when [I]120-henchard got [there]447-there , [they]6098-they told [me]120-henchard [you]3915-his visitor had some years before been living at [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge . Back came [I]120-henchard again , and by long and by late [I]120-henchard got [here]4417-here by [coach]6100-coach , ten minutes ago . ' [He]120-henchard lives down by [the mill]6101-the mill , ' says [they]6098-they . So here [I]120-henchard am . Now — that transaction between [us]6102-us some twenty years agone — ' tis that [I]120-henchard 've called about . ' Twas a curious business . [I]120-henchard was younger then than [I]120-henchard am now , and perhaps the less said about it , in one sense , the better . ”[120-henchard] “ Curious business ! ' Twas worse than curious . [I]127-newson can not even allow that [I]127-newson 'm [the man [you]3915-his visitor met then]6103-the man you met then . [I]127-newson was not in [my]127-newson senses , and [a man]4474-a man 's senses are [himself]4474-a man . ”[127-newson] “ [We]6102-us were young and thoughtless , ”[127-newson] said [Newson]127-newson . “ However , [I]120-henchard 've come to mend matters rather than open arguments . [Poor Susan]272-poor susan — hers was a strange experience . ”[120-henchard] “ [She]272-poor susan was [a warm - hearted , home - spun woman]6105-a warm - hearted , home - spun woman . [She]272-poor susan was not what [they]6106-they call shrewd or sharp at all — better [she]272-poor susan had been . ”[120-henchard] “ [She]272-poor susan was not . ”[127-newson] “ As [you]3915-his visitor in all likelihood know , [she]272-poor susan was simple - minded enough to think that the sale was in a way binding . [She]272-poor susan was as guiltless o ' wrong - doing in that particular as [a saint in the clouds]6107-a saint in the clouds . ”[120-henchard] “ [I]120-henchard know it , [I]120-henchard know it . [I]120-henchard found it out directly , ”[120-henchard] said [Henchard]120-henchard , still with averted eyes . “ There lay the sting o't to [me]3917-the sailor of former days . If [she]272-poor susan had seen it as what it was [she]272-poor susan would never have left [me]3917-the sailor of former days . Never ! But how should [she]272-poor susan be expected to know ? What advantages had [she]272-poor susan ? None . [She]272-poor susan could write [her]272-poor susan own name , and no more . ”[3917-the sailor of former days] “ Well , it was not in [my]3917-the sailor of former days heart to undeceive [her]272-poor susan when the deed was done , ”[3917-the sailor of former days] said [the sailor of former days]3917-the sailor of former days . “ [I]191-henchard thought , and there was not much vanity in thinking it , that [she]272-poor susan would be happier with [me]191-henchard . [She]272-poor susan was fairly happy , and [I]191-henchard never would have undeceived [her]272-poor susan till the day of [her]272-poor susan death . [[Your]6108-your child]6109-your child died ; [she]272-poor susan had another , and all went well . But a time came — mind [me]191-henchard , a time always does come . A time came — it was some while after [she]272-poor susan and [I]191-henchard and [the child]306-the child returned from [America]19-america — when [somebody [she]272-poor susan had confided [her]272-poor susan history to]6111-somebody she had confided her history to , told [her]272-poor susan [my]191-henchard claim to [her]272-poor susan was a mockery , and made a jest of [her]272-poor susan belief in [my]191-henchard right . After that [she]272-poor susan was never happy with [me]191-henchard . [She]272-poor susan pined and pined , and socked and sighed . [She]272-poor susan said [she]272-poor susan must leave [me]191-henchard , and then came the question of [[our]6112-our child]4892-our child . Then [a man]4474-a man advised [me]191-henchard how to act , and [I]191-henchard did it , for [I]191-henchard thought it was best . [I]191-henchard left [her]272-poor susan at [Falmouth]10-falmouth , and went off to [sea]677-sea . When [I]191-henchard got to [the other side of [the Atlantic]98-the atlantic]6116-the other side of the atlantic there was a storm , and it was supposed that [a lot of [us]6112-our]6117-a lot of us , including [myself]191-henchard , had been washed overboard . [I]191-henchard got ashore at [Newfoundland]11-newfoundland , and then [I]191-henchard asked [myself]191-henchard what [I]191-henchard should do . “[191-henchard] ' Since [I]0-i 'm [here]4417-here , [here]4417-here [I]0-i 'll bide , ' [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i ; '' twill be most kindness to [her]3920-she , now [she]3920-she 's taken against [me]0-i , to let [her]3920-she believe [me]0-i lost , for , ' [I]0-i thought , ' while [she]3920-she supposes [us]3921-us both alive [she]3920-she 'll be miserable ; but if [she]3920-she thinks [me]0-i dead [she]3920-she 'll go back to [him]3922-him , and [the child]306-the child will have a [home]675-home . ' [I]0-i 've never returned to [this country]3925-this country till a month ago , and [I]0-i found that , as [I]0-i supposed , [she]3920-she went to [you]3926-you , and [[my]0-i daughter]4881-my daughter with [her]3920-she . [They]3928-they told [me]0-i in [Falmouth]10-falmouth that [Susan]272-poor susan was dead . But [my]0-i Elizabeth - [Jane]191-henchard — where is [she]3920-she ? ” “[191-henchard] Dead likewise , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard doggedly . “[3926-you] Surely [you]3926-you learnt that too ? ” [The sailor]449-the sailor started up , and took an enervated pace or two down [the room]985-the room . “[3926-you] Dead ! ” [he]449-the sailor said , in a low voice . “[0-i] Then what 's the use of [my]0-i money to [me]0-i ? ” [Henchard]191-henchard , without answering , shook [his]0-i head as if that were rather a question for [Newson]127-newson [himself]127-newson than for [him]127-newson . “[3920-she] Where is [she]3920-she buried ? ” [the traveller]6120-the traveller inquired . “[3920-she] Beside [[her]3920-she mother]588-her mother , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard , in the same stolid tones . “[3920-she] When did [she]3920-she die ? ” “[3920-she] A year ago and more , ” replied [the other]338-the other without hesitation . [The sailor]449-the sailor continued standing . [Henchard]191-henchard never looked up from the floor . At last [Newson]127-newson said : “[0-i] [My]0-i journey hither has been for nothing ! [I]0-i may as well go as [I]0-i came ! It has served [me]0-i right . [I]0-i 'll trouble [you]3930-you no longer . ” [Henchard]191-henchard heard the retreating footsteps of [Newson]127-newson upon the sanded floor , the mechanical lifting of the latch , the slow opening and closing of the door that was natural to [a baulked or dejected man]6123-a baulked or dejected man ; but [he]127-newson did not turn [his]127-newson head . [Newson]127-newson 's shadow passed the window . [He]127-newson was gone . Then [Henchard]191-henchard , scarcely believing the evidence of [his]127-newson senses , rose from [his]127-newson seat amazed at what [he]127-newson had done . It had been the impulse of a moment . The regard [he]127-newson had lately acquired for [Elizabeth]191-henchard , the new - sprung hope of [his]127-newson loneliness that [she]191-henchard would be to [him]127-newson [a daughter of whom [he]127-newson could feel as proud as of [the actual daughter [she]191-henchard still believed [herself]191-henchard to be]6125-the actual daughter she still believed herself to be]6124-a daughter of whom he could feel as proud as of the actual daughter she still believed herself to be , had been stimulated by the unexpected coming of [Newson]127-newson to a greedy exclusiveness in relation to [her]191-henchard ; so that the sudden prospect of [her]191-henchard loss had caused [him]127-newson to speak mad lies like [a child , in pure mockery of consequences]6126-a child , in pure mockery of consequences . [He]127-newson had expected questions to close in round [him]127-newson , and unmask [his]127-newson fabrication in five minutes ; yet such questioning had not come . But surely [they]6127-they would come ; [Newson]127-newson 's departure could be but momentary ; [he]127-newson would learn all by inquiries in [the town]632-the town ; and return to curse [him]127-newson , and carry [his]127-newson last treasure away ! [He]127-newson hastily put on [his]127-newson hat , and went out in the direction that [Newson]127-newson had taken . [Newson]127-newson 's back was soon visible up [the road]320-the road , crossing [Bull - stake]99-bull - stake . [Henchard]191-henchard followed , and saw [[his]127-newson visitor]3915-his visitor stop at [the King 's Arms]945-the king 's arms , where [the morning coach]6132-the morning coach which had brought [him]127-newson waited half - an - hour for [another coach]6133-another coach which crossed there . [The coach [Newson]127-newson had come by]6134-the coach newson had come by was now about to move again . [Newson]127-newson mounted , [his]127-newson luggage was put in , and in a few minutes [the vehicle]2873-the vehicle disappeared with [him]127-newson . [He]127-newson had not so much as turned [his]127-newson head . It was an act of simple faith in [Henchard]191-henchard 's words — faith so simple as to be almost sublime . [The young sailor who had taken [Susan Henchard]122-henchard on the spur of the moment and on the faith of a glance at [her]6136-the young sailor who had taken susan henchard on the spur of the moment and on the faith of a glance at her face face]6136-the young sailor who had taken susan henchard on the spur of the moment and on the faith of a glance at her face , more than twenty years before , was still living and acting under the form of [the grizzled traveller who had taken [Henchard]122-henchard 's words on trust so absolute as to shame [him]127-newson as [he]127-newson stood]6137-the grizzled traveller who had taken henchard 's words on trust so absolute as to shame him as he stood . Was [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard to remain [his]127-newson by virtue of this hardy invention of a moment ? “[4491-father] Perhaps not for long , ” said [he]127-newson . [Newson]127-newson might converse with [[his]127-newson fellow - travellers]6138-his fellow - travellers , [some of whom might be [Casterbridge people]6140-casterbridge people]6139-some of whom might be casterbridge people ; and the trick would be discovered . This probability threw [Henchard]122-henchard into a defensive attitude , and instead of considering how best to right the wrong , and acquaint [[Elizabeth]191-henchard 's father]6141-elizabeth 's father with the truth at once , [he]127-newson bethought [himself]127-newson of ways to keep the position [he]127-newson had accidentally won . Towards [the young woman]310-the young woman [herself]310-the young woman [his]127-newson affection grew more jealously strong with each new hazard to which [his]127-newson claim to [her]310-the young woman was exposed . [He]127-newson watched [the distant highway]6143-the distant highway expecting to see [Newson]127-newson return on foot , enlightened and indignant , to claim [[his]127-newson child]6144-his child . But [no figure]6145-no figure appeared . Possibly [he]127-newson had spoken to [nobody]298-nobody on [the coach]4720-the coach , but buried [his]127-newson grief in [his]127-newson own heart . [His]127-newson grief ! — what was it , after all , to that which [he]127-newson , [Henchard]122-henchard , would feel at the loss of [her]310-the young woman ? [Newson]127-newson 's affection cooled by years , could not equal [his]127-newson who had been constantly in [her]310-the young woman presence . And thus [his]127-newson jealous soul speciously argued to excuse the separation of [father]4491-father and [child]562-child . [He]127-newson returned to [the house]782-the house half expecting that [she]310-the young woman would have vanished . No ; there [she]310-the young woman was — just coming out from [the inner room]6151-the inner room , the marks of sleep upon [her]310-the young woman eyelids , and exhibiting a generally refreshed air . “[4491-father] O [father]4491-father ! ” [she]310-the young woman said smiling . “[0-i] [I]0-i had no sooner lain down than [I]0-i napped , though [I]0-i did not mean to . [I]0-i wonder [I]0-i did not dream about [poor Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae , after thinking of [her]139-farfrae so ; but [I]0-i did not . How strange it is that [we]3932-we do not often dream of latest events , absorbing as they may be . ” “[202-father] [I]0-i am glad [you]0-i have been able to sleep , ” [he]127-newson said , taking [her]310-the young woman hand with anxious proprietorship — an act which gave [her]310-the young woman a pleasant surprise . [They]3932-we sat down to breakfast , and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's thoughts reverted to [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [Their]3932-we sadness added charm to a countenance whose beauty had ever lain in its meditative soberness . “[202-father] [Father]202-father , ” [she]310-the young woman said , as soon as [she]310-the young woman recalled [herself]310-the young woman to the outspread meal , “[0-i] it is so kind of [you]202-father to get this nice breakfast with [your]202-father own hands , and [I]0-i idly asleep the while . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do it every day , ” [he]202-father replied . “[0-i] [You]0-i have left [me]0-i ; [everybody]1670-everybody has left [me]0-i ; how should [I]0-i live but by [my]0-i own hands . ” “[562-child] [You]0-i are very lonely , are [you]0-i not ? ” “[0-i] Ay , [child]562-child — to a degree that [you]0-i know nothing of ! It is [my]0-i own fault . [You]0-i are the only one who has been near [me]0-i for weeks . And [you]0-i will come no more . ” “[3935-her] Why do [you]0-i say that ? Indeed [I]0-i will , if [you]0-i would like to see [me]0-i . ” [Henchard]191-henchard signified dubiousness . Though [he]202-father had so lately hoped that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard might again live in [[his]202-father house]1329-his house as [daughter]603-daughter , [he]202-father would not ask [her]191-henchard to do so now . [Newson]127-newson might return at any moment , and what [Elizabeth]191-henchard would think of [him]127-newson for [his]127-newson deception it were best to bear apart from [her]191-henchard . When [they]6154-they had breakfasted [[his]202-father stepdaughter]2495-his stepdaughter still lingered , till the moment arrived at which [Henchard]191-henchard was accustomed to go to [his]202-father daily work . Then [she]191-henchard arose , and with assurance of coming again soon went up [the hill]328-the hill in the morning sunlight . “[4491-father] At this moment [her]3935-her heart is as warm towards [me]0-i as [mine]0-i is towards [her]3935-her , [she]3935-her would live with [me]0-i here in [this humble cottage]3936-this humble cottage for the asking ! Yet before the evening probably [he]3937-he will have come , and then [she]3935-her will scorn [me]0-i ! ” This reflection , constantly repeated by [Henchard]191-henchard to [himself]202-father , accompanied [him]202-father everywhere through the day . [His]202-father mood was no longer that of [the rebellious , ironical , reckless misadventurer]6157-the rebellious , ironical , reckless misadventurer ; but the leaden gloom of [one who has lost all that can make life interesting , or even tolerable]6158-one who has lost all that can make life interesting , or even tolerable . There would remain [nobody]298-nobody for [him]202-father to be proud of , [nobody]298-nobody to fortify [him]202-father ; for [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard would soon be but as [a stranger]4470-a stranger , and worse . [Susan]122-henchard , [Farfrae]139-farfrae , [Lucetta]214-lucetta , [Elizabeth]191-henchard — all had gone from [him]202-father , one after one , either by [his]202-father fault or by [his]202-father misfortune . In place of [them]6162-them [he]202-father had no interest , hobby , or desire . If [he]202-father could have summoned music to [his]202-father aid [his]202-father existence might even now have been borne ; for with [Henchard]122-henchard music was of regal power . The merest trumpet or organ tone was enough to move [him]202-father , and high harmonies transubstantiated [him]202-father . But hard fate had ordained that [he]202-father should be unable to call up this Divine spirit in [his]202-father need . [The whole land ahead of [him]202-father]6163-the whole land ahead of him was as darkness itself ; there was nothing to come , nothing to wait for . Yet in the natural course of life [he]202-father might possibly have to linger on [earth]6164-earth another thirty or forty years — scoffed at ; at best pitied . The thought of it was unendurable . To [the east of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]6165-the east of casterbridge lay moors and [meadows through which much water flowed]6166-meadows through which much water flowed . [The wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night , might hear singular symphonies from [these waters]6168-these waters , as from a lampless orchestra , all playing in [their]6162-them sundry tones from near and far parts of [the moor]3395-the moor . At [a hole in [a rotten weir]6171-a rotten weir]6170-a hole in a rotten weir [they]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night executed a recitative ; where [a tributary brook]6172-a tributary brook fell over a stone breastwork [they]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night trilled cheerily ; under an arch [they]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night performed a metallic cymballing , and at [Durnover Hole]100-durnover hole [they]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night hissed . [The spot at which]6173-the spot at which [their]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night instrumentation rose loudest was a place called Ten Hatches , whence during high springs there proceeded a very fugue of sounds . [The river]1757-the river here was deep and strong at all times , and the hatches on this account were raised and lowered by cogs and a winch . A patch led from [the second bridge]6175-the second bridge over [the highway]301-the highway ( so often mentioned ) to [these Hatches]6177-these hatches , crossing [the stream]5911-the stream at [their]6167-the wanderer in this direction who should stand still for a few moments on a quiet night head by [a narrow plank - bridge]6179-a narrow plank - bridge . But after night - fall [human beings]1011-human beings were seldom found going that way , the path leading only to [a deep reach of [the stream]5911-the stream called Blackwater]6181-a deep reach of the stream called blackwater , and the passage being dangerous . [Henchard]122-henchard , however , leaving [the town]632-the town by [the east road]6184-the east road , proceeded to [the second , or stone bridge]6185-the second , or stone bridge , and thence struck into [this path of solitude]6186-this path of solitude , following [its]6186-this path of solitude course beside [the stream]5911-the stream till the dark shapes of the Ten Hatches cut the sheen thrown upon [the river]1757-the river by the weak lustre that still lingered in the west . In a second or two [he]122-henchard stood beside [the weir - hole where [the water was at]6190-the water was at [its]6190-the water was at deepest]6189-the weir - hole where the water was at its deepest . [He]122-henchard looked backwards and forwards , and [no creature]6191-no creature appeared in view . [He]122-henchard then took off [his]122-henchard coat and hat , and stood on the brink of [the stream]5911-the stream with [his]122-henchard hands clasped in front of [him]122-henchard . While [his]122-henchard eyes were bent on the water beneath there slowly became visible a something floating in the circular pool formed by the wash of centuries ; the pool [he]122-henchard was intending to make [his]122-henchard death - bed . At first it was indistinct by reason of the shadow from [the bank]325-the bank ; but it emerged thence and took shape , which was that of a human body , lying stiff and stark upon the surface of [the stream]5911-the stream . In the circular current imparted by the central flow the form was brought forward , till it passed under [his]122-henchard eyes ; and then [he]122-henchard perceived with a sense of horror that it was [HIMSELF]122-henchard . Not [a man somewhat resembling [him]122-henchard , but one in all respects [[his]122-henchard counterpart]6196-his counterpart , [[his]122-henchard actual double]6197-his actual double , was floating as if dead in [Ten Hatches Hole]101-ten hatches hole]6195-a man somewhat resembling him , but one in all respects his counterpart , his actual double , was floating as if dead in ten hatches hole . The sense of the supernatural was strong in [this unhappy man]6198-this unhappy man , and [he]122-henchard turned away as [one]1127-one might have done in the actual presence of an appalling miracle . [He]122-henchard covered [his]122-henchard eyes and bowed [his]122-henchard head . Without looking again into [the stream]5911-the stream [he]122-henchard took [his]122-henchard coat and hat , and went slowly away . Presently [he]122-henchard found [himself]122-henchard by the door of [[his]122-henchard own dwelling]6201-his own dwelling . To [his]122-henchard surprise [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard was standing [there]447-there . [She]191-henchard came forward , spoke , called [him]122-henchard “[0-i] [father]4491-father ” just as before . [Newson]127-newson , then , had not even yet returned . “[4491-father] [I]0-i thought [you]3939-you seemed very sad this morning , ” [she]191-henchard said , “[0-i] so [I]0-i have come again to see [you]3939-you . Not that [I]0-i am anything but sad [myself]0-i . But [everybody]1670-everybody and everything seem against [you]3939-you so , and [I]0-i know [you]3939-you must be suffering . ” How [this woman]5418-this woman divined things ! Yet [she]5418-this woman had not divined [their]6204-their whole extremity . [He]0-i said to [her]3941-she , “[0-i] Are miracles still worked , do [ye]3941-she think , [Elizabeth]191-henchard ? [I]0-i am not [a read man]3942-a read man . [I]0-i do n't know so much as [I]0-i could wish . [I]0-i have tried to peruse and learn all [my]0-i life ; but the more [I]0-i try to know the more ignorant [I]0-i seem . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n't quite think there are any miracles nowadays , ” [she]3941-she said . “[0-i] No interference in the case of desperate intentions , for instance ? Well , perhaps not , in a direct way . Perhaps not . But will [you]3939-you come and walk with [me]0-i , and [I]0-i will show ' [ee]3943-ee what [I]0-i mean . ” [She]3941-she agreed willingly , and [he]0-i took [her]3941-she over [the highway]301-the highway , and by [the lonely path]6206-the lonely path to [Ten Hatches]102-ten hatches . [He]0-i walked restlessly , as if some haunting shade , unseen of [her]3941-she , hovered round [him]0-i and troubled [his]0-i glance . [She]3941-she would gladly have talked of [Lucetta]214-lucetta , but feared to disturb [him]0-i . When [they]6207-they got near [the weir]6208-the weir [he]0-i stood still , and asked [her]3941-she to go forward and look into [the pool]6209-the pool , and tell [him]0-i what [she]3941-she saw . [She]3941-she went , and soon returned to [him]0-i . “[0-i] Nothing , ” [she]3941-she said . “[0-i] Go again , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard , “[0-i] and look narrowly . ” [She]3941-she proceeded to [the river]1757-the river brink a second time . On [her]3941-she return , after some delay , [she]3941-she told [him]0-i that [she]3941-she saw something floating round and round there ; but what it was [she]3941-she could not discern . It seemed to be a bundle of old clothes . “[0-i] Are they like [mine]3944-mine ? ” asked [Henchard]191-henchard . “[202-father] Well — they are . Dear [me]0-i — [I]0-i wonder if — [Father]202-father , let [us]3945-us go away ! ” “[0-i] Go and look once more ; and then [we]3945-us will get [home]675-home . ” [She]3941-she went back , and [he]0-i could see [her]3941-she stoop till [her]3941-she head was close to the margin of [the pool]6209-the pool . [She]3941-she started up , and hastened back to [his]0-i side . “[0-i] Well , ” said [Henchard]191-henchard ; “[0-i] what do [you]0-i say now ? ” “[0-i] Let [us]3945-us go [home]675-home . ” “[0-i] But tell [me]0-i — do — what is it floating there ? ” “[0-i] The effigy , ” [she]3941-she answered hastily . “[3948-their] [They]3948-their must have thrown it into [the river]1757-the river higher up amongst [the willows at [Blackwater]103-blackwater]3950-the willows at blackwater , to get rid of it in [their]3948-their alarm at discovery by [the magistrates]5583-the magistrates , and it must have floated down here . ” “[3948-their] Ah — to be sure — the image o ' [me]0-i ! But where is the other ? Why [that one]3952-that one only ? ... That performance of [theirs]3948-their killed [her]3952-that one , but kept [me]0-i alive ! ” [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard thought and thought of these words “[202-father] kept [me]0-i alive , ” as [they]3948-their slowly retraced [their]3948-their way to [the town]632-the town , and at length guessed [their]3948-their meaning . “[0-i] [Father]202-father ! — [I]0-i will not leave [you]202-father alone like this ! ” [she]191-henchard cried . “[202-father] May [I]0-i live with [you]202-father , and tend upon [you]202-father as [I]0-i used to do ? [I]0-i do not mind [your]202-father being poor . [I]0-i would have agreed to come this morning , but [you]202-father did not ask [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] May [you]0-i come to [me]0-i ? ” [he]202-father cried bitterly . “[0-i] [Elizabeth]191-henchard , do n't mock [me]0-i ! If [you]0-i only would come ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will , ” said [she]191-henchard . “[0-i] How will [you]202-father forgive all [my]0-i roughness in former days ? [You]202-father can not ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have forgotten it . Talk of that no more . ” Thus [she]191-henchard assured [him]202-father , and arranged [their]6213-their plans for reunion ; and at length each went [home]675-home . Then [Henchard]191-henchard shaved for the first time during many days , and put on clean linen , and combed [his]202-father hair ; and was as [a man]4474-a man resuscitated thenceforward . The next morning the fact turned out to be as [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had stated ; the effigy was discovered by [a cowherd]6216-a cowherd , and that of [Lucetta]214-lucetta a little higher up in [the same stream]6217-the same stream . But as little as possible was said of the matter , and the figures were privately destroyed . Despite this natural solution of the mystery [Henchard]191-henchard no less regarded it as an intervention that the figure should have been floating there . [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard heard [him]0-i say , “[4446-somebody] Who is such a reprobate as [I]0-i ! And yet it seems that even [I]0-i be in [Somebody]4446-somebody 's hand ! ”[127-newson]

But the emotional conviction that [he]0-i was in [Somebody]4446-somebody 's hand began to die out of [Henchard]191-henchard 's breast as time slowly removed into distance the event which had given that feeling birth . The apparition of [Newson]127-newson haunted [him]0-i . [He]127-newson would surely return . Yet [Newson]127-newson did not arrive . [Lucetta]214-lucetta had been borne along [the churchyard path]3955-the churchyard path ; [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge had for the last time turned its regard upon [her]214-lucetta , before proceeding to its work as if [she]214-lucetta had never lived . But [Elizabeth]191-henchard remained undisturbed in the belief of [her]191-henchard relationship to [Henchard]191-henchard , and now shared [[his]127-newson home]3956-his home . Perhaps , after all , [Newson]127-newson was gone for ever . In due time [the bereaved Farfrae]3957-the bereaved farfrae had learnt the , at least , proximate cause of [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's illness and death , and [his]3957-the bereaved farfrae first impulse was naturally enough to wreak vengeance in the name of the law upon [the perpetrators of the mischief]3958-the perpetrators of the mischief . [He]3957-the bereaved farfrae resolved to wait till the funeral was over ere [he]3957-the bereaved farfrae moved in the matter . The time having come [he]3957-the bereaved farfrae reflected . Disastrous as the result had been , it was obviously in no way foreseen or intended by [the thoughtless crew who arranged the motley procession]3959-the thoughtless crew who arranged the motley procession . The tempting prospect of putting to [the blush people who stand at the head of affairs]3960-the blush people who stand at the head of affairs — that supreme and piquant enjoyment of [those who writhe under the heel of the same]3961-those who writhe under the heel of the same — had alone animated [them]3960-the blush people who stand at the head of affairs , so far as [he]3957-the bereaved farfrae could see ; for [he]3957-the bereaved farfrae knew nothing of [Jopp]137-jopp 's incitements . Other considerations were also involved . [Lucetta]214-lucetta had confessed everything to [him]3957-the bereaved farfrae before [her]214-lucetta death , and it was not altogether desirable to make much ado about [her]214-lucetta history , alike for [her]214-lucetta sake , for [Henchard]191-henchard 's , and for [his]3957-the bereaved farfrae own . To regard the event as an untoward accident seemed , to [Farfrae]139-farfrae , truest consideration for [the dead one]3962-the dead one 's memory , as well as best philosophy . [Henchard]191-henchard and [himself]3957-the bereaved farfrae mutually forbore to meet . For [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's sake [the former]3963-the former had fettered [his]3957-the bereaved farfrae pride sufficiently to accept the small seed and root business which [some of [the Town Council]4580-the town council , headed by [Farfrae]139-farfrae]3964-some of the town council , headed by farfrae , had purchased to afford [him]3957-the bereaved farfrae a new opening . Had [he]3957-the bereaved farfrae been only personally concerned [Henchard]191-henchard , without doubt , would have declined assistance even remotely brought about by [the man whom [he]3957-the bereaved farfrae had so fiercely assailed]3966-the man whom he had so fiercely assailed . But the sympathy of [the girl]311-the girl seemed necessary to [his]3957-the bereaved farfrae very existence ; and on [her]311-the girl account pride itself wore the garments of humility . Here [they]3968-they settled [themselves]3968-they ; and on each day of [their]3968-they lives [Henchard]191-henchard anticipated [her]311-the girl every wish with a watchfulness in which paternal regard was heightened by a burning jealous dread of rivalry . Yet that [Newson]127-newson would ever now return to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge to claim [her]311-the girl as [a daughter]3969-a daughter there was little reason to suppose . [He]127-newson was [a wanderer]3970-a wanderer and [a stranger]4470-a stranger , almost [an alien]3972-an alien ; [he]127-newson had not seen [[his]127-newson daughter]2039-his daughter for several years ; [his]127-newson affection for [her]311-the girl could not in the nature of things be keen ; other interests would probably soon obscure [his]127-newson recollections of [her]311-the girl , and prevent any such renewal of inquiry into the past as would lead to a discovery that [she]311-the girl was still a creature of the present . To satisfy [his]127-newson conscience somewhat [Henchard]191-henchard repeated to [himself]127-newson that the lie which had retained for [him]127-newson the coveted treasure had not been deliberately told to that end , but had come from [him]127-newson as the last defiant word of a despair which took no thought of consequences . Furthermore [he]127-newson pleaded within [himself]127-newson that [no Newson]127-newson could love [her]311-the girl as [he]127-newson loved [her]311-the girl , or would tend [her]311-the girl to [his]127-newson life 's extremity as [he]127-newson was prepared to do cheerfully . Thus [they]3974-they lived on in [the shop overlooking [the churchyard]2102-the churchyard]3250-the shop overlooking the churchyard , and nothing occurred to mark [their]3974-they days during the remainder of the year . Going out but seldom , and never on a marketday , [they]3974-they saw [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae only at rarest intervals , and then mostly as a transitory object in the distance of [the street]797-the street . Yet [he]127-newson was pursuing [his]127-newson ordinary avocations , smiling mechanically to [fellow - tradesmen]3978-fellow - tradesmen , and arguing with [bargainers]3979-bargainers — as [bereaved men]3980-bereaved men do after a while . Time , “ in [his]127-newson own grey style , ”[127-newson] taught [Farfrae]139-farfrae how to estimate [his]127-newson experience of [Lucetta]188-lucetta — all that it was , and all that it was not . There are [men whose hearts]3981-men whose hearts insist upon a dogged fidelity to some image or cause thrown by chance into [their]3981-men whose hearts keeping , long after [their]3981-men whose hearts judgment has pronounced it no rarity — even the reverse , indeed , and without [them]3981-men whose hearts the band of [the worthy]3982-the worthy is incomplete . But [Farfrae]139-farfrae was not of those . It was inevitable that the insight , briskness , and rapidity of [his]127-newson nature should take [him]127-newson out of the dead blank which [his]127-newson loss threw about [him]127-newson . [He]127-newson could not but perceive that by the death of [Lucetta]214-lucetta [he]127-newson had exchanged a looming misery for a simple sorrow . After that revelation of [her]214-lucetta history , which must have come sooner or later in any circumstances , it was hard to believe that life with [her]214-lucetta would have been productive of further happiness . But as a memory , nothwithstanding such conditions , [Lucetta]214-lucetta 's image still lived on with [him]127-newson , [her]214-lucetta weaknesses provoking only the gentlest criticism , and [her]214-lucetta sufferings attenuating wrath at [her]214-lucetta concealments to a momentary spark now and then . By the end of a year [[Henchard]191-henchard 's little retail seed and grain shop]3983-henchard 's little retail seed and grain shop , not much larger than [a cupboard]3984-a cupboard , had developed [its]3983-henchard 's little retail seed and grain shop trade considerably , and [the stepfather]3985-the stepfather and [daughter]603-daughter enjoyed much serenity in the pleasant , sunny corner in which [it]3983-henchard 's little retail seed and grain shop stood . The quiet bearing of one who brimmed with an inner activity characterized [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard at this period . [She]191-henchard took long walks into [the country]633-the country two or three times a week , mostly in [the direction of [Budmouth]54-budmouth]3988-the direction of budmouth . Sometimes it occurred to [him]127-newson that when [she]191-henchard sat with [him]127-newson in the evening after those invigorating walks [she]191-henchard was civil rather than affectionate ; and [he]127-newson was troubled ; one more bitter regret being added to those [he]127-newson had already experienced at having , by [his]127-newson severe censorship , frozen up [her]191-henchard precious affection when originally offered . [She]191-henchard had [her]191-henchard own way in everything now . In going and coming , in buying and selling , [her]191-henchard word was law . “ [You]191-henchard have got a new muff , [Elizabeth]191-henchard , ”[191-henchard] [he]127-newson said to [her]191-henchard one day quite humbly . “ Yes ; [I]127-newson bought it , ”[127-newson] [she]191-henchard said . [He]127-newson looked at it again as it lay on an adjoining table . The fur was of a glossy brown , and , though [he]127-newson was [no judge of such articles]3989-no judge of such articles , [he]127-newson thought it seemed an unusually good one for [her]191-henchard to possess . “ Rather costly , [I]191-henchard suppose , [[my]191-henchard dear]4489-my dear , was it not ? ”[191-henchard] [he]127-newson hazarded . “ It was rather above [my]191-henchard figure , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said quietly . “ But it is not showy . ”[127-newson] “ O no , ”[127-newson] said the netted lion , anxious not to pique [her]191-henchard in the least . Some little time after , when the year had advanced into another spring , [he]127-newson paused opposite [[her]191-henchard empty bedroom]3990-her empty bedroom in passing [it]3990-her empty bedroom . [He]127-newson thought of the time when [she]191-henchard had cleared out of [[his]127-newson then large and handsome house in [Corn Street]75-corn street]3991-his then large and handsome house in corn street , in consequence of [his]127-newson dislike and harshness , and [he]127-newson had looked into [[her]191-henchard chamber]3992-her chamber in just the same way . [The present room]3993-the present room was much humbler , but what struck [him]127-newson about it was the abundance of books lying everywhere . [Their]3994-their number and quality made the meagre furniture that supported them seem absurdly disproportionate . Some , indeed many , must have been recently purchased ; and though [he]127-newson encouraged [her]191-henchard to buy in reason , [he]127-newson had no notion that [she]191-henchard indulged [her]191-henchard innate passion so extensively in proportion to the narrowness of [their]3995-their income . For the first time [he]127-newson felt a little hurt by what [he]127-newson thought [her]191-henchard extravagance , and resolved to say a word to [her]191-henchard about it . But , before [he]127-newson had found the courage to speak an event happened which set [his]127-newson thoughts flying in quite another direction . The busy time of the seed trade was over , and the quiet weeks that preceded the hay - season had come — setting [their]3994-their special stamp upon [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge by thronging [the market]5183-the market with wood rakes , new waggons in yellow , green , and red , formidable scythes , and pitchforks of prong sufficient to skewer up [a small family]3997-a small family . [Henchard]191-henchard , contrary to [his]127-newson wo nt , went out one Saturday afternoon towards [the market - place]1919-the market - place from a curious feeling that [he]127-newson would like to pass a few minutes on the spot of [his]127-newson former triumphs . [Farfrae]139-farfrae , to whom [he]127-newson was still [a comparative stranger]3999-a comparative stranger , stood a few steps below [the Corn Exchange]4000-the corn exchange door — a usual position with [him]127-newson at this hour — and [he]127-newson appeared lost in thought about something [he]127-newson was looking at a little way off . [Henchard]191-henchard 's eyes followed [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's , and [he]127-newson saw that the object of [his]127-newson gaze was [no sample - showing farmer]4001-no sample - showing farmer , but [[his]127-newson own stepdaughter , who had just come out of [a shop]3261-a shop over the way]4002-his own stepdaughter , who had just come out of a shop over the way . [She]4002-his own stepdaughter , who had just come out of a shop over the way , on [her]4002-his own stepdaughter , who had just come out of a shop over the way part , was quite unconscious of [his]127-newson attention , and in this was less fortunate than [those young women whose very plumes , like those of [Juno]273-juno 's bird]4004-those young women whose very plumes , like those of juno 's bird , are set with Argus eyes whenever possible [admirers are within ken]4005-admirers are within ken . [Henchard]191-henchard went away , thinking that perhaps there was nothing significant after all in [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's look at [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard at that juncture . Yet [he]127-newson could not forget that [the Scotchman]886-the scotchman had once shown a tender interest in [her]191-henchard , of a fleeting kind . Thereupon promptly came to the surface that idiosyncrasy of [Henchard]191-henchard 's which had ruled [his]127-newson courses from the beginning and had mainly made [him]127-newson what [he]127-newson was . Instead of thinking that a union between [[his]127-newson cherished step - daughter]4007-his cherished step - daughter and [the energetic thriving [Donald]139-farfrae]4008-the energetic thriving donald was a thing to be desired for [her]191-henchard good and [his]127-newson own , [he]127-newson hated the very possibility . Time had been when such instinctive opposition would have taken shape in action . But [he]127-newson was not now [the Henchard of former days]4009-the henchard of former days . [He]127-newson schooled [himself]127-newson to accept [her]191-henchard will , in this as in other matters , as absolute and unquestionable . [He]127-newson dreaded lest an antagonistic word should lose for [him]127-newson such regard as [he]127-newson had regained from [her]191-henchard by [his]127-newson devotion , feeling that to retain this under separation was better than to incur [her]191-henchard dislike by keeping [her]191-henchard near . But the mere thought of such separation fevered [his]127-newson spirit much , and in the evening [he]127-newson said , with the stillness of suspense : “ Have [you]191-henchard seen [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae to - day , [Elizabeth]191-henchard ? ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard started at the question ; and it was with some confusion that [she]191-henchard replied “ No . ”[127-newson] “ Oh — that 's right — that 's right .... It was only that [I]127-newson saw [him]371-the young man in [the street]797-the street when [we]6220-we both were [there]447-there . ”[127-newson] [He]127-newson was wondering if [her]191-henchard embarrassment justified [him]127-newson in a new suspicion — that the long walks which [she]191-henchard had latterly been taking , that the new books which had so surprised [him]127-newson , had anything to do with [the young man]371-the young man . [She]191-henchard did not enlighten [him]127-newson , and lest silence should allow [her]191-henchard to shape thoughts unfavourable to [their]4011-their present friendly relations , [he]127-newson diverted the discourse into another channel . [Henchard]191-henchard was , by original make , [the last man to act stealthily , for good or for evil]4012-the last man to act stealthily , for good or for evil . But the solicitus timor of [his]127-newson love — the dependence upon [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's regard into which [he]127-newson had declined ( or , in another sense , to which [he]127-newson had advanced ) — denaturalized [him]127-newson . [He]127-newson would often weigh and consider for hours together the meaning of such and such a deed or phrase of [hers]191-henchard , when a blunt settling question would formerly have been [his]127-newson first instinct . And now , uneasy at the thought of a passion for [Farfrae]149-farfrae which should entirely displace [her]191-henchard mild filial sympathy with [himself]127-newson , [he]127-newson observed [her]191-henchard going and coming more narrowly . There was nothing secret in [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's movements beyond what habitual reserve induced , and it may at once be owned on [her]191-henchard account that [she]191-henchard was guilty of occasional conversations with [Donald]139-farfrae when [they]4013-they chanced to meet . Whatever the origin of [her]191-henchard walks on [the Budmouth Road]4795-the budmouth road , [her]191-henchard return from those walks was often coincident with [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's emergence from [Corn Street]75-corn street for a twenty minutes ' blow on [that rather windy highway]4015-that rather windy highway — just to winnow the seeds and chaff out of [him]127-newson before sitting down to tea , as [he]127-newson said . [Henchard]191-henchard became aware of this by going to the Ring , and , screened by [its]4016-its enclosure , keeping [his]127-newson eye upon [the road]320-the road till [he]127-newson saw [them]4013-they meet . [His]127-newson face assumed an expression of extreme anguish . “ Of [her]191-henchard , too , [he]127-newson means to rob [me]127-newson ! ”[127-newson] [he]127-newson whispered . “ But [he]127-newson has the right . [I]127-newson do not wish to interfere . ”[127-newson] The meeting , in truth , was of a very innocent kind , and matters were by no means so far advanced between [the young people]4018-the young people as [Henchard]191-henchard 's jealous grief inferred . Could [he]127-newson have heard such conversation as passed [he]127-newson would have been enlightened thus much : — [HE]127-newson . — “ [You]4019-she like walking this way , [Miss Henchard]166-miss henchard — and is it not so ? ”[127-newson] ( uttered in [his]127-newson undulatory accents , and with an appraising , pondering gaze at [her]4019-she ) . [SHE]4019-she . — “ O yes . [I]4019-she have chosen [this road]6222-this road latterly . [I]4019-she have no great reason for it . ”[4019-she] [HE]127-newson . — “ But that may make a reason for [others]860-others . ”[127-newson] [SHE]4019-she ( reddening ) . — “ [I]127-newson do n't know that . A secret cast a deep shadow over [my]191-henchard life . And well [you]127-newson know what it was . ”[191-henchard] [Elizabeth]191-henchard admitted that [she]191-henchard did , but [she]191-henchard refrained from confessing why [the sea]5783-the sea attracted [her]191-henchard . [She]191-henchard could not [herself]191-henchard account for it fully , not knowing the secret possibly to be that , in addition to early marine associations , [her]191-henchard blood was [a sailor]1192-a sailor 's . “ Thank [you]127-newson for those new books , [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae , ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard added shyly . “ [I]191-henchard wonder if [I]191-henchard ought to accept so many ! ”[191-henchard] “ Ay ! why not ? [Henchard]191-henchard vowed that [he]4025-he would leave [them]4022-their to [their]4022-their own devices , put nothing in the way of [their]4022-their courses , whatever [they]4022-their might mean . If [he]4025-he were doomed to be bereft of [her]191-henchard , so it must be . In the situation which [their]4022-their marriage would create [he]4025-he could see no locus standi for [himself]4025-he at all . [Farfrae]149-farfrae would never recognize [him]4025-he more than superciliously ; [his]4025-he poverty ensured that , no less than [his]4025-he past conduct . And so [Elizabeth]191-henchard would grow to be [a stranger to [him]4025-he]4026-a stranger to him , and the end of [his]4025-he life would be friendless solitude . With such a possibility impending [he]4025-he could not help watchfulness . Indeed , within certain lines , [he]4025-he had the right to keep an eye upon [her]191-henchard as [his]4025-he charge . The meetings seemed to become matters of course with [them]4027-them on special days of the week . At last full proof was given [him]4025-he . [He]4025-he was standing behind a wall close to [the place at which [Farfrae]149-farfrae encountered [her]191-henchard]4028-the place at which farfrae encountered her . [The chief]345-the chief looming trouble in this engagement had not decreased . Both [Farfrae]149-farfrae and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , unlike [the rest of the people]4033-the rest of the people , must suppose [Elizabeth]191-henchard to be [[his]149-farfrae actual daughter]4034-his actual daughter , from [his]149-farfrae own assertion while [he]149-farfrae [himself]149-farfrae had the same belief ; and though [Farfrae]149-farfrae must have so far forgiven [him]149-farfrae as to have no objection to own [him]149-farfrae as [a father - in - law]4035-a father - in - law , intimate [they]4036-they could never be . Thus would [the girl]311-the girl , who was [[his]149-farfrae only friend]4038-his only friend , be withdrawn from [him]149-farfrae by degrees through [[her]311-the girl husband]387-her husband 's influence , and learn to despise [him]149-farfrae . Had [she]311-the girl lost [her]311-the girl heart to [any other man in [the world]4424-the world]2727-any other man in the world than the one [he]149-farfrae had rivalled , cursed , wrestled with for life in days before [his]149-farfrae spirit was broken , [Henchard]191-henchard would have said , “ [I]191-henchard am content . ”[191-henchard] But content with the prospect as now depicted was hard to acquire . There is an outer chamber of the brain in which thoughts unowned , unsolicited , and of noxious kind , are sometimes allowed to wander for a moment prior to being sent off whence [they]4042-they came . One of these thoughts sailed into [Henchard]191-henchard 's ken now . Suppose [he]149-farfrae were to communicate to [Farfrae]149-farfrae the fact that [[his]149-farfrae betrothed]4043-his betrothed was not [the child of [Michael Henchard]120-henchard]4044-the child of michael henchard at all — legally , [nobody 's child]4045-nobody 's child ; how would [that correct and leading townsman]4046-that correct and leading townsman receive the information ? [He]149-farfrae might possibly forsake [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , and then [she]191-henchard would be [[her]191-henchard step - sire]4047-her step - sire 's own again . [Henchard]191-henchard shuddered , and exclaimed , “ God forbid such a thing ! Why should [I]149-farfrae still be subject to these visitations of [the devil]6225-the devil , when [I]149-farfrae try so hard to keep [him]149-farfrae away ? ”[149-farfrae]

What [Henchard]191-henchard saw thus early was , naturally enough , seen at a little later date by [other people]4048-other people . That [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae “ walked with [that bankrupt [[Henchard]191-henchard 's step - daughter]6227-henchard 's step - daughter , of [all women]6228-all women]6226-that bankrupt henchard 's step - daughter , of all women , ”[149-farfrae] became a common topic in [the town]632-the town , the simple perambulating term being used hereabout to signify a wooing ; and [the nineteen superior young ladies of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]4050-the nineteen superior young ladies of casterbridge , who had each looked upon [herself]191-henchard as [the only woman capable of making [the merchant Councilman]4052-the merchant councilman happy , indignantly left off going to [the church [Farfrae]149-farfrae attended]4053-the church farfrae attended , left off conscious mannerisms , left off putting [him]149-farfrae in [their]4050-the nineteen superior young ladies of casterbridge prayers at night amongst [[their]4050-the nineteen superior young ladies of casterbridge blood relations]4054-their blood relations]4051-the only woman capable of making the merchant councilman happy , indignantly left off going to the church farfrae attended , left off conscious mannerisms , left off putting him in their prayers at night amongst their blood relations ; in short , reverted to [their]4050-the nineteen superior young ladies of casterbridge normal courses .
