[The Three Mariners]4601-the three mariners having been , years before , [the house in which [they]4601-the three mariners had witnessed [the young man]371-the young man and [woman]286-woman 's first and humble appearance on the [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge stage]4061-the house in which they had witnessed the young man and woman 's first and humble appearance on the casterbridge stage , [they]4601-the three mariners took a kindly interest in [their]4601-the three mariners career , not unconnected , perhaps , with visions of festive treatment at [their]4601-the three mariners hands hereafter . [Mrs. Stannidge]136-mrs. stannidge , having rolled into [the large parlour]4064-the large parlour one evening and said that it was a wonder [such a man as [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae]4065-such a man as mr. farfrae , “ [a pillow of [the town]632-the town , ”[132-christopher coney] who might have chosen one of [the daughters of [the professional men]4067-the professional men or [private residents]921-private residents]4066-the daughters of the professional men or private residents]6229-a pillow of the town , ” who might have chosen one of the daughters of the professional men or private residents , should stoop so low , [Coney]132-christopher coney ventured to disagree with [her]136-mrs. stannidge . “ No , [ma'am]618-ma'am , no wonder at all . ' Tis [she]6232-she that 's a stooping to [he]149-farfrae — that 's [my]191-henchard opinion . [A widow man]6233-a widow man — whose first wife was no credit to [him]149-farfrae — what is it for [a young perusing woman]6234-a young perusing woman that 's [[her]6234-a young perusing woman own mistress]6235-her own mistress and well liked ? But as a neat patching up of things [I]191-henchard see much good in it . When [a man]4474-a man have put up [a tomb of best marble - stone]6237-a tomb of best marble - stone to [the other one]6238-the other one , as [he've]4474-a man done , and weeped [his]4474-a man fill , and thought it all over , and said to [hisself]274-hisself , ' [T'other]275-t'other took [me]191-henchard in , [I]191-henchard knowed this one first ; [she]6234-a young perusing woman 's a sensible piece for [a partner]6239-a partner , and there 's [no faithful woman in high life]6240-no faithful woman in high life now ' ; — well , [he]4474-a man may do worse than not to take [her]6234-a young perusing woman , if [she]6234-a young perusing woman 's tender - inclined . ”[191-henchard] Thus [they]4069-they talked at the Mariners . But [we]4069-they must guard against a too liberal use of the conventional declaration that a great sensation was caused by the prospective event , that [all the gossips]4070-all the gossips ' tongues were set wagging thereby , and so - on , even though such a declaration might lend some eclat to the career of [[our]4069-they poor only heroine]4071-our poor only heroine . When all has been said about [busy rumourers]4072-busy rumourers , a superficial and temporary thing is the interest of anybody in affairs which do not directly touch [them]4072-busy rumourers . It would be a truer representation to say that [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge ( ever excepting [the nineteen young ladies]4073-the nineteen young ladies ) looked up for a moment at the news , and withdrawing its attention , went on labouring and victualling , bringing up [its children]4074-its children , and burying [its]6-casterbridge dead , without caring a tittle for [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's domestic plans . Not a hint of the matter was thrown out to [[her]4071-our poor only heroine stepfather]5242-her stepfather by [Elizabeth]191-henchard [herself]191-henchard or by [Farfrae]149-farfrae either . Reasoning on the cause of [their]4069-they reticence [he]5242-her stepfather concluded that , estimating [him]5242-her stepfather by [his]5242-her stepfather past , [the throbbing pair]4076-the throbbing pair were afraid to broach the subject , and looked upon [him]5242-her stepfather as [an irksome obstacle whom [they]4076-the throbbing pair would be heartily glad to get out of the way]4077-an irksome obstacle whom they would be heartily glad to get out of the way . Embittered as [he]5242-her stepfather was against society , this moody view of [himself]5242-her stepfather took deeper and deeper hold of [Henchard]191-henchard , till the daily necessity of facing [mankind]481-mankind , and of [them]4076-the throbbing pair particularly [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard , became well - nigh more than [he]5242-her stepfather could endure . [His]5242-her stepfather health declined ; [he]5242-her stepfather became morbidly sensitive . [He]5242-her stepfather wished [he]5242-her stepfather could escape those who did not want [him]5242-her stepfather , and hide [his]5242-her stepfather head for ever . But what if [he]5242-her stepfather were mistaken in [his]5242-her stepfather views , and there were no necessity that [his]5242-her stepfather own absolute separation from [her]191-henchard should be involved in the incident of [her]191-henchard marriage ? [He]5242-her stepfather proceeded to draw a picture of the alternative — [himself]5242-her stepfather living like a fangless lion about the back rooms of [a house in which [[his]5242-her stepfather stepdaughter]2495-his stepdaughter was [mistress]3197-mistress]4079-a house in which his stepdaughter was mistress , [an inoffensive old man]4082-an inoffensive old man , tenderly smiled on by [Elizabeth]191-henchard , and good - naturedly tolerated by [[her]191-henchard husband]387-her husband . It was terrible to [his]5242-her stepfather pride to think of descending so low ; and yet , for [the girl]311-the girl 's sake [he]5242-her stepfather might put up with anything ; even from [Farfrae]149-farfrae ; even snubbings and masterful tongue - scourgings . The privilege of being in [the house]782-the house [she]191-henchard occupied would almost outweigh the personal humiliation . Whether this were a dim possibility or the reverse , the courtship — which it evidently now was — had an absorbing interest for [him]5242-her stepfather . [Elizabeth]191-henchard , as has been said , often took [her]191-henchard walks on [the Budmouth Road]4795-the budmouth road , and [Farfrae]149-farfrae as often made it convenient to create an accidental meeting with [her]191-henchard there . Two miles out , a quarter of a mile from [the highway]301-the highway , was [the prehistoric fort called [Mai Dun]105-mai dun , of huge dimensions and many ramparts , within or upon whose enclosures [a human being]4089-a human being as seen from [the road]320-the road]4088-the prehistoric fort called mai dun , of huge dimensions and many ramparts , within or upon whose enclosures a human being as seen from the road , was but an insignificant speck . [Hitherward Henchard]276-henchard often resorted , glass in hand , and scanned [the hedgeless Via]4091-the hedgeless via — for it was the original track laid out by [the legions of [the Empire]4093-the empire]4092-the legions of the empire — to a distance of two or three miles , [his]5242-her stepfather object being to read the progress of affairs between [Farfrae]149-farfrae and [[his]5242-her stepfather charmer]4094-his charmer . One day [Henchard]276-henchard was at [this spot]1420-this spot when [a masculine figure]4096-a masculine figure came along [the road]320-the road from [Budmouth]54-budmouth , and lingered . Applying [his]276-henchard telescope to [his]276-henchard eye [Henchard]276-henchard expected that [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's features would be disclosed as usual . But the lenses revealed that today [the man]291-the man was not [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [[Jane]191-henchard 's lover]4099-jane 's lover . [It]291-the man was one clothed as [a merchant captain]4100-a merchant captain , and as [he]291-the man turned in the scrutiny of [the road]320-the road [he]291-the man revealed [his]291-the man face . [Henchard]191-henchard lived a lifetime the moment [he]276-henchard saw it . The face was [Newson]127-newson 's . [Henchard]191-henchard dropped the glass , and for some seconds made no other movement . [Newson]127-newson waited , and [Henchard]191-henchard waited — if that could be called a waiting which was a transfixture . But [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard did not come . Something or other had caused [her]191-henchard to neglect [her]191-henchard customary walk that day . Perhaps [Farfrae]149-farfrae and [she]191-henchard had chosen [another road]4102-another road for variety 's sake . But what did that amount to ? [She]191-henchard might be here to - morrow , and in any case [Newson]127-newson , if bent on a private meeting and a revelation of the truth to [her]191-henchard , would soon make [his]127-newson opportunity . Then [he]127-newson would tell [her]191-henchard not only of [his]127-newson paternity , but of the ruse by which [he]127-newson had been once sent away . [Elizabeth]191-henchard 's strict nature would cause [her]191-henchard for the first time to despise [[her]191-henchard stepfather]5242-her stepfather , would root out [his]127-newson image as that of [an arch - deceiver]4104-an arch - deceiver , and [Newson]127-newson would reign in [her]191-henchard heart in [his]127-newson stead . But [Newson]127-newson did not see anything of [her]191-henchard that morning . Having stood still awhile [he]127-newson at last retraced [his]127-newson steps , and [Henchard]191-henchard felt like [a condemned man who has a few hours]4105-a condemned man who has a few hours ' respite . When [he]127-newson reached [[his]127-newson own house]4106-his own house [he]127-newson found [her]191-henchard there . “ [O [father]4491-father]6241-o father ! ”[191-henchard] [she]191-henchard said innocently . “ [I]191-henchard have had a letter — a strange one — not signed . [Somebody]4446-somebody has asked [me]191-henchard to meet [him]127-newson , either on [the Budmouth Road]4795-the budmouth road at noon today , or in the evening at [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae 's . [He]127-newson says [he]127-newson came to see [me]191-henchard some time ago , but a trick was played [him]127-newson , so that [he]127-newson did not see [me]191-henchard . [I]191-henchard do n't understand it ; but between [you]191-henchard and [me]191-henchard [I]191-henchard think [Donald]139-farfrae is at the bottom of the mystery , and that it is a relation of [his]127-newson who wants to pass an opinion on [his]127-newson choice . But [I]191-henchard did not like to go till [I]191-henchard had seen [you]191-henchard . Shall [I]191-henchard go ? ”[191-henchard] [Henchard]191-henchard replied heavily , “ Yes ; go . ”[4107-his] The question of [his]4107-his remaining in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge was for ever disposed of by this closing in of [Newson]127-newson on the scene . [Henchard]191-henchard was not [the man]291-the man to stand the certainty of condemnation on a matter so near [his]4107-his heart . And being [an old hand at bearing anguish in silence , and haughty withal]4109-an old hand at bearing anguish in silence , and haughty withal , [he]4107-his resolved to make as light as [he]4107-his could of [his]4107-his intentions , while immediately taking [his]4107-his measures . [He]4107-his surprised [the young woman whom [he]4107-his had looked upon as [his]4107-his all in [this world]4111-this world]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world by saying to [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world , as if [he]4107-his did not care about [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world more : “ [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world am going to leave [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] “ Leave [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge ! ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world cried , “ and leave — [me]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world ? ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] “ Yes , [this little shop]6245-this little shop can be managed by [you]4107-his alone as well as by [[us]6246-us both]6247-us both ; [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world do n't care about [shops]6248-shops and [streets]6249-streets and [folk]5018-folk — [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world would rather get into [the country]633-the country by [myself]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world , out of sight , and follow [my]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world own ways , and leave [you]4107-his to [yours]4107-his . ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] [She]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world looked down and [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world tears fell silently . It seemed to [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world that this resolve of [his]4112-his had come on account of [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world attachment and its probable result . [She]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world showed [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world devotion to [Farfrae]139-farfrae , however , by mastering [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world emotion and speaking out . “ [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world am sorry [you]4107-his have decided on this , ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world said with difficult firmness . “ For [I]191-henchard thought it probable — possible — that [I]191-henchard might marry [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae some little time hence , and [I]191-henchard did not know that [you]4107-his disapproved of the step ! ”[191-henchard] “ [I]191-henchard approve of anything [you]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world desire to do , [Izzy]277-izzy , ”[191-henchard] said [Henchard]191-henchard huskily . “ If [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world did not approve it would be no matter ! [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world wish to go away . [My]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world presence might make things awkward in the future , and , in short , it is best that [I]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world go . ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] Nothing that [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world affection could urge would induce [him]4113-him to reconsider [his]4113-him determination ; for [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world could not urge what [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world did not know — that when [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world should learn [he]4113-him was not related to [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world other than as [a step - parent]4114-a step - parent [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world would refrain from despising [him]4113-him , and that when [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world knew what [he]4113-him had done to keep [her]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world in ignorance [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world would refrain from hating [him]4113-him . It was [his]4113-him conviction that [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world would not so refrain ; and there existed as yet neither word nor event which could argue it away . “ Then , ”[4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world] [she]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world said at last , “ [you]4113-him will not be able to come to [my]4113-him wedding ; and that is not as it ought to be . ”[4113-him] “ [I]4113-him do n't want to see it — [I]4113-him do n't want to see it ! ”[4113-him] [he]4113-him exclaimed ; adding more softly , “ but think of [me]4115-me sometimes in [your]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world future life — [you]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world 'll do that , [Izzy]277-izzy ? — think of [me]4115-me when [you]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world are living as [the wife of [the richest]6253-the richest]6252-the wife of the richest , [the foremost man in [the town]632-the town]6254-the foremost man in the town , and do n't let [my]4115-me sins , WHEN [YOU]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world KNOW THEM ALL , cause ' [ee]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world to quite forget that though [I]4115-me loved ' [ee]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world late [I]4115-me loved ' [ee]4110-the young woman whom he had looked upon as his all in this world well . ”[4115-me] “ It is because of [Donald]139-farfrae ! ”[191-henchard] [she]4115-me sobbed . “ [I]4116-his do n't forbid [you]4115-me to marry [him]4116-his , ”[4116-his] said [Henchard]191-henchard . “ Promise not to quite forget [me]4116-his when — — ”[4116-his] [He]4116-his meant when [Newson]127-newson should come . [She]4115-me promised mechanically , in [her]4115-me agitation ; and the same evening at dusk [Henchard]191-henchard left [the town]632-the town , to whose development [he]4116-his had been one of [the chief stimulants for many years]4118-the chief stimulants for many years . During the day [he]4116-his had bought a new tool - basket , cleaned up [his]4116-his old hay - knife and wimble , set [himself]4116-his up in fresh leggings , kneenaps and corduroys , and in other ways gone back to the working clothes of [[his]4116-his young manhood]4119-his young manhood , discarding for ever the shabby - genteel suit of cloth and rusty silk hat that since [his]4116-his decline had characterized [him]4116-his in [the Casterbridge street]4120-the casterbridge street as [a man who had seen better days]4121-a man who had seen better days . [He]4116-his went secretly and alone , not [a soul of the many who had known [him]4116-his being aware of [his]4116-his departure]4122-a soul of the many who had known him being aware of his departure . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard accompanied [him]4116-his as far as [the second bridge on [the highway]301-the highway]4123-the second bridge on the highway — for the hour of [her]191-henchard appointment with [the unguessed visitor at [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's]4125-the unguessed visitor at farfrae 's had not yet arrived — and parted from [him]4116-his with unfeigned wonder and sorrow , keeping [him]4116-his back a minute or two before finally letting [him]4116-his go . [She]191-henchard watched [his]4116-his form diminish across [the moor]3395-the moor , the yellow rush - basket at [his]4116-his back moving up and down with each tread , and the creases behind [his]4116-his knees coming and going alternately till [she]191-henchard could no longer see them . Though [she]191-henchard did not know it [Henchard]191-henchard formed at this moment much the same picture as [he]4116-his had presented when entering [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge for the first time nearly a quarter of a century before ; except , to be sure , that the serious addition to [his]4116-his years had considerably lessened the spring to [his]4116-his stride , that [his]4116-his state of hopelessness had weakened [him]4116-his , and imparted to [his]4116-his shoulders , as weighted by the basket , a perceptible bend . [He]4116-his went on till [he]4116-his came to the first milestone , which stood in the bank , half way up [a steep hill]4127-a steep hill . [He]4116-his rested [his]4116-his basket on the top of the stone , placed [his]4116-his elbows on it , and gave way to a convulsive twitch , which was worse than a sob , because it was so hard and so dry . “ If [I]4116-his had only got [her]191-henchard with [me]4116-his — if [I]4116-his only had ! ”[4116-his] [he]4116-his said . “ Hard work would be nothing to [me]139-farfrae then ! But that was not to be . [I]139-farfrae — [Cain]278-cain — go alone as [I]139-farfrae deserve — [an outcast]6256-an outcast and [a vagabond]3658-a vagabond . But [my]139-farfrae punishment is not greater than [I]139-farfrae can bear ! ”[139-farfrae] [He]4116-his sternly subdued [his]4116-his anguish , shouldered [his]4116-his basket , and went on . [Elizabeth]191-henchard , in the meantime , had breathed [him]4116-his a sigh , recovered [her]191-henchard equanimity , and turned [her]191-henchard face to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge . Before [she]191-henchard had reached [the first house]4128-the first house [she]191-henchard was met in [her]191-henchard walk by [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae . This was evidently not [their]4129-their first meeting that day ; [they]4129-their joined hands without ceremony , and [Farfrae]139-farfrae anxiously asked , “ And is [he]4116-his gone — and did [you]191-henchard tell [him]4116-his ? — [I]139-farfrae mean of the other matter — not of [ours]4129-their . ”[139-farfrae] “ [He]4116-his is gone ; and [I]139-farfrae told [him]4116-his all [I]139-farfrae knew of [[your]191-henchard friend]5652-your friend . [Donald]139-farfrae , who is [he]4116-his ? ”[139-farfrae] “ Well , well , [dearie]6259-dearie ; [you]6259-dearie will know soon about that . And [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard will hear of it if [he]4131-her lover does not go far . ”[4130-her] “ [He]4131-her lover will go far — [he]4131-her lover 's bent upon getting out of sight and sound ! ”[139-farfrae] [She]4130-her walked beside [[her]4130-her lover]4131-her lover , and when [they]4132-they reached [the Crossways]106-the crossways , or [Bow]107-bow , turned with [him]4131-her lover into [Corn Street]75-corn street instead of going straight on to [her]4130-her own door . At [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's house]3661-farfrae 's house [they]4132-they stopped and went in . [Farfrae]139-farfrae flung open the door of [the ground - floor sitting - room]4134-the ground - floor sitting - room , saying , “ There [he]4131-her lover is waiting for [you]191-henchard , ”[127-newson] and [Elizabeth]191-henchard entered . In the arm - chair sat [the broad - faced genial man who had called on [Henchard]191-henchard on a memorable morning between one and two years before this time , and whom [the latter]4511-the latter had seen mount [the coach]4720-the coach and depart within half - an - hour of [his]4131-her lover arrival]4135-the broad - faced genial man who had called on henchard on a memorable morning between one and two years before this time , and whom the latter had seen mount the coach and depart within half - an - hour of his arrival . It was [Richard Newson]127-newson . The meeting with [the light - hearted father from whom [she]191-henchard had been separated half - a - dozen years]4138-the light - hearted father from whom she had been separated half - a - dozen years , as if by death , need hardly be detailed . It was an affecting one , apart from the question of paternity . [Henchard]191-henchard 's departure was in a moment explained . When the true facts came to be handled the difficulty of restoring [her]191-henchard to [her]191-henchard old belief in [Newson]127-newson was not so great as might have seemed likely , for [Henchard]191-henchard 's conduct itself was a proof that those facts were true . Moreover , [she]191-henchard had grown up under [Newson]127-newson 's paternal care ; and even had [Henchard]191-henchard been [[her]191-henchard father]4886-her father in nature , [this father]4140-this father in early domiciliation might almost have carried the point against [him]4140-this father , when the incidents of [her]191-henchard parting with [Henchard]191-henchard had a little worn off . [Newson]127-newson 's pride in what [she]191-henchard had grown up to be was more than [he]127-newson could express . [He]127-newson kissed [her]191-henchard again and again . “ [I]127-newson 've saved [you]191-henchard the trouble to come and meet [me]127-newson — ha - ha ! ”[127-newson] said [Newson]127-newson . “ The fact is that [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae here , [he]149-farfrae said , ' Come up and stop with [me]149-farfrae for a day or two , [Captain Newson]279-newson , and [I]149-farfrae 'll bring [her]191-henchard round . ' ' Faith , ' says [I]149-farfrae , ' so [I]149-farfrae will ' ; and here [I]149-farfrae am . ”[149-farfrae] “ Well , [Henchard]191-henchard is gone , ”[149-farfrae] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae , shutting the door . “ [He]149-farfrae has done it all voluntarily , and , as [I]127-newson gather from [Elizabeth]191-henchard , [he]149-farfrae has been very nice with [her]191-henchard . [I]127-newson was got rather uneasy ; but all is as it should be , and [we]6260-we will have [no more deefficulties]6261-no more deefficulties at all . ”[127-newson] “ Now , that 's very much as [I]127-newson thought , ”[127-newson] said [Newson]127-newson , looking into the face of [each by turns]4141-each by turns . “ [I]149-farfrae said to [myself]149-farfrae , ay , a hundred times , when [I]149-farfrae tried to get a peep at [her]191-henchard unknown to [herself]191-henchard — ' Depend upon it , ' tis best that [I]149-farfrae should live on quiet for a few days like this till something turns up for the better . ' [I]149-farfrae now know [you]191-henchard are all right , and what can [I]149-farfrae wish for more ? ”[149-farfrae] “ Well , [Captain Newson]279-newson , [I]149-farfrae will be glad to see [ye]191-henchard [here]4417-here every day now , since it can do no harm , ”[149-farfrae] said [Farfrae]149-farfrae . “ And what [I]279-newson 've been thinking is that the wedding may as well be kept under [[my]279-newson own roof]6263-my own roof , [the house]782-the house being large , and [you]191-henchard being in [lodgings]6265-lodgings by [yourself]191-henchard — so that a great deal of trouble and expense would be saved [ye]191-henchard ? — and ' tis a convenience when [a couple]6266-a couple 's married not to hae far to go to get [home]675-home ! ”[279-newson] “ With all [my]279-newson heart , ”[279-newson] said [Captain Newson]279-newson ; “ since , as [ye]191-henchard say , it can do no harm , now poor [Henchard]191-henchard 's gone ; though [I]139-farfrae would n't have done it otherwise , or put [myself]139-farfrae in [his]6268-his way at all ; for [I]139-farfrae 've already in [my]139-farfrae lifetime been [an intruder into [[his]6268-his family]342-his family]6269-an intruder into his family quite as far as politeness can be expected to put up with . But what do [the young woman]310-the young woman say [herself]310-the young woman about it ? [Elizabeth]191-henchard , [[my]139-farfrae child]6272-my child , come and hearken to what [we]4142-we be talking about , and not bide staring out o ' the window as if [ye]6272-my child did n't hear . ' “[139-farfrae] [Donald]139-farfrae and [you]139-farfrae must settle it , ” murmured [Elizabeth]191-henchard , still keeping up a scrutinizing gaze at some small object in [the street]797-the street . “[139-farfrae] Well , then , ” continued [Newson]279-newson , turning anew to [Farfrae]139-farfrae with a face expressing thorough entry into the subject , “[149-farfrae] that 's how [we]4142-we 'll have it . And , [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae , as [you]149-farfrae provide so much , and [houseroom]4143-houseroom , and all that , [I]0-i 'll do [my]0-i part in the drinkables , and see to the rum and schiedam — maybe a dozen jars will be sufficient ? — as [many of [the folk]5014-the folk]4144-many of the folk will be [ladies]5334-ladies , and perhaps [they]4144-many of the folk wo n't drink hard enough to make a high average in the reckoning ? But [you]149-farfrae know best . [I]0-i 've provided for [men]4432-men and [shipmates]4148-shipmates times enough , but [I]0-i 'm as ignorant as [a child]288-a child how many glasses of grog [a woman]647-a woman , that 's not [a drinking woman]4151-a drinking woman , is expected to consume at these ceremonies ? ” “[149-farfrae] Oh , none — [we]4142-we 'll no want much of that — O no ! ” said [Farfrae]149-farfrae , shaking [his]149-farfrae head with appalled gravity . “[149-farfrae] Do [you]149-farfrae leave all to [me]0-i . ” When [they]4142-we had gone a little further in these particulars [Newson]279-newson , leaning back in [his]279-newson chair and smiling reflectively at the ceiling , said , “[191-henchard] [I]0-i 've never told [ye]149-farfrae , or have [I]0-i , [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae , how [Henchard]191-henchard put [me]0-i off the scent that time ? ” [He]279-newson expressed ignorance of what [the Captain]6274-the captain alluded to . “[291-the man] Ah , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had n't . [I]0-i resolved that [I]0-i would not , [I]0-i remember , not to hurt [the man]291-the man 's name . But now [he]291-the man 's gone [I]0-i can tell [ye]149-farfrae . Why , [I]0-i came to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge nine or ten months before that day last week that [I]0-i found [ye]149-farfrae out . [I]0-i had been [here]4417-here twice before then . The first time [I]0-i passed through [the town]632-the town on [my]0-i way westward , not knowing [Elizabeth]191-henchard lived [here]4417-here . Then hearing at some place — [I]0-i forget where — that [a man of the name of Henchard]4156-a man of the name of henchard had been [mayor here]4157-mayor here , [I]0-i came back , and called at [[his]291-the man house]1329-his house one morning . [The old rascal]4159-the old rascal ! — [he]291-the man said [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard had died years ago . ” [Elizabeth]191-henchard now gave earnest heed to [his]0-i story . “[291-the man] Now , it never crossed [my]0-i mind that [the man]291-the man was selling [me]0-i a packet , ” continued [Newson]279-newson . “[0-i] And , if [you]4161-you 'll believe [me]0-i , [I]0-i was that upset , that [I]0-i went back to [the coach]4720-the coach that had brought [me]0-i , and took passage onward without lying in [the town]632-the town half - an - hour . Ha - ha ! — ' twas a good joke , and well carried out , and [I]0-i give [the man]291-the man credit for't ! ” [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard was amazed at the intelligence . “[291-the man] A joke ? — O no ! ” [she]191-henchard cried . “[291-the man] Then [he]291-the man kept [you]0-i from [me]0-i , [father]4491-father , all those months , when [you]0-i might have been [here]4417-here ? ” [The father]6275-the father admitted that such was the case . “[0-i] [He]291-the man ought not to have done it ! ” said [Farfrae]149-farfrae . [Elizabeth]191-henchard sighed . “[0-i] [I]0-i said [I]0-i would never forget [him]291-the man . But O ! [I]0-i think [I]0-i ought to forget [him]291-the man now ! ” [Newson]279-newson , like a good many rovers and sojourners among [strange men and strange moralities]6276-strange men and strange moralities , failed to perceive the enormity of [Henchard]191-henchard 's crime , notwithstanding that [he]279-newson [himself]279-newson had been [the chief sufferer therefrom]6277-the chief sufferer therefrom . Indeed , the attack upon [the absent culprit]6278-the absent culprit waxing serious , [he]279-newson began to take [Henchard]191-henchard 's part . “[291-the man] Well , ' twas not ten words that [he]291-the man said , after all , ” [Newson]279-newson pleaded . “[291-the man] And how could [he]291-the man know that [I]0-i should be such [a simpleton]4167-a simpleton as to believe [him]291-the man ? ' Twas as much [my]0-i fault as [his]291-the man , [poor fellow]4168-poor fellow ! ” “[291-the man] No , ” said [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard firmly , in [her]191-henchard revulsion of feeling . “[291-the man] [He]291-the man knew [your]291-the man disposition — [you]291-the man always were so trusting , [father]4491-father ; [I]0-i 've heard [[my]0-i mother]5160-my mother say so hundreds of times — and [he]291-the man did it to wrong [you]291-the man . After weaning [me]0-i from [you]291-the man these five years by saying [he]291-the man was [[my]0-i father]5103-my father , [he]291-the man should not have done this . ” Thus [they]6279-they conversed ; and there was [nobody]298-nobody to set before [Elizabeth]191-henchard any extenuation of [the absent one]6281-the absent one 's deceit . Even had [he]291-the man been present [Henchard]191-henchard might scarce have pleaded it , so little did [he]291-the man value [himself]291-the man or [his]291-the man good name . “[291-the man] Well , well — never mind — it is all over and past , ” said [Newson]279-newson good - naturedly . “[291-the man] Now , about this wedding again . ”[4172-the man of their talk]

Meanwhile , [the man of their talk]4172-the man of their talk had pursued [his]4172-the man of their talk solitary way eastward till weariness overtook [him]4172-the man of their talk , and [he]4172-the man of their talk looked about for [a place of rest]4173-a place of rest . [His]4172-the man of their talk heart was so exacerbated at parting from [the girl]311-the girl that [he]4172-the man of their talk could not face [an inn]888-an inn , or even [a household of the most humble kind]4176-a household of the most humble kind ; and entering [a field]4177-a field [he]4172-the man of their talk lay down under a wheatrick , feeling no want of food . The very heaviness of [his]4172-the man of their talk soul caused [him]4172-the man of their talk to sleep profoundly . The bright autumn sun shining into [his]4172-the man of their talk eyes across the stubble awoke [him]4172-the man of their talk the next morning early . [He]4172-the man of their talk opened [his]4172-the man of their talk basket and ate for [his]4172-the man of their talk breakfast what [he]4172-the man of their talk had packed for [his]4172-the man of their talk supper ; and in doing so overhauled the remainder of [his]4172-the man of their talk kit . Although everything [he]4172-the man of their talk brought necessitated carriage at [his]4172-the man of their talk own back , [he]4172-the man of their talk had secreted among [his]4172-the man of their talk tools a few of [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard 's cast - off belongings , in the shape of gloves , shoes , a scrap of [her]191-henchard handwriting , and the like , and in [his]4172-the man of their talk pocket [he]4172-the man of their talk carried a curl of [her]191-henchard hair . Having looked at these things [he]4172-the man of their talk closed them up again , and went onward . During five consecutive days [Henchard]191-henchard 's rush basket rode along upon [his]4172-the man of their talk shoulder between [the highway hedges]4178-the highway hedges , the new yellow of the rushes catching the eye of [an occasional field - labourer]4179-an occasional field - labourer as [he]4172-the man of their talk glanced through the quickset , together with the wayfarer 's hat and head , and down - turned face , over which the twig shadows moved in endless procession . It now became apparent that the direction of [his]4172-the man of their talk journey was [Weydon Priors]1-weydon - priors , which [he]4172-the man of their talk reached on the afternoon of the sixth day . [The renowned hill whereon the annual fair had been held for so many generations]4180-the renowned hill whereon the annual fair had been held for so many generations was now bare of [human beings]1011-human beings , and almost of aught besides . A few sheep grazed thereabout , but these ran off when [Henchard]191-henchard halted upon [the summit]4182-the summit . [He]4172-the man of their talk deposited [his]4172-the man of their talk basket upon the turf , and looked about with sad curiosity ; till [he]4172-the man of their talk discovered the road by which [[his]4172-the man of their talk wife]380-his wife and [himself]4172-the man of their talk had entered on [the upland]520-the upland so memorable to both , five - and - twenty years before . “ Yes , [we]6282-we came up that way , ”[4172-the man of their talk] [he]4172-the man of their talk said , after ascertaining [his]4172-the man of their talk bearings . “ [She]380-his wife was carrying [the baby]4842-the baby , and [I]4172-the man of their talk was reading a ballet - sheet . Then [we]6282-we crossed about here — [she]380-his wife so sad and weary , and [I]4172-the man of their talk speaking to [her]380-his wife hardly at all , because of [my]4172-the man of their talk cursed pride and mortification at being poor . Then [we]6282-we saw [the tent]368-the tent — that must have stood more this way . ”[4172-the man of their talk] [He]4172-the man of their talk walked to another spot , it was not really where [the tent]368-the tent had stood but it seemed so to [him]4172-the man of their talk . “ Here [we]6282-we went in , and here [we]6282-we sat down . [I]4172-the man of their talk faced this way . Then [I]4172-the man of their talk drank , and committed [my]4172-the man of their talk crime . It must have been just on that very pixy - ring that [she]380-his wife was standing when [she]380-his wife said [her]380-his wife last words to [me]4172-the man of their talk before going off with [him]4172-the man of their talk ; [I]4172-the man of their talk can hear [their]6285-their sound now , and the sound of [her]380-his wife sobs : ' O [Mike]120-henchard ! [I]4172-the man of their talk 've lived with [thee]4172-the man of their talk all this while , and had nothing but temper . Now [I]4172-the man of their talk 'm no more to ' ee — [I]4172-the man of their talk 'll try [my]4172-the man of their talk luck elsewhere . ' ”[4172-the man of their talk] [He]4172-the man of their talk experienced not only the bitterness of [a man who finds , in looking back upon an ambitious course , that what [he]4172-the man of their talk has sacrificed in sentiment]4186-a man who finds , in looking back upon an ambitious course , that what he has sacrificed in sentiment was worth as much as what [he]4172-the man of their talk has gained in substance ; but the superadded bitterness of seeing [his]4172-the man of their talk very recantation nullified . [He]4172-the man of their talk had been sorry for all this long ago ; but [his]4172-the man of their talk attempts to replace ambition by love had been as fully foiled as [his]4172-the man of their talk ambition itself . [[His]4172-the man of their talk wronged wife]4187-his wronged wife had foiled [them]4188-them by a fraud so grandly simple as to be almost a virtue . It was an odd sequence that out of all this tampering with social law came that flower of Nature , [Elizabeth]191-henchard . Part of [his]4172-the man of their talk wish to wash [his]4172-the man of their talk hands of life arose from [his]4172-the man of their talk perception of its contrarious inconsistencies — of [Nature]280-nature 's jaunty readiness to support unorthodox social principles . [He]4172-the man of their talk intended to go on from [this place]482-this place — visited as an act of penance — into [another part of [the country]633-the country]4190-another part of the country altogether . But [he]4172-the man of their talk could not help thinking of [Elizabeth]191-henchard , and [the quarter of the horizon in which [she]191-henchard lived]4192-the quarter of the horizon in which she lived . Out of this it happened that the centrifugal tendency imparted by weariness of [the world]4424-the world was counteracted by the centripetal influence of [his]4172-the man of their talk love for [[his]4172-the man of their talk stepdaughter]2495-his stepdaughter . As a consequence , instead of following a straight course yet further away from [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge , [Henchard]191-henchard gradually , almost unconsciously , deflected from that right line of [his]4172-the man of their talk first intention ; till , by degrees , [his]4172-the man of their talk wandering , like that of [the Canadian woodsman]4195-the canadian woodsman , became part of a circle of which [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge formed the centre . In ascending [any particular hill]4196-any particular hill [he]4172-the man of their talk ascertained the bearings as nearly as [he]4172-the man of their talk could by means of the sun , moon , or stars , and settled in [his]4172-the man of their talk mind the exact direction in which [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge and [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard lay . Sneering at [himself]4172-the man of their talk for [his]4172-the man of their talk weakness [he]4172-the man of their talk yet every hour — nay , every few minutes — conjectured [her]191-henchard actions for the time being — [her]191-henchard sitting down and rising up , [her]191-henchard goings and comings , till thought of [Newson]279-newson 's and [Farfrae]149-farfrae 's counter - influence would pass like a cold blast over a pool , and efface [her]191-henchard image . And then [he]4172-the man of their talk would say to [himself]4172-the man of their talk , “ O [[you]6286-you fool]6287-you fool ! All this about [a daughter who is [no daughter of thine]6289-no daughter of thine]6288-a daughter who is no daughter of thine ! ”[4172-the man of their talk] At length [he]4172-the man of their talk obtained employment at [his]4172-the man of their talk own occupation of hay - trusser , work of that sort being in demand at this autumn time . The scene of [his]4172-the man of their talk hiring was [a pastoral farm]4197-a pastoral farm near [the old western highway]4198-the old western highway , whose course was the channel of all such communications as passed between [the busy centres of novelty]4199-the busy centres of novelty and [the remote Wessex boroughs]4200-the remote wessex boroughs . [He]4172-the man of their talk had chosen [the neighbourhood of [this artery]4202-this artery]4201-the neighbourhood of this artery from a sense that , situated [here]4417-here , though at a distance of fifty miles , [he]4172-the man of their talk was virtually nearer to [her]191-henchard whose welfare was so dear than [he]4172-the man of their talk would be at [a roadless spot only half as remote . And thus [Henchard]191-henchard]4204-a roadless spot only half as remote . and thus henchard found [himself]191-henchard again on the precise standing which [he]4172-the man of their talk had occupied a quarter of a century before . Externally there was nothing to hinder [his]4172-the man of their talk making another start on [the upward slope]4205-the upward slope , and by [his]4172-the man of their talk new lights achieving higher things than [his]4172-the man of their talk soul in its half - formed state had been able to accomplish . But the ingenious machinery contrived by [the Gods for reducing human possibilities of amelioration to a minimum — which arranges that wisdom to do shall come pari passu with the departure of zest for doing]4206-the gods for reducing human possibilities of amelioration to a minimum — which arranges that wisdom to do shall come pari passu with the departure of zest for doing — stood in the way of all that . [He]4172-the man of their talk had no wish to make an arena a second time of [a world]4207-a world that had become a mere painted scene to [him]4172-the man of their talk . Very often , as [his]4172-the man of their talk hay - knife crunched down among the sweet - smelling grassy stems , [he]4172-the man of their talk would survey mankind and say to [himself]4172-the man of their talk : “ Here and everywhere be [folk]5018-folk dying before [their]5018-folk time like frosted leaves , though wanted by [[their]5018-folk families]6291-their families , [the country]633-the country , and [the world]4424-the world ; while [I]191-henchard , [an outcast]6256-an outcast , an encumberer of [the ground]6295-the ground , wanted by [nobody]298-nobody , and despised by [all]6297-all , live on against [my]191-henchard will ! ”[191-henchard] [He]4172-the man of their talk often kept an eager ear upon the conversation of those who passed along [the road]320-the road — not from a general curiosity by any means — but in the hope that among [these travellers between [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge and [London]63-london]4209-these travellers between casterbridge and london [some]895-some would , sooner or later , speak of [the former place]4211-the former place . The distance , however , was too great to lend much probability to [his]4172-the man of their talk desire ; and the highest result of [his]4172-the man of their talk attention to wayside words was that [he]4172-the man of their talk did indeed hear the name “ [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge ”[803-the speaker] uttered one day by [the driver of [a road - waggon]4213-a road - waggon]4212-the driver of a road - waggon . [Henchard]191-henchard ran to the gate of [the field [he]4172-the man of their talk worked in]4214-the field he worked in , and hailed [the speaker]803-the speaker , who was [a stranger]4470-a stranger . “ Yes — [I]803-the speaker 've come from [there]447-there , [maister]4974-maister , ”[803-the speaker] [he]803-the speaker said , in answer to [Henchard]191-henchard 's inquiry . “ [I]4217-a woman inside the waggon - tilt trade up and down , [ye]191-henchard know ; though , what with this travelling without horses that 's getting so common , [my]4217-a woman inside the waggon - tilt work will soon be done . ”[4217-a woman inside the waggon - tilt] “ Anything moving in [the old place]6300-the old place , mid [I]4217-a woman inside the waggon - tilt ask ? ”[4217-a woman inside the waggon - tilt] “ All the same as usual . ”[803-the speaker] “ [I]4217-a woman inside the waggon - tilt 've heard that [Mr. Farfrae]149-farfrae , [the late mayor]6301-the late mayor , is thinking of getting married .
