Surely [they]6302-them said a wedding was coming off soon — on [Martin]281-martin 's Day ? ”[5219-an elderly woman] [The man]291-the man declared [he]291-the man remembered nothing about it ; and [the waggon]1690-the waggon went on jangling over [the hill]328-the hill . [Henchard]191-henchard was convinced that [the woman]300-the woman 's memory served [her]300-the woman well . The date was an extremely probable one , there being no reason for delay on either side . [He]291-the man might , for that matter , write and inquire of [Elizabeth]191-henchard ; but [his]291-the man instinct for sequestration had made the course difficult . Yet before [he]291-the man left [her]191-henchard [she]191-henchard had said that for [him]291-the man to be absent from [her]191-henchard wedding was not as [she]191-henchard wished it to be . The remembrance would continually revive in [him]291-the man now that it was not [Elizabeth]191-henchard and [Farfrae]149-farfrae who had driven [him]291-the man away from [them]4222-them , but [his]291-the man own haughty sense that [his]291-the man presence was no longer desired . [He]291-the man had assumed the return of [Newson]279-newson without absolute proof that [the Captain]6274-the captain meant to return ; still less that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard would welcome [him]291-the man ; and with no proof whatever that if [he]291-the man did return [he]291-the man would stay . What if [he]291-the man had been mistaken in [his]291-the man views ; if there had been no necessity that [his]291-the man own absolute separation from [her]191-henchard [he]291-the man loved should be involved in these untoward incidents ? To make one more attempt to be near [her]191-henchard : to go back , to see [her]191-henchard , to plead [his]291-the man cause before [her]191-henchard , to ask forgiveness for [his]291-the man fraud , to endeavour strenuously to hold [his]291-the man own in [her]191-henchard love ; it was worth the risk of repulse , ay , of life itself . But how to initiate this reversal of all [his]291-the man former resolves without causing [husband]315-husband and [wife]316-wife to despise [him]291-the man for [his]291-the man inconsistency was a question which made [him]291-the man tremble and brood . [He]291-the man cut and cut [his]291-the man trusses two days more , and then [he]291-the man concluded [his]291-the man hesitancies by a sudden reckless determination to go to the wedding festivity . Neither writing nor message would be expected of [him]291-the man . [She]191-henchard had regretted [his]291-the man decision to be absent — [his]291-the man unanticipated presence would fill the little unsatisfied corner that would probably have place in [her]191-henchard just heart without [him]291-the man . To intrude as little of [his]291-the man personality as possible upon a gay event with which that personality could show nothing in keeping , [he]291-the man decided not to make [his]291-the man appearance till evening — when stiffness would have worn off , and a gentle wish to let bygones be bygones would exercise its sway in all hearts . [He]291-the man started on foot , two mornings before [St. Martin's]109-st. martin's - tide , allowing [himself]291-the man about sixteen miles to perform for each of the three days ' journey , reckoning the wedding - day as one . There were only [two towns]4226-two towns , [Melchester]110-melchester and [Shottsford]111-shottsford , of any importance along [his]291-the man course , and at the latter [he]291-the man stopped on the second night , not only to rest , but to prepare [himself]291-the man for the next evening . Possessing no clothes but the working suit [he]291-the man stood in — now stained and distorted by [their]4227-their two months of hard usage , [he]291-the man entered [a shop]3261-a shop to make some purchases which should put [him]291-the man , externally at any rate , a little in harmony with the prevailing tone of the morrow . A rough yet respectable coat and hat , a new shirt and neck - cloth , were the chief of these ; and having satisfied [himself]291-the man that in appearance at least [he]291-the man would not now offend [her]4229-her , [he]291-the man proceeded to the more interesting particular of buying [her]4229-her some present . What should that present be ? [He]291-the man walked up and down [the street]797-the street , regarding dubiously the display in [the shop]804-the shop windows , from a gloomy sense that what [he]291-the man might most like to give [her]4229-her would be beyond [his]291-the man miserable pocket . At length a caged goldfinch met [his]291-the man eye . The cage was a plain and small one , [the shop]804-the shop humble , and on inquiry [he]291-the man concluded [he]291-the man could afford the modest sum asked . A sheet of newspaper was tied round the little creature 's wire prison , and with the wrapped up cage in [his]291-the man hand [Henchard]191-henchard sought a lodging for the night . Next day [he]291-the man set out upon the last stage , and was soon within [the district which had been [his]291-the man dealing ground]4233-the district which had been his dealing ground in bygone years . Part of the distance [he]291-the man travelled by [carrier]4234-carrier , seating [himself]291-the man in the darkest corner at the back of [[that trader]4235-that trader 's van]4236-that trader 's van ; and as [the other passengers]4237-the other passengers , mainly [women going short journeys]4238-women going short journeys , mounted and alighted in front of [Henchard]191-henchard , [they]4239-they talked over much local news , not the least portion of this being the wedding then in course of celebration at [the town]632-the town [they]4239-they were nearing . It appeared from [their]4239-they accounts that [the town band]806-the town band had been hired for the evening party , and , lest the convivial instincts of that body should get the better of [their]4239-they skill , the further step had been taken of engaging [the string band from [Budmouth]54-budmouth]4242-the string band from budmouth , so that there would be a reserve of harmony to fall back upon in case of need . [He]291-the man heard , however , but few particulars beyond those known to [him]291-the man already , the incident of the deepest interest on the journey being the soft pealing of the Casterbridge bells , which reached [the travellers]758-the travellers ' ears while [the van]4244-the van paused on [the top of [Yalbury Hill]112-yalbury hill]4245-the top of yalbury hill to have the drag lowered . The time was just after twelve o'clock . Those notes were a signal that all had gone well ; that there had been no slip ' twixt cup and lip in this case ; that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard and [Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae were [man]488-man and [wife]316-wife . [Henchard]191-henchard did not care to ride any further with [[his]291-the man chattering companions]4248-his chattering companions after hearing this sound . Indeed , it quite unmanned [him]291-the man ; and in pursuance of [his]291-the man plan of not showing [himself]291-the man in [Casterbridge street]4249-casterbridge street till evening , lest [he]291-the man should mortify [Farfrae]139-farfrae and [[his]291-the man bride]4250-his bride , [he]291-the man alighted here , with [his]291-the man bundle and bird - cage , and was soon left as a lonely figure on [the broad white highway]4251-the broad white highway . It was [the hill near which [he]291-the man had waited to meet [Farfrae]139-farfrae]4252-the hill near which he had waited to meet farfrae , almost two years earlier , to tell [him]291-the man of the serious illness of [[his]291-the man wife]380-his wife [Lucetta]214-lucetta . [The place]515-the place was unchanged ; [the same larches]4255-the same larches sighed the same notes ; but [Farfrae]139-farfrae had [another wife]4256-another wife — and , as [Henchard]191-henchard knew , a better one . [He]291-the man only hoped that [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had obtained [a better home than had been [hers]191-henchard at the former time]4257-a better home than had been hers at the former time . [He]291-the man passed the remainder of the afternoon in a curious highstrung condition , unable to do much but think of the approaching meeting with [her]191-henchard , and sadly satirize [himself]291-the man for [his]291-the man emotions thereon , as [a Samson shorn]4258-a samson shorn . Such an innovation on [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge customs as a flitting of [bridegroom]4259-bridegroom and [bride]4260-bride from [the town]632-the town immediately after the ceremony , was not likely , but if it should have taken place [he]291-the man would wait till [their]4262-their return . To assure [himself]291-the man on this point [he]291-the man asked [a market - man]4263-a market - man when near [the borough]1619-the borough if [the newly - married couple]4265-the newly - married couple had gone away , and was promptly informed that [they]4265-the newly - married couple had not ; [they]4265-the newly - married couple were at that hour , according to all accounts , entertaining [a houseful of [guests]4267-guests at [[their]4265-the newly - married couple home in [Corn Street]75-corn street]4268-their home in corn street]4266-a houseful of guests at their home in corn street . [Henchard]191-henchard dusted [his]291-the man boots , washed [his]291-the man hands at [the riverside]4269-the riverside , and proceeded up [the town]632-the town under the feeble lamps . [He]291-the man need have made no inquiries beforehand , for on drawing near [[Farfrae]139-farfrae 's residence]4271-farfrae 's residence it was plain to the least observant that festivity prevailed within , and that [Donald]139-farfrae [himself]139-farfrae shared it , [his]291-the man voice being distinctly audible in [the street]797-the street , giving strong expression to a song of [[his]291-the man dear native country that [he]291-the man loved so well as never to have revisited it]4273-his dear native country that he loved so well as never to have revisited it . [Idlers]813-idlers were standing on the pavement in front ; and wishing to escape the notice of [these Henchard]4275-these henchard passed quickly on to the door . It was wide open , [the hall]1877-the hall was lighted extravagantly , and [people]1161-people were going up and down the stairs . [His]291-the man courage failed [him]291-the man ; to enter footsore , laden , and poorly dressed into the midst of such resplendency was to bring needless humiliation upon [her]139-farfrae [he]291-the man loved , if not to court repulse from [[her]139-farfrae husband]387-her husband . Accordingly [he]291-the man went round into [the street]797-the street at the back that [he]291-the man knew so well , entered [the garden]1272-the garden , and came quietly into [the house]782-the house through [the kitchen]1003-the kitchen , temporarily depositing the bird and cage under a bush outside , to lessen the awkwardness of [his]291-the man arrival . Solitude and sadness had so emolliated [Henchard]191-henchard that [he]291-the man now feared circumstances [he]291-the man would formerly have scorned , and [he]291-the man began to wish that [he]291-the man had not taken upon [himself]291-the man to arrive at such a juncture . However , [his]291-the man progress was made unexpectedly easy by [his]291-the man discovering alone in [the kitchen]1003-the kitchen [an elderly woman]5219-an elderly woman who seemed to be acting as [provisional housekeeper]4285-provisional housekeeper during the convulsions from which [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's establishment was just then suffering . [She]5219-an elderly woman was one of [those people whom nothing surprises]4286-those people whom nothing surprises , and though to [her]5219-an elderly woman , [a total stranger]4287-a total stranger , [his]291-the man request must have seemed odd , [she]5219-an elderly woman willingly volunteered to go up and inform [[the master]5001-the master and mistress of [the house]782-the house]4289-the master and mistress of the house that “ [a humble old friend ”]6305-a humble old friend ”[291-the man] had come . On second thought [she]5219-an elderly woman said that [he]291-the man had better not wait in [the kitchen]1003-the kitchen , but come up into [the little back - parlour]4292-the little back - parlour , which was empty . [He]291-the man thereupon followed [her]5219-an elderly woman thither , and [she]5219-an elderly woman left [him]291-the man . Just as [she]5219-an elderly woman got across [the landing]1070-the landing to the door of [the best parlour]4294-the best parlour a dance was struck up , and [she]5219-an elderly woman returned to say that [she]5219-an elderly woman would wait till that was over before announcing [him]291-the man — [Mr.]4295-mr. and [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae having [both joined in the figure]4296-both joined in the figure . The door of [the front room]4621-the front room had been taken off [its]4298-its hinges to give more space , and that of [the room [Henchard]191-henchard]4299-the room henchard sat in being ajar , [he]291-the man could see fractional parts of [the dancers]4300-the dancers whenever [their]4300-the dancers gyrations brought [them]4300-the dancers near the doorway , chiefly in the shape of the skirts of dresses and streaming curls of hair ; together with about three - fifths of the band in profile , including the restless shadow of a fiddler 's elbow , and the tip of the bass - viol bow . The gaiety jarred upon [Henchard]191-henchard 's spirits ; and [he]291-the man could not quite understand why [Farfrae]139-farfrae , [a much - sobered man]4301-a much - sobered man , and [a widower]4840-a widower , who had had [his]4840-a widower trials , should have cared for it all , notwithstanding the fact that [he]291-the man was quite [a young man]285-a young man still , and quickly kindled to enthusiasm by dance and song . That [the quiet Elizabeth , who had long ago appraised life at a moderate value , and who knew in spite of [her]4304-the quiet elizabeth , who had long ago appraised life at a moderate value , and who knew in spite of her maidenhood that marriage was as a rule no dancing matter maidenhood that marriage was as a rule no dancing matter]4304-the quiet elizabeth , who had long ago appraised life at a moderate value , and who knew in spite of her maidenhood that marriage was as a rule no dancing matter , should have had zest for this revelry surprised [him]291-the man still more . However , [young people]4305-young people could not be quite [old people]4306-old people , [he]291-the man concluded , and custom was omnipotent . With the progress of the dance [the performers]4307-the performers spread out somewhat , and then for the first time [he]291-the man caught a glimpse of [the once despised daughter who had mastered [him]291-the man]4308-the once despised daughter who had mastered him , and made [his]291-the man heart ache . [She]4308-the once despised daughter who had mastered him was in a dress of white silk or satin , [he]291-the man was not near enough to say which — snowy white , without a tinge of milk or cream ; and the expression of [her]4308-the once despised daughter who had mastered him face was one of nervous pleasure rather than of gaiety . Presently [Farfrae]139-farfrae came round , [his]291-the man exuberant Scotch movement making [him]291-the man conspicuous in a moment . [The pair]5819-the pair were not dancing together , but [Henchard]191-henchard could discern that whenever the chances of [the figure]4310-the figure made [them]5819-the pair [the partners of a moment]4311-the partners of a moment [their]5819-the pair emotions breathed a much subtler essence than at other times . By degrees [Henchard]191-henchard became aware that the measure was trod by [some one who out - [Farfraed Farfrae]282-farfraed farfrae]4312-some one who out - farfraed farfrae in saltatory intenseness . This was strange , and it was stranger to find that [the eclipsing personage]4313-the eclipsing personage was [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [[Jane]191-henchard 's partner]4314-jane 's partner . The first time that [Henchard]191-henchard saw [him]291-the man [he]291-the man was sweeping grandly round , [his]291-the man head quivering and low down , [his]291-the man legs in the form of an X and [his]291-the man back towards the door . The next time [he]291-the man came round in the other direction , [his]291-the man white waist - coat preceding [his]291-the man face , and [his]291-the man toes preceding [his]291-the man white waistcoat . That happy face — [Henchard]191-henchard 's complete discomfiture lay in it . It was [Newson]279-newson 's , who had indeed come and supplanted [him]291-the man . [Henchard]191-henchard pushed to the door , and for some seconds made no other movement . [He]291-the man rose to [his]291-the man feet , and stood like a dark ruin , obscured by “ the shade from [his]291-the man own soul up - thrown . ”[191-henchard] But [he]291-the man was no longer [the man to stand these reverses unmoved]4315-the man to stand these reverses unmoved . [His]291-the man agitation was great , and [he]291-the man would fain have been gone , but before [he]291-the man could leave the dance had ended , [the housekeeper]4316-the housekeeper had informed [Elizabeth]191-henchard - [Jane]191-henchard of [the stranger who awaited [her]191-henchard]4317-the stranger who awaited her , and [she]191-henchard entered [the room]985-the room immediately . “ Oh — it is — [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard ! ”[291-the man] [she]191-henchard said , starting back . “ What , [Elizabeth]191-henchard ? ”[291-the man] [he]291-the man cried , as [she]291-the man seized [her]291-the man hand . “ What do [you]291-the man say ? — [Mr. Henchard]120-henchard ? Do n't , do n't scourge [me]291-the man like that ! Call [me]291-the man [worthless old Henchard]120-henchard — anything — but do n't ' ee be so cold as this ! O [[my]291-the man maid]4482-my maid — [I]291-the man see [you]4482-my maid have another — [a real father in [my]291-the man place]6307-a real father in my place . Then [you]4482-my maid know all ; but do n't give all [your]4482-my maid thought to [him]6307-a real father in my place ! Do [ye]4482-my maid save a little room for [me]291-the man ! ”[291-the man] [She]291-the man flushed up , and gently drew [her]291-the man hand away . “ [I]291-the man could have loved [you]120-henchard always — [I]291-the man would have , gladly , ”[291-the man] [she]291-the man said . “ But how can [I]120-henchard when [I]120-henchard know [you]120-henchard have deceived [me]120-henchard so — so bitterly deceived [me]120-henchard ! [You]120-henchard persuaded [me]120-henchard that [[my]120-henchard father]5103-my father was not [[my]120-henchard father]5103-my father — allowed [me]120-henchard to live on in ignorance of the truth for years ; and then when [he]5103-my father , [[my]120-henchard warm - hearted real father]6310-my warm - hearted real father , came to find [me]120-henchard , cruelly sent [him]5103-my father away with a wicked invention of [my]120-henchard death , which nearly broke [his]5103-my father heart . O how can [I]120-henchard love as [I]120-henchard once did [a man who has served [us]6312-us like this]6311-a man who has served us like this ! ”[120-henchard] [Henchard]120-henchard 's lips half parted to begin an explanation . But [he]120-henchard shut them up like a vice , and uttered not a sound . How should [he]120-henchard , there and then , set before [her]4319-her with any effect the palliatives of [his]120-henchard great faults — that [he]120-henchard had [himself]120-henchard been deceived in [her]4319-her identity at first , till informed by [[her]4319-her mother]588-her mother 's letter that [[his]120-henchard own child]4321-his own child had died ; that , in the second accusation , [his]120-henchard lie had been the last desperate throw of [a gamester who loved [her]4319-her affection better than [his]120-henchard own honour]4322-a gamester who loved her affection better than his own honour ? Among the many hindrances to such a pleading not the least was this , that [he]120-henchard did not sufficiently value [himself]120-henchard to lessen [his]120-henchard sufferings by strenuous appeal or elaborate argument . Waiving , therefore , [his]120-henchard privilege of self - defence , [he]120-henchard regarded only [his]120-henchard discomposure . “ Do n't [ye]4319-her distress [yourself]4319-her on [my]120-henchard account , ”[120-henchard] [he]120-henchard said , with proud superiority . “ [I]4340-the housemaid would not wish it — at such a time , too , as this . [I]4340-the housemaid have done wrong in coming to ' ee — [I]4340-the housemaid see [my]4340-the housemaid error . But it is only for once , so forgive it . [I]4340-the housemaid 'll never trouble ' [ee]4319-her again , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard — no , not to [my]4340-the housemaid dying day ! Good - night . Good - bye ! ”[4340-the housemaid] Then , before [she]4319-her could collect [her]4319-her thoughts , [Henchard]191-henchard went out from [[her]4319-her rooms]2478-her rooms , and departed from [the house]782-the house by the back way as [he]120-henchard had come ; and [she]4319-her saw [him]120-henchard no more .

It was about a month after the day which closed as in the last chapter . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard had grown accustomed to the novelty of [her]191-henchard situation , and the only difference between [Donald]139-farfrae 's movements now and formerly was that [he]120-henchard hastened indoors rather more quickly after business hours than [he]120-henchard had been in the habit of doing for some time . [Newson]279-newson had stayed in [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge three days after the wedding party ( whose gaiety , as might have been surmised , was of [his]120-henchard making rather than of [the married couple]4325-the married couple 's ) , and was stared at and honoured as became [the returned Crusoe of the hour]4326-the returned crusoe of the hour . But whether or not because [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge was difficult to excite by dramatic returns and disappearances through having been for centuries [an assize town]4327-an assize town , in which sensational exits from [the world]4424-the world , antipodean absences , and such like , were half - yearly occurrences , [the inhabitants]780-the inhabitants did not altogether lose [their]780-the inhabitants equanimity on [his]120-henchard account . On the fourth morning [he]120-henchard was discovered disconsolately climbing [a hill]4330-a hill , in [his]120-henchard craving to get a glimpse of [the sea]5783-the sea from somewhere or other . The contiguity of salt water proved to be such a necessity of [his]120-henchard existence that [he]120-henchard preferred [Budmouth]54-budmouth as [a place of residence]4332-a place of residence , notwithstanding the society of [[his]120-henchard daughter]2039-his daughter in [the other town]4334-the other town . Thither [he]120-henchard went , and settled in lodgings in [a green - shuttered cottage]4335-a green - shuttered cottage which had a bow - window , jutting out sufficiently to afford glimpses of [a vertical strip of blue sea]4336-a vertical strip of blue sea to any one opening the sash , and leaning forward far enough to look through [a narrow lane of [tall intervening houses]4338-tall intervening houses]4337-a narrow lane of tall intervening houses . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard was standing in the middle of [[her]191-henchard upstairs parlour]4339-her upstairs parlour , critically surveying some re - arrangement of articles with [her]191-henchard head to one side , when [the housemaid]4340-the housemaid came in with the announcement , “ Oh , please [ma'am]618-ma'am , [we]6314-we know now how that bird - cage came [there]447-there . ”[139-farfrae] In exploring [[her]191-henchard new domain]4341-her new domain during the first week of residence , gazing with critical satisfaction on [this cheerful room]4342-this cheerful room and that , penetrating cautiously into [dark cellars]4343-dark cellars , sallying forth with gingerly tread to [the garden]1272-the garden , now leaf - strewn by autumn winds , and thus , like [a wise field - marshal]4345-a wise field - marshal , estimating the capabilities of [the site whereon [she]191-henchard was about to open [her]191-henchard housekeeping campaign]4346-the site whereon she was about to open her housekeeping campaign — [Mrs. Donald Farfrae]139-farfrae had discovered in a screened corner a new bird - cage , shrouded in newspaper , and at the bottom of the cage a little ball of feathers — the dead body of a goldfinch . [Nobody]298-nobody could tell [her]191-henchard how the bird and cage had come [there]447-there , though that [the poor little songster]4349-the poor little songster had been starved to death was evident . The sadness of the incident had made an impression on [her]191-henchard . [She]191-henchard had not been able to forget it for days , despite [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's tender banter ; and now when the matter had been nearly forgotten it was again revived . “ Oh , please [ma'am]618-ma'am , [we]6314-we know how the bird - cage came [there]447-there . That [farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding — [he]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding was seen wi ' it in [his]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding hand as [he]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding came up [the street]797-the street ; and ' tis thoughted that [he]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding put it down while [he]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding came in with [his]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding message , and then went away forgetting where [he]6318-farmer 's man who called on the evening of the wedding had left it . ”[6320-the serene minerva - eyes of one “ whose gestures beamed with mind ”] This was enough to set [Elizabeth]191-henchard thinking , and in thinking [she]191-henchard seized hold of the idea , at one feminine bound , that the caged bird had been brought by [Henchard]191-henchard for [her]191-henchard as a wedding gift and token of repentance . [He]4350-he had not expressed to [her]191-henchard any regrets or excuses for what [he]4350-he had done in the past ; but it was a part of [his]4350-he nature to extenuate nothing , and live on as [one of [[his]4350-he own worst accusers]4352-his own worst accusers]4351-one of his own worst accusers . [She]191-henchard went out , looked at the cage , buried [the starved little singer]4353-the starved little singer , and from that hour [her]191-henchard heart softened towards [the self - alienated man]4354-the self - alienated man . When [[her]191-henchard husband]387-her husband came in [she]191-henchard told [him]387-her husband [her]191-henchard solution of the bird - cage mystery ; and begged [Donald]139-farfrae to help [her]191-henchard in finding out , as soon as possible , [whither Henchard]191-henchard had banished [himself]4350-he , that [she]191-henchard might make [her]191-henchard peace with [him]4350-he ; try to do something to render [his]4350-he life less that of [an outcast]6256-an outcast , and more tolerable to [him]4350-he . Although [Farfrae]139-farfrae had never so passionately liked [Henchard]191-henchard as [Henchard]191-henchard had liked [him]4350-he , [he]4350-he had , on the other hand , never so passionately hated in the same direction as [[his]4350-he former friend]1896-his former friend had done , and [he]4350-he was therefore not the least indisposed to assist [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard in [her]191-henchard laudable plan . But it was by no means easy to set about discovering [Henchard]191-henchard . [He]4350-he had apparently sunk into [the earth]4358-the earth on leaving [Mr.]4359-mr. and [Mrs. Farfrae]139-farfrae 's door . [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard remembered what [he]4350-he had once attempted ; and trembled . But though [she]191-henchard did not know it [Henchard]191-henchard had become [a changed man]4360-a changed man since then — as far , that is , as change of emotional basis can justify such a radical phrase ; and [she]191-henchard needed not to fear . In a few days [Farfrae]139-farfrae 's inquiries elicited that [Henchard]191-henchard had been seen by [one who knew [him]4350-he walking steadily along [the Melchester highway]4362-the melchester highway eastward , at twelve o'clock at night — in other words , retracing [his]4350-he steps on [the road by which [he]4350-he had come]4363-the road by which he had come]4361-one who knew him walking steadily along the melchester highway eastward , at twelve o'clock at night — in other words , retracing his steps on the road by which he had come . This was enough ; and the next morning [Farfrae]139-farfrae might have been discovered driving [his]4350-he gig out of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge in that direction , [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard sitting beside [him]4350-he , wrapped in a thick flat fur — the victorine of the period — [her]191-henchard complexion somewhat richer than formerly , and an incipient matronly dignity , which [the serene Minerva - eyes of one “ whose gestures beamed with mind ”]6320-the serene minerva - eyes of one “ whose gestures beamed with mind ”[139-farfrae] made becoming , settling on [her]191-henchard face . Having [herself]191-henchard arrived at a promising haven from at least the grosser troubles of [her]191-henchard life , [her]191-henchard object was to place [Henchard]191-henchard in some similar quietude before [he]4350-he should sink into that lower stage of existence which was only too possible to [him]4350-he now . After driving along [the highway]301-the highway for a few miles [they]4365-they made further inquiries , and learnt of a road - mender , who had been working thereabouts for weeks , that [he]4350-he had observed [such a man]4704-such a man at the time mentioned ; [he]4350-he had left [the Melchester coachroad at [Weatherbury]30-weatherbury]4367-the melchester coachroad at weatherbury by a forking highway which skirted [the north of [Egdon Heath]113-egdon heath]4368-the north of egdon heath . Into [this road]6222-this road [they]4365-they directed the horse 's head , and soon were bowling across [that ancient country]4370-that ancient country whose surface never had been stirred to a finger 's depth , save by the scratchings of rabbits , since brushed by the feet of [the earliest tribes]4371-the earliest tribes . The tumuli [these]4372-these had left behind , dun and shagged with heather , jutted roundly into the sky from [the uplands]4373-the uplands , as though they were the full breasts of [Diana Multimammia]114-diana multimammia supinely extended there . [They]4365-they searched [Egdon]115-egdon , but found no [Henchard]191-henchard . [Farfrae]139-farfrae drove onward , and by the afternoon reached [the neighbourhood of [some extension of [the heath]4376-the heath to the north of [Anglebury]116-anglebury]4375-some extension of the heath to the north of anglebury]4374-the neighbourhood of some extension of the heath to the north of anglebury , a prominent feature of which , in the form of a blasted clump of firs on [a summit of a hill]4377-a summit of a hill , [they]4365-they soon passed under . That [the road [they]4365-they were following]4378-the road they were following had , up to this point , been [Henchard]191-henchard 's track on foot [they]4365-they were pretty certain ; but the ramifications which now began to reveal [themselves]4365-they in the route made further progress in the right direction a matter of pure guess - work , and [Donald]139-farfrae strongly advised [[his]4379-his wife]380-his wife to give up the search in person , and trust to other means for obtaining news of [[her]380-his wife stepfather]5242-her stepfather . [They]4365-they were now a score of miles at least from [home]675-home , but , by resting the horse for a couple of hours at [a village [they]4365-they had just traversed]4383-a village they had just traversed , it would be possible to get back to [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge that same day , while to go much further afield would reduce [them]4365-they to the necessity of camping out for the night , “ and that will make a hole in a sovereign , ”[191-henchard] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . [She]139-farfrae pondered the position , and agreed with [him]4379-his . [He]4379-his accordingly drew rein , but before reversing [their]4365-they direction paused a moment and looked vaguely round upon [the wide country which [the elevated position]4385-the elevated position disclosed]4384-the wide country which the elevated position disclosed . While [they]4365-they looked [a solitary human form]4386-a solitary human form came from under the clump of trees , and crossed ahead of [them]4365-they . [The person]1251-the person was [some labourer]4388-some labourer ; [his]1251-the person gait was shambling , [his]1251-the person regard fixed in front of [him]1251-the person as absolutely as if [he]1251-the person wore blinkers ; and in [his]1251-the person hand [he]1251-the person carried a few sticks . Having crossed [the road]320-the road [he]1251-the person descended into [a ravine]4390-a ravine , where [a cottage]4825-a cottage revealed [itself]4825-a cottage , which [he]1251-the person entered . “ If [it]4825-a cottage were not so far away from [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge [I]191-henchard should say that must be [poor Whittle]171-whittle . ' Tis just like [him]171-whittle , ”[191-henchard] observed [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . “ And it may be [Whittle]171-whittle , for [he]171-whittle 's never been to [the yard]1277-the yard these three weeks , going away without saying any word at all ; and [I]139-farfrae owing [him]171-whittle for two days ' work , without knowing who to pay it to . ”[139-farfrae] The possibility led [them]4392-them to alight , and at least make an inquiry at [the cottage]5487-the cottage . [Farfrae]139-farfrae hitched the reins to the gate - post , and [they]4392-them approached what was of [humble dwellings]4394-humble dwellings surely the humblest . The walls , built of kneaded clay originally faced with a trowel , had been worn by years of rain - washings to a lumpy crumbling surface , channelled and sunken from [its]4825-a cottage plane , [its]4825-a cottage gray rents held together here and there by a leafy strap of ivy which could scarcely find substance enough for the purpose . The rafters were sunken , and the thatch of the roof in ragged holes . Leaves from the fence had been blown into the corners of the doorway , and lay there undisturbed . The door was ajar ; [Farfrae]139-farfrae knocked ; and [he]4395-he who stood before [them]4392-them was [Whittle]171-whittle , as [they]4392-them had conjectured . [His]171-whittle face showed marks of deep sadness , [his]171-whittle eyes lighting on them with an unfocused gaze ; and [he]171-whittle still held in [his]171-whittle hand the few sticks [he]171-whittle had been out to gather . As soon as [he]171-whittle recognized [them]4392-them [he]171-whittle started . “ What , [Abel Whittle]171-whittle ; is it that [ye]171-whittle are heere ? ”[139-farfrae] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . “ Ay , yes [sir]4588-sir ! [You]4588-sir see [he]171-whittle was kind - like to [mother]4495-mother when [she]4495-mother wer here below , though ' a was rough to [me]139-farfrae . ”[139-farfrae] “ Who are [you]171-whittle talking of ? ”[139-farfrae] “ O [sir]4588-sir — [Mr. Henchet]283-mr. henchet ! Did n't [ye]171-whittle know it ? [He]171-whittle 's just gone — about half - an - hour ago , by the sun ; for [I]191-henchard 've got no watch to [my]191-henchard name . ”[191-henchard] “ Not — dead ? ”[139-farfrae] faltered [Elizabeth - Jane]191-henchard . “ Yes , [ma'am]618-ma'am , [he]171-whittle 's gone ! [He]171-whittle was kind - like to [mother]4495-mother when [she]4495-mother wer here below , sending [her]4495-mother the best ship - coal , and hardly any ashes from it at all ; and taties , and such - like that were very needful to [her]4495-mother . [I]139-farfrae seed en go down [street]5614-street on the night of [your]618-ma'am worshipful 's wedding to [the lady at [yer]618-ma'am side]6328-the lady at yer side , and [I]139-farfrae thought [he]171-whittle looked low and faltering . And [I]139-farfrae followed en over [Grey 's Bridge]117-grey 's bridge , and [he]171-whittle turned and zeed [me]139-farfrae , and said , ' [You]139-farfrae go back ! ' But [I]139-farfrae followed , and [he]171-whittle turned again , and said , ' Do [you]139-farfrae hear , [sir]4588-sir ? Go back ! ' But [I]139-farfrae zeed that [he]171-whittle was low , and [I]139-farfrae followed on still . Then ' a said , ' [Whittle]171-whittle , what do [ye]171-whittle follow [me]139-farfrae for when [I]139-farfrae 've told [ye]171-whittle to go back all these times ? ' And [I]139-farfrae said , ' Because , [sir]4588-sir , [I]139-farfrae see things be bad with ' [ee]6331-ee , and [ye]4588-sir wer kind - like to [mother]4495-mother if [ye]4588-sir wer rough to [me]139-farfrae , and [I]139-farfrae would fain be kind - like to [you]4588-sir . ' Then [he]171-whittle walked on , and [I]139-farfrae followed ; and [he]171-whittle never complained at [me]139-farfrae no more . [We]6333-we walked on like that all night ; and in the blue o ' the morning , when ' twas hardly day , [I]139-farfrae looked ahead o ' [me]139-farfrae , and [I]139-farfrae zeed that [he]171-whittle wambled , and could hardly drag along . By the time [we]6333-we had got past [here]4417-here , but [I]139-farfrae had seen that [this house]5155-this house was empty as [I]139-farfrae went by , and [I]139-farfrae got [him]171-whittle to come back ; and [I]139-farfrae took down the boards from the windows , and helped [him]171-whittle inside . ' What , [Whittle]171-whittle , ' [he]171-whittle said , ' and can [ye]171-whittle really be such [a poor fond fool]6336-a poor fond fool as to care for such a wretch as [I]139-farfrae ! ' Then [I]139-farfrae went on further , and [some neighbourly woodmen]6337-some neighbourly woodmen lent [me]139-farfrae a bed , and a chair , and a few other traps , and [we]6333-we brought ['em]171-whittle [here]4417-here , and made [him]171-whittle as comfortable as [we]6333-we could . But [he]171-whittle did n't gain strength , for [you]171-whittle see , [ma'am]618-ma'am , [he]171-whittle could n't eat — no appetite at all — and [he]171-whittle got weaker ; and to - day [he]171-whittle died . [One of [the neighbours]6341-the neighbours]6340-one of the neighbours have gone to get [a man]4474-a man to measure [him]171-whittle . ”[139-farfrae] “ Dear [me]171-whittle — is that so ! ”[171-whittle] said [Farfrae]139-farfrae . As for [Elizabeth]191-henchard , [she]139-farfrae said nothing . “ Upon the head of [his]171-whittle bed [he]171-whittle pinned a piece of paper , with some writing upon it , ”[171-whittle] continued [Abel Whittle]171-whittle . “ But not being [a man o ' letters]6343-a man o ' letters , [I]120-henchard ca n't read writing ; so [I]120-henchard do n't know what it is . [I]120-henchard can get it and show [ye]191-henchard . ”[120-henchard] [They]4396-they stood in silence while [he]171-whittle ran into [the cottage]5487-the cottage ; returning in a moment with a crumpled scrap of paper . On it there was pencilled as follows : — [MICHAEL HENCHARD]120-henchard 'S WILL “ That [Elizabeth - Jane Farfrae]284-elizabeth - jane be not told of [my]120-henchard death , or made to grieve on account of [me]120-henchard . “[120-henchard] & that [I]0-i be not bury'd in consecrated ground . “ & that [no sexton]6344-no sexton be asked to toll the bell . “[120-henchard] & that [nobody]298-nobody is wished to see [my]0-i dead body . “ & that [no murners]6345-no murners walk behind [me]120-henchard at [my]120-henchard funeral . “[120-henchard] & that no flours be planted on [my]0-i grave , “ & that [no man]6025-no man remember [me]0-i . “[0-i] To this [I]0-i put [my]0-i name . “ [MICHAEL HENCHARD]120-henchard ”[139-farfrae] “ What are [we]6347-we to do ? ”[4400-her] said [Donald]139-farfrae , when [he]4399-he had handed the paper to [her]4400-her . [She]4400-her could not answer distinctly . “ O [Donald]139-farfrae ! ”[4400-her] [she]4400-her cried at last through [her]4400-her tears , “ what bitterness lies there ! O [I]4400-her would not have minded so much if it had not been for [my]4400-her unkindness at that last parting ! ... But there 's no altering — so it must be . ”[None-None] What [Henchard]120-henchard had written in the anguish of [his]120-henchard dying was respected as far as practicable by [Elizabeth - Jane]284-elizabeth - jane , though less from a sense of the sacredness of last words , as such , than from [her]4400-her independent knowledge that [the man who wrote them]4401-the man who wrote them meant what [he]120-henchard said . [She]4400-her knew the directions to be a piece of the same stuff that [his]120-henchard whole life was made of , and hence were not to be tampered with to give [herself]4400-her a mournful pleasure , or [[her]4400-her husband]387-her husband credit for large - heartedness . All was over at last , even [her]4400-her regrets for having misunderstood [him]120-henchard on [his]120-henchard last visit , for not having searched [him]120-henchard out sooner , though these were deep and sharp for a good while . From this time forward [Elizabeth - Jane]284-elizabeth - jane found [herself]4400-her in a latitude of calm weather , kindly and grateful in itself , and doubly so after the Capharnaum in which some of [her]4400-her preceding years had been spent . As the lively and sparkling emotions of [her]4400-her early married life cohered into an equable serenity , the finer movements of [her]4400-her nature found scope in discovering to the narrow - lived ones around [her]4400-her the secret ( as [she]4400-her had once learnt it ) of making limited opportunities endurable ; which [she]4400-her deemed to consist in the cunning enlargement , by a species of microscopic treatment , of those minute forms of satisfaction that offer themselves to [everybody not in positive pain ; which , thus handled , have much of the same inspiring effect upon life as wider interests cursorily embraced]4403-everybody not in positive pain ; which , thus handled , have much of the same inspiring effect upon life as wider interests cursorily embraced . [Her]4400-her teaching had a reflex action upon [herself]4400-her , insomuch that [she]4400-her thought [she]4400-her could perceive no great personal difference between being respected in [the nether parts of [Casterbridge]6-casterbridge]4404-the nether parts of casterbridge and glorified at [the uppermost end of [the social world]4406-the social world]4405-the uppermost end of the social world . [Her]4400-her position was , indeed , to a marked degree one that , in the common phrase , afforded much to be thankful for . That [she]4400-her was not demonstratively thankful was no fault of [hers]4400-her . [Her]4400-her experience had been of a kind to teach [her]4400-her , rightly or wrongly , that the doubtful honour of a brief transmit through [a sorry world]4407-a sorry world hardly called for effusiveness , even when the path was suddenly irradiated at some half - way point by daybeams rich as [hers]4400-her . But [her]4400-her strong sense that neither [she]4400-her nor [any human being]4408-any human being deserved less than was given , did not blind [her]4400-her to the fact that there were [others receiving less who had deserved much more]4409-others receiving less who had deserved much more . And in being forced to class [herself]4400-her among [the fortunate]4410-the fortunate [she]4400-her did not cease to wonder at the persistence of the unforeseen , when [the one to whom such unbroken tranquility had been accorded in the adult stage]4411-the one to whom such unbroken tranquility had been accorded in the adult stage was [she]4411-the one to whom such unbroken tranquility had been accorded in the adult stage whose youth had seemed [to teach that happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain]4412-to teach that happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain .
